job_description:
Data Science Director
Location(s) – Gaithersburg (US), Cambridge (UK) or Gothenburg (Sweden)
Salary – Competitive salary and company benefits apply
Would you like to be a part of a Data Science & Artificial Intelligence (DS&AI) group who has direct strategic impact on drug development, playing a key role in getting medicines to patients?
At AstraZeneca, we are constantly pushing the boundaries of science to deliver life-changing medicines to patients, with a real passion for discovery and a pipeline to show for it. Here, you’ll have the opportunity to make a difference in people’s lives every single day.
AstraZeneca is looking to invest in the data management and analysis platforms underlying its existing and emerging drug discovery technology, through its long term Growth Through Innovation Strategy. Within the new Data Science and AI Group, you will be working with colleagues to build data management and analysis foundations for the future.
The [Data Science & AI] team collaborates across R&D to drive innovation through data science and AI. Together we aim to:
Improve our understanding of disease and uncovering new targets
Transform R&D processes
Speed the design and delivery of new medicines for patients
You will play a pivotal role in a rapidly growing team analysing and manipulating various types of biomedical datasets and generating the insights from our complex data that brings innovative medicines to patients faster. In this role, you will apply your expertise in machine learning, quantitative data analysis and leadership to develop innovative data science solutions across multiple therapeutic areas (Respiratory, Autoimmunity, Inflamation, Cardiovascular, Renal and Metabolism) in clinical drug development.
Main Duties and Responsibilities
Provides advanced data science expertise to cross-functional AstraZeneca projects and drives delivery of advanced data science solutions in high pressure and high impact situations.
Applies a range of data science methodologies, can fluently use a range of data science techniques, and is recognised as expert on one or more specific data science methodologies.
Develops novel data science solutions where off-the-shelf methodologies do not fit.
Supports the strategic planning of the department by providing data science leadership
Define project requirements from interactions with senior stakeholders and collaborators across R&D functions, oversee delivery and stakeholder management
Leads moderate (4-5 person) data science projects with cross-functional teams or impact.
Coaches and mentors junior data scientists
Publishes work to ensure that AstraZeneca drives the data science agenda in the pharmaceutical industry.
Develops best practice to ensure that data science work is delivered to robust quality standards.
Ensures own work is compliant within Clinical Development, and other appropriate regulations and procedures.
Collaborate in a multidisciplinary environment with world leading clinicians, data scientists, biological experts, statisticians and IT professionals
Develop collaborations with external academic and commercial enterprises
Maintains an external profile as an expert in one or more machine learning/data science areas.
Essential Requirements
MSc degree in rigorous quantitative science (such as mathematics, computer science, engineering)
Practical software development and analytical skills in standard data science tools (such as ProgR, Julia or python) and database languages (e.g. SQL)
Significant hands-on experience analysing and interpreting data, drawing conclusions, defining recommended actions, and reporting results across stakeholders
Knowledge of statistics and optimization techniques
Experience of manipulating and analysing large high dimensionality unstructured biomedical datasets
Extensive hands-on experience applying data science tools in practice.
Excellent Communication, business analysis, and consultancy skills.
Demonstrated experience articulating business questions and using mathematical techniques to arrive at an answer using available data.
Significant experience post-graduate degree in Machine Learning
A passion to apply machine learning to tackle difficult problems in drug development
Desirable Requirements
PhD degree in rigorous quantitative science (such as mathematics, computer science, engineering)
Experience within the pharmaceutical industry
In-depth experience of working in a global organization with complex/geographical context
Strong track record of delivering large, cross functional projects
Experience in novel methods development and application
Significant post-graduate degree in leading and delivering impactful data science projects
Multiple published papers and/or patents, contribution to external open source projects
Next Steps – Apply today

To be considered for this exciting opportunity, please complete the full application on our website at your earliest convenience – it is the only way that our Recruiter and Hiring Manager can know that you feel well qualified for this opportunity. If you know someone who would be a great fit, please share this posting with them.

Amazon Web Services (AWS) is looking for experienced and collaborative pre-sales managers to coach, grow, and partner with technically skilled, customer-facing Solutions Architects. You will help develop the industry’s best cloud-based solutions architects by enabling and coaching them on best practices, solution selling, presentation and speaking skills, as well as how to create and present architectures of widely varying size and complexity. In collaboration with sales, you will drive revenue growth across a broad set of technology leaders, innovators, and disruptors in the US Southeast. Your team will help customers architect highly scalable and available workloads, cloud native applications, and innovative solutions in various technology domains such as Artificial Intelligence (AI), Machine Learning (ML), Big Data, Internet of Things (IoT), and Serverless computing. If you are someone who likes to work with customers and solve complex challenges, AWS is hiring Senior Managers for our Solutions Architects.

In this role, you will need to be technically capable and credible in your own right as well as effective in shaping the customer and solutions-focused skills of your team. We are looking for leaders who love learning and introducing new technology in order to help colleagues and customers embrace and adopt new technology. We need innovative leaders who can look beyond the technology and consider the value our technology creates for our customers, and can help change how our technology is viewed to enable outcomes. You will help team members ramp-up on AWS as well as develop speaking, writing, presentation, and executive interaction skills. You will also need to be adept at interacting, communicating and partnering with other departments within AWS such as our services teams, marketing, and professional services teams, as well as representing your team to executive management.

Amazon's Culture

Our positive and supportive culture encourages our people to do their best work every day. We have 14 leadership principles that help guide us in our every-day decision making process. We believe they are a clearer articulation of those things that have always been a part of what makes Amazon great – things that we must consciously hold on to in fulfilling our mission to be Earth’s Most Customer Centric Company. We are continuously looking for new ways to maintain a culture where our people excel and lead healthy and happy lives. Learn more about life at Amazon. It is always Day One.

At AWS, we have a credo of “Work hard. Have fun. Make history”. In this role, you will love what you do, and instinctively know how to make work fun, while maintaining a work-life balance. We look for leaders who are creative and who are willing to take on any challenge and make a big impact for their team, for the company and for our customers.

Enjoy developing technical talent to achieve great things. You will have a passion for educating, training, and enabling cloud computing experts for a diverse and challenging set of enterprise customers.

The ideal candidate will have past experience working as a Solutions Architect, technical pre-sales, or a similar role and experience managing a team of a Solution Architects. You will have an ability to grow your leadership skills as well as diving deep into various hands-on solutions while developing new skills, so you can make strong contributions in architecture transformation discussions.

How You’ll Grow

At Amazon, our professional development plan focuses on helping people at every level of their career to identify and use their strengths to do their best work every day. From entry-level employees to senior leaders, we believe there’s always room to learn and develop your career. We offer opportunities to help sharpen your skills in addition to hands-on experience in the global, fast-changing business world. From on-the-job learning experiences to formal development programs, our professionals have a variety of opportunities to continue to grow throughout their career.

ROLES AND RESPONSIBILITIES

As a key member of the business development and sales management teams, ensure success in building and migrating applications, software and services onto the AWS platform.
Hire, on-board, train, and develop new Solutions Architects from internal and external sources.
Educate enterprise customers on the value proposition of AWS, and participate in architectural discussions to ensure solutions are designed for successful deployment in the cloud.
Coach Solutions Architects in the skills needed to conduct one-to-few and one-to-many training sessions so they can transfer deep technical skills to customers who are considering or using AWS.
Capture and share best-practice knowledge amongst the AWS solutions architect community
Guide and motivate the development of whitepapers, data sheets, and other high-value customer facing guidance and best practices.
Build deep relationships with decision makers within customer accounts to enable them to be “Cloud advocates”.
Act as a conduit and liaison between customers, service engineering teams and support.

Working knowledge of software development tools and methodologies.Presentation skills with a high degree of comfort speaking with executives, IT Management, and developers.Strong written communication skillsHigh level of comfort communicating effectively across internal and external organizationsDemonstrated ability to adapt to new technologies and learn quicklyExperience working within software development or Internet-related industriesHistory of successful technical consulting and/or architecture engagements with large-scale customers or enterprises.Familiarity with common enterprise services (Directory Services, Information Assurance, Virtual Desktop, etc.), products (i.e., Oracle, SAP)Experience migrating or transforming legacy customer solutions to the cloud.Professional experience architecting/operating solutions built on AWS
Benefits

At Amazon, we know that great people make a great organization. We value our people and offer employees a broad range of benefits. Learn more about what working at Amazon can mean for you.

Amazon is an Equal Opportunity-Affirmative Action Employer – Minority / Female / Disability / Veteran / Gender Identity / Sexual Orientation

CCB Data & Analytics:

The CCB Data & Analytics Team unifies data and analytics talent across Chase to responsibly leverage data to build competitive advantages for our businesses with value and protection for customers. The team encompasses a variety of Data & Analytics disciplines, from data governance and data strategy/partnerships to reporting, data science and machine learning, and are actively engaged in ensuring impact at the front-line and the customer through Sales and Marketing transformation. We have a strong partnership with our dedicated Technology partners, who provide us with our cutting edge data and analytics infrastructure. Joining CCB Data & Analytics means you sit in the engine that powers Chase with insights, providing an opportunity to materially impact both our customer and business outcomes. The team also offers significant learning and mobility opportunities for career development and future growth.

Position Overview:

The Analytics Platform Solution Manager is part of the platform ownership team responsible for analytic infrastructure and capabilities that support a wide range of analytics from business intelligence reporting to advanced machine learning and artificial intelligence. This team interfaces with business and technology partners to identify and prioritize needed analytical capabilities and drive their development, testing, and ultimate integration into the business. The Solution Manager will be responsible for the overall vision, roadmap, and budget for a subset of our analytic platform capabilities.
This position will initially focus on the modernization of our SAS platforms and workloads. This involves working with IT to develop the target platform architecture in the new strategic data centers and coordinating business groups to migrate their work to the new infrastructure. It also entails understanding and coordinating all the change that will be required to migrate programs from SAS 9.X to the new SAS Vaya version. A key part of this effort is to reduce our reliance on SAS by migrating use cases to other types of technology and building more automated, IT-supported solutions. This manager role will work with the business to plan the work and drive the execution and status reporting. The candidate will need to understand analytic technologies available in the firm and be able to help SAS users identify new ways of conducting their analysis.
Longer-term, this role will take on management of new products in the analytics space. Example capabilities include big data platforms for advanced analytics, relational/KVP/graph databases, data archival, data federation, usage and performance monitoring instrumentation, and more. The position will evolve into a role similar to that of an Area Product Owner role in the Less@Chase agile construct, but fairly technical and hands-on.

Responsibilities:
Initial responsibilities:
Develop complete inventory of SAS usage across CCB and break it down into categories for migration planning.
Work with each team to identify how they will do their work in the future.
Develop migration plans with each team and track status and progress.
Roll these plans up into a roadmap suitable for executive communication.
Partner with the Risk and Finance team that is driving the effort across the firm. Attend weekly calls and report CCB’s migration status and identify and risks to the program.
Identify any areas of SAS that should remain and prepare plans for migration to the new SAS VAYA infrastructure in the new strategic data centers.
Assist with crafting the vision for next-generation SAS capabilities that align to our analytic platform strategies and controls.
Provide feedback to the other product owners where capabilities are needed in order to move workload from SAS. Help shape the roadmaps for the other platforms to make this migration successful.
Develop training programs, SharePoint content, and deliver webinars to help educate the organization about modernization of our SAS workload.
Manage the budget for the program on a year over year basis and track actual spend.

Longer-term responsibilities:
Act as a product owner for a specific area of analytic capabilities, acting as the single point of contact on the business side to communicate current state, target state, four-quarter roadmap, annual budget, active development projects, timelines, etc.
Manage a subset of the overall $150+ million dollar budget for analytic platforms in CCB, identifying the most important investments that will drive future budgets each year.
Meet regularly with business stakeholders (ranging from analyst to senior executive) to understand their goals and any challenges they have in achieving them. Identify new capabilities that address their challenges.
Interface with DECO IT and GTI to understand the firm’s technology strategy and its drivers that influence how we shape solutions at JPMC.
Keep current with innovations and trends in the analytics technology sector, which is rapidly changing. Assess whether new technologies and products can help our business meet its objectives.
Single point of contact and coordination for multiple projects, analyses, or products; responsible for developing timelines, aligning resources, and driving progress to an aggressive timeline.
Document / create content that helps communicate platform strategy and facilitate technology adoption by the business.
Identify and solve problems across a variety of disciplines impacting book of work, including: technology, data science, legal, and other functions. Willing to learn about areas that are less familiar to push common sense solutions.
Manage and validate the output of related specialized groups, and influence work plan in each to ensure they align to desired business results.
Communicate to senior audiences on results or progress of book of work.
Develop long term support infrastructure or projects once completed.
Ensure audit, compliance, legal and other firm controls are followed and installed on each project and relevant activity.
Embrace a mentoring role in developing associate and analyst talent within the organization.
Support and/or chair the various agile scrum ceremonies such as sprint planning meetings, and refinement sessions.
Manage the agile product backlog for your area product.


5+ years of experience in financial services, technology-enabled industries, and/or at a top tier management consulting firm
Bachelor's degree in a related discipline; i.e., Computer Science, MIS, Economics, Analytics, etc.; Master’s degree is a plus.
Knowledge and experience with common technologies in the analytics space such as Hadoop, Spark, and relational databases. Experience with MPP databases preferred.
Experience working as an analyst using key statistical, SQL, and coding principles. Experience with business intelligence tools (i.e. Tableau) and languages such as ProgR, and Python are preferred.
Strong project management / agile skills – the ability to manage multiple projects and prioritize work requirements to work in multi-disciplinary team setting
Demonstrated track record of driving complex data-related technical implementations across teams.
Strong written and verbal communication skills, particularly with web or presentation content. Ability to convey technical or complex material to business leaders.
Strong analytical and problem solving skills (problem structuring, driving to an answer, having a point of view)
Strong written/verbal communication and presentation skills written and oral presentation / communication skills – the ability to convey complex information simply and clearly to senior business leaders
Demonstrate superior judgment to mitigate risk, and fosters an environment where risk/control issues are escalated and trends are anticipated and identified
Pragmatic problem solving across multiple types of issues in project work
Willingness to learn new areas of focus especially support functions

job_title: CIB-Wholesale Payments-Digital Product Manager, Vice President
job_description:
Why Join our Team?
The banking ecosystem is undergoing constant change that requires a perpetual focus on innovation. Emerging technologies are rapidly changing the way we do business, leading to new business models with the potential to radically transform the financial services sector.
As a member of the digital product management team, you will have the opportunity to define and deliver a completely new client experience and drive new growth for the business through our next-generation digital gateway. This gateway is a revolutionary new global platform launching in 2020 that seamlessly supports our client’s need to pay or collect in over 100 countries through a variety of bank-hosted engagement channels such as a client-branded online and mobile portal, voice-responsive phone, in-person point of sale and is future-ready for Artificial Intelligence powered assistants, chat services and more.
You will have the opportunity to approach our work with an agile mindset and entrepreneurial spirit. This is a very exciting time to join a team that is shaping the company’s digital strategy.

Skills we are seeking
Ability to develop and implement new product offeringsExperience with digital solutions, including web based and mobile platforms
Key influencing skills working across multiple teams to deliver our visionStrong product management skills to focus on a customer first mindset, lean product thinking and a focus on product adoptionStrong project management, analytical, detail oriented, problem solving, and communication skills with both internal and external partnersHolistically understand core business problems and requirements from clients in order to deliver efficient and useful solutionsA track record demonstrating a high level of personal initiative, setting and executing challenging goalsWork incredibly well with cross-functional partners and in a matrix environment including partnering with TS Product, Sales, Analytics and Design teams to recognize key growth areas for the business and emerging client needsAbility to adeptly pivot opportunities based on new information and market opportunitiesTroubleshoot application issues and coordinate issue resolution across product and technology teamsStrong interpersonal, communication and team-building skills

Professional experiences (3+ years) that will set you apart

3+ years of experience as a Product Manager, or similar technology-related role
Bachelor’s degree or equivalent work experienceAdopt an agile mindset to oversee the team's product development efforts, ensuring the final product is functional, operational, and meets design and feature specificationsKnowledge of Wholesale Payments products (Payments, Receivables, Liquidity, FX, Channels, Merchant Services)Knowledge of emerging technologies as well as exposure to design thinkingExperience in Agile and Iterative development methodologiesSome technical expertise in the past in building prototypes and pilot solutionsPassion for creatively solving problems and an entrepreneurial spirit
More about the team

We are an innovative and constantly evolving team within the Wholesale Payments business at J.P. Morgan. We are product developers and strategists with a penchant for action, new ideas and a passion for solving client challenges and adopting new technologies.
What we build will matter and have huge impact; our products and solutions will reach thousands of our clients around the world, and affect how J.P. Morgan does business, moving trillions of dollars a day (25% of all U.S. Dollar movement globally). Moreover, our group works closely with other innovation groups across Treasury Services and other lines of business to accelerate the development of new products and capabilities.
About J.P. Morgan Treasury Services
J.P. Morgan Treasury Services (TS) is one of the world's largest providers of treasury management services. J.P. Morgan's TS business is a full-service provider of innovative cash management, trade, liquidity, commercial card, and escrow services - specifically developed to meet the challenges treasury professionals face today. More than 135,000 corporations, financial institutions, governments and municipalities in over 180 countries and territories entrust their business to J.P. Morgan.
About J.P. Morgan Chase & Co.

J.P. Morgan’s Corporate & Investment Bank is a global leader across banking, markets and investor services. The world’s most important corporations, governments and institutions entrust us with their business in more than 100 countries. The Corporate & Investment Bank provides strategic advice, raises capital, manages risk and extends liquidity in markets around the world.

Lead/Principal Cybersecurity Engineer - 00054129 - (00054129)
Description

MITRE is a trusted operator of federally funded research and development centers and we’re on a mission to make the world a safer place—for all of humanity, today and in the future. To deliver on our mission, we need the world’s best talent and leaders—groundbreakers and partnership-builders on a global scale in areas like healthcare, artificial intelligence, critical infrastructure resiliency, pandemic management, and cybersecurity. In return, we have the privilege of backing you with thousands of technical experts in diverse fields, a culture of innovation and knowledge sharing, access to data and resources uniquely available to MITRE through our wide-ranging partnerships across government, industry and academia.

We are looking for expert cybersecurity engineers who will help develop and architect resilient cybersecurity approaches and architectures. The ideal candidate will have expert knowledge of defensive cybersecurity operations, and traditional cyber network protections and accreditation paths such as the risk management framework (RMF).

Key Functions:

Work with multi-organization engineering teams to architect cybersecurity defense solutions that support more efficient and effective detection and response. Includes penetration testing, vulnerability analysis, active cyber operations development, and resilient cyber network designs
Serve as cyber engineering SME and trusted advisor
Improve integration of system architectures, tools, analytic platforms and threat intel sources
Demonstrate knowledge of proactive measures and toolsets that can be used to emulate adversarial events (blending offensive and defensive cybersecurity practices with counter-intelligence and physical surveillance practices)
Develop, operationalize, and improve and/or evaluate tools, techniques, and procedures (TTPs) for detecting and responding to modern cyber threats
Provide planning, strategy and policy, requirements, and integration support for cyber capabilities and identifies opportunities for cyber enhancement and protection


Qualifications

Minimum Qualifications:

Bachelor's Degree in Computer Science or Computer Engineering or similar field and 8 years of experience.
Ability to apply advanced principles, theories and concepts comparable to those obtained with a Master's degree in a relevant field of study.
Understands the missions, domains and challenges of MITRE customers and is fully responsible for deliverables-including definition, completion, and technical quality, as well as assuring consistency across the responsibility span.
Define projects or programs greater than themselves.
Applicants selected for this position will be subject to a government security investigation and must meet eligibility requirements for access to classified information or applicants who are eligible for security clearances
Required Qualifications:

Self-starter with knowledge of penetration testing and tools such as Burp Suite, Fuzzing.
Strong knowledge of advanced cyber threats, active defensive cyber tools, active offensive attack surfaces and adversary methodologies.
Experience with enterprise architecture, software development, cyber operations, command and control systems, space control, space sensors and data exploitation, and astrodynamics
Collaborate with government contractors and work in multi-disciplinary teams
Effective communication and technical writing skills
Ability to think strategically about technical and operational challenges within a security organization and experience developing roadmaps and implementation plans for moving an organization forward
Ability to develop new ideas and techniques that advance the state of the practice for cyber defensive operations
Obtain and maintain a TS/SCI level security clearance

Preferred Qualifications:

Experience and knowledge are desired but not limited to the following areas: detection and/or cybersecurity analysis (e.g., via forensics, network and memory analysis, reverse engineering, cyber threat intelligence) of the presence of an cyber threat actor (including insiders) or malware; and reactive measures such as cyber incident response, situation analysis, and vulnerability management.
Ability to communicate complex, concepts, ideas in a confident and well-organized manner
Applies a combination of expert engineering knowledge of enterprise IT and security solutions to design, develop, and/or implement solutions to ensure they are consistent with enterprise architecture security policies
Experience in implementing cryptography, encryption, anti-tamper, and anti-spoofing technologies
Knowledge of cross domain technologies and implementation

Primary Location: United States-California-El Segundo
Other Locations: United States-New Mexico-Kirtland AFB
Work Locations: MITRE Los Angeles 90245

This requisition requires a clearance of: SAP
Travel: Yes, 25 % of the Time

job_title: Enterprise Cybersecurity Data Analytics Team Lead
job_description:
Job Details
Job ID: 11828

New ideas are all around us, but only a few will change the world. That’s our focus at JPL. We ask the biggest questions, then search the universe for answers—literally. We build upon ideas that have guided generations, then share our discoveries to inspire generations to come. Your mission—your opportunity—is to seek out the answers that bring us one step closer. If you’re driven to discover, create, and inspire something that lasts a lifetime and beyond, you’re ready for JPL.

Located in Pasadena, California, JPL has a campus-like environment situated on 177 acres in the foothills of the San Gabriel Mountains and offers a work environment unlike any other: we inspire passion, foster innovation, build collaboration, and reward excellence.

Responsibilities

Are you passionate about technology? Do you want to lead the engineering and development of data analytics technologies for the security of JPL’s global network? If you answered yes, then we have the right opportunity for you! At NASA’s Jet Propulsion Laboratory, we depend on innovation and technical excellence to develop IT systems and services that provide the edge we need to explore the universe.

We are looking for Cybersecurity Data Analytics Team Lead to join our workforce who shares our passion for technology.

Responsibilities

Provide technical leadership and engineering expertise for the design, deployment, operations and maintenance of Cybersecurity data analytics capabilities to support and augment the JPL Cybersecurity Operations Center.
Collaborate with technical team members and external customers to define and implement solutions for applications including streamlining processes, impact evaluation, updating or replacing existing solutions, determining deliverables, and communication plans.
Be responsible for all aspects of deployments including application configurations, testing, user acceptance testing, application delivery, bug tracking and resolutions.
Collaborate with the Cybersecurity technical and policy teams in evaluating technologies, strategies, policies, products and responses to Cybersecurity issues and events.

Qualifications
Typically requires a Bachelor’s degree with a minimum of 9 years of related experience; Master’s degree with a minimum of 7 years of related experience; or PhD with a minimum of 5 years related experience.
Wide-ranging experience and advanced knowledge in the following areas: Cybersecurity Operations, Identity Management Systems, Network and Systems Architecture, UNIX, MAC and Windows systems administration.
Extensive understanding and wide application of advanced principles, theories, concepts and techniques in securing networked computer systems.
In-depth knowledge and direct working experience with the following technologies: Splunk, Syslog, Artificial Intelligence Capabilities and data storage
Experience architecting scalable systems and applications.
Excellent leadership skills, capable of synergizing, and guiding a team of highly technical individuals.
Excellent written and verbal communication skills, capable of effectively capturing and communicating technical information at all levels.
Experience with at least one standard programming language: C, C++, Java, Python, PHP, Shell Scripting.

Additional Desired Skills:
Knowledge of Laboratory policies and procedures, NASA policies and procedures, and government regulations across a range of applications.
Demonstrated experience working individually or within cross-functional teams supporting programs with lab-wide impact.
Demonstrated success in understanding internal business processes in a high-tech environment such as project management and designing system enhancements with positive productivity improvements by enhancing functionality of user requirements.
Experience leading technical teams on large-scale projects through completion.
Splunk Power User Certification

Work Authorization
U.S. Citizen or Permanent Resident

Duties
Summary
The Program Manager (Director) will lead a division within the Office of Business Process Integration (OBPI), Veterans Benefits Administration. The incumbent will serve as a consultant to the Deputy Executive Director and Executive Director of OBPI in the planning and decision-making process by preparing analysis and comparisons of alternative methods of achieving program objectives that improve delivery of benefits to Veterans, are fiscally responsible, and foster a culture of collaboration.
Responsibilities
Provides independent analysis of budget and programmatic requirements to support VBA's technology investments.
Advocates on behalf of the business to align re-engineering efforts, such as automation and artificial intelligence, to funding allocations.
Leverages experience with, and thorough understanding of, the multi-year Planning, Programming, and Budgeting Execution (PPBE) process to provide decision-making recommendations to senior leadership.
Proactively coordinates and integrates the multi-year planning process with the Chief of Financial Operations (CFO), and Facilities to support the implementation of business capabilities, including IT investment requirements
Exercises a high degree of expertise as a Certified Project Manager with significant knowledge and experience in Project/Program/Product Management principles and best practices to solicit, formulate, execute and manage a $200 million system portfolio of new and diverse projects with an annual technology budget of $100 million
Understands, develops, and applies data-driven process improvement methods, practices, and standards, such as Lean Six Sigma, internal business processes, analyses, and testing methodology, ensuring efficacy and stakeholder confidence in modernization solutions
Prepares briefing materials for the ED/DED of OBPI to inform/influence senior officials on a variety of issues related to strategic business process changes and supportive tools
Reviews/approves/disapproves actions involving personnel requirements and the allocation of resources among projects and/or organization alignment
Serves as a consultant to the DED/ED in the planning and decision-making process by preparing analysis and comparisons of alternative methods of achieving program objectives
Applies organizational development principles and drives employee engagement by ensuring career development, training, and technical competence are maintained, promising talent is recruited, and selection/promotion decisions are effectively made
Understands Agile, Scaled Agile, DevOps, and PROSCI Change Management principles
Applies deep knowledge of acquisitions and contract management with an emphasis on acquiring solutions as a service
Familiarity with Quality Management Systems, ISO 9001, and CMMI

Travel Required
Occasional travel - You may be expected to travel for this position.
Supervisory status
Yes
Promotion Potential
15
Job family (Series)
0340 Program Management
Requirements

Requirements
Conditions of Employment
You must be a U.S. citizen to apply for this job
Selectees are subject to a background/suitability investigation
Selective Service registration is required for males born after 12/31/1959
A probationary period may be required for employees and supervisors
Qualifications
Amended: Note this announcement has been amended to extend the close date to Monday, April 27, 2020.


To qualify for this position, applicants must meet all requirements by the closing date of this announcement.

Time-in-grade: Applicants who are/were federal employees and have held a GS grade any time in the past 52 weeks must also meet time-in-grade requirements. For a GS-15 position you must have served 52 weeks at the GS-14 level.
To support your claim of time in grade, you must submit your most recent appointment, promotion, or within grade increase SF-50 (not an award or general adjustment SF-50). See the required documents section for more information.
SF-50: If you are seeking a reassignment/change to lower grade, you must submit a copy of your most recent SF-50 (non-award) AND the SF-50 placing you into your current position.
Specialized Experience: Applicants must also have one year of specialized experience equivalent to at least the next lower grade (GS-14) in the normal line of progression for the occupation in the organization. Specialized experience is defined as work that involves: experience applying technology and business expertise in assessing risks and costs of solutions to meet business needs; analyzing budget and programmatic requirements to support implementation of business capabilities, including business case/needs and requirements for IT related investments; developing and executing management strategies to support the processing of claim or benefits related business applications or systems.


Experience refers to paid and unpaid experience, including volunteer work done through National Service programs (e.g., Peace Corps, AmeriCorps) and other organizations (e.g., professional; philanthropic; religions; spiritual; community; student; social). Volunteer work helps build critical competencies, knowledge, and skills and can provide valuable training and experience that translates directly to paid employment. You will receive credit for all qualifying experience, including volunteer experience.

The Office of Personnel Management's group coverage qualification standards, associated individual occupational requirements (IOR), and individual qualification standards covering white collar occupations in the Federal competitive service can be found here.
Education
A transcript must be submitted with your application if you are basing all or part of your qualifications on education.

There is no educational substitution for the GS-15 level.

Only education or degrees recognized by the U.S. Department of Education from accredited colleges, universities, schools, or institutions may be used to qualify for federal employment. You can verify your education here. If you are using foreign education to meet qualification requirements, you must send a Certificate of Foreign Equivalency with your transcript in order to receive credit for that education.
Additional information
Work Schedule: Regular office hours; Alternate work schedules are available
Title/PD#: Program Manager (Director) GS - 15; PD 374510
Promotion Potential: The position is at the full performance level.

Physical Requirements: The work is sedentary. Typically, the employee may sit comfortably to do the work. However, there may be some walking; standing; bending; carrying of light items such as papers, books, small parts; driving an automobile, etc. No special physical demands are required to perform the work.

Placement Policy: The posting of this announcement does not obligate management to fill a vacancy or vacancies by promotion. The position may be filled by reassignment, change to lower grade, transfer, appointment, or reinstatement. Management may use any one or any combination of these methods to fill the position.

Special Employment Consideration: VA encourages persons with disabilities to apply, including those eligible for hiring under 5 CFR 213.3102(u), Schedule A, appointment of persons with disabilities [i.e., intellectual disabilities, severe physical disabilities, or psychiatric disabilities], and/or disabled Veterans with a compensable service-connected disability of 30% or more. Please contact the special placement coordinator or the human resources specialist listed on this vacancy for more information regarding applying for consideration under schedule A or as a 30% disabled Veteran.

The Interagency Career Transition Assistance Plan (ICTAP) and Career Transition Assistance Plan (CTAP) provide eligible displaced Federal competitive service employees with selection priority over other candidates for competitive service vacancies. To be qualified you must submit appropriate documentation and be found well-qualified for this vacancy. A well-qualified candidate is defined as meeting all of the minimum qualification standards and eligibility requirements as well as possessing skills that clearly exceed the minimum qualifications requirements for this position. Information about ICTAP and CTAP eligibility can be found here.

VA supports the use of telework as a way to help attract and retain talented individuals in public service, increase worker productivity, and better prepare the agency to operate during emergencies. This position may be authorized for telework. Telework eligibility will be discussed during the interview process.

This job opportunity announcement may be used to fill additional vacancies.

If you are unable to apply online view the following link for information regarding an Alternate Application.

How You Will Be Evaluated
You will be evaluated for this job based on how well you meet the qualifications above.
In describing your experience, please be clear and specific. We will not make assumptions regarding your experience. Applicants who do not fully address the specialized experience needed for the position (as described above in the job announcement) in their resume or who do not possess the education to substitute for it will not be referred for consideration.
After you have met the minimum qualifications, you will be rated on the following competencies based on your application for this position:

Organizational Performance Analysis: Knowledge of methods, techniques and tools to analyze program, organizational, and mission performance which are time sensitive and often controversial.
Administration and Management: Knowledge of planning, coordination, and execution of business functions, resource allocation, and production.
Organizational Stewardship: Takes responsibility and initiative, sets and meets priorities, organizes and uses time and resources effectively.
Effective Written: Communication Skills Conveys written information in a clear, concise, organized, and convincing manner.
Oral Communication: Skills Verbally communicates idea and issues in a clear and convincing manner and receive feedback.
Strategic Thinking: Formulates objectives and priorities, and implements plans consistent with the long-term interests of the organization in a global environment. Capitalizes on opportunities and manages risks.
Interpersonal Effectiveness: Demonstrates mastery of interpersonal interaction, develops collaborative relationships.


If you are referred for consideration, you may be asked to submit additional job-related information, which may include, but is not limited to responses to the knowledge, skills, and abilities; completion of a work sample, and/or an interview.
Your resume and/or supporting documentation will be verified. Please follow all instructions carefully. Errors or omissions may affect your rating or consideration for employment.

Notice to Applicants: It is the policy of the Government not to deny employment simply because an individual has been unemployed or has had financial difficulties that have arisen through no fault of the individual. Information about an individual's employment experience will be used only to determine the person's qualifications and to assess his or her relative level of knowledge, skills, and abilities. Although an individual's personal conduct may be relevant in any employment decision, including conduct during periods of unemployment or evidence of dishonesty in handling financial matters, financial difficulty that has arisen through no fault of the individual will generally not itself be the basis of an unfavorable suitability or fitness determination.

The Mozilla Foundation has launched a multi-year investment strategy focused on advancing 'Trustworthy artificial intelligence' globally. Our strategy requires effective and consistent earned media, as well as outreach to key partners including tech developers, tech investors, consumers, and policymakers. (Our approach to Trustworthy AI and an outline of our Theory of Change is described in greater detailhere ( https://mzl.la/AIIssueBrief ).)

Reporting to the Director of Advocacy, the Senior Manager, Marketing is responsible for crafting a visible, effective presence for Mozilla and our work. Duties include the creation and execution of a strategic, goal-based, data-centric marketing plan to promote our brand identity, to help drive interest and collaboration with our work, and to expand outreach to target audiences using a wide variety of mechanisms.

The successful candidate is highly organized, creative, opportunistic, self-starter — and most of all, ready to attract and engage key people around impactful collaborations with Mozilla! Those who excel in this role are quick learners, able to generate high-quality materials for both on and offline use, and adept marketers able to reach targeted audiences.

---------------------

Key responsibilities:
---------------------

Strategy Development (20%)


Build and execute comprehensive marketing plans using current trends, approaches, and tools to meet our Trustworthy AI goals
Develop strategies and plans that best leverage and complement earned media, executive comms, and PR strategies
Measure the effectiveness of the marketing strategies and update/refine plans as needed
Develop and manage spending against strategic goals and efficiency measures

Marketing & Brand Building (60%)


Build marketing strategies that advance our Trustworthy AI strategy and programmatic goals
Develop and execute audience-specific marketing plans, collateral materials, online and offline events, and engagement opportunities that elevate Mozilla's visibility and activities among key audiences including tech developers, tech investors, and tech + policy thought leaders globally
Develop marketing plans for our key publications, reports, and projects to ensure they reach key audiences and work with marketing/distribution requirements
Plan, develop, and place paid advertising, polls, and sponsorships to effectively reach key audiences
Cultivate and coordinate staff and leadership attendance at conferences, meetings, events, and other opportunities to maximize opportunities to reach our key audiences with the right message
Leverage external brand, messaging and advertising guidance and resources, as needed

Management (20%)


Effectively manage marketing efforts, including staff and consultants within the team
Project manage cross-organizational efforts as needed
Develop, manage and evaluate spending of marketing budget
Work with the leadership team to participate in activities related to our strategic and organizational development

---------------------------
Qualifications/Requirements
---------------------------


Experience: Minimum of 7 years in marketing or blended marketing roles
Experience creatively developing a brand to match an organization's vision/mission/strengths with its key audiences in mind
Experience promoting brand identity and developing branding policies
Proven planning skills to develop and implement comprehensive, proactive marketing strategies that support institutional goals
Proven ability to write, develop, and manage promotional materials and activities (print, online/web, multimedia, social networking)
Experience devising marketing & sales strategies based on market findings/analysis, using multiple channels/strategies for reaching a target audience and meeting goals
Experience analyzing the operational and budget efficiency of various marketing strategies, mechanisms, alternatives
Supervisory experience: hiring, training, evaluating and mentoring staff. Experience promoting a positive work environment
Strong interpersonal communication and demonstrated ability to establish and sustain credibility with all colleagues, leadership, and consultants

The Mozilla Foundation can hire in the jurisdictions of the United States, Canada, the United Kingdom, and Germany.

We are an equal opportunity employer and value diversity. We do not discriminate on the basis of race, religion, color, national origin, gender, sexual orientation, age, marital status, veteran status, or disability status.

At Diagnostic Robotics, we imagine a world where clinicians, consumers, and payers have access to all the information they need to make smarter, more cost-effective decisions about patient care. Our intuitive, user-friendly diagnostic solutions leverage artificial intelligence and predictive analytics models to make this world a reality. We're looking for a Senior Product Manager who's experienced in managing end to end product processes, from ideation, market research and down to successful implementation.
Duties and responsibilities
In your day-to-day, you'll be responsible for leading product work, and collaborating closely with designers, engineers, data scientists and medical doctors.
Create product strategies consistent with the company's vision, and translate them into detailed requirements and prototypes.
Prioritize tasks as needed, and come up with creative new ideas to expand our product and improve our customer experience.

Experience
At least 3 years experience working in product management
Experience from regulated environment
Excellent leadership and personal skills
Self-organized, process driven
Super creative thinker, with a strong eye for design and detail
Passion for delighting users, doing things differently

Perfect English and communication skills

Self-learning individual who reads constantly and loves to pass on their knowledge to others

The Raytheon Intelligence & Space (RIS) Advanced Manufacturing, Modernization, and Technology (AMMT) team is seeking an enthusiastic, highly motivated and innovative team member to take on the role of Automation Lead in the El Segundo, CA consolidated manufacturing center (CMC). This position will be responsible for executing automation projects within the El Segundo factory. The Automation Engineering Lead will work for the California Automation Section Manager, and will collaborate with local factory leadership, manufacturing engineering, industrial engineering, operations, supply chain, and front end of the business Automation Lead to execute automation development, deployment, and factory sustainment of automation systems. The Automation Engineering Lead envisions and incorporates advanced Smart Factory/Industry 4.0 technologies as well as identify opportunities for process improvements via lean techniques. The Automation Engineering Lead will also be responsible for maintaining up to date knowledge on automation technologies and Industry 4/Smart Factory concepts as they relate to current/future project execution.

The position will be networked across RIS factories, which includes locations in McKinney (TX), Forest (MS), Santa Barbara County (CA), and Largo (FL), in addition to operations and automation engineers from other Raytheon Technologies business units. The ideal candidate will have a proven track record of automation deployment and/or sustainment in a factory setting, including high mix, low volume production.



Required Skills:

Experience in automation design, development, deployment, validation and/or sustainment in a factory setting.
6+ years professional engineering experience in a manufacturing environment, with at least 2 years being directly related to automation and/or controls.
Experience with automation systems (robots, vision systems, PLCs, etc.)
Experience with process integration and electromechanical / mechatronic systems
Understanding of automation programming environments
Experience in mechanical and/or electrical design, computer vision, artificial intelligence, or other related field.
Experience with CAD (Solidworks, Pro E, AutoCAD electrical, etc.)
Basic project management, problem solving and team building skills
Sense of business urgency and drive
Ability to prioritize during haze of confusion and/or conflicting goals
Time & task management skills
Ability to lead/manage engineers and technical trades on project teams
Ability to demonstrate strong critical thinking and problem solving skills
Ability to obtain a DoD Secret clearance
Desired Skills:

Exposure to a wide variety of production machinery, industrial sensors, and equipment (LVDT and pressure transducers, dispense systems, temperature controllers, DC torque controllers, current and power meters, etc.)
Knowledge of Electrical Standards (NFPA79, National Electric code, UL508A).
Knowledge of Safety standards (ANSI/RIA15.06, OSHA).
Experience programming Cartesian, SCARA and Articulated robots is highly desired (Fanuc, UR or others)
Experience with Vision systems (Cognex, Keyence, Fanuc)
Experience creating technical specifications for automated manufacturing equipment is highly desired
Experience transitioning products and processes from prototype to production desired
Debug and optimize automated processes to maximize cycle time, improve availability and yield
Enforce application of Raytheon standards, manage external integrators during specification generation, design review, design approval
Participate in initial equipment conceptual development and carefully balance product specifications, process requirements, layout complexity, cost, and lead-time limits.
Understanding of Lean principles and terminology and/or six sigma black belt or equivalent
Familiarity with Industry 4.0 / Smart Factory concepts, Digital Manufacturing Simulation
Understanding of SCADA (Supervisory Control and Data Acquisition) systems, MES (Manufacturing Execution Systems), ISA (International Society of Automation) 95 architectures.
Experience with cyber and/or cyber-physical systems security protocols
Experience with PLCs, MTConnect, and/or Transactional Automation (use of API, XML)
Demonstrated ability to develop risk mitigation plans to prevent overruns to budget and schedule
Proactively identifies and manages changes in project scope, identifies potential problems, and devises contingency plans
Strong project management and project planning experience/knowledge with demonstrated ability to drive projects to successful completion
Strong interpersonal communication (verbal, written and presentation) skills with the ability to interact positively and collaboratively with others at all levels of the organization
Experience in project management, preferably, as it relates to automation development and deployment, including MS Project schedule development, and financial measures/metrics
Demonstrated ability to develop business cases and Return on Investment analyses
Demonstrated an understanding of earned value management practices
Ability to obtain an SSBI clearance, or candidate holds active SSBI.
Experience or education in systems engineering and application to automation systems.
Required Education (including Major):

BS in an engineering field or the sciences
Desired Education:
MS in engineering or business related field (for example, systems engineering, manufacturing engineering, industrial engineering, MBA, business management, program management, etc.)

This position requires either a U.S. Person or a Non-U.S. Person who is eligible to obtain any required Export Authorization. 160772

job_title: Chief Information Officer (CIO) | Chief Technology Officer (CTO) ​| Technology Director
job_description:
Duration

Part-time or full-time based on client engagement

Location

Locations throughout the United States and/or virtual remote locations

Compensation

Commensurate with experience, certification, and education

Summary

Pivotal Technology Professionals is currently hiring Chief Information Officers, Chief Technology Officers, and Technology Directors to provide virtual, part-time, and interim technology leadership services to our clients.

Client engagements will be a combination of on-site work, virtual remote work, and a hybrid combining both on-site and virtual remote work. The travel requirements will be established before the start of the engagement.

This is a part-time or contract position. Compensation is based on experience, certification, and education.

Duties:

Each client engagement is unique. The high-level requirements for the engagement will be determined before the client engagement starts. However, the specific client goals must be initially clarified and understood at the start of the engagement. These duties may include the following:

Understand the client’s specific goals that they want to achieve from the engagement. Document the goals and scope of the engagement, review with the client to ensure accuracy. Provide a time estimate to complete the engagement.

Align the overall IT strategy with business requirements.

Identify the technology services required to support the client’s customers, partners, suppliers, and internal business operations.

Analyze the technology services that are required to support the client’s business. Perform an assessment of current services. Document the results of the assessment including suggestions for new technology services, updates to existing services, and termination of existing services. Document recommendations to the client based on the outcome of the assessment.

Review the IT organization structure, resources, and skills and make change recommendations based on review.

Lead initiatives to plan, design, build, deploy, monitor, and improve the technology services that are required to support the client’s business.
Provide advice, research, recommendations, and guidance for incorporating one or more specific technology product and service offerings into the organization. This includes the high-level approach, required resources, budget, and duration to integrate. Some of these emerging technology trends may include:

– Artificial Intelligence, Machine Learning, Deep Learning, Ethics, and Bias

– Digital Transformation and Services

– Internet of Things (IoT)

– Mobile Technology

– Predictive Analytics, Data Science, and Big Data

– Cloud Migration, Multi-cloud, and On-Premises Enterprise

– Network Modernization, SDN, SD-WAN, and Edge Computing

– Cyber Security, Privacy, Data Protection, and Regulatory Compliance

– Blockchain

– Communications, Collaboration, and the Future of Work

– Agile Methods, DevOps, and Cloud-Native Design

– Employee Engagement, Experience, and Retention

Prepare for and conduct review meetings with the client’s leadership executives that include engagement scope, strategy, service performance, engagement deliverables, and progress updates.

Create engagement deliverables including:

– Business objectives and scope document

– Action plans including approach, budget and duration

– Technology service assessment and recommendations documentation

– Technology service inventory, requirements and design documentation

– Presentations to client business leaders

Qualifications:

– Bachelor’s or Master’s degree in computer science, information systems, or equivalent. Advanced degree preferred.

– At least 15 years of experience participating in technology initiatives with a minimum of 5 years in a senior technology leadership role.

– Experience working with ITSM (IT Service Management), ITIL (IT Infrastructure Library), TOGAF (The Open Group Architecture Framework), COBIT (Control Objectives for Information and Related Technologies) (Governance), KT (Kepner-Tregoe) are a plus.

– Experience leading a PMO (Program Management Office) and formal project management a plus.

– Sophisticated interpersonal skills including excellent written & oral communications, and presentation skills.

– Must be authorized to work in the United States without sponsorship

Notices:

Principals only. Recruiters, please do not contact us for this position
do NOT contact us with unsolicited services or offers

Qualified and interested candidates, kindly email your resume to:

applicant@pivotaltechpros.com

Data Asset Management Director – R&D Data Office
Location(s) - Cambridge (UK); Gothenburg (Sweden); Gaithersburg (USA) – Permanent
Salary - Competitive salary and company benefits
Would you like to be a part of a Data Science & Artificial Intelligence (DS&AI) group who has direct strategic impact on drug development, playing a key role in getting medicines to patients?
At AstraZeneca, we are constantly pushing the boundaries of science to deliver life-changing medicines, with a real passion for discovery and a pipeline to show for it. Here, you’ll have the chance to create a difference in people’s lives every single day.
AstraZeneca is investing heavily in data management and analysis capabilities, through its long-term Growth Through Innovation Strategy. The DS&AI team collaborates across R&D to drive innovation through data science and AI. Together we seek to:
Improve our understanding of disease and uncovering new targets
Transform R&D processes
Speed the design and delivery of new medicines for patients
The R&D Data Office, within DS&AI, is a key organisation to deliver upon AstraZeneca’s strategy. Data Office operates a central capability, with R&D wide accountability, to ensure that we harness the power of data to drive innovative science. Data Office will govern data, drive data quality and ensure our data is readied for analytics, crafting paved-paths for scientists to perform research driven by data, without compromising our legal restrictions or ethical principles.
Sustainable, FAIR (Findable, Accessible, Interoperable & Reusable) data is the lifeblood of AstraZeneca as a science-led, pure-play pharmaceutical company and critical for the delivery of AstraZeneca’s corporate strategy, in which Data, AI and Digital is a foundational value driver for Innovative Science and a potential corporate differentiator.
In this role you will be accountable for designing processes for the onboarding, cataloguing, & management of data assets, systems, and processes that drive the process of making data FAIR.
Typical Accountabilities
Analyze current-state information related to data assets gathered by the Data Discovery team
Provide Stewardship of data assets to inform the data use and analytic processes.
Design and implement optimal processes and specifications for:
on-boarding of data / meta-data into a centralized data repository
cataloguing of data assets that are ingested into a central repository
systematic tagging of data from ethical & legal review process
data asset management including optimal data and data standards refresh schedules
workflow management to ensure access to the right data assets and versions
automation to enable operational scale-up.
Collaborate with:
IT partners for the implementation of data / meta-data on-boarding, and cataloguing activities including the development of minimum meta-data models for each data asset type, automation of implementation processes
Data Provisioning / Science Data Foundation / Data Strategy & Value teams to understand demand for data / meta-data on-boarding and management and plan and implement data asset management activities in consultation with the Head of Scientific Data Assets
Data Policy & Data Governance teams to ensure policy and governance needs are planned for and complied with.
Additionally:
Inform the decision-making process for data vs. meta-data ingestion to a centralized repository
Develop, own, and continuously improve, clear processes to manage data assets and make scientific data FAIR and AI/Analytics-ready, so that data value grows over time. Secure value measurability, and scalability for changes in scope and demand
Collaborate with other members of the Data Asset team, Data Office functional units, & the DS & AI community to aid the Data FAIRification process
Line-manage a team of Data Asset management professionals and create a stimulating, inspiring and rewarding environment that allows them to make a meaningful difference, grow their capability and add more value, and develop their careers in a variety of directions.
Education, skills and experience required
Relevant degree in Information/Data Science, Computer Science, Informatics, IT, or other related subject area
Experience in the pharma and the life sciences sector
Extensive experience in data asset stewardship & management
In-depth experience and operational understanding of data repositories, ETL processes, data management principles, common data models, data standards, and analytic tools
Experience designing, programming, testing, or supporting software development and integrations
Extensive experience working with IT partners in the implementation of data asset management projects
Ability to learn new tools and technologies
Experience in creating system and user documentation.
Travel – willingness and ability to travel domestically & internationally.
Resilience – ability to overcome and motivate others in the face of a changing environment.
Next Steps – Apply today!

Summary
Posted: Apr 24, 2020
Role Number:200167569
Would you like to play a part in the next revolution in human-computer interaction? Come join the Siri team at Apple. Contribute to a product that is redefining mobile computing. Build groundbreaking technology for artificial intelligence. Transform the way people keep up with the world and work with the people who crafted the intelligent assistant that helps millions of people get things done — just by asking.
We are looking for an experienced leader who wants to bring their passion for building incredible teams to deliver the next generation of voice assistant technology to Siri. Our growing team combines strong technical skills, product vision, and an exciting mission.
Key Qualifications
Track record of building high-performance software development teams that have delivered complex full-stack engineering projects.
Proven ability grow and guide a development organization through productive critique, evangelism, guiding, training, learning, and coaching.
Dedicated, motivated, self-driven problem solver with strong cross-functional partnerships and leadership skills.
Proactive communicator, with experience guiding strong results from organizations that span geographic boundaries.
5+ years of experience building, managing, and leading highly skilled teams of engineers.
5+ years of hands-on experience architecting, designing and developing software products.
Description
Join Apple's Siri team as a Senior Engineering Manager to deliver the best Siri experience around the world. We are involved in bringing innovative solutions to complex engineering issues. From Speech Recognition to Natural Language Processing, Machine Learning, Big Data consumption all the way to Speech Synthesis. Be ready to architect and develop robust scalable systems for Siri jointly with all these teams.
SPECIFIC RESPONSIBILITIES INCLUDE
• Help grow our Boulder presence through growing and guiding strong local teams capable of delivering incredible products.
• Lead the design of everything from core Siri architecture to engineering tools, user interactions, and processes.
• Work closely with the Siri Understanding, Platform, Tools and International teams, in a multi-functional environment.
• Build ambitious engineering plans to achieve excellence for Siri customers around the world.
Education & Experience
BS/MS in Computer Science or equivalent experience.
Additional Requirements
Apple is an Equal Opportunity Employer that is committed to inclusion and diversity. We also take affirmative action to offer employment and advancement opportunities to all applicants, including minorities, women, protected veterans, and individuals with disabilities. Apple will not discriminate or retaliate against applicants who inquire about, disclose, or discuss their compensation or that of other applicants.

Description

HireVue is transforming the way companies discover, hire and develop the best talent by combining the power of video, games and AI for better hiring decisions. The HireVue Assessments and Video Interviewing Platform uses a ground-breaking combination of industrial/organizational science and rigorously tested, predictive artificial intelligence to help customers find and engage higher quality talent, faster. HireVue is available worldwide in over 30 languages and has hosted more than 11 million on-demand interviews and one million assessments. Its more than 700 customers worldwide include over one-third of the Fortune 100 and leading brands such as Unilever, JP Morgan Chase, Delta Air Lines, Vodafone, Carnival Cruise Line and Goldman Sachs.

Who are we looking for?

HireVue has an exciting opportunity for a Government Customer Success Director. This strategic individual contributor will provide proactive account management specifically to our Government customers. The ideal candidate will be required to drive strategic direction, product adoption, retention, growth and expansion through proactive thought leadership and demonstrated value-added advocacy. This is a dynamic position and the CSD must be comfortable with frequent multi-tasking between management, technical, business, strategic, marketing, and planning activities.

What you'll be doing:
Work closely with the HireVue Federal Sales team to identify growth and expansion opportunities
Facilitate regular executive meetings to define and proactively drive progress towards desired business metrics and outcomes
Be a subject matter expert & advocate
Partner with current customers on HireVue product offerings, best practices & processes, and lead customers to effectively integrate digital interviewing and assessments into those processes for successful adoption and long term value/ business impact

Strong understanding of E+M field theory and applications.

Strong problem solving and circuit debugging skills with a solid understanding of core engineering principles, fundamental circuit design, and analytical techniques is required.
Experience with analog circuit simulation and Cadence Schematic Capture and PCB Layout tools preferred.

About NIO

NIO Inc. is a pioneer in China’s premium electric vehicle market. Founded in November 2014, NIO’s mission is to shape a joyful lifestyle by offering premium smart electric vehicles and being the best user enterprise. NIO designs, jointly manufactures, and sells smart and connected premium electric vehicles, driving innovations in next generation technologies in connectivity, autonomous driving and artificial intelligence. Redefining the user experience, NIO provides users with comprehensive, convenient and innovative charging solutions and other user-centric services. NIO began deliveries of the ES8, a 7-seater high-performance premium electric SUV in China in June 2018, and its variant, the six-seater ES8, in March 2019. NIO officially launched the ES6, a 5-seater high-performance premium electric SUV, in December 2018 and began deliveries in June 2019. NIO officially launched the EC6, a 5-seater smart premium electric Coupe SUV, in December 2019 and plans to commence deliveries in 2020.

job_description:
CLARA analytics ("CLARA") drives change in the commercial insurance markets with easy to use artificial intelligence (AI) based solutions that dramatically reduce claims costs by anticipating the needs of claimants and helping align the best resources to meet those needs. Leading examples of our solutions include CLARA providers, an award-winning provider scoring engine that helps rapidly connect injured workers with top performing doctors, and CLARA claim, an early warning system that helps frontline claims teams efficiently manage claims, reduce escalations and understand the drivers of complexity. CLARA’s customers include a broad spectrum from the top 25 insurance carriers to small, self-insured organizations.

This is a chance to get in early with a rapidly growing Silicon Valley company, and to participate in developing the next generation of truly game-changing products in the Insurance Industry.

We are a leading software provider in the fast growing Insure-tech industry. We improve insurance claims outcomes for patients and carriers in commercial insurance through easy-to-use AI.

About the role:
We are looking for a self-driven, world class Software Engineer in Test Lead who will work with the Data Engineering and ML teams to architect and develop innovative frameworks to characterize and validate the tens of gigabytes of data that flows through CLARA’s ETL pipelines on a daily basis. You will play a key role in monitoring the consistency of the data ingested, ensuring the correctness of our pipelines and validating the results of our ML algorithms.

Be a key contributor to the strategy and architecture of CLARA’s data validation process

Develop test strategies, plans and cases and engineering best practices related to software test engineering, both manual and automated testing with a specific focus on data quality

Experience & expertise in creation of Test Automation frameworks using Python or Java or Scala.
