Ability to resolves major client issues as they may arise by finding "win-win" solutions. Recommends solutions that are new and different from those requested by the client, yet customized to client’s needs.
Ability to anticipate key market place trend, and opportunities and synthesizes new and improved ways of meeting business needs.
Ability to work collaboratively across business units with a company-wide, market-focused view of the future
Driver of continuous improvement
Experience and Qualifications:
Possess a minimum of 10 years of relevant professional experience to include
 management consulting experience (a minimum of 5+years in consulting preferred),
IT solution design experience of complex, large-scale, and strategic projects.
Experience of both technical infrastructure and software architecture, ideally working for a dynamic system integrator / value-add partner / solution provider in an external customer-focused environment
Big 5 Consulting Experience Preferred.
Detailed knowledge of software architecture principles and Methodologies.
Be customer focused - able to present technical information and concepts to non-technical people
History of successfully managing a team of technologist (Team size: 5-15). Successfully engaged on projects from Inception through completion.
Competency in one or more technologies and how best to utilize them in building out a solution – Java and/or .Net
Solution design experience of portal services, directory and identity services, collaboration tools, networking solutions - both LAN and WAN infrastructure, server, desktop and storage and cloud architectures.
Strong industry experience in one or more industry area, including Healthcare, Financial service and Retail/Packages good.
Practical experience in Java, Web Services & Servers, Middleware, .Net and SOA knowledge as it pertains to architecting solutions.
Experience with Web based technologies : HTML 5, CSS3, Javascript, XML, XSLT, Ajax, Java, JSP, Servlet, JSF
Experience with LDAP, SAML
Knowledge of OutSystems or FICO Application Studio is preferred
Competent in database technologies, specifically as they pertain to high throughput transactional and/or large data warehousing solutions.
Can speak to multiple aspects of FICO product integrations
Demonstrable knowledge in Solution Architecting, code-profiling and optimization
Education and/or Certifications:
Must have a BS degree in engineering, computer science, or a scientific-related field.
Why Make a Move to FICO?
At FICO, you can develop your career with a leading organization in one of the fastest-growing fields in technology today – Big Data analytics. You’ll play a part in our commitment to help businesses use data to improve every choice they make, using advances in artificial intelligence, machine learning, predictive and prescriptive modeling, and much more.
FICO makes a real difference in the way businesses operate worldwide:
Credit Scoring — 150+ billion FICO Scores have been sold to date, making it the most used credit score in the world.
Fraud Detection and Security — 2.6+ billion payment cards globally are protected by FICO fraud systems.
Lending — 3/4 of US mortgages are approved using the FICO Score.
Anti-Money Laundering — our solutions check more than half a billion transactions a day to prevent criminal schemes such as terrorist financing
Global trends toward digital transformation have created tremendous demand for FICO’s solutions, placing us among the world’s top 100 software companies by revenue. We support many of the world’s largest banks, insurers, retailers, telecommunications providers and other firms reach a new level of success.
Our success is dependent on really talented people – just like you – who thrive on the collaboration and innovation that’s nurtured by a diverse and inclusive environment. We’ll provide the support you need, while ensuring you have the freedom to develop your skills and grow your career. Join FICO and help change the way business thinks!
Learn more about how you can fulfill your potential at www.fico.com/Careers
FICO values the benefit that diversity and a culture of inclusion bring to our workplace. job_title: Principal Technical Consultant, Federal - Top Secret Clearance
job_description:
We are seeking a Principal Technical Consultant to join our Customer Success Public Sector team. Our team is a mission-focused organization with a long and successful history of supporting customers across federal civilian agencies and the department of defense. In this role, you will be engaging with our customers post-sales to develop software solutions on the Appian platform. These applications help organizations drive digital transformation and equips the government with solutions that enable them to achieve their agencies' objectives. Your primary responsibility will be to implement innovative technical solutions on the Appian platform and advise our government customers on how to best architect and deliver Appian technology solutions.

What you'll do:

Immediately impact clients by partnering throughout the entire life-cycle of projects to define, design, and implement business process-based solutions.
Drive adoption by empowering clients to become self-sufficient with building process applications on their own.
Design, implement and provide demonstrations of solutions with Appian software.
Design, build and launch new data models in production.
Establish and implement metrics to optimize team delivery and measure business agility in terms of predictability, reliability, and adaptability.
Independently communicate with both client technical teams and business owners as needed during the design and implementation.

You'll be successful in this role if you are:

Skilled at working with clients to define business processes and gather functional system requirements
Not an order taker; asks "why" questions and solve the right problems
Passionate about technology and enjoys continuously learning
Successful on cross-functional teams; has built products using agile methodologies
An excellent communicator and is comfortable presenting to both technical and non-technical audiences

Preferred skills and experience:

Active Top Secret Clearance
B.S./B.A. in Engineering, Computer Science, Mathematics or related field/degree
10+ years of experience with hands-on software development or technical consulting
US Citizen and willingness to complete DoD or Federal Civilian government background investigations.
Proficiency in coding in 1 or 2 languages (e.g. Java, JavaScript, .NET, Python, Node.js Ruby, PHP, etc).
Knowledge of software testing practice; Test-driven development, setup and execution of automated test suites within a continuous integration framework
Knowledge of data model design, working with relational databases such as SQL Server, Oracle, AWS Aurora, and MySQL, JDBC Connections and PL/SQL
Web servers and application servers such as IIS, Apache HTTP Server, Tomcat, and JBoss
Developing integrations using APIs such as REST and SOAP, web services
Agile software development practices, pair programming, stand-ups, planning sessions, and sprints
Amazon Web Services (AWS); Artificial Intelligence (AI), Analytics, Machine Learning, Google Cloud, Application Integration, Database, Developer Tools, Management & Governance, and Elastic Containers
Willingness to travel; 10% or less annually to support customer engagement

About Us:
Appian provides a leading low-code software development platform that enables organizations to rapidly develop powerful and unique applications. The applications created on Appian's platform help companies drive digital transformation and competitive differentiation. Many of the world's largest organizations use Appian applications to improve customer experience, achieve operational excellence, and simplify global risk management and compliance. We have built Appian by grounding ourselves in value and in respect, which requires allowing employees to define themselves and their potential. As a result, we are proud to have earned the #1 position on The Washington Post's "Top Workplaces 2018" list in the Large Employer category.

Appian Corporation is an equal opportunity/affirmative action employer. All qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to sex, gender identity, sexual orientation, race, color, religion, national origin, disability, protected Veteran status, age, or any other characteristic protected by law. job_title: Machine Learning Engineer, Public Sector - AWS Professional Services
job_description:
Basic Qualifications
Current, active US Government Security Clearance of Secret or aboveBS in computer science, or related technical, math, or scientific field3+ years of relevant experience in building large scale enterprise IT systems2+ year of experience with data engineering, ETL, and data wrangling1+ year of public cloud computing experience in AWS
Have Questions, Wish to Apply, Have someone to refer?
Contact Josh May directly - joshmy@amazon.com

Excited by using massive amounts of data to develop Machine Learning (ML) and Deep Learning (DL) models? Want to help public sector, medical center, and non-profit customers derive business value through the adoption of Artificial Intelligence (AI)? Eager to learn from many different enterprise’s use cases of AWS ML and DL? Thrilled to be key part of Amazon, who has been investing in Machine Learning for decades, pioneering and shaping the world’s AI technology?

At Amazon Web Services (AWS), we are helping large enterprises build ML and DL models on the AWS Cloud. We are applying predictive technology to large volumes of data and against a wide spectrum of problems. Our Professional Services organization works together with our AWS customers to address their business needs using AI.

AWS Professional Services is a unique consulting team. We pride ourselves on being customer obsessed and highly focused on the AI enablement of our customers. If you have experience with AI, including building ML or DL models, we’d like to have you join our team. You will get to work with an innovative company, with great teammates, and have a lot of fun helping our customers.

If you do not live in a market where we have an open Data Scientist position, please feel free to apply. Our Data Scientists can live in any location where we have a WWPS Professional Service office.

We’re looking for top architects, system and software engineers capable of using ML and other techniques to design, evangelize, and implement state-of-the-art solutions for never-before-solved problems.

The primary responsibilities of this role are to:
Design data architectures and data lakesProvide expertise in the development of ETL solutions on AWSUse ML tools, such as Amazon SageMaker Ground Truth (GT) to annotate data. Work with Professional Services on designing workflow and user interface for GT annotation.Collaborate with our data scientists to create scalable ML solutions for business problemsInteract with customer directly to understand the business problem, help and aid them in implementation of their ML ecosystemAnalyze and extract relevant information from large amounts of historical data — provide hands-on data wrangling expertiseWork closely with account team, research scientist teams and product engineering teams to drive model implementations and new algorithmsThis position can have periods of up to 10% travel.
This position requires that the candidate selected be a US Citizen and obtain and maintain an active TS/SCI security clearance.

Preferred Qualifications
Masters or PhD degree in computer science, or related technical, math, or scientific fieldWorking knowledge of deep learning, machine learning and statistics.User interface experience with Javascript, HTMLKnowledge of ETL tools and databases (both SQL-based, NoSQL)Experience in using Python, ProgR, or Matlab or other statistical/machine learning softwareStrong communication and data presentation skillsThe motivation to achieve results in a fast-paced environment.Comfortable working in a fast paced, highly collaborative, dynamic work environment

This role requires to develop and manage application portfolios for each department and to attain all IT service level agreements for the user community within the organization. It is a leadership position that entails guiding and coaching other consultants and teams, planning and overseeing of projects and budgets and design functional strategies.

Responsible to Improves operational processes and supports critical business strategies by directing the development, implementation, and maintenance of applications systems
Manage functions of the team, including, but not limited to email exchange, identity & access management system, Microsoft Office 365 & Teams, SharePoint products in accordance with best practices

Work with external vendors to support hardware and software. Establish strong partnerships with vendors and set clear expectations.
Negotiate access agreements, establish service level agreements, and ensure contracts are in place to support the services provided by the infrastructure team.

Bachelor’s Degree or equivalency (CS, CE, CIS, IS, MIS, or engineering discipline) or equivalent work experience

Deep knowledge of the managed sub-function and solid knowledge of the overall departmental function.
Minimum of 3+ years in a solution architecture role using service and hosting solutions such as private/public cloud IaaS, PaaS and SaaS platforms.
Experience in architecting and designing technical solutions for Microsoft-centric solutions based on industry standards using Azure IaaS, PaaS and SaaS capabilities.

Experience with machine learning tools such as Azure ML, IBM, AWS, etc.

Knowledge of cloud security controls including tenant isolation, encryption at rest, encryption in transit, key management, vulnerability assessments, application firewalls, SIEM, etc.

job_title: Director or Senior Principal Engineer of Deep Learning
job_description:
Enlitic is on the verge of transforming patient care by bridging human and artificial intelligence to identify medical issues earlier and more accurately. We were founded in San Francisco in 2014and our team has since expanded to New York, Vancouver, Canada, and Melbourne, Australia. We believe that our ground-breaking work will help save time, money, and most importantly, lives - a belief shared by our investors who have fueled our work with $55 million to date. We have also garnered the attention of CNN, The Wall Street Journal, The New York Times, Inc.and Fortune among other global media outlets, and we were named one of the smartest AI companies by MIT Tech Review. Enlitic is seeking an experienced Software Engineer to join the Engineering team to support next generation AI enhanced medical diagnostics. The engineering team builds large distributed components that run Enlitic's platform. The Enlitic platform strives to redefine performance in terms of scale and latencies. The engineering team does everything from designing scalable data storage, to building out software components and internal infrastructure tools. We are looking for candidates who share a passion for tackling complexity and building platforms that can scale through multiple orders of magnitude.
The exciting things you will get to do:
Your primary mission is to lead, manage, and work closely with our DeepLearning team to build our groundbreaking AI models
Manage and run our research and experimentation efforts
Collaborate across disciplines to ensure our tooling is effective and our models meet the high standards of our clinical team
Prepare, manage, and publish cutting research for both internal and external consumption at conferences and in journals
Direct and mentor our Deep Learning team through the model production process toward product releases
Enhance the scientific culture of the team
The experience and qualifications we hope you bring to the position:
15+ years’ experience with a Bachelor's, Master’s, PhD, or MD Degree in related field
Math background (calculus, linear algebra, statistics)
Prior deep learning experience is required – CV or NLP preferred
Proven experience building and leading Deep Learning Teams in both research and production
You have strong coding skills, and can work in languages ranging from Python to C++ in a team development environment
You are an expert in scientific computing and systems and have model prototyping experience in TensorFlow (preferred)/PyTorch/Theano with GPUs
We celebrate diversity at our company and are proud to be an equal opportunity employer. We do not discriminate on the basis of race, religion, color, national origin, gender, sexual orientation, age, marital status, veteran status, gender identity, or disability status. We understand that to hire the best talent, we need to search the globe. We encourage our employees to be themselves and require tolerance and acceptance among our diverse talent.

Do you want to use & improve your talents building breakthrough products that solve real customer problems and have a huge impact? Microsoft Teams is an award winning (Best of Enterprise Connect 2018) chat-based collaboration application in Office 365. It's a hub for teamwork, giving teams instant access to everything they need. Microsoft Teams is also the canvas that brings all your content, tools, people, and conversations together in one place. True to Microsoft’s mission statement, the purpose of Microsoft Teams is to empower people and teams to achieve more through streamlined collaboration. However, this is just the beginning. There is a lot more to come and we need your help in creating it!

Our culture is inclusive, casual and high energy; our team members come from diverse backgrounds, thrive in team-working, and are grounded in our customer needs. This space is going through rapid growth. People can learn new technologies and grow their career quickly.
Responsibilities
We work on a varied set of challenges spanning many computer engineering domains: user experience, high availability services, security, machine learning, artificial intelligence, big data, developer ecosystem etc. And we leverage lots of cutting-edge open source technologies in our stack. We are looking for Engineering Manager to help us lead this effort in making Teams Meeting a first class experience used by millions of people worldwide and building a high performance eng team. If you want to work in a startup like environment with the desire to move fast, this may be the team for you.
Qualifications
Basic Qualifications:
10+ years of software development experience in at least one of the following languages: C++, C#, Java, TypeScript, AngularJS and/or ReactJS, or other OO language BS Degree in CS or related engineering field, out of which 4 years as EM.

Preferred Qualifications:
Passionate about having a huge impact and delivering breakthrough customer value.
Strong passion for delivering high quality, large scale services in storage, search, data or related areas.
Ability to ramp up quickly on new technologies and adopt solution from within the company or from the Open Source community.
Experience with deploying, running and maintaining large scale services.
Exceptional problem solving & debugging skills. Background in data storage technologies is a plus. Awareness of emerging design patterns and technologies in Web UI space

job_title: Siri - Engineering Program Manager, Siri Experience
job_description:
Summary
Posted: Apr 29, 2020
Role Number:200168373
Would you like to play a part in the next revolution in human-computer interaction? Contribute to a product that is redefining mobile computing. Create groundbreaking technology for artificial intelligence. We are building new Siri products and features that ship to hundreds of millions of customers around the world, across consumer products like iPhone, Apple Watch and AirPods. We're looking for someone to own the technical program and product management efforts across our product portfolio. You have an eye for product and design, but also love rolling up your sleeves and getting into the weeds with engineering. You have a consistent track record of successfully leading large, highly sophisticated, cross-functional programs. You're willing to wear any hat vital and thrive in a dynamic, fast-paced environment. As a part of our team, you'd be responsible for building amazing new features and driving critical improvements to deliver the highest quality user experience that Apple customers expect and love!
Key Qualifications
7+ years in a product, program and/or project management role leading cross-functional teams in product development
Experience managing large and sophisticated software programs for consumer products at scale
Self-motivated and proactive, with proven creative and critical thinking capabilities
Excellent communication and presentation skills, written and verbal, to all levels of an organization
Innate drive to improve how things work, strong technical skills with an aptitude for design and user experience
Insatiable curiosity, not afraid to ask questions and dig deep into technical areas
Ability to, directly and indirectly, lead large teams for success
Prior experience working on speech and NL products is a major plus
Description
- Lead roadmap planning and execution of your features
- Drive and ship large, cross-functional features from inception through ship and post-ship
- Define, plan and deliver features end-to-end working closely with engineering, design and other Siri PM's - Lead all aspects of your projects including specifications, scope, requirements, timelines, and resource allocation
- Analyze product metrics to measure performance and use this data to drive decisions
- Be the voice of the customer; partner with design and champion features that build a beautiful, compelling and intuitive end-user experience
- Communicate project status to leads and executives, present in executive reviews and coordinate product demos
- Build strong relationships across Apple and facilitate communication between cross-divisional groups
Education & Experience
BS/MS/PhD CS/CE/EE or Equivalent
Additional RequirementsStrong technical proficiency, with experience in and passion for speech recognition and natural language processingFamiliarity with agile development methodologies and experiencing influencing and driving adoption in your workplaceBonus: prior programming experience within a workplace or academic environment
Apple is an equal opportunity employer that is committed to inclusion and diversity. We also take affirmative action to offer employment and advancement opportunities to all applicants, including minorities, women, protected veterans, and individuals with disabilities. Apple will not discriminate or retaliate against applicants who inquire about, disclose, or discuss their compensation or that of other applicants.

About Rev:
Rev is the largest and most popular voice-to-text service in the world with more than 170,000 customers globally. Recognized widely as the most accurate and fastest service of its kind, Rev helps anyone capture insights from voice, connect with audiences and turbocharge productivity. Powered by a large and vibrant community of freelancers, Rev uses artificial intelligence tools to turn speech into text at unparalleled low cost. The company is obsessed with making the power of voice accessible to everyone, all while creating fulfilling work-from-home jobs.

About the Position:
Rev is growing quickly!

Rev's support team not only provides customers top tier service but to our freelancer workforce as well. Our support team is 100% remote and located all over the globe. As our support leader, you will be on the frontline in providing the best experience and gaining insight into our users. In this role you will report to the Director of Operations and drive sustainable growth management of our 30 person support team.

We are looking for a data-driven manager and relationship builder who enjoys working with a large team. You should be passionate about providing customers and freelancers with a timely and robust experience. You are people person who likes to get your hands dirty. You are constantly looking for ways to increase efficiency and eliminate frustration points.

Responsibilities:

Provide people leadership and guidance for the support team by defining responsibilities setting the expectations
Define a vibrant culture and robust on-boarding experience for a fully remote team
Use Key Process Indicators (KPI's) and other metrics to track performance, maintain accountability and drive continual process improvement
Work closely with customers and freelancers to ensure we are providing solutions that meet their needs through interactions and surveys
Collaborate with product and operations to facilitate new product enhancements
Work with vendors to manage and improve our systems.
Own capacity forecasting for team resources and facilitate changes to enable our support organization to grow.

Preferred Qualifications:

Minimum of 4 years leading teams in an application support or SaaS customer support with experience in managing process improvements with measurable positive outcomes
Bachelor's degree or equivalent combination of education and experience.
Experience leading a remote workforce is preferred
You enjoy using data to gain insight into your organization. (Excel knowledge is a plus, Zendesk experience is needed)
Must be a self started who is collaborative, customer-focused and project-oriented
Highly organized and confidence under pressure. There is rarely a day when we are not running at full steam and juggling multiple tasks.
Excellent communication skills with a keen attention to detail while handling multiple priorities. The support team is highly distributed and interacts with a lot of internal groups.
Expect occasional off-hours, shift work, or weekend hours as needed to support Production and Releases

Security and Compliance are arguably the most significant concerns for enterprises today. M365 Security + Compliance Team has been building momentum in this space and has become a market leader in several categories. As part of our evolution, we are innovating at a rapid pace, designing new experiences that extend from the security professional to the consumer spaces. If you are curious and have a passion for complexity, come join our multidisciplinary team of designers and creatives who are transforming the workplace.

The M365 Security + Compliance Team is looking for a bridge builder, cross pollinator and open minded design leader who will focus on delivering the design strategy across Security + Compliance ecosystem extending throughout our sister products across M365 and Microsoft.
We are on a One Microsoft journey, connecting our ecosystem experiences and putting customers at the center. You will continue to pursue that north star and, through design strategy excellence and vision, guide different teams across the business to reconcile an ecosystem approach.

Our studios are large, open, spaces where designers, managers, and producers work collaboratively to craft experiences. We are big fans of sticky notes and design thinking. We take a systems design approach to our work. . We partner with top-notch program managers, developers, producers, and researchers who together on release dates, technological challenges, and customer feedback.

All design managers in M365 design studios must have a clear understanding of each phase of the design process: information architecture + interaction design, research + usability, rapid prototyping, visual + motion design, brand integration, and content creation. You will be expected to broaden your technical understanding as new technologies emerge, and you'll get the chance to apply it and your growing design expertise as roles in and across the studios evolve.
Responsibilities
You will play many roles. You will be an educator, a consultant, a hands-on collaborator, a coach and a mentor. Above all, you will inspire everyone around you towards a design vision for the M365 S+C portfolio and how it comes to life. You will help define our business strategy and models to keep up with the growing needs and demands of our customers. You will also learn about our technologies and their impact, so that you can translate business and technology into compelling customer-focused solutions and experiences.

Strategy & Planning
Partner with product management and engineering to drive improvements to the S+C process
Responsible for designing and measuring experiences to understand how new products and technologies, impact our partners, business, and customer
Grow our presence and reputation and be a voice and spokesperson externally and across the company
Establish what Design strategy excellence should look like for Microsoft
Define initiatives that land our charter and extend our reach into new areas
Understand strategic business goals to focus work around Objectives and Key Results
Present complex design concepts to key stakeholders and business partners
Contribute to annual, quarterly, and monthly strategic planning in support of key objectives

Delivery & Execution
Inspire the team to ensure exceptional design deliverables
Oversee timelines and deliverables, guide production, and communicate evolving project goals
Review design proposals to ensure efforts are aligned with company, stakeholder, and end user priorities
Find a meaningful balance between optimizing for speed, quality, and doing risky, but interesting work

People
Comfortably lead and inspire
Create opportunities for designers to grow and flourish
Provide guidance, oversight, and mentorship to the team
Set expectations and help to promote a fun, highly collaborative team culture
Attract, retain, and develop top talent
Foster cross-functional collaboration (e.g., with Engineering and Product Management) to drive value
Proactively identify and resolve impediments
Guide team members in strategy, alignment, analysis, and execution of tasks
Qualifications
Requirements
Strong experience building, managing, and leading product design teams
Deep knowledge of various design disciplines, with particular strength in UX
Bachelor's/Master’s degree in product design, HCI, interaction design, industrial design, communication design, architecture, or equivalent experience
10+ years of work and management related experience required
Must have strong communication skills
Solid understanding of cross platform design systems and technical frameworks
Ability to demonstrate and present an in-depth knowledge of fundamental engineering practices
Ability to communicate insight effectively to all levels of stakeholders
Experience with Security space is a plus, but not a requirement
Recent use and knowledge of Artificial Intelligence, a plus.

job_title: Enterprise Security Architect, Lead – Medical Technology and Internet of Things (IoT)
job_description:
Description
Job Description:
Leidos Military and Veterans Health Solutions (MVHS), part of Leidos Health, seeks an Enterprise Security Architect with strong background, skill and expertise combining cybersecurity with knowledge of medical environments, medical devices, and the Internet of Things (IoT). The right candidate will also have had experience creating or contributing to solutions that integrate cybersecurity and specialized information technology spanning clinical, research or administrative settings in the healthcare or allied fields.
Applicants for this remote or telecommuting position can perform this job anywhere in the U.S.
Primary Responsibilities
Successful candidates can expect to divide their time between two (2) types of assignments. First, they will assist in researching, developing, authoring and implementing cybersecurity guidance and security architectural standards for the VA Office of Enterprise Security Architecture (ESA). The successful candidate may take a lead role in promoting and refining new and existing ESA initiatives, direction and guidance through collaborative activities with other VA departments and stakeholders.
Second, the Enterprise Security Architect will act as cybersecurity health consults to security and privacy features and capabilities to execute architectural risk assessments and create security packages for proposed and existing VA IT systems, environments and devices, spanning concept, design, implementation and post-deployment phases. Candidate will interface with key VA stakeholders within the various VA product and security teams. Candidate may also provide subject matter expertise from time to time to other Leidos Health teams on an ad hoc basis.
Basic Qualifications
Masters of Arts (MA)/Masters of Science (MS) with a minimum of fifteen (15) years of experience in information technology or cybersecurity, or the equivalent of 10 additional years of experience will be accepted in lieu of a MA/MS.
Must possess at least one Advanced IT cybersecurity certification (CISSP (preferred), CISM, CISA, CIPP, CEH, or the equivalent).
Candidate must be able to pass a VA High/BI Public Trust background investigation, including a National Agency Check (NAC) covering the past seven (7) years.
Demonstrated expertise in research and analysis of exceptionally complex cybersecurity problems and processes confronting US governments systems as well as knowledge and capabilities in the areas of medical technology, medical environments (clinical and research) and medical devices or medical IoT. Specific cybersecurity interest areas may also include applying block chain technology and Artificial Intelligence/Machine Learning (AI/ML) to healthcare cybersecurity or the use of Virtual Reality or Augmented Reality (VR/AR) in either clinical or support applications.
Must possess expertise in multiple areas of information technology such as but not limited to: enterprise security architecture, cybersecurity engineering, telecommunications systems design, IT operations, risk assessments, vulnerability management, cloud technologies, system security, the Internet of Things (IoT) and privacy for both traditional and next-generation IT digital architectures.
Familiar with creating and interpreting security diagram overlays and updates, determining security requirements, and security mitigation implementation
Preferred Qualifications
Knowledge and familiarity with cybersecurity practices and trends for US government information technology, especially at VA or DoD, although we value similar cybersecurity experience acquired at other federal agencies or departments.
Familiarity with one or more US government initiatives such as the NIST Cybersecurity Framework (CSF) and Privacy Framework, the Federal Risk and Authorization Management Program (FedRAMP), the Risk Management Framework (RMF), Federal Identity Credential and Access Management (FICAM) or Electronic Health Records Management (EHRM).
Familiarity with healthcare and medical security and privacy requirements under the Health Insurance Portability and Accountability Act of 1996 (HIPAA), Health Information Technology for Economic and Clinical Health Act (HITECH), and Food and Drug Administration (FDA) regulations governing the use of medical devices as well as other federal mandates. Knowledge of assessment frameworks such as HITRUST.
External Referral Bonus:
Ineligible
Potential for Telework:
Yes
Clearance Level Required:
Public Trust
Travel:
Yes, 10% of the time
Scheduled Weekly Hours:
40
Shift:
Day
Requisition Category:
Professional
Job Family:
Security Architecture and Engineering
Leidos is a Fortune 500® information technology, engineering, and science solutions and services leader working to solve the world's toughest challenges in the defense, intelligence, homeland security, civil, and health markets. The company's 33,000 employees support vital missions for government and commercial customers. Headquartered in Reston, Virginia, Leidos reported annual revenues of approximately $10.19 billion for the fiscal year ended December 28, 2018. For more information, visit www.Leidos.com.
Pay and benefits are fundamental to any career decision. That's why we craft compensation packages that reflect the importance of the work we do for our customers. Employment benefits include competitive compensation, Health and Wellness programs, Income Protection, Paid Leave and Retirement. More details are available here.
Leidos will never ask you to provide payment-related information at any part of the employment application process. And Leidos will communicate with you only through emails that are sent from a Leidos.com email address. If you receive an email purporting to be from Leidos that asks for payment-related information or any other personal information, please report the email to spam.leidos@leidos.com.
All qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to sex, race, ethnicity, age, national origin, citizenship, religion, physical or mental disability, medical condition, genetic information, pregnancy, family structure, marital status, ancestry, domestic partner status, sexual orientation, gender identity or expression, veteran or military status, or any other basis prohibited by law. Leidos will also consider for employment qualified applicants with criminal histories consistent with relevant laws.

Coolest jobs on this planet… or any other… are with Lockheed Martin Space.

At the dawn of a new space age, Lockheed Martin is a pioneer, partner, innovator and builder. Our amazing men and women are on a mission to make a difference in the world and every day we use our unique skills and experiences to create, design and build solutions to some of the worlds’ hardest engineering problems. Our culture encourages employees to dream big, perform with excellence and create incredible products. We provide the resources, inspiration and focus and if you have the passion and courage to dream big, we want to build a better tomorrow with you.

The Joint Warfighting National Mission Initiative (JWNMI) will assist the new DoD Joint AI Center (JAIC) in enabling the warfighter to solve current and future strategic, operational, and tactical problems through the application of Artificial Intelligence (AI). AI-enabled operations improve Joint Force capabilities by making operational functions faster, more accurate, and able to operate in a more synchronized manner. AI-enabled decision making helps the Joint Force beyond the capacity of human-centered operational planning to the point where human-machine integration provides the Joint Force with a decisive edge against any adversary.

As the Associate Chief Engineer for Integration, you will:
Help provide overall technical leadership to the program’s integration of AI capabilities into new and existing DoD Programs of Record, working closely with the program’s Integration architecture leadSupport program Leadership in creating and managing project roadmaps/schedules and evaluating new Technical Direction Letter (TDL) requestsHelp define the product solution vision for new program requirements requested by the customerProvide support to program engineering boards when delegated by board chairHelp ensure the flawless execution of program development, integration, engagement and operations support by reviewing work products, analyzing execution data, participating in program planning, and providing leadership to deployment and operations support events and situationsAssist with the program technical leadership team with program start up activities to develop and define program approaches, plans and procedures, including documentation.

This position requires an active TS/SCI security clearance.



To promote the sharing of ideas, Lockheed Martin fosters an inclusive work environment that encourages differences and big-picture thinking. Our employees play an active role in strengthening the quality of life where we live and work by volunteering more than 850,000 hours annually. Here are some of the benefits you can enjoy:
MedicalDental401kPaid time offWork/life balanceCareer developmentMentorship opportunitiesRewards & recognition
Lockheed Martin is an Equal Opportunity/Affirmative Action Employer. You will receive consideration for employment without regard to race, color, religion, sex, pregnancy, sexual orientation, gender identity, national origin, age, protected veteran status, or disability status.

Learn more about Lockheed Martin’s competitive and comprehensive benefits package.
Basic Qualifications:
Experience as a Systems Engineer or Product OwnerExperience working in a multi-project, multiple customer environmentExperience in systems engineering activities such as requirements definition, system design and architecture, operational environment integration and testing.Experience in End-to-End/System-of-System integrationStrong problem-solving skills
Experience with Agile development methodologiesStrong written and oral communication skillsExperience supporting briefings and engagements with customersAbility to perform effectively in a team environment, interacting with developers, technical leadership, other engineers, and management.The candidate must have a TS clearance and be SCI eligible.
Desired Skills:
Participating in a Chief Engineer (CE) Pipeline development program or equivalent senior technical leadership development program such as Rising Technical Talent (RTT)Experience interfacing with US Army, Navy, Marine Corps, Space Force or Air Force personnel at various levels, ideally with experience in both acquisition programs and operational units of multiple servicesUnderstanding of the operational and tactical level command and control and Intelligence Surveillance and Reconnaissance systems in use by the U.S. Army, Navy, Marine Corp and Air Force for non-space domain operations.
Ability to build strong relationships with program internal and external stakeholders and peersAbility to facilitate group discussions to close on technical solutions with senior team members.Experience with AI/ML concepts, tools, and methodologiesExperience with on-contract, new work proposal development such as Task Orders, major Engineering Change Proposals or the equivalent inclusive of customer engagement, scope definition, solution development, cost estimating and sub-contractor engagementActive TS/SCI clearanceThe candidate should possess a high degree of ethics, strong core values and an optimistic outlook, and show the ability to work independently with initiative, creativity and innovation
BASIC QUALIFICATIONS:
job.Qualifications

Lockheed Martin is an Equal Opportunity/Affirmative Action Employer. All qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to race, color, religion, sex, pregnancy, sexual orientation, gender identity, national origin, age, protected veteran status, or disability status.
Join us at Lockheed Martin, where your mission is ours. Our customers tackle the hardest missions. Those that demand extraordinary amounts of courage, resilience and precision. They’re dangerous. Critical. Sometimes they even provide an opportunity to change the world and save lives. Those are the missions we care about.

As a leading technology innovation company, Lockheed Martin’s vast team works with partners around the world to bring proven performance to our customers’ toughest challenges. Lockheed Martin has employees based in many states throughout the U.S., and Internationally, with business locations in many nations and territories.

Experienced Professional

AI Software Engineer, Lead - (00055645)
Description

MITRE’s Collaboration and Social Computing Department is seeking a Lead Software Engineer with extensive experience in Artificial Intelligence (AI), Machine Learning (ML), Natural Language Processing (NLP), and Software Engineering concepts and tools. While the selected candidate will work on a wide variety of efforts, there is an immediate need for an individual with very strong AI/ML/NLP, computer vision, and software engineering skills, as well as leadership and extensive customer-facing experience, to take on a challenging sponsor project known as the LEADS Program. In this position, the ideal candidate will advise influential sponsors, solve urgent problems in AI-enabled collaboration and social computing systems, and position the department to react quickly to future requests for work in intelligent collaboration systems.

The successful candidate will:

Lead software engineering teams in the architecture and implementation of solutions for challenging AI-enabled collaboration and social computing systems in domains such as healthcare, intelligence, and defense
Mature the department's strategy for enhancing readiness to develop a broad range of AI-enabled collaboration and social computing system prototypes
– Mentor and recommend training for department members in AI/ML/NLP and software engineering techniques that are useful for advanced collaboration and social computing systems

Develop and use modern software engineering techniques to integrate AI/ML/NLP algorithms into conceptual prototypes

Stay up-to-date on advances within the AI/ML/NLP fields, both in industry and academia

Demonstrate technical proficiency and leadership in producing software solutions that address sponsor requirements and needs

Establish and maintain trusted relationships with MITRE customers in order to understand their missions, domains and challenges; serve as a Trusted Advisor

Assume full responsibility for deliverables including definition, completion, and technical quality, as well as assuring consistency

Have expertise in industry standard best practices for software design, implementation, testing, and documentation


Qualifications

Required Qualifications

Bachelor’s degree in Computer Science, Computer Engineering, or similar field.
Must be a US citizen capable of obtaining and maintaining a Top Secret Clearance.8 + years’ experience with programming languages such as Python and C++, as well as professional experience with AI frameworks such as TensorFlow, Torch, Caffe, AWS Machine Learning or Keras.
Specialization in an AI-related field of study, or related job experience.
Demonstrated technical leadership.Customer-facing experience.
Excellent written and verbal communications skills.


Preferred qualifications

Preference given to qualified candidates with an active Top-Secret clearance.Master’s Degree or higher in Computer Science, Computer Engineering, or similar field.
Understanding of Deep Neural Networks (DNNs) and Generative Adversarial Networks (GANs) a plus.

Other Locations: United States-Massachusetts-Bedford
Work Locations: Washington 22102

This requisition requires a clearance of: Top Secret
Travel: Yes, 5 % of the Time
Job Posting: Apr 30, 2020, 10:57:25 PM

As a CSM at Moveworks you will be leading initiatives to drive widespread adoption and impact with the Moveworks product. You will play an advisory role to customers as they deploy and optimize our product, build long-term strategic relationships with both customers and partners, and ensure optimal customer experience and outcomes. Each of our team members push boundaries, own customer scenarios, and deliver high-quality results. If you’re ready to do the best work of your career and help build an enduring company in the process, we would love to meet you!

Integral parts of this role are serving as the voice of the customer internally, understanding their challenges, and partnering with internal teams to ensure we are building a product that customers love and delivers value. The ideal candidate will be instrumental from the point of sale and extend through implementation, project success and renewals. You must have a drive to identify and improve usage while becoming a trusted partner for key accounts. Come to this role with a problem-solving mindset and curiosity to learn, and be able to play in the fast-paced, ambiguous startup environment.

For most customers, Moveworks is their first deployment of Artificial Intelligence and Machine Learning. As a CSM, you will be their trusted advisor and educator while growing your own knowledge of the AI and ML space. You will become a true partner to our most strategic customers and shape how our product evolves by representing the voice of the customer. This job offers an incredible growth trajectory, and a place where your contributions add immense value to the company’s success. Join us to do the best work of your career.

What will you do?

You partner with our initial customers to drive product value
You develop trusted advisor relationships with executive sponsors to ensure they are achieving full business value
You partner cross-functionally to translate business needs and product requirements into new solutions for customers
You will evolve and iterate on our customer onboarding strategy
You work with internal teams and customers to drive adoption, engagement and growth
You will help customers identify, quantify, and work toward transformational goals in partnership with Moveworks
You will adapt quickly to product changes and limitations, and communicate these strategically to stakeholders
You will act as the voice of the customer, gathering customer feedback and helping share the product roadmap

What do you bring to the table?

You have 2+ years of account management, implementation, or sales experience in software/SaaS
You have experience in explaining technical solutions, establishing goals, developing opportunities, building + selling business cases, and improving customer experience
You have experience supporting deployments with large enterprise customers
Process focused with strong problem-solving ability - always searching for a smarter, better way to achieve a goal
You have experience building strong internal and external relationships, including with senior-level executives throughout companies
You are diplomatic, have tact and you are poised under pressure
You possess a voracious appetite to learn and grow
You have completed a Bachelor’s degree
You are willing to travel 10-25% of the time

job_title: OSS Lead KP – Technical PM - Infrastructure Project Manager
job_description:
Arthur Grand Technologies is in the business of providing staffing and technology consulting services . We have doubled our revenue year over year for the past 5 years. This speaks to the long lasting relationship and customer satisfaction that we have built in this short span of time. Our company is managed by a team of professionals who worked for big 5 consulting firms for 20+ years We are a minority owned staff augmentation and technology consulting company.

​

​Advantage of doing business with us

Dedicated Client Relationship Manager – We have dedicated client relationship manager for each customer to understand their needs and serve better.

Proven Track Record – Providing staffing services to major Systems Integrators including Accenture, Grant Thornton LLP and Deloitte LLP. We always deliver what we promise which resulted in repeat business with our customers.

Speed – our experts can be on-site or on the project within days after your selection.

Cost Savings – by hiring our experts, you avoid costly recruiting fees, relocation expenses, and fully loaded costs associated with providing benefits.

Transition to Full-time – in cases where the customer want to continue the initial relationship, it is entirely possible that the initial contract relationship can be converted to a full-time position.

Supplier Diversity Goals – Customer can take credit of 100% of the contracting dollars to meet its small business contracting goals.

Services:
Our IT professionals offer a breadth of skills that can match virtually any client requirement. Our candidates specialize in many technical disciplines such as:

Data Science, Machine Learning and Artificial Intelligence

Mobile and Web Development

Cloud Computing (IaaS, PaaS, SaaS) and Virtualization

Data Warehousing and Business Intelligence

Infrastructure Management Services

Project and Program Management

Tasks

Position: OSS Lead KP – Technical PM

Location: Pentagon City, VA

Full Time

We are currently seeking a motivated, career and customer-oriented IT Operations Support Services Engineer (OSS) / Technical Project Manager to begin an exciting and challenging career.

Responsibilities:
The candidate shall provide technical ability in supporting the OSS task within the JSP infrastructure. The successful candidate must possess proven technical ability in the architecture, deployment, and sustainment of COTS, GOTS, and custom-built applications.

The OSS Task is to facilitate and automate the Operations, Administration, Maintenance, and Provisioning (OAM&P) activities for JSP using commercial best practices and industry technologies, standards, and frameworks. This task area is the focal point for the modernization of the IT infrastructure that the JSP PSS contract is operating and maintaining.

Successful delivery of this position’s expectations requires someone with strong oral and written communication skills, including the ability to communicate technical subjects to non-expert, technical managers.

Position Requirements


Five years of experience in computer system engineering; hardware and software analysis, system integration, and system maintenance.
With a minimum of three years of work related experience in the following computer related areas: Networks, servers, and systems management; Public Key Infrastructure, IT customer support; computer server and workstation installation, diagnosis and repair; technical writing; computer security; knowledge management; database administration, design and management; system maintenance; information technology project management; information system testing.
Knowledge of a range of current information technologies, computing platforms, and network systems, such as: cloud computing, blade server, unified communications, collaboration tools, cryptographic systems, social networks tools, enterprise services bus
Experience securing Operating Systems to comply with DISA STIGs. The Security Technical Implementation Guides (STIGs) are the configuration standards for DOD Information Assurance (IA) and IA-enabled devices/systems.
Network experience configuring and maintaining desktop firewalls.
Experience configuring security policies to protect system applications.

Education / Certification / Security Clearance Requirement:

Bachelor's in Science degree in Computer Engineering, computer information systems, telecommunications, or management information systems, or 12 years overall experience relevant to this position or equivalent.
Active DoD 8140 certification at IAT Level II: CCNA Security, CySA+, GICSP, GSEC, Security+ CE, SSCP; candidates without a valid certification will not be considered
Active DoD issued Top Secret Clearance or Higher

job_title: Senior Manager Product Mgmt External Services -Tech
정리된 job_title: Senior Manager Product Mgmt External Services
job_description:
Bachelor’s degree with a technical major (e.g., math, computer science, physics, engineering) from an accredited college or university14+ years of professional experience including at least 4 years of management experience7+ years of professional experience in an IT sales organization or an IT consulting role1+ year of ML industry experienceWillingness to travel to meet with customers (~40% of time)

Amazon Web Services (AWS) is looking for a Senior Manager of Product Managment for external services who possesses a unique balance of business expertise, Artificial Intelligence (AI) and Machine Learning (ML) depth, and strong interpersonal skills. This role will focus on (1) supporting customers across industries who desire to use AWS AI/ML to enhance their business or operational outcomes; and (2) building and leading a global team to do the same.

Your broad responsibilities include: owning the business approach and ultimate success around specific AI/ML projects. You should be comfortable leading a discussion of complex business concepts with cross-functional groups which can include business executives, line managers, data scientists, as well as IT operations resources. In addition, you will engage with other AWS service teams, solutions architects, business development, marketing, partners and regional professional services organizations to drive large and highly complex sales opportunities to closure and through delivery.
You will evangelize AWS AI/ML and be a trusted ML advisor to the customer. You will enjoy working with customers of all shapes and sizes, listening to their needs and translating those into concrete ML solutions using AWS services that have business impact. You will have a passion for educating and ideating on ML-based solutions for a diverse and challenging set of customer problems across industries.
You will also have a strong understanding of large-scale AI/ML solutions as well as proven leadership and team-building skills. The ideal candidate will have past experience working as a management consultant, ML practitioner, analytics delivery lead, or industry executive and an appreciation of the advantages of cloud computing. You will enjoy keeping your existing business and AI/ML skills honed and developing new ones, so you can make strong contributions to deep business discussions.

RESPONSIBILITIES
Build and lead a teamEnsure customer success in ideating and launching AI/ML on the AWS platformEducate customers on the value proposition of AWS AI/ML and lead deep business discussions to identify business problems and ML solutions designed to capture business value and drive the intended success metricsLead workshops with customer leaders to identify AI/ML opportunitiesAuthor or otherwise contribute to AWS customer-facing publications such as whitepapersBuild deep relationships with individuals within customers to enable them to be AWS AI/ML advocatesAct as a business liaison between customers, services, data scientists and support

The successful candidate will possess both technical and customer-facing skills that will allow him/her to be the technical “face” of AWS for the ML Solutions Lab. He/she will be able to drive discussions with senior leadership with customers and partners, as well as to interact with and collaborate with software developers, IT professionals, data scientists and system architects.
Graduate degree (e.g., MBA, MS, JD, PhD)Strong verbal and written communications skills are a must, as well as the ability to listen to the voice of the customer and to work effectively and collaboratively across internal and external teamsExcellent speaking and presentation skills including formal presentations, white boarding, large and small group presentations, as well as strong writing skillsBusiness understanding of cloud computingFun to work with, team-oriented and results-driven

BA/BS degree in graphic design, HCI, interaction design, or related field. May be substituted with significant industry experience and accomplishments.10+ years of experience in product, web, and mobile UX design.Portfolio of shipped work demonstrating impactful principal design work and leadership, with a deep understanding of human-centered design principles.Strong communication, presentation, and interpersonal skills including the ability to communicate design concepts clearly and persuasively across different audiences and varying levels of the organization.Ability to organize, plan, and stay ahead of the work.Work must consistently demonstrate a strong aesthetic judgement and training, in addition to exemplary UX skills.Experience designing UX across different types of devices and screen sizesProficiency in a variety of design tools such as Sketch, Figma, Illustrator, Photoshop, Axure, Invision, Flinto.Proven ability to both deliver a bold vision and iterate quickly on concepts to arrive at an amazing customer experience.Experience in a wide range of qualitative and quantitative user research methodologies.Excellent writing skills.

What will artificial intelligence and data science look like in 10 years? How do we design tools and rich user interfaces to empower millions of humans working with code and data: scientists, engineers, developers, analysts, students, and data scientists? How would you design a dashboard for managing complex machine learning experiments? How will people collaborate in the creation and sharing of narratives based on code, data, and AI? How do we build tools that encourage practitioners and organizations towards the ethical usage of AI? How can we design user experiences that empower humans as they work alongside AI-based systems? Are you up for a challenge to develop a comprehensive and ambitious design strategy for the future of AI?

The Amazon SageMaker team is on a mission to make data science and machine learning understandable, accessible, affordable, and scalable. Amazon SageMaker provides every developer and data scientist with the ability to build, train, and deploy machine learning models quickly. As a fully-managed cloud service, it covers the entire data science workflow from data preparation and exploratory data analysis to model building and inference. The foundation of the SageMaker user experience is the industry standard, open-source Jupyter Notebook.

We are looking for passionate and innovative design leaders who will guide our design efforts in this emerging and exciting field.

You are an experienced design leader, ready to champion human centered design to simplify complicated and painful customer tasks and activities in data science and machine learning. You feel at home working in diverse, cross-functional teams that include product managers, scientists, and developers.

As a design leader, you have deep knowledge and practical experience in all aspects of UX design for software applications, from user research and design concept creation to visual and interaction design and usability testing. You will work collaboratively with leaders inside AWS, the open-source community (Project Jupyter, etc.), and AWS customers to deliver products that are intuitive, understandable, and a joy to use.

Key Responsibilities
Lead, mentor, and inspire a growing team of UX designers and researchers.Design products that delight a wide range of users working with code, data, and machine learning models on the AWS AI platform: data scientists, data engineers, machine learning researchers, analysts, and students.Develop a comprehensive design vision, approach, and strategy for the AI platform, looking past the current hype and limitations of AI to the long-term human and business value for AWS customers.Create design principles for the ethical and responsible usage of AI, and work to incorporate them into a design system and products.Drive design projects through all phases, from user research and exploratory mockups to design reviews, delivery, and usability testing.Collaborate and communicate effectively within cross-functional teams that span design, product, engineering, and management.Design the UX, visual style, user interface, information architecture, and interaction flow of web applications for users working with code, data, and machine learning models.Develop and maintain a detailed design system that spans multiple products, and communicate those to developers and product managers.Collaborate on design projects with open source projects in the data and machine learning space, including Project Jupyter.Develop and contribute deep knowledge of the latest user research practices, HCI research, design guidelines, and design heuristics.Solicit and accept feedback, weigh inputs and priorities, and take part in constructive dialogue to resolve healthy debates.Conduct design reviews with senior leadership showing a strong ability to communicate design ideas and the customer and business impact of designs.

Master’s degree in graphic design, HCI, interaction design, or related field preferred. May be substituted with significant industry experience and accomplishments.Experience in managing design teams.Experience working in a collaborative team, partnering closely with product management to define use cases and requirements, and working directly with developers on implementation of your designs.Experience in information architecture design.Prior design experience in the field of data science, developer tools, and machine learning tools.Familiarity with personas relevant to the AWS AI platform: data scientists, scientists, machine learning researchers, analysts, students, and teachers.Experience in inclusive UX design and web accessibility.

Pilgrim’s is the second largest chicken producer in the world, with operations in the U.S., Puerto Rico, Mexico and the U.K. Pilgrim’s processes, prepares, packages and delivers fresh, further-processed and value-added poultry products for sale to customers in more than 100 countries, employs more than 50,000 people and contracts with more than 5,200 family farmers. Pilgrim’s is headquartered in beautiful Greeley, Colorado, at the JBS USA corporate office where our 1,200 employees enjoy more than 300 days of sunshine a year.
We are looking for a Data Science Manager who is passionate about unlocking the value of our data to provide data insights that inform and influence our product and business decisions. By managing a data science team and analyzing large internal and publicly available datasets, you will empower our business through the use of machine learning and artificial intelligence, enhance decision making and allow for insight driven collaboration.
 Responsibilities:
Leverage the optimum machine learning techniques for predictions in various Business Units such as Procurement, Sales, Marketing, Operations, etc. to enhance revenue and reduce costs.
Design, develop, and implement end-to-end machine learning production pipelines (data exploration, data preprocessing, feature engineering, model building, and performance evaluation).
Collaborate with data engineers and IT to implement robust production solutions.
Communicate the findings to peers and executives through effective data visualizations techniques.
Work with different business units across the company to understand their needs and help identify new opportunities.
Build and maintain QlikSense reports, dashboards, and metrics to monitor the performance of our products
Build, lead, and coach data engineers & data scientists to deliver world-class products
Research new technologies and methods across data science, data engineering, and data visualization to improve the technical capabilities of the team.
Qualifications:


Master’s or Ph.D. degree in Applied mathematics, Computer Science, Software Engineering, Statistics, Business Analytics or related fields.
Three or more years of Data Science experience preferred.
Highly proficient in Python, SQL, and cloud platforms (Microsoft Azure, AWS, or GCP).
Solid technical and-on skills in machine learning (regression, classification, clustering, dimensionality reduction), deep learning (CNN, RNN/LSTM), time series data, optimization, anomaly detection, statistical algorithms, and data engineering.
Proficient in Keras, Tensorflow, Scikit-learn and other machine learning libraries.
SAP BI HANA knowledge and QlikSense reporting proficiency.
Strong ability to use logic and excellent problem-solving skills.
Demonstrated experience with agile development methods.
Experience in agricultural/meat/animal husbandry industries is a plus.
EOE/M/F/V/Disabled

job_title: Director of Product and Test Engineering
job_description:
Job Description

Come join a creative team of engineers dedicated to designing the hardware technologies that network the leading cloud-service datacenters. We are looking for a motivated and astute individual to join our team as Director of Product and Test Engineering. You will be joining a close-knit team responsible for building the world's leading programmable Ethernet switches. Our organization works on all levels of ASIC development, starting from high-level architecture to low-level circuit design and high-volume manufacturing.

As the Director of Product and Test engineering, you will be responsible for leading a team to ensure the testability and manufacturability of integrated circuits from the component feasibility stage through production ramp. Your team will also oversee post-silicon characterization and electrical validation of the device to conformal to industry specifications and the product datasheet.

The ideal candidate should exhibit the following behavioral traits:
Strong problem-solving skills and ability to clarify ambiguity
Clear, concise communication and a collaborative personality

Qualifications

Minimum Requirements
BSEE, BS Physics, or BS Solid State Engineering or Similar
10+ years of experience in Product, Test, Reliability, and/or DFT engineering
5+ years of experience in engineering management
Preferred Requirements
12 years of engineering management experience
Understanding of networking protocols and test methods
Knowledge of networking industry expectations with respect to quality and performance
Knowledge of specialized tests used in networking industry
Experience in background in DFT engineering, semiconductor processing, and product engineering
Understanding of Fault coverage engineering processes
Understanding of DFT methods including scan methodology and RAM test
Experience with and understanding of yield modeling, yield analysis, and yield improvement methodologies
Experience designing and/or managing high volume manufacturing semiconductor test methods
Defining Flows
Defining Hardware types and capabilities
Probe test methodologies
Package test methodologies
System Level Test methodologies
Hardware maintenance
Personnel - Training, managing and hiring
Understanding of current industry best practices
Experience with automation of semiconductor test Handlers
Software linkages and controls
Knowledge of documentation and controls necessary to run a stable test floor
Test program release protocols, yield triggers, software control,
Experience with Semiconductor Characterization methodologies
Experience with and understanding of Reliability models and methods
HTOL, FIT, Acceleration Factors, HW
Knowledge of Networking Industry Reliability expectations and requirements
Experience building and maintaining highly motivated teams
Inside this Business Group

The Data Center Group (DCG) is at the heart of Intel’s transformation from a PC company to a company that runs the cloud and billions of smart, connected computing devices. The data center is the underpinning for every data-driven service, from artificial intelligence to 5G to high-performance computing, and DCG delivers the products and technologies—spanning software, processors, storage, I/O, and networking solutions—that fuel cloud, communications, enterprise, and government data centers around the world.

Posting Statement

All qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to race, color, religion, religious creed, sex, national origin, ancestry, age, physical or mental disability, medical condition, genetic information, military and veteran status, marital status, pregnancy, gender, gender expression, gender identity, sexual orientation, or any other characteristic protected by local law, regulation, or ordinance....

Position of Trust

This role is a Position of Trust. Should you accept this position, you must consent to and pass an extended Background Investigation, which includes (subject to country law), extended education, SEC sanctions, and additional criminal and civil checks. For internals, this investigation may or may not be completed prior to starting the position. For additional questions, please contact your Recruiter....

Are you passionate about AI and Machine Learning? Does the idea of building the AI/ML that will transform how trading, investments, and customer service is done, across the firm excite you? Then come and join us.
We are the AI Accelerator team at JP Morgan, a startup group with the goal of revolutionizing how Machine Learning and AI is done across the entire JP Morgan Chase. You will join the Product Management team and work alongside other leaders who have built and shipped AI and Machine Learning products at Google, Facebook, Microsoft, and Salesforce.
We are the AI Accelerator team at JP Morgan, a startup group with the goal of revolutionizing how Machine Learning and AI is done across the entire JP Morgan Chase. You will join the Product Management team and work alongside other leaders who have built and shipped AI and Machine Learning products at Google, Facebook, Microsoft, and Salesforce.

JPMorgan Chase (JPMC) is a leading global financial services firm with assets of $2 trillion and operations in more than 60 countries. JPMC has made a strategic decision to fundamentally transform its operations through the adoption of artificial intelligence and machine learning at scale. The AI Acceleration (AIX) team, headquartered in Palo Alto, is a new group tasked with achieving this vision. We’re hiring the best of the best from Silicon Valley to come join us.
To learn more about the AIX team and JPMC, please see this recent interview with our team leader and Global Head of AI, Apoorv Saxena.
Your Responsibilities:
Drive the infrastructure vision for AI Services and Solutions for AI Accelerator team
Partner with engineering team and TPM team to define product priorities
Identify the critical customer journeys for AI Services and Solutions
Construct and maintain a stack ranked product backlog
Attend customer meetings and conferences on a regular basis
Evangelize AI and Machine Learning across the firm


Requirements:
Minimum five years of experience in Product Management role
Minimum three years of experience shipping AI/ML or Analytics products
Ability to communicate the logic, reason, and priority of each CUJ
A solid grasp of user-centered design and testing methodologies
Ability to iterate on user stories and solutions efficiently and intelligently
Ability to juggle multiple priorities and effectively deliver in a fast-paced, dynamic environment
A willingness to help and share knowledge with other team members.
An insatiable appetite for feedback and constructive criticism
The ability to anticipate needs and take required actions
Familiarity with Analytics, Big Data, and public Cloud technologies.
Strong project management capabilities.
Excellent verbal and written communication skills.
Strong work ethic and the utmost attention to detail.
Master’s degree in Computer Science, Financial Engineering, Statistics, Data Science or related field



Preferred:

Previous product management experience in Public Cloud area
PhD in Computer Science, Statistics, or Data Science
MBA from a top tier business school
When you work at JPMorgan Chase & Co., you’re not just working at a global financial institution. You’re an integral part of one of the world’s biggest tech companies. In 14 technology hubs worldwide, our team of 40,000+ technologists design, build and deploy everything from enterprise technology initiatives to big data and mobile solutions, as well as innovations in electronic payments, cybersecurity, machine learning, and cloud development. Our $9.5B+ annual investment in technology enables us to hire people to create innovative solutions that will not only transform the financial services industry, but also change the world.
At JPMorgan Chase & Co. we value the unique skills of every employee, and we’re building a technology organization that thrives on diversity. We encourage professional growth and career development, and offer competitive benefits and compensation. If you’re looking to build your career as part of a global technology team tackling big challenges that impact the lives of people and companies all around the world, we want to meet you.

job_description:

Posted: May 4, 2020
Weekly Hours: 40

Are you excited by early-stage initiatives with potential for a huge impact? The Siri Assistant team is building groundbreaking technology for machine learning, computer vision, and artificial intelligence... and we are looking for people like you!
This is an opportunity to join a new team in Apple AI/ML that is investigating novel visual capabilities of Siri across all Apple products that will transform the way people engage with the world around them! We’re looking for strong program managers to work on groundbreaking technology, collaborate with experts across Apple, and deliver new end-to-end experiences that delight customers.
Key Qualifications
5+ years experience as a Program Manager, Data Scientist, Engineering Manager, or similar role leading cross-functional product or software engineering teams.
Experience managing large, highly complex software programs for consumer products at scale
Experience in statistical learning software (machine learning and/or deep-learning)
Have worked in a cloud environment, supporting experimentation and fast iteration
Excellent communication and presentation skills, written and verbal, to all levels of an organization
Innate drive to improve how things work, strong technical skills with an eye for design and user experience
Self-sufficient in analyzing and drawing conclusions about the quality and product opportunity from raw and refined product data

- Support cross-functional teams from product ideation to delivery
- Lead all aspects of your projects including specifications, scope, requirements, and timelines
- Drive data collection requirements and implement iteration loops for model and algorithm tuning
- Work with Business Development on data partnerships
- Analyze product metrics to inform product planning for immediate and long term impact
- Work with the engineering team to build solutions that will endure for years to come
