Description

About the World Bank Group

Innovation and partnership bond the five institutions of the World Bank Group (WBG): the International Bank for Reconstruction and Development (IBRD) and the International Development Association (IDA), which together form the World Bank; the International Finance Corporation (IFC); the Multilateral Investment Guarantee Agency (MIGA); and the International Centre for Settlement of Investment Disputes (ICSID). The World Bank Group is one of the world's largest sources of funding and knowledge for developing countries. It uses financial resources and extensive experience to help our client countries reduce poverty, increase economic growth, and improve quality of life. To ensure that countries can access the best global expertise and help generate cutting-edge knowledge, the World Bank Group is constantly seeking to improve the way it works. Key priorities include delivering measurable results, promoting openness and transparency in development, and improving access to development information and data.

VPU Context: Information and Technology Solutions (ITS) enables the WBG to achieve its mission of ending extreme poverty by 2030 and boosting shared prosperity in a sustainable manner by delivering transformative information and technologies to its staff working in over 130 client countries. ITS services range from: establishing the infrastructure to reach and connect staff and development stakeholders; providing the devices and agile technology and information applications to facilitate the science of delivery through decentralized services; creating and maintaining tools to integrate information across the World Bank Group, the clients we serve and the countries where we operate; and delivering the computing power staff need to analyze development challenges and identify solutions. The ITS business model combines dedicated business solutions centers that provide services tailored to specific World Bank Group business needs and shared services that provide infrastructure, applications and platforms for the entire Group. ITS is one of three VPUs that have been brought together as the World Bank Group Integrated Services (WBGIS), to provide enhanced corporate core services and enable the institution to operate as one strategic and coordinated entity.

Department Context: The mission of the Corporate Information Technologies Department (CIT) is to leverage technology to enable IFC’s strategic priorities and to support IFC’s business and operations. By acting as the technology partner and business enabler, the department provides state-of-art information and technology solutions to support IFC’s Investment & Advisory Services, Financial Operations, Treasury & the Asset Management Company. We work closely with the business to design solutions that automate business processes, help enable business responsiveness to clients, improve operational efficiency and organizational effectiveness, and manage risks. We are committed to delivering business solutions that deliver value for money while we continue to excel at the basics by providing IFC with an integrated digital platform that connects policies, processes, people, and knowledge across the institution in a holistic and staff-centric manner. CIT aims to ensure that our solutions meet the business needs of users across a range of functions including operations and corporate business processes, information, knowledge and learning, data and analytics, and more.

DUTIES AND ACCOUNTABILITIES

CIT is seeking a Manager to lead, guide, and manage the Solutions and Data team (CITSD). His/her prime duties and responsibilities are:

Direct oversight of the use and choice of technology and solution for all IFC’s IT applications including operational, finance, budgeting and knowledge applications.Injecting technology innovation within IFC products and driving the next generation data and analytics platform enabling data driven decisions for IFC business.Helping ensure that IFC solutions will be built leveraging modern digital delivery models that incorporate design thinking, modern application architectures, modular design of solutions, cloud platforms and accelerators like edge computing, microservices and containers, modern sourcing techniques, data engineering and science, DevSecOps, lean and agile, performance engineering and appropriate integration of IT services or platforms.Achieving overall client satisfaction, cost effectiveness, and timely delivery of projects and enabling the transformation of the business portfolio to meet modern standards and client expectations.Working with multiple vendors and product teams on varying contractual terms and conditions to delivering secure and high performing applicationsServing as CIT's liaison to other shared service providers within ITS such as Enterprise Platforms, Enterprise Architecture, Office and Information Security, Networking and infrastructure to provide value-added IT products and services in a responsive and cost-effective manner.Collaborating with other ITS peer groups to ensure architectural robustness and consistency, adhering to industry best practices and agreed WBG architectural standards.Supervision of 15+ staff and more than 100 contractors.Reporting to the CIT Director & CIO, the manager will act as a key technology adviser to the IFC CIO.

Key Responsibilities

The Manager, Solutions and Data is responsible for performing activities in the following areas:

Solutions and Results to Clients:
Manages client relationship, design and solution approaches, and associated delivery for IFC IT’s portfolio of business applications throughout the entire lifecycle from inception through implementation, deployment, maintenance, and retirement pertaining to IFC operational, knowledge, accounting and budgeting systems, and cross cutting solutions.Applies deep technology know-how to identify opportunities to shape the future of IFC business through technology and innovation.Provides technological guidance to IFC business stakeholders, develops and implements scalable solutions.Works closely with the CIT Director and CIO to help drive the transition of CIT towards an agile operating model and drive technology innovation and simplification of processes to deliver business value quicker and better using an agile and lean operational model.Partners with CIT frontline operations, frontline finance and run the business teams to minimize gaps, redundancies, rework, and duplication of effort by coordinating new cross cutting capabilities across the IFC IT portfolio, with a specific focus on DevSecOps, cloud and other emerging technologies.Clearly articulates and evangelizes to IFC business the benefits that technology alignment with industry best practices will provide and drive them as part of the application implementation lifecycle.

Technical leadership:
Leverages emerging technology industry trends, including design thinking, agile, cloud solutions, edge computing, microservices and containers-based architecture, performance engineering, process automation, big data, DevSecOps.Provides strategic thinking and advisory to IT and business leadership.Leads the build and support of management reporting, data driven decision systems, data and analytics applications and platforms, leveraging emerging technologies like analytical engines, text analytics, machine learning, and artificial intelligence as necessary.Leads the technology strategy and implementation of fine-grained authorization, access management and alignment with the WBG privacy policy.Ensures well architected platforms and applications are built on a foundation of enterprise technology standards and enterprise security.Ensures that projects within the portfolio are executed under strategic guidelines (technology standards, development methodology, outsourcing/offshoring, etc.).Uses deep technology know-how across a broad range of technology and functional domains to advise the department and IFC business on technology.Manages solution, business and information architecture, solution design and implementation support for IFC’s application landscape throughout the entire lifecycle from inception through implementation, deployment, maintenance, and retirement.

People/Talent Management:
Models exemplary WBG leadership values and managerial behaviors and reinforces these qualities in own team and staff.Drives and inspires technical excellence within the team and the unit by creating an environment of learning and innovation that attracts and develops the best talent reflective of the diversity of our clients.Manages and mentors IT staff to provide state-of-the-practice services as per ITS PMO standards in planning, developing, implementing, and maintaining systems in a responsive and cost-effective manner.Supports management in developing and implementing appropriate strategies for global staffing, deployment, talent and performance management.

Unit Specific:
Leads the technology delivery for IFC systems and applications including key transformational programs underway - iPortal, Access IFC, Web platforms, Next Generation Data platform and analytics.Manages cross cutting services for IFC applications including monitoring, performance engineering, and logging.Has an in-depth understanding of IFC technology platforms and domains and its underlying processes and data.Works closely with the Office of Information Security and application delivery teams to ensure that applications are aligned with the institutional security guidelines and processes and the security posture of IFC applications is strong.Minimizes gaps, redundancies, rework, and duplication of efforts by working closely with business users and stakeholders; and coordinates new solutions with them and other CIT Business Portfolios.Leads feasibility, risk, regulatory compliance, and ROI analyses for proposed projects; presents recommendations related to project feasibility.Manages allocated resources efficiently and effectively (including financial, human resources and technology).Collaborates closely with senior business leaders/management to manage expectations, provides status updates on project and discusses concerns; ensures resolution of concerns/issues.Facilitates the prioritization of requirements (new development, enhancements, and maintenance) across the business areas by identifying constraints with regards to delivery capacity, business area absorptive capacity, finance industry trends and IT sourcing availability by working closely with business users and sponsors.Manages vendor relationships – for products, projects and services – assuming responsibility for authorized licenses, contract adherence, and associate upgrades.Streamlines institutional content management systems and data dissemination platforms/tools.Assumes accountability for integrating the work of multiple large teams spread across geographical locations and multiple vendors to deliver project success.Participates as a peer with senior IFC and ITS leadership in developing long term plans and strategies that have an enterprise-wide focus.Provides special insights and expertise that ensures that breakthroughs and competitive advantage through technology are realized.Develops and implements strategies to ensure that the IFC and ITS can attract and retain top IT talent. By acting as a "thought leader" and developing a network of contacts in the community, this role increases the status of the IFC and ITS as an employer for top IT talent thus contributing to the IFC's ability to attract and retain technical staff.Ensure ability to scale services to meet new business demands and enable the team to plan for and respond to spikes in capacity demands.Create an inclusive environment for staff and be a role-model to IFC’s diversion and inclusion agenda

Key Stakeholders

CIT Director and CIO: The candidate will work closely with the CIT CIO with an emphasis on providing technical thought leadership, alignment with the enterprise strategy on cloud, mobile and innovative technologies thereby strengthening the client centric service delivery.CIT Leadership Team: As a core and integral part of the CIT Leadership Team, the candidate will work closely with the frontline client facing teams to build robust, scalable, and highly performing solutions catering to business needs.Client partners: Manage client relationship and associated delivery for the overall application solutions and technology, data and analytics, access management, and alignment with privacy policy solutions portfolio to ensure CIT responds to IFC staff and clientele’s requests in an integrated, timely, and coherent manner, and that substantive analytical work is conducted throughout the process.ITS Shared services teams: Will act as the anchor point and liaison for the shared service engagements related to cloud and on-premise platforms and services, information security, enterprise architecture, networking, infrastructure, technology and innovation. Will contribute as a thought leader in ITS enterprise level discussions and committees.CITSD Staff: Provide Leadership and manage a team of professionals of around 20 staff with diverse functional, technical, and cultural backgrounds. This includes mentoring of IT staff to provide state-of-the-practice services as per industry standards in planning, developing, implementing and maintaining systems in a responsive and cost-effective manner.Vendors: Works with sourcing teams to ensure that the right vendor teams are procured at the right terms and conditions. Leads governance and program management discussions with senior and executive leadership from vendors establishing strong partnership and collaboration.
Selection Criteria
Passion for the WBG mission.Advanced degree in IT or related discipline and with at least 15 years of relevant experience, 10 of which of supervisory capacity.Industry recognizable management and technical certifications in the areas of architecture, security, solution designs etc. also an advantage.At least 10 years of experience in the design, delivery and marketing of information, data and technology services to clients.In depth understanding of current and latest technology trends, emergency technologies, and how to leverage them to support business objectives.Demonstratable experience in the latest approaches to information technology solutions, thought leadership on strategic alignment with industry trends, and data/content disclosure control are required.Possession of a combination of deep technical understanding, relationship management, financial management experience, proven leadership, and pragmatism to take stock of the status of the portfolio and make improvements in a decisive and objective manner.Ability to objectively negotiate and facilitate trade-offs, build consensus and commitment to a ‘best value’ direction among multiple stakeholders, often with broadly divergent frames of reference and competing interests, within a multinational institution.Proven track record with leading matrixed teams and working collaboratively across organizational boundaries and partners to achieve program objectives.Understanding of the IFC’s line of business – this includes IFC products, Policies and Procedures for investment, advisory and trade middle office services, risk – financial and nonfinancial, financial management, safeguards, external funds and board operations will be preferred, but not mandatory.Familiarity with World Bank Group IT environment, compliance requirements, policies, standards, and procedures.Must be a clear and logical thinker with an open and innovative mind, and the ability to think outside the box.Demonstrable qualities of being resourceful, resilient, and versatile.The ability to handle tough deadlines, and multiple demands from multiple sources.Positive attitude and highest ethical standards are a must.

Knowledge Required

The nature of this function demands that it be led by an experienced manager with deep technical understanding and keen business analytic ability to ensure that opportunities are seized to optimize efficiency, effectiveness (elimination of redundant tasks), and outstanding communication/leadership skills. From a domain perspective, this requires that the candidate have:

High level of technological awareness. Keeps abreast of available technology; Understands applicability and limitations of technology to the work of the office; Actively and closely works with business stakeholders and sponsors to apply technology to appropriate tasks and processes; Shows willingness to stay abreast of new technology trends and drives practical implementation of these for IFC business needs.Ability to articulate complex technology concepts clearly and simply based on the audience and focusing on the inherent business value and benefits.Experience in managing client relationships with multiple business sponsors, IT stakeholders and vendors.Experience at a managerial level in designing, developing, implementing and overseeing very large and complex centralized and globally distributed institutional systems.Experience in both waterfall and agile software development methodologies.Up-to-date, best practice experience with SDLC, including agile and lean operating models, management of on-site/offshore development teams and leading effective outsourced IT teams.A robust, cross-functional perspective to be able to bridge the business to information technology gap.Experience in emerging technology industry trends, including design thinking, agile, cloud solutions, edge computing, microservices and containers-based architecture, performance engineering, process automation, big data, DevSecOps, networking.A perceptive and diplomatic ability to sort out cost-effective and common approaches that meet identified business requirements.Significant experience in IT Portfolio Program Management - The candidate must possess a clear mastery of IT program management and delivery, excellent client relationship management skills, and proven team leadership skills. As well as well-articulated awareness of fundamental aspects of business applications and enterprise data store approaches. S/he must have a clear understanding and appreciation of the agility needed to support changing corporate objectives in a dynamic marketplace. Moreover, the candidate must exhibit a clear comprehension and appreciation for the postulates and practice of IT Governance.

Required Competencies

Program and portfolio management – experience in strategy, planning, monitoring progress, managing resources and reporting progress.Client Understanding and Advising - Acts as a credible business partner and works with a long-term VPU-wide perspective in addressing clients' needs.Learning Orientation - Stays abreast of broad new trends and developments in the industry and ensures that best practices are incorporated into the normal approaches taken by the VPU to enhance the business.Broad Business Thinking - Maintains a deep understanding of key business issues and the broader WBG-wide ramifications of individual account decisions to ensure consistency across WBG. Partners with business leaders to sponsor long-term enterprise-wide initiatives.Negotiation - Clarifies strategic expectations and principles of the enterprise.Project Management (ITS) - Sought after as an expert in Project and Program Management.Risk Management - Determines the probability of risk and sets the degree of tolerance for major investments and strategic decisions.Service Provider Assessment and Evaluation - Develops the rationale for using, or not using, external vendors for projects or functions.System Development Life Cycle Knowledge (SDLC) - Manages the SDLC for existing projects.Team Management – Supervisory experience in leading software development teams, coaching and mentoring staff.Diverse Teams – experience in building diverse teams from various backgrounds, cultures and geographies.

WBG Leadership Values and Managerial Behaviors

Leadership of Self: Role model the change and values for WBG; Demonstrate courage of convictions, ownership and self-mastery within the organization in accordance to our values.People Leadership: Lead and inspire staff to perform and deliver for better results; Help others achieve their fullest potential through coaching and mentorship.Collaborative Leadership: Be mutually accountable for entire WBG’s corporate targets and success; Work across WBG and with clients and partners to achieve better results.Client Solutions Leadership: Be the leading provider of development solutions for country clients; Provide leadership in both knowledge generation and knowledge sharing.Decisive Leadership: Take informed risks and make decisions in a transparent manner resulting in transformative impact for clients; Commit to decisions once they have been made.

WBG 5 Managerial Competencies: Courage of your convictions; Leading Teams for impact; Influencing across boundaries; Fostering openness to new ideas; and Building talent for the future.

WBG Core Competencies for all staff: Lead and Innovate; Deliver Results for Clients; Collaborate Within Teams and Across Boundaries; Create, Apply and Share Knowledge; and Make Smart Decisions.


Poverty has no borders, neither does excellence. We succeed because of our differences and we continuously search for qualified individuals with diverse backgrounds from around the globe.

Overview:
NCI is a leading provider of enterprise solutions and services to U.S. defense, intelligence, health and civilian government agencies. NCI's AI solution, Shai(tm), scales humans with artificial intelligence by empowering the workforce to meet their mission by using best in class AI solutions coupled with our exceptional service offerings. Working with strategic partners, NCI is committed to bringing commercial innovation to missions of national importance. NCI is a mid-tier systems integrator headquartered in Reston, VA, and operates at locations across the globe.

NCI has been designated a 2020 Military Friendly Employer by MilitaryFriendly.com
Responsibilities:
NCI: The Database Administartor II implements and maintains smooth operation and physical design of databases. Reviews database design and integration of systems. Provides backup recovery and makes recommendations regarding enhancements and/or improvements. Maintains security and integrity controls. Formulates policies, procedures, and standards relating to database management, and monitors transaction activity and utilization.

Responsibilities:
Database loading; development and management of operational procedures; environment management; database health (e.g. monitoring, proactive and reactive responses); resource planning; database upgrade planning; backup and recovery strategy planning and implementation; environment transition planning (development, test, stage, production).

Experience in database administration, information technology, database architecture, or a related field
MCSE/MCSA certifications.
Preferred Experience with Linux and Windows Server environments.
Extensive experience with database technologies (MySQL, MS SQL, PostgreSQL Oracle, MongoDB)
Experience with cloud services (AWS, Microsoft Azure) a plus.
Strong command of SQL and SQL server tools.
Advanced knowledge of database security, backup and recovery, and performance monitoring standards.
Understanding of relational and dimensional data modeling.
PowerShell and Unix shell scripting skills.
Familiarity with SSAS, SSIS, SSRS.
Strong mathematical and statistical knowledge.
Excellent written and verbal communication skills.
Impeccable attention to detail

job_title: Director I, Data Products - BI & Analytics
job_description:
Advance your career at Liberty Mutual Insurance - A Fortune 100 Company.
As a Director I, Data Products with Liberty Mutual Insurance, you will be a key strategic leader responsible for creating and executing our BI and Analytics strategy for GRM. The leader will also be responsible for building/augmenting our BI and analytics solutions and toolkit used to drive various business lines and needs in GRM. This role will be responsible for helping define the strategy, vision and advanced processes for a set of Data & Analytics capabilities and tools that advances our platform towards analytics, machine learning and automation in the enterprise and enabling data as a service.
You will partner with internal business owners to understand business objectives, pain points and design product requirements. You will also collaborate with engineering teams to build capabilities that best leverage the right technology to meet business objectives and deliver value. This role will be responsible for simplification of our BI solutions and footprint by matching the right personas with the appropriate tools/solutions. This role will also be responsible for launching new technical solutions and tools to enable the business partners to achieve speed to market for data. This role requires having knowledge of data infrastructure and ability to drive insights through products and solutions.
The ideal candidate will be highly motivated, strategic, solution oriented, tactical and self-driven. This person should also be an articulate communicator, detail oriented, and committed to providing outstanding results every day. If you are passionate about data and the power of analytics to create industry re-defining insights and committed to the mission of enabling data to achieve an advantage, we want you to join our team!
This position will report to the Senior Director of Data Products and can be based in any of the following NH offices: Portsmouth, Exeter, or Dover.
Responsibilities:
Understand business needs and priorities to collaborate with leaders throughout the GRM organization and create the vision for the right business intelligence and analytics solutions
Own, create and improve the delivery and utilization of business intelligence data products and platform capabilities across the organization (On prem and Cloud)
Develop a strategy to leverage the right business intelligence solutions for cloud and enable data and technology to enable appropriate personas and needs and enable self service.
Product planning, defining detailed requirements, coordinating across teams (front end developers, data engineers, solution engineers, data scientists, data analysts, and executives), mitigating risks and balancing delivery timelines with technical constraints to support business objectives
Enable change and best practices through the BI and Analytics COE (Center of excellence)
Determine business requirements and produce supporting process design documentation that clearly articulates the requirements to the Data Engineering team
Develop and improve KPI’s reflecting appropriate usage of solutions based on persona, need and speed to market
Define project success criteria and business metrics to confirm results meet the business need
Leverage agile project management disciplines for planning and execution of data and analytics projects, including design, development, testing and deployment
Gather feedback and measure the performance of delivered products
Qualifications:
6+ years’ product management experience, ideally with experience in managing a global data product
Familiar with localization and other global requirements
3+ years of people management experience, either a leader of teams or a direct manager
Demonstrated experience with full life-cycle product management: problem definition and solution discovery, stakeholder buy-in, validation, launch, and ongoing operations
Experience working with Power Platform, Tableau, SQL, SAS, MicroStrategy, Looker or other reporting and data visualization tools
Experience tracking down and creating datasets, knowledge of preparation, organization and statistical analysis
Comfortable with quick iteration and experimentation
Creative problem-solving skills, analytical thinker and passion for new technology
Excellent communication (written and oral) and presentation skills; solid business acumen; well-honed influencing skills are essential.
Familiarity and the ability to combine data science with application of machine learning, computer vision, deep learning and artificial intelligence capabilities emerging in the industry
Benefits:
We value your hard work, integrity and commitment to positive change. In return for your service, it’s our privilege to offer you benefits and rewards that support your life and well-being. To learn more about our benefit offerings please visit: https://LMI.co/Benefits
Overview:
At Liberty Mutual, we give motivated, accomplished professionals the opportunity to help us redefine what insurance means; to work for a global leader with a deep sense of humanity and a focus on improving and protecting everyday lives. We create an inspired, collaborative environment, where people can take ownership of their work; push breakthrough ideas; and feel confident that their contributions will be valued and their growth championed.
We’re dedicated to doing the right thing for our employees, because we know that their fulfillment and success leads us to great places. Life. Happiness. Innovation. Impact. Advancement. Whatever their pursuit, talented people find their path at Liberty Mutual.

Abbott is a global healthcare leader that helps people live more fully at all stages of life. Our portfolio of life-changing technologies spans the spectrum of healthcare, with leading businesses and products in diagnostics, medical devices, nutritionals and branded generic medicines. Our 103,000 colleagues serve people in more than 160 countries.
Make an impact! At Abbott we’re empowering people to manage their health with digital health technologies. This opportunity directly supports Abbott’s Neuromodulation business, a fast-growing business, offering the most innovative Spinal Cord and Deep Brain Simulation platforms in the market. Abbott’s Neuromodulation business has a large Product Development site in Plano (Dallas), Texas, where this position is based. Abbott is creating groundbreaking high-quality products designed and built with the betterment of human life as the primary focus. It’s our people who make this all happen. We are thinkers, problem solvers, and innovators working together to constantly challenge the status quo.
The Principal Software Engineer is responsible for assuring that the devices remain in line with business needs and requirements in their structure and function. Establishes and maintains technology standards, evaluates and directs new technology designs. Provides technical architectural expertise, playing a vital role in innovating, designing, enhancing, implementing and scaling application and wireless connectivity platforms. Works closely with the business to translate business requirements into system design that fit the overall business architecture. Designs frameworks and systems enabling effective realization of today’s and future business requirements. Drives engineering and architectural best practices broadly throughout the organization.
DUTIES:
Responsible for defining and documenting the software architecture and abstracting the following from the implantable therapy engine: UI, Hardware, Remote Services, Wireless Connectivity
Bring expertise in the abilities of software system design: scalability, reliability, extensibility, usability and be able to design a software architecture that enables them
Research, requirements, architecture, and development of cross-platform Wireless Connectivity (WiFi, BT, BLE, RFID, NFC) and sensors system software with focus on high quality and secured wireless communication for implantable devices
Create an architectural vision and implement the vision in an agile, fast moving environment
Designs an architecture that implements best practices in privacy and security and meeting healthcare requirements for worldwide regulations, e.g. FDA, TUV etc
Assesses complex technical challenges, defines the solutions required to operationalize the business imperatives
Works with cross-functional teams, product management, development, quality and operations to create innovative operating alternatives that form the overall strategy and business architecture
Engage non-technical business stakeholders to understand business needs to define technical architecture requirements and innovate next generation products.
Design and build systems to enable Artificial Intelligence/Machine Learning Algorithms on edge device toward personalized predictive medication
Interface with 3rd party software companies to integrate, optimize and stability platform system software
Mentor cross-functional teams on system and Wireless Connectivity software
Provides data to senior management on the new trends and threats in the Software space. Serves as technical expert on new products in the areas of Wireless Connectivity, Artificial intelligence/Machine Learning
QUALIFICATIONS
Bachelor's degree in Computer Science, Electrical Engineering, Computer Engineering or other related technical field. Master's degree or PhD in a technical field preferred.
12+ years of experience as a Software Developer/Architect. 10+ years of experience with software built using technologies such as HTML, Java, Python, C#, C,JavaScript, Android, and iOS.
Experience with development on mobile platforms
3+ years of experience with commercialization of Wireless Connectivity (Wifi, Bluetooth, BLE) on iOS and Andriod
Experience with Artificial Intelligence / Machine Learning Algorithms on embedded devices
Demonstrated foundation in Computer Science, with competencies in data structures, algorithms and software design
Demonstrated knowledge of Android and iOS mobile application development.
Knowledge of Android UI frameworks and touch-based UI.
Understanding and significant work experience with various SDLC methodologies including Agile /Scrum
Experience with requirements analysis and technical design and documenting
Significant experience with security architecture and engineering
Previous experience managing external (contract) software development resources
Solid verbal, written, and interpersonal skills with ability to effectively communicate at multiple levels in the organization. Excellent communication and relationship skills, especially the ability to articulate advanced technical topics to non-technical individuals
Ability to leverage and/or engage others to accomplish projects
Ability to contribute to multiple projects/demands simultaneously
Ability to work both within a team, and independently, in a fast-paced, changing environment
Very strong technical leadership and ability to constantly build, leverage and influence large network of senior technology and business experts across a large, diverse enterprise, and outside: vendors, standards bodies, analysts, and academia
Preferred experience - Software as a Medical Device (SaMD) development, Digital health software development

job_title: Senior Site Reliability Engineering Manager (Technology Development Senior Manager 1)
job_description:
Important Note: During the application process, ensure your contact information (email and phone number) is up to date and upload your current resume when submitting your application for consideration. To participate in some selection activities you will need to respond to an invitation. The invitation can be sent by both email and text message. In order to receive text message invitations, your profile must include a mobile phone number designated as “Personal Cell” or “Cellular” in the contact information of your application.
At Wells Fargo, we want to satisfy our customers’ financial needs and help them succeed financially. We’re looking for talented people who will put our customers at the center of everything we do. Join our diverse and inclusive team where you’ll feel valued and inspired to contribute your unique skills and experience.
Help us build a better Wells Fargo. It all begins with outstanding talent. It all begins with you.
Wells Fargo Technology sets IT strategy; enhances the design, development, and operations of our systems; optimizes the Wells Fargo infrastructure footprint; provides information security; and enables continuous banking access through in-store, online, ATM, and other channels to Wells Fargo’s more than 70 million global customers.
The Chief Technology Office (CTO) is leading technology transformation in a multi-cloud technology ecosystem, delivering products and innovative solutions at scale that are stable, secure, and always on. We are hiring a Senior Site Reliability Engineering (SRE) Manager to build and grow the CTO Site Reliability Engineering (SRE) teams and practice at Wells Fargo. We believe that "Hope is not a Strategy" and operational issues should be solved through code.
The Senior SRE Manager will launch the SRE Practice across Wells Fargo Technology, working with CIOs and operate leaders to build embedded SRE teams within the lines of business (LOBs). The person in this role will build and manage a team of 15+ highly capable full stack Software Engineers (SWEs) and Site Reliability Engineers (SREs) to ensure Wells Fargo products and services are always on. This manager will ensure applications on-boarded to SRE are instrumented for full-stack observability and continuous testing, introduce continuous improvement, integrate into IT Service Operations, and share support responsibilities for critical customer journeys, business flows, and applications. They will also forge the strategy for AIOps through AI/ML and NoOps, delivering strategic innovation to improve availability, stability, and resiliency.
This leader will be responsible for the following:
Launch enterprise SRE practice to drive transformation of traditional IT Service Operations organizations
Establish SRE practices and principles, and foster a culture of curiosity, credibly challenge assumptions, and influence change
Manage, mentor, and inspire a team of highly-talented software and site reliability engineers in CTO, and 60 embedded SREs in LOBs
Gather requirements and onboard customer journeys to new enterprise observability, CI/CD, continuous testing platforms
On-board 50+ customer journeys and apps to SRE in 2020 with growth to 300 applications over 3 years
Lead team to conduct SRE assessments, identify SLOs/SLIs, instrument for observability, testing, continuous improvement through automation and integration, and share support responsibilities for critical customer journeys and applications
Establish & Measure through data key metrics for customer impact, critical business flow availability, customer satisfaction
Launch the error budget, blameless post mortems, and drive remediation through Agile methodology
Innovate, develop, build, buy, POC, and pilot the latest technology to improve stability, availability, and reliability
Establish AIOPS/NoOps practice leveraging AI/ML for operate data, build self healing capabilities or autonomic healing, automating cognitive processes for resolving systemic issues
Proven Technical Expertise with one or more of the following:
Software Development: Java, Go, C/C++, Angular, ProgR, Scala
OS and Platform: AWS, Lamda, EMR, PCF, Kubernetes, OpenShift, Linux, Azure, Windows, VMware
CI/CD and Automation: Jenkins, Gitlab, SonarQube, Artifactory, Ansible, Puppet, Apigee
Observability and AIOps: DataDog, Grafana, Prometheus, ELK, Elastic, Kibana, Kafka, CloudWatch, Jaeger, Zipkin, Kinesis, Apache Airflow, AppDynamics
Experience in one or more of the following areas is desired:
AIOps: Moogsoft, BigPanda, Robotic Process Automation (RPA), UIpath, Artificial Intelligence (AI) and Machine Learning (ML) Frameworks
Operations Tools: ServiceNow, PagerDuty, Microsoft Teams, Symphony/Slack, Remedy, IBM Netcool

job_title: CIB-Wholesale Payments-Middle Office Transformation-Navigator Product Manager, Associate
job_description:
J. P. Morgan Wholesale Payments and the Commercial Bank have launched a global, cross-Line of Business transformation program to drive a best-in-class implementations and service experience, support growth, and improve efficiency for clients and employees. We are committing significant talent and resources to: empower our simpler clients with a fully digitized experience from conversion through ongoing set up, maintenance, and service; deliver innovative capabilities to complex clients to allow them to self-service on their terms and streamline interactions with the bank; and empower employees to focus on more value-add activities by reducing the time it takes to service our clients and fulfill requests. In addition, we will leverage data science and artificial intelligence to proactively provide differentiated insights that drive better decision-making and optimize their transaction processing.

The innovative capabilities we are creating will be made available across our two client-facing channels (JPM Access and Chase Connect), our new employee portal (Navigator), and via APIs.
Role Overview
The Navigator Product Manager will work on a team that is responsible for delivering an excellent experience for Client Service and Implementations employees in the Wholesale Payments Business and the Commercial Bank. The team collaboratively designs and develops a platform that facilitates best-in-class set-up & maintenance of clients, entities, accounts, products, and services; resolution of common client inquiries; and dissemination of insights. The team plays a key role in defining the strategic workflow that optimizes the internal client experience, which in turn optimizes internal and external interactions. They ensure the platform is designed to be intuitive and provides a seamless experience with a look and feel tailored to the employees’ needs. This role will focus on the internal desktop and experience for the service organization.

The team collaborates with technology partners as well other product teams in the program that are developing the underlying components that power the platform, to ensure they meet users’ needs and those that offer the greatest value are prioritized. Additionally, the role entails deep Line of Business and user interactions via feedback design sessions and will require significant cross pollination with the other product teams in the program. Working as the bridge between end-users and the development team, this role will communicate the voice of the users, inform the product roadmap, articulate new features and enhancements to technologists, coordinate the successful implementation of product releases, and support ongoing product use while ensuring focus on program’s strategic vision and goals and meeting deadlines.
Key Responsibilities
Collaborate closely with technology partners to execute against strategic vision
Work closely with client service and implementations colleagues and key stakeholders to understand needs and pain points as well as trends in the competitive marketplace
Develop user journeys and other artifacts that help communicate, and rally support for, intuitive user experience that best meets the needs of the platforms’ users
Collaborate closely with the product and technology teams building the core components that enable critical underlying functionality of the portal
Identify critical dependencies, and other issues and present recommendations for resolution
Maintain ongoing proactive partnership with technology team members to ensure business demands are understood and delivered in an agile manner within agreed upon timeframes
Ensure feedback from user demos is incorporated into roadmaps so that deliverables meet business needs
Support client and practitioner adoption of new features/functionality

Qualifications
Minimum of 4-5 years of experience, including experience in product management or user experience at a financial services, technology, or fintech firm
Self-starter able thrive in a fast-paced, collaborative and cross-functional environment that is results-driven
Creative problem solver, capable of developing innovative and differentiated solutions
Rigorous, logical thinker with ability to identify and articulate rationale, assumptions, and risks
Excellent relationship-building skills, with ability to establish trust and credibility across lines of business and functions
Fortitude to persevere when confronted with difficult challenges
Strong time-management and organizational skills with ability to objectively prioritize
Excellent written, visual, and verbal communication skills, including ability to communicate technical topics to a non-technical audience and business needs to a technical audience
Passion for driving toward an excellent client experience; UI/UX/design experience a significant plus
Established track record of delivering results in a complex environment
Good understanding of lean/agile product development lifecycle
Knowledge of treasury services, wholesale payments, corporate/commercial banking and client service/implementations functions and platforms a significant plus
Superior judgment to mitigate risk and foster an environment where risk/control issues are escalated and creative solutions are identified
Bachelor’s degree required; graduate degree in a business or technical field preferred
Location base in Chicago

Additional Background
J.P. Morgan’s Corporate & Investment Bank (CIB) is a global leader across banking, markets and investor services. The world’s most important corporations, governments and institutions entrust us with their business in more than 100 countries. With $24 trillion of assets under custody and over $420 billion in deposits, the Corporate & Investment Bank provides strategic advice, raises capital, manages risk and extends liquidity in markets around the world.

J.P. Morgan Wholesale Payments is one of the world’s largest, most trusted and innovative full-service providers of domestic and international cash management, liquidity, commercial card, merchant processing, FX and escrow solutions. With more than 135,000 corporations, financial institutions, public sector agencies and non-government clients in over 180 countries across the globe, we offer specialized solutions that provide operating efficiencies and value beyond other standardized solutions available in the market. Our global product and technology platform, integrated client service model and network of operational centers enable us to deliver a consistent set of services to clients no matter where they are across the world.
Commercial Banking (CB) offers clients the convenience and vast banking network of Chase, combined with the thought leadership and global financial capabilities of J.P. Morgan. We deliver extensive industry knowledge, local expertise and dedicated service to more than 24,000 clients, including corporations, municipalities, financial institutions, real estate investors and owners, and not-for-profit organizations with annual revenue generally ranging from $20 million to $2 billion. We offer a comprehensive set of financial products and services including credit, equipment finance, real estate finance, treasury services and provide clients with access to the investment banking and asset management services of J.P. Morgan.

Are you seeking the opportunity to lead experiences that deliver deep Artificial Intelligence to hundreds of millions of users? In Microsoft Search, Assistant, and Intelligence (MSAI) team, we are building a team of diverse, talented engineers to build transformative and cross-cutting experiences for users of Microsoft 365 who depend on Windows, Edge, Outlook, and Teams to fulfill their passion at work and in life. We are looking for those who bring fresh ideas from different backgrounds while possessing the experience and drive to define, design and deliver high quality, performant, delightful experiences to our users.

We value individual creativity, passion, and ability to deliver as an interdisciplinary team. We advocate for inclusive teams that value diversity of thought and background as strongly as technical skills. Everyone is encouraged to come up with new ideas to make our customers lives better and to collaborate as a team to deliver them. We invest in each team member’s technical and personal growth and partner on their career goals. This is a place where engineers have real meaningful impact on the success of our customer mission and contribute to the core company mission of empowering every person and organization on the planet to achieve more.
Responsibilities
Your responsibilities will include some or all the below:
Bring your experience to a vibrant team through design review, code review and mentoring while helping the team build an inclusive interdisciplinary culture where everyone can do their best work.
Define, design, and deliver experiences from incubation stage to maturity with customer trust and user delight as core design principle. You will strongly influence the direction of the assistant at Microsoft as we compete in this rapidly growing and competitive market.
Develop and release features for new and existing Microsoft apps.
Work with our product and design teams to implement an intuitive and engaging user experience.
Define and build systems and strategies to ensure high quality, stable and performant code
Perform code and design reviews that guarantee code quality and that allow our more junior members to learn and grow their expertise
Gather feedback from real users and iterate in data driven manner
Qualifications
Required Qualifications:
Bachelor’s degree in CS, EE or equivalent
7-9+ years of experience in designing, developing, and shipping software
3+ years min of experience in developing end user facing experiences
Knowledge of object-oriented software development, algorithms, and data structures.
Strong UI and design skills
Strong programming and algorithm design skills
Strong verbal and written communication skills with excellent interpersonal communication and collaboration skills
Demonstrated commitment to the success of others.
Preferred Qualifications:
Expert level Windows application and/or Chrome extension developer
Strong client/service experience delivering cloud-driven user experience – e.g. through React
Enjoy learning and ramping up on new technologies quickly
Passion for data-driven decision making

Overview:
Trend Micro, a global leader in cybersecurity, is passionate about making the world safe for exchanging digital information today and in the future. Artfully applying our XGen™ security strategy, our innovative solutions for consumers, businesses, and governments deliver connected security for data centers, cloud workloads, networks, and endpoints. With over 6,500 employees in 50 countries and the world’s most advanced global threat research and intelligence, Trend Micro enables organizations to secure their connected world. www.trendmicro.com

Principal Artificial Intelligence Research Scientist
Trend Micro is one of the first cybersecurity companies to adopt machine learning and AI. We have more than 15 years of experience applying AI on dealing with malware, malicious URLs, spam emails, botnets and many more. However, the changes brought about by AI show no signs of slowing down. Top-tier AI researchers and conferences announce astonishing breakthroughs almost every day. Numerous AI start-ups have the full attention of venture capitalists as they use their creativity to develop powerful new solutions to real customer pain points. In the world of cybersecurity, both defenders and attackers now use state-of-the-art AI technologies to get ahead of each other. As a leader in this field, Trend Micro must never fall behind.

We are looking for AI experts that make more AI landing in our domain and make a real impact on the company, the industry, and the world.

The new position will focus on connecting state-of-the-art AI technologies into Trend Micro eco-system and CyberSecurity industry. The role will digest, validate, reproduce, evaluate, and communicate latest AI papers, presentations, products, patents, tools, frameworks. Furthermore, the role needs to bring AI ideas into the company’s process, projects, and products. Finally, innovative thinking, data analytics skills, and willingness to communicate and collaborate are critical for a successful candidate.
Duties & Responsibilities:
Exploration to bring in more possibilities:
Search for use cases to demonstrate the advantage of Artificial Intelligence in Cybersecurity.
Summarize, digest, validate, reproduce, evaluate, and communicate latest AI papers, presentations, products, patents, tools, frameworks.
Design and prototype new algorithms, optimization methods, and architectures for cybersecurity machine learning solutions
Exploitation to solve problems and improve current company solutions:
Use data analytics skills to identify the key questions and problems in existing solution from daily operation logs and open available data.
Transform the identified cybersecurity problems into technical solutions and actionable recommendations using the AI technologies.
Communication to internal team members for better collaboration and to external public to bring more visibilities
Develop conference papers, presentations, patent applications, that are broadly appealing and accessible beyond a core scientific audience
Deliver high quality stories leveraging agile process
Share knowledge and contribute to an environment of continuous improvement
Qualifications/Requirements:
The Principal Artificial Intelligence Research Scientist must at least have 3 years end to end AI landing experience and practice from initial idea proposition, proof of concept research, implementation, product integration and operation, industrial impact evaluation and paper/patent submission; plus the minimum requirements for the position of Artificial Intelligence Research Scientist, outlined below:
PhD. in Computer Science or related field, or a Master’s Degree with publications in high-ranked conferences and journals to demonstrate research capability
Thorough understanding of latest deep learning / machine learning algorithms, and experience of application implementation with latest deep learning technologies
Experience in using DL (Deep Learning) frameworks such as TensorFlow and PyTorch
Python programming skills and its libraries knowledge is a MUST
Analytical ability and problem-solving skills is a MUST
Excellent communication and presentation skills - both written and verbal, and explain complex research problems to non-technical audience
Experience with graph-neural network family, recurrent network family, reinforcement learning is a plus
Broad knowledge on the internet, cloud/edge computing, and distributed computing, and cybersecurity is a plus
Knowledge of AWS or Cloud platform is a plus
Curiosity – out of box thinking is a plus

Our mission is to protect life.
We’re out to make the world a safer place by solving big problems and taking on the public safety challenges of our time. From our company's inception building the TASER device to a full suite of hardware and software solutions, we are focused on providing police agencies with the state-of-the-art devices and services they need to successfully serve and protect us. In the next few years, we're going to eliminate the burden of paperwork in policing, so officers can increase the time they spend building relationships and serving in their communities. We’ll put video at the heart of the police record so our justice system can get to the truth faster. And we won't stop innovating until the bullet is rendered obsolete.

It’s a big mission, but it’s one we’ll pursue relentlessly every single day.

Your Impact

Fleet 3 is Axon’s next generation in-car platform for law enforcement. Not only will this be the best in-car video system on the market but it will include Axon’s newest artificial intelligence capabilities to incorporate live services and the ability to alert officers of vehicles of interest via smart license plate reading technology. Building this system from the ground up and leveraging the strengths of the Axon Ecosystem is a huge task.

With this mission, we are looking for an experienced product manager who has a track record of defining and executing complex software deliverables across multiple teams and job roles. You’ll be responsible delivering user research-based guidance to the software squads as they build out critical workflows for users of our system. You’ll work collaboratively with product managers, technical program managers, product designers, engineers and our go-to-market teams to own delivery of a high-quality, enterprise-ready system. As our program progresses, you’ll be at the heart of capturing product feedback on the system as we deploy it to beta users across the country. You’ll prioritize that feedback, plan updates, and ready the overall system for launch.
Your day to day
Direct and guide the software product vision, communicate to the cross-functional team, and evolve it based on interactions with customers and as the solution is developed
Work with engineering teams to balance scope, functionality, performance, and time to market
Creatively generate solutions to a wide range of technical, work flow, and business problems
Gather quantitative and qualitative data from market and end users
Make data driven decisions when possible and fall back on well supported intuition when data is not available
Problem solve within constraints that truly exist and break through constraints that don’t actually exist
Lead & mentor more junior product managers
Operate with autonomy while proactively reducing ambiguity for your team and your cross-functional peers
Represent software team in leadership updates, roadmapping, and go-to-market activities
Set performance metrics for the most important functions of the products and manage team to measure and achieve them
Basic Qualifications
You have a bachelor's degree or equivalent in computer science, engineering or related field
5+ years relevant Software Product Management experience ideally shipping complex, multi product/system solutions with IoT devices and SaaS components
Experience solving complex user interaction problems with creative solutions
You have deep experience working with engineers to balance scope, time to market, and functionality, constantly making trade-offs using qualitative, quantitative, and absent data
Excellent problem solving skills, well-structured written and verbal communication
Flexibility to travel domestically and internationally when necessary (15%)
You have a proven track record of delivering successful products that achieve key business outcomes
Preferred Qualifications
You have real-world experience with each of the expectations listed in section entitled “Your Day to Day”
Compensation and Benefits
Competitive salary and 401K with employer match
Discretionary paid time off
Robust parental leave policy
An award-winning office/working environment
Ride along with real police officers in real life situations, see them use technology, get inspired
And more...

Job Description:
Technical Product Manager | Product Development Team
Orange County, CA Preferred - Remote Acceptable | Full Time

Role Description
As the Technical Product Manager, you will lead the product roadmap for our data analytics in the emerging real estate digital transformation space.The ideal candidate will have experience managing end-to-end data processing solutions on mobile and web platforms, a strong product management background in technology, and experience with data rich platforms. Additionally, qualified candidates who have experience building products at scale at previous startups and/or reinvent existing platforms are highly sought after for this position.

As a Techincal Product Manager, you will help to develop and execute on our evolving strategy related to our proprietary data bringing the insights to life through understanding the data value proposition both internally and for our customer facing products.
The successful candidate must be an experienced, creative problem solver with proven ability to be both hands on and strategic across our dynamic, complex organization and deliver tangible, impactful results. We are making big bets on the future of real-estate, trailblazing a 2030 vision for the industry. Watch our CEO, Jeff Meyers share the landscape of untapped opportunities.

You will play a critical role in our business as we work to refine our product, post the merger of our two companies (Hanley Wood & Meyers Research).

Responsibilities
Lead data modeling, data infrastructure and machine learning for our database, including both internal proprietary and third party data layers, and their impact on customer facing product
Provide "out of the box" product and technology inspirations to drive creative user solutions for what is possible and what will be possible
Translate and synthesize requirements between data scientist, research, engineers, designers, product managers and customers
Create a customer onboarding program, working with research, sales and support teams to ensure product launch success
Contribute to the shaping of the roadmap with support from EVP of Product Development
Work closely with the research and engineering teams to ensure the internal user experience is simple, seamless and delightful and to ensure data ingestion and consumption are of the highest integrity
Talk to users, always looking for deeper insights, understanding their needs and uses to solve problems with the best solution possible
Partner effectively with UX Research, as available, helping to define the problems we are seeking to understand and validate decision making
Research industry and non-industry competitors to understand our unique competitive advantage
Identify metrics to track and measure customer and business benefits
Facilitate effective scoping sessions with the team, clearly documenting decisions and consistently integrating the story and scope
Challenge the team to question assumptions about what's needed, sharpening the team's thinking about what's essential, why and when
Monitor and identify future potential product quality risks
Communicate with team, product leadership, key stakeholders frequently and effectively to ensure the teams are aligned and engaged
Act accountable and positive in all conditions, taking ownership of problems and solutions
Be decisive, assertive, and optimize constant progress daily while complying with our core values

 Requirements
Experience: 5-7 years of experience in an agile product development role. A minimum of 3 years of Data or Technical Product Management.
Portfolio: Share past products, where you've influenced technical product development. Showcase how you go about developing a unique customer experience through digital product.
Education: Undergrad/Grad education in statistics, computer science with a machine learning focus, mathematics, physics, etc.
Product Strategy and Vision: Take an ownership position in influencing the digital disruption of our industry through creative solutions, with an eye for modern design, and a compelling technology-driven identity for our products and services
Discovery: As a product owner focused on the delighting the customer, delivering on exceptional product discovery techniques including opportunity assessment, customer journey mapping and interviews.
Prototyping: Within a fast pace, multi-product environment, your ability to translate business objectives and customer needs into a prototype and iterate quickly will be a vital part of your role
Sprint Techniques: To ensure the execution of most valuable product to the customer, you'll manage the sprint ceremonies including bi-weekly sprint planning, the product backlog to meet the needs of the customer and collaborate from end to end with design and engineering team members in an agile environment leveraging tools such as Jira and Confluence.
Product Launch: We'll need you to help us craft our core messaging in collaboration with our internal product marketing team to all stakeholders. To ensure we've delivered on our promise, you will monitor and measure our product success through qualitative and quantitative testing techniques, developing and designing product metrics and working collaboratively with our customer support team.
Leadership: As the leader of communicating our product point of view, you take pride in delivering against our vision, inspiring and challenging team members to continue to push beyond traditional real estate product solutions.
Teaming: As a subject matter expert, your ability to teach and work collaboratively within the organization will be required to ensure our process is consistent across all of our product touch points.
Project Management: Come prepared for weekly stand-ups, bring your best client-facing skills to meetings, be prepared to work and learn, set deadlines, take notes and ownership of the next steps. Execute meticulously in a fast-paced environment with ambiguity. Ability to multitask and prioritize in a fast-paced, deadline-driven environment.
Tools: We are a collaborative and tech-driven company. Tools include Box, Slack, Jira, Salesforce, IOS, Microsoft Office Suites. IOS Apple experience preferred. More advance design tool experience a plus. Technical expertise in basic computer languages a plus.

Knowledge of technological infrastructure and architecture that can support Artificial Intelligence and Machine Learning technology

Knowledge of image and digital documentation processing and storage
Experience working with a Data Scientist
Knowledge of Real Estate principals

K2 (www.k2.com) is a software company, headquartered in Seattle and with offices around the world.

At K2 we are passionate about putting innovation in the hands of business users making the impossible easy. K2's digital process automation (DPA) platform lays the foundation for intelligent automation, allowing businesses to orchestrate processes that bring in robotic process automation (RPA), artificial intelligence, and machine learning to deliver world-class solutions.

Our cloud platform provides a robust workflow engine and a low code user interface designer that enables non-developers to build enterprise scale apps quickly. Combined with our powerful integration services, you can easily connect applications with virtually any other service, application or system with basic JavaScript or no code at all.

K2 is seeking a technical product manager to take ownership and lead a significant new extension to the K2 product portfolio. You would own shaping a new family of solutions built on the K2 platform. You would have accountability for the strategy, customer and market requirements, and end-to-end delivery of roadmap for these solutions and support their adoption and growth in the market. This position has cross-company influence, requiring end-to-end alignment across product management, engineering, marketing, sales, channel, services, and support functions inside K2.

We are an established technology company with fortune 500 customers around the world that executes with the growth mindset and agile practices of a start-up. This is a new project where you can get in early and have a big impact on our product direction and delivery.

Responsibilities:
Define and own the solution roadmap based on the market landscape, competition, industry trend, telemetry insights, etc. and arrive at an execution plan for prioritized list of investments.

Work with internal and external partners to gather feedback, manage dependencies
Track closely the changes in the market, industry landscape, technology trends and competition.
Effectively facilitate product reviews and meetings with leadership, customers, partners, and analysts
Ensure customer success for all customers, working closely with key customers

Experience driving development of SaaS products using Agile/DevOps engineering practices.
Familiar with cloud architecture, modern web app dev technologies and UX design.
Demonstrated ability to translate business requirements to product specifications and deliver results in an environment of ambiguity
BS in Computer Science, Electrical Engineering or related field or equivalent experience.

Experience with Azure, AWS, or Google Cloud Platform
Domain knowledge in integration, dev tools, rules engines, and/or analytics
Experience with building application experiences that delight users

At DistributionNOW, we believe our associates are the best in the business. We value and reward hardworking, creative, and dedicated employees that desire to be part of a team committed to outstanding customer service.
