At Lyft, our mission is to improve people's lives with the world's best transportation. To do this, we start with our own community by creating an open, inclusive, and diverse organization.

We care deeply about delivering the best transportation experience; this means the best experience for the passenger and the best experience for the driver. We believe this quality of service can only be achieved with a deep understanding of our world, our cities, our streets… how they evolve, how they breathe. We embrace the powerful positive impact autonomous transportation will bring to our everyday lives and with our ambition, we will become a leader in the development and operation of such vehicles. Thanks to our network, with hundreds of millions of rides every year, we have the means to make autonomy a safe reality. As a member of Level5, you will have the opportunity to develop and deploy tomorrow's hardware & software solutions and thereby revolutionize transportation.

This is an opportunity to participate in the development of Lyft's autonomous vehicle systems as the manager of the Autonomous Vehicle Systems Integration (SI) Team. The team is responsible for vehicle integration, system bring-up and debug, system verification testing, testbed and sub-assembly integration, vehicle shakedown and calibration infrastructure.

Responsibilities:
Management of a team of engineers responsible for vehicle integration, system bring-up and debug, system verification testing, testbed and sub-assembly integration, vehicle shakedown and calibration infrastructure
Work cross-functionally with product, technical program management, software, sensors, mechanical, and electrical engineering to define system bring-up and debug for autonomous vehicles
Execute systems verification and validation testing through a partnership with systems engineering
Define system and sub-system level architecture
Lead cross-functional technical design reviews
Support the functional safety processes

Experience:
Master's degree in one of the following fields: systems engineering, mechanical, electrical, computer engineering, aerospace engineering or related disciplines
Demonstrated ability to successfully manage engineering teams of diverse disciplines
Demonstrated experience in executing verification and validation testing for complex systems
Proven ability to operate effectively and autonomously across multiple teams in situations of ambiguity, with only high level direction
Experience in the design, development and deployment of autonomous vehicles, automotive or related complex remote sensing/mapping systems
Related experience in one of the following fields: sensors (camera, radar, lidar), controls, geo-localization (GPS & IMU), robotics, remote sensing, machine learning/artificial intelligence or on-edge compute
Ability to influence, negotiate, and inspire others in a matrixed environment
Ability to communicate highly technical problems and solutions at all levels from engineer to C-level executives
Experience developing complex systems combining remote sensing technology, Artificial Intelligence, and Controls for a safety critical application
Understanding of typical vehicle communication protocols/interfaces
Experience in systems integration, vehicle testing, functional safety, and vehicle launch
Software coding skills (matlab, python or C/C++)

Benefits:
Great medical, dental, and vision insurance options

In addition to 11 observed holidays, salaried team members have unlimited paid time off, hourly team members have 15 days paid time off

401(k) plan to help save for your future

18 weeks of paid parental leave. Biological, adoptive, and foster parents are all eligible

Pre-tax commuter benefits

Lyft Pink - Lyft team members get an exclusive opportunity to test new benefits of our Ridership Program

Lyft is an Equal Employment Opportunity employer that proudly pursues and hires a diverse workforce. Lyft does not make hiring or employment decisions on the basis of race, color, religion or religious belief, ethnic or national origin, nationality, sex, gender, gender-identity, sexual orientation, disability, age, military or veteran status, or any other basis protected by applicable local, state, or federal laws or prohibited by Company policy. Lyft also strives for a healthy and safe workplace and strictly prohibits harassment of any kind. Pursuant to the San Francisco Fair Chance Ordinance and other similar state laws and local ordinances, and its internal policy, Lyft will also consider for employment qualified applicants with arrest and conviction records.

AiCure is looking for a leader to help manage and develop our project management team while also being hands on with the project management of key accounts. This individual must be an experienced standout with extensive knowledge in client relationship management, technical implementations, the project lifecycle, continuous improvement and automation of processes, as well as strategic approaches to managing clients and projects successfully. A working knowledge of clinical trials and the regulatory landscape is a must.
Responsibilities include:
Team Management (40%)
Support the project managers at AiCure by ensuring they have the tools, training and processes to maximize their success in delivering AiCure products and services
Develop the project managers by providing continuous feedback and ensuring they are meeting key personal objectives that will help them grow and develop
Effectively track and manage resourcing for projects, ensuring efficiency with allocation while staying ahead of workload
Track and proactively manage cross-project KPIs and metrics that ensure success of AiCure deployments
Handle escalation of issues like CAPAs, critical business findings from audits or any project performance issues
Provide regular and ongoing reporting to the VP of Operations (Value Services) and AiCure leadership team
Project Management (50%)
Manage all phases of each assigned project, including budget, invoicing, staffing, project plan and client deliverables while maintaining high client satisfaction by providing proactive communication and issue/risk management.
Manage multiple projects concurrently that are deployed in the US and globally, ensuring high quality and timely deliverables in a dynamic environment.
Coordinate with other Client Services personnel as well as Engineering and Product to ensure the timely and quality preparation of project deliverables based on assigned scope-of-services.
Ensure all project deliverables are in compliance with applicable local and national regulatory requirements as well as following the AiCure Quality Management System governance procedures.
Oversee logistics and technical support, including providing hands on support, as defined by scope-of-services.
Develop and track KPIs and metrics related to successful project performance and oversight.
Coordinate delivery of data reports (e.g., weekly, interim, final, etc.) for project sponsors.
Account Management (10%)
Maximize opportunities at existing clients for AiCure, encompassing Change Orders and new projects
Work with the sales and scientific teams to help establish new opportunities
Manage governance meetings with project sponsors
Requirements
Bachelor’s degree in business, science, or related field; advanced degree is preferred
Experience managing direct reports and/or overseeing performance and personnel development
At least seven (7) years’ experience in project management or related role(s) in the healthcare technology or Pharmaceutical industry; clinical trials knowledge is a must
Understand the software life cycle from requirements to testing, support and closeout
Must be self-directed, results-oriented coupled with strong attention to detail, strong people skills and good judgment
Forward-thinking with ability to take initiative
Must possess strong client and vendor communication skills, with an ability to convey complex service project information and resolve project issues
Ability to manage multiple concurrent projects and prioritize in fast-paced, highly demanding environment
Ability and willingness to “roll up your sleeves” to implement a cutting-edge clinical trial solution
Bring a passionate, collaborative, and innovative mindset to the AiCure team
Excellent verbal and written communication, interpersonal, and presentation skills
Ability to travel 20-30%
Passionate about revolutionizing healthcare
Ability to effectively communicate in English
Qualified candidates must be legally authorized to be employed in the United States.
This role allows for a remote employee; however, AiCure is headquartered in Manhattan where this individual may need to travel on a regular basis
Benefits
Philosophy
Our selection process is highly competitive because we only hire the best, most enthusiastic candidates. Openness, flexibility, creativity, ownership, and accountability are our main pillars. We love solving challenging problems and creating solutions that have real impact on people- at scale.
Impact
We're on a mission to revolutionize healthcare and when you join us, you'll have the opportunity of having a real, tangible impact not only on individuals directly using our technology, but also on how drugs are tested and brought to market across the world. That means everyone globally will benefit from what you do. You'll be inspired every day because you'll be making a real difference and you'll see it happen. In real time and at scale.
People
You'll work with brilliant, positive people who thrive in an interdisciplinary, multi-cultural environment, and are curious, creative, and focused on executing our mission. You'll be up to speed on the most recent advances in Artificial Intelligence (Machine Learning, Computer Vision, Big Data) while solving challenging problems in human psychology and behavior. You'll work with Scientists, Engineers, Designers, and Medical Doctors, to create innovative products that scale in an environment that encourages learning, collaboration, and growth.
Compensation
We offer great compensation packages that are not only highly competitive, but will allow you to benefit and grow as we expand and scale. This position will include some equity in the company.
Paid Time Off (PTO)/Vacation
Generous and flexible paid time off policy that starts with 20 days of accrual per calendar year so you can take the breaks that you need in order to recharge and stay energized.
Health Coverage
Full (100%) coverage on medical, dental, and vision insurance plans with one of the biggest health insurance companies in the U.S. You'll have plenty of choices for all of your healthcare needs.
401K
We offer 401K so you when you retire, you can benefit from all of the great things you do with us.
Flexible Hours
We believe that people are at their best when they're happy and that flexibility improves creativity. With us you'll have plenty of flexibility so you can think out of the box, challenge yourself, and build great things that have a real impact while maintaining the life-work balance that helps you thrive.
Fantastic Location
We're in one of the best neighborhoods in NYC: in the heart of the Flatiron District, close to all that is culture, food, shopping, cafes, and parks to inspire you.
Office
We have a fantastic open loft-space with brand new, state of the art equipment including standing desks, snacks, kitchen, areas for mingling and having a break, and plenty of sunshine. Full views of the Empire State Building included.
EEO Minorities/Women/Veterans/Disabled

Artificial intelligence and machine learning (AI/ML) are no longer distant concepts for future technology projects. Every conceivable industry is pursuing AI/ML now as a way to open up new opportunities and make better decisions with companies like Intuit, the NFL, Capital One, GE Healthcare, Snap Inc., F1 Racing, Pinterest, Comcast, AstraZeneca, and Siemens innovating with AI/ML on Amazon Web Services today.

Amazon Web Services’ broad set of AI services, combined with the capabilities of the rest of the AWS platform, allows customers to build intelligent applications without any machine learning experience. Powerful use cases like personalized product recommendations, image and video analysis, voice-based assistants, forecasting, natural language interfaces, and more is now possible through an API. Tens of thousands of developers use AWS AI services to power their applications, and we’re looking for a standout product marketer who can help us capture that customer success and inspire a whole new generation of developers to put machine learning to work.

Expect to hit the ground running with the following goals…

Join an all-star team of product marketing managers singularly focused on helping developers get started with machine learning, and directly contribute by developing and executing our customer advocacy strategy.

Dive deep on our machine learning customers to understand how they achieving success and the impact they’re having on their own customers. Develop compelling case studies and customer references that inspire potential customers to build.

Build and deliver programs that help AWS developers be successful by encouraging idea sharing and friendly competition.

Think big about new ways to inspire developers and demonstrate how AWS can help customers be more successful with AI/ML.

Collaborate and earn trust with our AWS Evangelists to build a thriving community of developers through both AWS-led initiatives and external programs.

This is a highly visible role with the opportunity to do big things. If you have a demonstrated track record of delivering impactful results and bringing new ideas to the table to tackle tough challenges, let’s talk.

Oral and written communication skillsExperience executing marketing campaigns aimed at developers

job_title: Senior Software Engineering Manager - Minneapolis, MN
job_description:
Senior Software Engineering Manager - Minneapolis, MN-200010517

At U.S. Bank, we're passionate about helping customers and the communities where we live and work. The fifth-largest bank in the United States, we’re one of the country's most respected, innovative and successful financial institutions. U.S. Bank is an equal opportunity employer committed to creating a diverse workforce. We consider all qualified applicants without regard to race, religion, color, sex, national origin, age, sexual orientation, gender identity, disability or veteran status, among other factors.

U.S. Bank is seeking a Senior Software Engineering Manager for our Digital Banking Platform (mobile and online banking) with design and development experience to contribute toward the success of our technology initiatives. He/she will be responsible for development and support of the artificial intelligence engine within the digital banking applications.

You will be responsible for architecting and implementing high performing mobile applications on iOS and/or Android. We are super serious about application performance, complex and engaging UI and integrated experience across multiple applications. You'll work closely with the engineers on your team as well Product, Design, QA and other partner teams to deliver well-engineered experiences that delight our customers.


The overall team is a combination of employees, contractors, and off shore developers. This position will include application design, development oversight, and coordination with other groups within the bank to deliver the overall solution. You will own release schedules in our fast-paced environment, and work closely with software engineers, QA, product managers and field testers to get high-quality products and new features built, tested, and released on time. You will coordinate lots of fast-changing, moving parts and still get them to come together as a product. You'll need excellent communication skills to be the go-to person for all questions about release schedules, quality and progress updates.


Key Responsibilities

Manage technical projects or programs, working closely with product managers, engineers and technical staff to develop and track release milestones and schedules for the many moving parts that need to come together.
Develop a plan and schedule with well-defined milestones.
Manage communication of progress/status within the core team and external to the team; escalate issues as necessary.
Assess the quality of releases through monitoring of incoming bugs and code changes to identify quality issues and trends.
Develop tools and processes to improve software engineering productivity.


Successful applicants will exemplify US Bank's ethical principles of uncompromising integrity, respect for others, accountability for decisions and actions, and good citizenship.


Leaders at U.S. Bank consistently demonstrate integrity and ethics, maturity and resilience, and inspire trust and confidence among their teams. Our leaders are strong communicators who promote collaborative relationships, influence others, and value the diversity of backgrounds and ideas among their employees


Qualifications

Basic Qualifications
Bachelor’s degree, or equivalent work experience10 or more years of experience with developing and implementing applicationsEight or more years of experience with major tasks, deliverables, formal methodologies and disciplines for delivering new or enhanced applications

Preferred Skills/Experience

Hands on experience developing native IOS, Android or web applicationsFive or more years of managerial experienceExperience managing a front end development teamStrong understanding on mobile design principles, patterns and best practices
Strong analytical skills and ability to review code.
Proven experience in both small and medium size teams
Proven ability to architect mobile application and adopt and improve existing architecture
Strong collaboration skills with peers
Good development background
Coordinate multiple streams of work and plan releases
Strong object oriented programming and design skills
Excellent communication skills written and verbal
Good proven track record of development sustainable governance processes
Experience leading in agile development teams
Web API and REST architecture
Experience with HTML/JS / ReactNative is a strong plus
Experience with Git, Scrum, Kanban
Agile development experience
Strong estimation and resource planning skills
Ability to interact with Business line leaders and develop consensus and obtain buy in Banking experience


Job Information Technology
Primary Location Minnesota-MN-Minneapolis
Shift 1st - Daytime
Average Hours Per Week 40

ABOUT VISTAPRINT
We are Vistaprint, a member of the Cimpress family (NASDAQ: CMPR), the world leader for mass-customized marketing products, serving almost 20 million small and medium sized businesses locally in 20+ countries. Working across the globe in a truly international team, we are shaping the digital revolution in printing and mass customization. Over the past 25 years, we grew from startup to $2.75 billion in annual revenue and are confident that we still have a huge, multi-year growth opportunity ahead of us. Our confidence is driven by two primary factors: firstly, ~80% of the market segment for small businesses’ marketing materials is still served through traditional offline channels, often lacking the convenience and cost advantages from greater scale that we can offer our customers. Secondly, there is a significant opportunity to accelerate our activity in adjacent product segments such as packaging, apparel, signage, or corporate line of business accounts. We are a profitable business with an entrepreneurial mindset, and throughout our history we have proven our commitment to investing for long-term horizons.
Since our inception, Vistaprint has sought to disrupt our market and to build a transformational and enduring business. Over the past 20 years, we’ have reinvented ourselves frequently in service of this mission. Change is in our DNA.

OPPORTUNITY
It is an exciting time to join Vistaprint as our founder, Robert Keane, recently stepped back in to lead Vistaprint as CEO and, is building out a new executive team. Together with all employees, we are renewing the company’s focus on delighting customers, fostering an entrepreneurial culture and accelerating our world-class capabilities.
We have a tremendous opportunity in front of us. Vistaprint’s vision of helping small business owners live their dreams is exciting and inspirational. In order to capitalize on our opportunity, we have embarked on a transformation journey to deliver “jaw-dropping customer value”. This transformation journey will lead us to achieve world-class technology, services, and innovation, and create an environment where our team members are inspired and enabled to do their best work.

Winning big in Data and Analytics is among our key priorities. Therefore, we recently hired a Chief Data Officer and are building the respective organization. Mission of this newly established team is to transform Vistaprint with industry-leading data products into one of the world’s most iconic Data and Analytics (DnA)-driven companies. We do this to
Enable jaw-dropping, seamless, and fully personalized customer experience
Fuel profitable growth with analytics capabilities across our entire value chain
Attract and retain top notch data science, analytics, and business-translator talent.
The newly established CDO organization will consist of cross-functional product teams that sit in 5 domains (pricing/promotion/personalization, channel platform/digital advertising, core business/customer modeling, manufacturing/supply chain, E2E customer experience). Next to the domains, there are chapters with specialized talent that works for the product teams. One of this chapters is Data Science, where we are recruiting for the chapter lead.
To enable top-notch data science and analytics capabilities, we have made major multi-year investments in a cloud-based, service-oriented and data-rich technology platform. The new platform has already launched in one country and will be rolled out across Europe during 2020, unlocking significant capability and hence, opportunity for growth.

POSITION SUMMARY
In support of this transformation, we are hiring for a newly created Data Science Chapter Lead position who will manage a team of data scientists responsible for the overarching goals of (i) developing best-in-class models and algorithms to create new data products and/or improve existing ones and (ii) establishing a data science community within Vistaprint, to foster exchange between various data capability chapters.

KEY RELATIONSHIPS

Reports to
Sebastian Klapdor, EVP and Chief Data Officer
(member of the Vistaprint Executive Team)

Direct reports

All members of Data Science chapter (currently ~10 people to be ramped up to 50 in the next 24 months).

Other key relationships

CDO Domain and Chapter Leads
Vistaprint Executive Team

KEY RESPONSIBILITIES
Directly reporting to the Chief Data Officer and as member of the CDO leadership team, the Data Science Chapter Lead will take a core role in Vistaprint’s transformation towards a highly data-driven organization by leading a team of data scientists deploying best-in-class models and algorithms. Besides fostering exchange between the various data capability chapters by establishing a data science community within Vistaprint, the Data Science Chapter Lead is steering the development of both new data products and new methodologies applied to existing products. As the Data Science Chapter Lead, he/she will be responsible for:
Shaping the initial growth of Data Science at Vistaprint through recruiting, staffing, training and retention of the Data Science Chapter team
Setting up a data science community within Vistaprint, allowing knowledge transfer between all data capability chapters
Working closely with colleagues from other data capability chapters to facilitate data exploration and fast prototyping
Building and leading a data science innovation lab for early stage idea exploration and testing jointly with business stakeholders
Developing complex models and algorithms that drive innovation throughout the organization, such as state-of-the-art dynamic pricing models
Prototype to production:
Designing, developing and implementing product prototypes that are piloted and converted to products the use of which is institutionalized within the business
Working closely with the business to collect feedback, incorporating in the product, as well as maintaining and improving its functionality over time
In conjunction with other stakeholders, establish an end to end Data Science technology platform to enable rapid prototyping, smooth delivery to production (including data processing), and agile improvement of models once in production
Establishing a data science “brand” for Vistaprint in relevant Data Science communities

DESIRED OUTCOMES
Acquisition and retention of ~50 data scientists over the next 24 months
Adoption of leading data science practices incl. CICD, model lifecycle management, quality assurance
Fostering a healthy Data Science culture driven by agile practices and business value
IDEAL EXPERIENCE
MSc/PhD in computer science, statistics, or operations research or related technical discipline (e.g. math, physics)
Certifications in statistics, data mining and machine learning a plus
5+ years of experience in a management role with direct people leadership
10+ years of experience in a data science related field (e.g., machine learning, optimization, statistics): exceptional track record of developing analytical models in a wide range of situations and with varying levels of data architecture / availability
Familiarity with latest Data Science, Analytics and Technology trends and their impact on business strategies and operations
Deep knowledge in relevant application domains for e-commerce and manufacturing (e.g., personalization, attribution modeling, programmatic advertising)
Strong understanding of statistics, structured and unstructured data analysis, predictive modeling techniques and good command of emerging methodologies like Artificial Intelligence
Recognized thought leader and innovator in the development of new tools, methodologies and problem solving approaches
Articulate, persuasive, communicator. Commands the room, handles executive and difficult audiences well. Skilled at defining, motivating and driving change at executive levels and across the broader community of stakeholders.
LEADERSHIP CAPABILITIES

Driving Results: an excellent understanding of costs and benefits and an ability to use that understanding to prioritize activities.
Customer Mindset: Ideally brings experience in serving and innovating on behalf of small business customers
Driving Change: Highly trusted individual; excellent communication and interpersonal skills; experience with change management to help change mindsets and behaviors across the organization
Building Capability:
Self-starter, hands-on entrepreneurial mindset; comfortable to take controlled risks and drive experimentation and learning
Ability to scale and devise processes that support fast, decentralized decision making
Leading People: Confident, engaging people leader, able to communicate a vision and bring people along on the journey

Digital Cockpit team at NIO is responsible for defining digital experience in all NIO’s premium smart EVs. It designs and implements software and hardware to enable the ultimate living room experience for L2+/L4 vehicles. The Software Platform team is responsible for bringing up and developing our next generation platform using the state-of-the-art processor, software, development tools on which other teams will develop and deliver the amazing user experience in the cockpit.
Responsibilities
Technical manager for major embedded software systems through the entire product life cycle, from software requirements, design, implementation, tests, release and maintenance
Lead and accountable for software architecture and design discussions and facilitate code reviews
Plan resources, manage priorities and deliver to commitments
Engage in sprint planning and prioritization
Qualification
BS/MS Degree in Computer Science or Electrical Engineering
5+ years experience managing a team of 5 or more people
10+ years experience development embedded systems including experience as a software or system solutions architect
Hands-on experience with system development and hardware product integration
Experience delivering three or more major products to mass production
Experience in Microcontrollers (32bits ARM core) architecture and design from scratch of a complete software product
Exceptional C, C++ programming skills
Great depth of experience in one or more RTOS (e.g. FreeRTOS, ThreadX, QNX) driver development for embedded systems with multi-core ARM or other
Hands-on experience developing embedded software with RTOS or bare metal.
Hands-on experience with general Software Quality Assurance methodologies and Safety Critical embedded firmware (ISO26262 or other like IEC 61508, DO-178C)
Hands-on with Continuous Integration process
Experience with multi-site development organization
Proficiency with embedded software toolchains (e.g. GCC, GreenHills) and version control (GIT)
Experience in Software Development Lifecycle (e.g. Agile)
Experience using bug tracking systems (e.g. Jira)
Experience with code coverage and static analysis tools
Excellent analytical and problems solving skills
Self-motivated, detail-oriented, result-oriented
Ability to multi-task in a fast-paced environment
About NIO

NIO Inc. is a pioneer in China’s premium electric vehicle market. Founded in November 2014, NIO’s mission is to shape a joyful lifestyle by offering premium smart electric vehicles and being the best user enterprise. NIO designs, jointly manufactures, and sells smart and connected premium electric vehicles, driving innovations in next generation technologies in connectivity, autonomous driving and artificial intelligence. Redefining the user experience, NIO provides users with comprehensive, convenient and innovative charging solutions and other user-centric services. NIO began deliveries of the ES8, a 7-seater high-performance premium electric SUV in China in June 2018, and its variant, the six-seater ES8, in March 2019. NIO officially launched the ES6, a 5-seater high-performance premium electric SUV, in December 2018 and began deliveries in June 2019. NIO officially launched the EC6, a 5-seater smart premium electric Coupe SUV, in December 2019 and plans to commence deliveries in 2020.

Equal Employment Opportunity
NIO is committed to a policy of equal employment opportunity. We recruit, employ, train, compensate, and promote without regard to race, color, age, sex, ancestry, marital status, religion, national origin, disability, sexual orientation, veteran status, present or past history of mental disability, genetic information or any other classification protected by state or federal law.

NIO US is an E-Verify employer.

Microsoft Teams is the hub for teamwork in Office 365 that integrates all the people, content, and tools your team needs to be more engaged and effective. It is core to Microsoft’s modern work, modern life & modern education value prop. Teams is the fastest growing app in Microsoft history We are the product that Gartner refers to as "a real game changer!"

The Microsoft Teams Calling, Meetings and devices (CMD) group is focused on brining intelligent, real-time connected/collaboration experiences across Web, Windows, Mac, iOS and Android Teams clients. Additionally, this team is responsible for bringing these calling and meeting experiences to new hardware that gets used in conference rooms, personal and common area phones.

Director, Field Marketing
Job description, low-code style:
As the #1 low-code application development platform, OutSystems provides customers with everything they need to build apps incredibly fast. So, let’s cut to the chase: we’re looking for an AMER Field Marketing Director. Does the challenge of working with a hot company in a rapidly growing tech market sound exciting?
The longer story:
The OutSystems low-code platform enables customers to facilitate digital transformation through massive efficiency gains in building and supporting enterprise-grade applications. By leveraging automation, artificial intelligence and deep technology integrations, software developers and business users can build applications through an intuitive, visual interface, rather than traditional coding. Customers experience tremendous cost savings and create competitive advantages by developing custom applications in days and weeks versus months and years, despite a shortage of skilled developers.
As the AMER Field Marketing Director, you will be responsible for driving Americas demand generation plans and partner with sales leaders to support business and growth goals. You will define and deploy a best-in-class field marketing strategy that is focused on driving new customer acquisition, pipeline generation/acceleration and expansion.
Reporting to the Global Head of Field and Partner Marketing, the ideal candidate is a strong leader with proven field marketing accomplishments, thrives on making data-driven decisions and has extensive knowledge of developing scalable programs that generate brand awareness, create net new opportunities and accelerate/grow pipeline.
Responsibilities:
Understand specific AMER market priorities and target accounts to translate those into results-oriented field marketing programs that generate demand for OutSystems solutions
Manage and develop a team of field marketing managers
Represent AMER sales and local requirements to rest of marketing department and functions to align support and initiatives that supplement locally budgeted and executed programs / tactics
Drive regional demand generation plans using a variety of programs across the marketing mix, including email campaigns, social, digital, paid search, webinars, hosted events, third party sponsorships, partner events, speaking engagements, ABM (account-based marketing), and more.
Integrate and adapt global messaging, partner plans, campaigns and content into AMER or local campaigns and programs.
Track, measure and communicate program results against metrics and KPIs with sales and marketing leadership to refine programs and prioritize efforts around pipeline targets.
Generate repeatable programs and best practices and processes that can be shared globally and across AMER regions.
Collaborate with marketing peers in APAC and EMEA to ensure alignment with other global / regional marketing programs and partner cross-functionally with the rest of marketing functions in corporate, product, and demand gen marketing to develop fully integrated, multi-channel campaigns.
Leverage results and lessons learned to work with key stakeholders in sales and marketing to continuously improve messaging and activities and institute feedback loops between sales and marketing.
Centralize and manage team’s event and campaign documents including plans, calendars and budgets.


Requirements:
10-15 years’ experience in field marketing or equivalent role in B2B enterprise software marketing.
Proven success in leading teams and executing programs that drive and accelerate demand, across a broad range of channels, including events, campaigns, digital, online and with / through partners.
Demonstrated ability to build highly effective working relationships with sales leadership and marketing, supporting the delivery of AMER’s overall GTM strategy.
Excellent written and verbal communication skills.
Experience developing regional partner relationships and executing partner marketing programs.
Creative and innovative thought process to bring OutSystems message to market to build awareness and convert awareness to pipeline.
Hands on experience in Marketo and SaleForce are a plus, but must have familiarity with analyzing lead and pipeline data.
A collaborative and flexible personality who adapts easily to change and is comfortable working in a fast-paced, hyper growth environment.
Strong project management skills and proven ability to manage numerous diverse and cross functional projects.
Bachelor's Degree with a Marketing or Business focus preferred.

Location:
US Remote or Boston

Working at OutSystems
We don’t have many rules, but we have a lot of common sense. Our commitment to our culture is highlighted in The Small Book of the Few Big Rules, written by our Founder and CEO, Paulo Rosado. This commitment to culture has landed us in the top six Forbes Best Cloud Computing Companies and CEOs To Work For three years running.
Disrupting the status quo is in our DNA. In fact, it’s why our company exists
We ask “why” a lot. It helps us connect our individual work to the bigger picture, and sometimes even uncover a better way
Our offices are great places to be, but will never be the stuff of future tech mockumentaries. We’re much more down-to-earth than that

Our software platform is revolutionizing how organizations build and deliver business-transforming applications. OutSystems is one of the fastest growing B2B software companies in the world, with a base in Lisbon, Portugal, international locations in Atlanta, Boston, London, Amsterdam, Dubai, Tokyo, Sydney, and Singapore, and customers in more than 52 countries.
Recognized as a leader in our market by top analyst firms, like Forrester and Gartner
Winner of multiple industry awards, including the prestigious CODiE award
Loved by customers who have voted us the best low-code software platform (Gartner Peer Reviews, TrustRadius, and G2 Crowd)

At Wells Fargo, we want to satisfy our customers’ financial needs and help them succeed financially. We’re looking for talented people who will put our customers at the center of everything we do. Join our diverse and inclusive team where you’ll feel valued and inspired to contribute your unique skills and experience.
Help us build a better Wells Fargo. It all begins with outstanding talent. It all begins with you.
The Enterprise Customer Excellence Group brings together customer-focused functions from across the enterprise to provide a holistic approach to critical points of interaction with Wells Fargo customers. The group, which includes the Enterprise Complaints Management Office, the Customer Remediation Center of Excellence and Net Promoter System, is responsible for understanding the causes of issues that affect customers, and providing solutions that ensure customers’ needs are understood and supported. The group is also accountable for ensuring regulators’ expectations are met and that team members have the tools and training necessary for success.
The Complaints Data Analytics and Reporting team (CDAR) organization falls under the ECMO and is accountable for Data, Analytics and Reporting responsibilities across Wells Fargo. CDAR provides deep analysis of complaints and insights into customer frustration. In this role, CDAR is also accountable for numerous Data and Analytical programs across the enterprise, including driving a scaled enterprise complaints automation program leveraging Artificial Intelligence, Machine Learning and other advanced analytical techniques incubated in the CDAR organization. CDAR has a broad customer-focused scope and was created to enable the development of consistent reporting and analytical tools to find insights into ways Wells Fargo can better serve its customers. CDAR partners with business, technology, operational and customer experience leaders across the company to develop relevant advanced analytical and technological capabilities to understand, predict, manage, resolve and report customer dissatisfaction across the company.
The Research and Diagnostics team (RAD) within CDAR is responsible for defining identification criteria and researching customer complaints that have the greatest potential for systemic customer issues and reviewing for potential customer impact. The team synthesizes information from the indicator sources, performs operational and/or analytical research, and identifies the root cause and presents their findings LOB leaders, control orgs and committees.
The Business Support Manager 3 (BSM3) will lead a team responsible for performing complex operational reviews of customer journeys. The team collects information and identifies the root cause of customer problems and challenges that result in complaints and makes assessments of broader customer impacts and provides recommendations for corrective actions necessary to improve the customer experience. The BSM3 will also be responsible for supporting management in the day-to-day supervision of a Research teams supporting one or more LOBs.
Management of the team will include:
Supporting the development of the review process and associated results reporting routines.
Establishing review and quality routines to ensure consistent quality customer reviews are performed efficiently and effectively.
Working with stakeholders to develop productive routines with the business, technology, control and risk organizations.
Communicating observations and recommendations to senior management for decisioning.
Monitoring and/or enhancing the efficacy of conditions triggering reviews and implemented recommendation.
Providing direction to team members, reviewing work, and providing one on one feedback.
May assist with documenting an end to end analysis of customer experience related to the emergence of customer complaints.
Partner with all levels of leadership, team members and business partners to identify, recommend and implement best practices.
Assists in establishing framework for operational reviews and suggests oversight strategies.
May support and drive strategic initiatives for the business.
Ability to perform and manage in a matrixed environment.
Maintains an awareness of the state of operational risk across the enterprise.
Escalates issues as appropriate to leadership and partners across lines of business to discuss findings.
As a Team Member Manager, you are expected to achieve success by leading yourself, your team, and the business. Specifically you will:
Lead your team with integrity and create an environment where your team members feel included, valued, and supported to do work that energizes them.
Accomplish management responsibilities which include sourcing and hiring talented team members, providing ongoing coaching and feedback, recognizing and developing team members, identifying and managing risks, and completing daily management tasks.

Required Qualifications

4+ years of experience in one or a combination of the following: administrative support, project management, implementation, business operations or strategic planning
1+ year of management experience

Desired Qualifications

Ability to exercise independent judgment to identify and resolve problems
Ability to organize and present analysis in a holistic manner for management decisions
Ability to perform advanced research and complex evaluations
Knowledge and understanding of complex regulatory/compliance issues and potential solutions
Knowledge and understanding of Wells Fargo Enterprise Complaints Policy
Ability to take initiative, identify opportunities and implement change
Strong analytical skills with ability to draw conclusions and translate findings

Other Desired Qualifications

10+ years of experience in one or a combination of the following: Operational organizations focused on continued process excellence, optimizing customer service, customer contact, operations, or operational risk.
Experience working at an Enterprise level.

Job Expectations

Ability to travel up to 25% of the time

Deliver meeting minutes and notes
Assist in National level reporting requirements
Interface with senior military officers, executives, and managers
Serve as the primary source and aggregator of knowledge
Lead and/or support essential project management and oversight activities
Lead and/or support management of project cost, schedule, and scope

15+ years of progressive and relevant experience

Would you like to be a part of a Data Science & Artificial Intelligence (DS&AI) group who has direct strategic impact on drug development, playing a key role in getting medicines to patients?
At AstraZeneca, we are constantly pushing the boundaries of science to deliver life-changing medicines to patients, with a real passion for discovery and a pipeline to show for it. Here, you’ll have the chance to create a difference in people’s lives every single day.
AstraZeneca is investing in data management and analysis capabilities, through its long-term Growth Through Innovation Strategy.
The DS&AI team collaborates across R&D to drive innovation through data science and AI. Together we seek to:
Improve our understanding of disease and uncovering new targets
Transform R&D processes
Speed the design and delivery of new medicines for patients
The R&D Data Office, within DS&AI, is a key organisation to deliver upon AstraZeneca’s strategy. Data Office operates a central capability, with R&D wide accountability, to ensure that we harness the power of data to drive innovative science. Data Office will govern data, drive data quality and ensure our data is readied for analytics, crafting paved-paths for scientists to perform data-driven research, without compromising our legal restrictions or ethical principles.
Sustainable, FAIR (Findable, Accessible, Interoperable & Reusable) data is the lifeblood of AstraZeneca as a science-led, pure-play pharmaceutical company and critical for the delivery of the AstraZeneca’s corporate strategy, in which Data, AI and Digital is a foundational value driver for Innovative Science and a potential corporate differentiator.
Under the supervision of the Data Asset Management Director, you will be accountable for designing processes for the onboarding, cataloguing, & management of data assets, systems, and processes, for a set of projects, that drive the process of making data FAIR.
Typical Accountabilities
Analyze current-state information related to data assets gathered by the Data Discovery team
Provide Stewardship of data assets to inform the data use and analytic processes.
Provide input for the design of optimal processes and specifications for:
on-boarding of data / meta-data into a centralized data repository
cataloguing of data assets
data asset management including optimal data and data standards refresh schedules
workflow management to ensure access to the right data assets and versions
automation to enable operational scale-up
Implement processes mentioned above
Collaborate with:
IT partners for the implementation of data / meta-data on-boarding, and cataloguing activities including the development of minimum meta-data models for each data asset type.
Data Provisioning / Science Data Foundation / Data Strategy & Value teams to understand demand for data / meta-data on-boarding and management and provide input for the planning and implementation of data asset management activities in consultation with the Data Asset Management Director
Data Policy & Data Governance teams to ensure policy and governance needs are planned for and complied with.
Inform the decision-making process for data vs. meta-data ingestion to a centralized repository
Continuously improve processes to manage data assets and make scientific data FAIR and AI/Analytics-ready, so that data value grows over time. Secure value measurability, and scalability for changes in scope and demand.
Collaborate with other members of the Data Asset team, Data Office functional units, & the DS & AI community to aid the Data FAIRification process.
Education, skills and experience required
Relevant degree in Information/Data Science, Computer Science, Informatics, IT, or other related discipline.
Experience in the pharma and the life sciences sector
Solid experience in data asset management and data ownership - Band E
Good operational understanding of data repositories, ETL processes, data management principles, common data models, data standards, and analytic tools.
Experience programming, testing, or supporting software development and integrations for the on-boarding, cataloguing and management of data assets.
Extensive experience working with IT partners in the implementation of data asset management projects
Ability to learn new tools and technologies
Experience in creating system and user documentation.
Travel – willingness and ability to travel domestically & internationally.
Resilience – ability to overcome and empower others in the face of a changing environment

ABOUT US

True Digital Surgery is a World Leader in Computer-Guided Microsurgery. We combine 3D visualization and guidance software applications focused on improving accuracy, efficiency and outcomes for surgeons and patients. Our medical imaging and guidance system employs advanced real-time 3D graphics capabilities and proprietary software that is sold to surgeons and hospitals all over the world.

SUMMARY

True Digital Surgery’s (TDS) mission is to continuously innovate in the digital imaging and medical device domains. Our technological pillars include all aspects of hardware and software imaging, robotics, augmented reality (AR) and artificial intelligence (AI). TDS’s products are designed to present the surgeons with real-time image fusions of live, preoperative, interoperative, and aggerated data in order to seamlessly give surgeons with all available information, thereby improving decision quality, and thus patient outcomes. The purpose of the Principal Software Engineer - Artificial Intelligence, is to develop IP, product concepts, and technical POCs, which utilize any Machine Learning to improve the surgeon interactions with our products.

ESSENTIAL DUTIES AND RESPONSIBILITIES

Include the following. Other duties may be assigned.

Who we are looking for
We are looking for a Network Service Delivery Manager to drive the implementation of our Network Services programs

Convey information clearly and effectively in verbal and written format. prepare business cases for department review. Interacts with various levels of management.

Interacts daily with vendor partners. Purchases vendor related services and evaluates vendor’s ability to deliver services. Leads monthly vendor stewardship meetings with vendors to discuss projects, issues, and long-term plans. Helps evaluate RFP responses and recommends solution.
Proactively reviews existing policies, procedures and CIS standards initiating appropriate strategies to improve the efficiency and effectiveness against established metrics.
Reviews reports on metric information regarding cost effectiveness, labor effectiveness and customer service levels obtained.
Contributes to the ongoing evolution of the network life cycle by reviewing cost regularly and making recommendations for improvement.
Monitors development initiatives to ensure conformance with architecture models and escalates to appropriate management if they don’t.
Regularly monitors vendor’s ability to deliver on time, at the right price and of the best quality.

These skills will help you succeed in this role
Proficient hands on experience with vulnerability Management and remediation
Experience with ServiceNow a plus
2-5 years network engineering experience
CCNA desired, CCNP certification a plus

Bachelor’s degree or equivalent
7-10 years of experience in a large organization
Superior knowledge of Network Services, LAN/WAN/Routers/Switches/Collaboration/etc
Detailed knowledge of Network Security
Minimum 5 years project management experience
Strong verbal and written communications skills
Well versed communicating at all levels

Night and Weekend support as required
Why this role is important to us
Our technology function, Global Technology Services (GTS), is vital to State Street and is the key enabler for our business to deliver data and insights to our clients. We’re driving the company’s digital transformation and expanding business capabilities using industry best practices and advanced technologies such as cloud, artificial intelligence and robotics process automation.
We offer a collaborative environment where technology skills and innovation are valued in a global organization. We’re looking for top technical talent to join our team and deliver creative technology solutions that help us become an end-to-end, next-generation financial services company.
Join us if you want to grow your technical skills, solve real problems and make your mark on our industry.

What we do. State Street is one of the largest custodian banks, asset managers and asset intelligence companies in the world. From technology to product innovation we’re making our mark on the financial services industry. For more than two centuries, we’ve been helping our clients safeguard and steward the investments of millions of people. We provide investment servicing, data & analytics, investment research & trading and investment management to institutional clients.
Work, Live and Grow. We make all efforts to create a great work environment. Our benefits packages are competitive and comprehensive. Details vary in locations, but you may expect generous medical care, insurance and savings plans among other perks. You’ll have access to flexible Work Program to help you match your needs. And our wealth of development programs and educational support will help you reach your full potential.

We're looking for a strong leader with PBM testing, test automation and quality experience to join our growing Testing Center of Excellence! Now is the time to join the company that's helping people on their path to better health: CVS Health!


This role will be responsible for leading and developing a team of quality assurance engineers, quality assurance analyst and developers in the implementation and maintenance of effective testing processes, procedures, strategies and test automation tooling for the delivery of benefit and clinical changes to clients with quality.

Primary responsibilities include: Leading and managing the overall Quality of Pharmacy Benefit Plan Setup, Clinical Formulary Setup, ensuring Client Experience and Member Experience meet or exceed their expectations using test automation tools. Defines and maintains a testing automation framework. Drives automation tooling adoption, optimization, and the implementation of new automation approaches using proven technology. Responsible for mentoring and motivating resources to perform to their best of capabilities and adopting industry best practices in Quality Assurance / Testing. The position will assume full ownership for business flows and create processes in the functional and integration test areas

DETAILED JOB RESPONSIBILITIES
1. Handle, lead and empower the Intelligent Automation team members to own and drive intelligent automation architecture, delivery and support. Work cross-functionally with key areas of the organization to deliver on both new ground-breaking product strategies as well as to advance existing products with new innovative approaches to deliver enterprise value. Drive the data architecture, design, delivery and operations of intelligent automation solutions by understanding CVS’s business challenges and integrating capabilities such Cognitive automation, machine learning and data analytics using Tableau to create seamless solutions. 20%

2. Coordinating with various project functions and standardizing various functions in overall business process. Reviewing each business functions (BRM, Coding and testing) and establishing standards in the process to increase productivity and efficiency and avoid ambiguities. Perform the gap analysis, contributing to as-Is and To-Be Process modeling session. Create benefit/clinical Log and schedule to track timeline. Prepare root-cause analysis for issues reported in live claims anomaly. 20%

3. Identifying areas of automation based on manual efforts in the current process and guide automation/tool team for requirements. Look for continuous improvements to the overall process to optimize and improve the performance and member experience on pharmacy claims. It includes analyzing client specific set-up using proprietary tools, which includes UM Tool, Formulary Tool, NDC lookup tool to analyze/get the data specific for clinical changes), Benefit tools (plan configuration), EZ Test, and SRX Therapy tools (creating Pricing List). 20%

4. Define, prioritize, allocate resources, track and provide status reporting of work assignments, projects, programs. Detailed description of Duty 4. Lead management for the projects / programs - including running delivery. Act as the key point of contact for the team, and lead the work intake, estimation, prioritization and delivery roadmap. 15%

5. Actively handling the performance of staff members to established Performance standards. Coaching your team to identify and resolve challenges by analyzing information and figuring out appropriate solutions and working towards practical and creative solutions. Encouraging teamwork and a supportive departmental culture with an emphasis on ensuring outstanding client service 10%

6. Recommending and leading operational improvements both strategically and in the day-to-day application of organizational policies and procedures. Provide consultation and expertise solution on client's prescription benefits/claim processing to meet complex custom client needs for plan design (benefit setup) changes. 10%

7. Identify and define business problems and issues, and develop strategic, analytical, and financial frameworks to conduct analysis or measure success. Create and maintain swim lane diagram, facilitate playbook for maintenance, and single source of truth for current configuration on respective clients and give directions/experienced knowledge to peers on benefits configuration, RxClaim adjudication system and testing methodology. 5%

To be successful in this role we are looking for someone who has strong decision making and creative problem solving skills. Who is able to work in fast paced and changing work environment with quick turnaround. Has the ability to coach, lead, mentor, develop and guide employee performance. Can effectively present information and respond to questions from groups of associates, leaders and clients. Knows the importance of sharing ideas and experiences, driving engagement, actively involving people. Obtains strong written and verbal communication and can easily talk to both technical and non-technical partners and users, and senior leaders.

Required Qualifications
10+ years of experience in PBM, managed care or HealthcareAt least 3 years of demonstrated leadership experience, coaching and mentoring high performing teams, with a preference for experience leading teams linked to benefit operations in the requirements and configuration for PBM implementations or similar field within a healthcare/PBM industryAt least 5 years of experience driving process re-engineering, improvement and automation initiatives and experience in leading teams and organizationsExperience with technologies and frameworks in the areas of artificial intelligence, machine learning or automation.

Preferred Qualifications
Experience in partnering with the Business Intelligence and Data Science teams and experience driving organizational data strategyExperience with regular and consistent interaction with key business stakeholders and senior leaders in IT and other functions.

Education
Bachelor Degree is required
Equivalent experience may be considered

Business Overview
It’s a new day in health care.

Combining CVS Health and Aetna was a transformative moment for our company and our industry, establishing CVS Health as the nation’s premier health innovation company. Through our health services, insurance plans and community pharmacists, we’re pioneering a bold new approach to total health. As a CVS Health colleague, you’ll be at the center of it all.

At CVS Health, we work every day to help people on their path to better health. Never has it been more important for us to deliver on our purpose to our valued customers, patients, members, and employees. With a presence in communities across the country, CVS Health colleagues are and will continue to be a critical piece of the country’s health care solution. The health and safety of our employees, patients, customers, and members is our top priority as we face the impact of COVID-19 together. Are you passionate about connected mobility and use of machine learning technologies in the Automotive Industry? AWS is looking for a technologist who understands business and technology trends impacting the Automotive industry, to build solutions with leading technology and consulting companies.

As a solutions architect focused on Automotive partners, you will have the exciting opportunity to build connected vehicle solutions, establish customer and partner trust, and nurture adoption of the AWS cloud computing platform across AWS’s most strategic Automotive business partners. job_title: Business Development Manager, Venture Capital & Startup - Public Sector
job_description:
MBA required.10+ years of Business development experience in cloud-based technology solutions7+ years of experience working with US Public Sector clients. Working knowledge of government acquisitions, contracts and technology certifications is a must.5+ years of experience delivering strategic value through unique relationships with startup firms, tech vendors, academia, VCs, CVCs, and incubators/accelerators.Extensive relationships within Pubic Sector, top-tier VCs, CVCs, Academia, Incubators/Accelerators, and related membership consortiums.Experience in marketing/selling emerging technologies such as Artificial Intelligence, Machine Learning, Quantum Computing as applied to Smart Cities, Health, Space and Immersive/Experiential applications.

Do you get excited by startups working on advanced technologies like AI/ML, IOT, and Quantum Computing? Do you also get excited about advancements in Space, Healthcare and Smart Cities technologies?

Do you have the business savvy, deep technical insights, and the passion to help public sector adopt innovation? Do you have deep relationships within the public sector and the startup/VC ecosystem to help further establish Amazon as the leader in the cloud computing?

The Worldwide Public Sector Sales (WWPS) team is looking for a Business Development Manager to work with government/public sector decision makers, startups, and VCs to accelerate the adoption of innovation by the public sector.

As a business development manager within AWS WWPS, you will have the exciting opportunity to help global public sector customers uncover, discover and refine use-cases that can be addressed through adoption of innovative cloud-based solutions built by startups on AWS. You will also have the opportunity to shape and deliver on a strategy to focus on Healthcare and Space within the public sector, and identify appropriate startups and VCs to help evangelize them about these opportunities. As a business development manager within AWS WWPS, you will be responsible for helping startups accelerate their public sector go-to-market by connecting the dots with public sector customers, AWS WWPS sales teams, partner teams and various sales-enablement teams to address the identified opportunities.

The ideal candidate will possess a business background that enables them to drive engagement with public sector decision makers, senior partners at VC firms and CxOs and founders of startups. The candidate will also have the requisite technical background that enables them to easily interact with engineers and architects. He/she should also have a demonstrated ability to think strategically and analytically about business, product, and technical challenges, with the ability to build and convey compelling value propositions, and work cross-organizationally to build consensus. A keen sense of ownership, drive, and grit is a must.

Roles & Responsibilities:
Serve as a key member of the WWPS Venture Capital and Startups team to drive overall market and technical strategy to help public sector customers uncover and discover use-cases that can be solved through innovative cloud-based solutions.Find and qualify startups that can address these use-cases identified within the public sector.Help startups accelerate their public sector go-to-market by working with key internal stakeholders (e.g. sales teams, marketing, partner team, legal, marketplace and APN teams), and by connecting startups with customers and key partners.Implement and manage reporting systems using salesforce.com to track the effectiveness of the efforts to uncover and discover opportunities within the public sector, for innovative solutions built by startups.Prepare and give business reviews to the senior management team regarding progress and roadblocks to the mission of driving adoption of startups-built innovation into public sector.Handle a high volume of engagements with startups and public sector customers.Experienced with account management (Enterprise, SMB and startup) and solution selling ability.Some relevant technical knowledge is helpful, such as: databases and storage systems, core distributed computing concepts, fundamentals of cloud computing and virtualization, AI/ML and its applicability in various applications. Some Travel required.
This position can sit virtually in the Bay Area.

Existing Public Sector R&D (or equivalent) relationships are highly desired.Startup board advisory and mentorship experience specifically in technical and go-to-market guidance.Experience with piloting joint solutions with startup firms to test new product/capability offerings for specific Public Sector applications is highly desired.Experience selling and/or marketing leading-edge, cloud-based health and/or space solutions to Public Sector customers is highly desired.Proven track record of taking ownership and driving results.Ability to effectively lead and work with a variety of organizations, management levels, cultures, and personalitiesExperience collaborating with both technical and non-technical stakeholders across multiple teams.Technical background with Computer Science and Business/Economics is highly desired.Working knowledge of software product development highly desired.Meets/exceeds Amazon’s leadership principles requirements for this roleMeets/exceeds Amazon’s functional/technical depth and complexity

About the Company
TeraRecon is a leader in advanced visualization and artificial intelligence solutions. Our flagship product, Intuition, is the market share leader for radiology and cardiology advanced visualization. Our AI division was awarded the best new radiology vendor for 2018 and nominated for best new software in 2019 by readers of industry news leader, AuntMinnie. Further, we were recently named the 2020 KLAS Category Leader for Advanced Visualization. We are committed to redefining advanced visualization by leveraging machine learning and improving radiology workflows through personalized automation that increases efficiency. TeraRecon is a privately-held global company with its world headquarters in Durham, NC, and major offices in Tokyo, Japan; Frankfurt, Germany; Fremont, CA and Acton, MA. While our employees are located across the world, we work as one company, functionally-aligned, and goal-driven. TeraRecon’s transparency and collaborative work environment foster an energetic and inviting culture.

About the Position
We are seeking an experienced Product Manager to join the TeraRecon team.

This position is based in our Acton, MA office or Durham, NC headquarters.

Responsibilities
Manage inbound Product Manager responsibilities which include, Product Owner role in Agile (Scrum) development team, Subject Matter Expert, gather competitive intelligence, represent Voice of the Customer and maintain Luminary sites. This role will be a team member and contributor for development of strategic product roadmaps
Manage outbound Product Manager responsibilities which include, creation and execution of New Product Introduction for commercial launch that include, Creation of Marketing Materials. Web Content and additional sales collateral tools, customer communications, value propositions, positioning and pricing.
Support in submission of 510k including Clinical Assessment and documentation of products.
Participate in development of architectural strategy, including technology standardization, user interface and usability standards.
Investigate, conduct proof of concept and generate recommendations on key third-party integration components and integrations.


Preferred Qualifications
3-5 year experience as an Advanced Visualization Product Manager is required.
Agile Product Owner or Scrum Master experience, certification preferred.
Knowledge about Networking and DICOM standards preferred
Experience in managing/developing solutions in a regulated Medical Device environment with 510k submissions
Strong understanding of Medical Imaging and standards, as they apply to medical informatics
Clinical and Managerial experience in cross sectional imaging CT,MRI and or PET
International business experience.


Education
Bachelor’s Degree or equivalent Industry experience required (Registered Technologist)
Master Degree preferred.


Salary: Depending on qualifications and experience.
Benefits: Medical, Dental, Vision, Life Insurance, LTD, STD, Section 125, and 401K

Boston College seeks a Manager, Research Computing to provide statistical consultation and analysis to faculty in all areas of Boston College. Provide statistical expertise in research projects, including grant applications, grants, papers, dissertations. Guide researchers who need statistical expertise. Supervise the work of full-time equivalent employees and graduate students as part of general oversight of a center for statistics and advanced analysis. Specific duties include:
Research computing: Under direction, provide management over research computing functions within the group. Provide infrastructure support for the high performance computing cluster and develop a structure to manage resource demand growth. Provide consultation and support to Boston College faculty and principal investigators’ research computing project needs.
Research consulting/analysis: Provide faculty and their research groups with consulting, user support, and training in relevant applications and tools. Provide expertise and support for research design, analysis, grants, and large statistical and/or geospatial datasets. Design and implement long-term quantitative initiatives to support research projects at Boston College. May be published for the statistical analysis on specified grants. Support users of research facilities and assist with managing, analyzing and producing projects with statistical and/or geospatial datasets.
Documentation/tutorials/workshops: Develop statistics-related on-line documentation and training materials. Conduct tutorials and workshops and deliver lectures for the entire research community to include faculty and graduate student consultants on statistical methods and the use of related software. Ensure that appropriate departments are aware of the statistical support resources provided by Research Services. Represent ITS to other University areas to effectively communicate the availability of research support resources to the research community.
Emerging technology: Monitor trends in statistical methods and software to ensure that consulting services are aligned with researchers’ needs and current tools and methodologies. Monitor and stay current with trends in research computing, such as container technology, machine learning, and artificial intelligence.
Supervision:

Ensure that customer service standards and support are upheld by assigned team.

Mentor staff and provide orientation and training to new and current staff members.
Position posted May 21, 2020 through June 21, 2020

Requirements

Minimum Requirements: PhD, or foreign equivalent, in Statistics, Economics or related field; plus 3 years experience as a Research Statistician, Data Scientist, Research Analyst or related, including the following which may be gained concurrently: 3 years applying statistical methods to research in an academic environment using STATA, ProgR, and Scripting; demonstrated record of publishing research reports and working papers; and demonstrated ability to develop and deliver technology training workshops.
Applicants should reply by clicking the “APPLY” button in the upper left hand corner of this page
Salary: $85,000 - $118,000/yr.

Description



At Exelon, we've got a place for you!

Join the nation's leading competitive energy provider, with one of the largest electricity generation portfolios and retail customer bases in the country. You will be part of a family of companies that strives for the highest standards of power generation, competitive energy sales, and energy delivery. Our team of outstanding professionals is focused on performance, thought leadership, innovation, and the power of ideas that come from a diverse and inclusive workforce.

Exelon will provide you the tools and resources you need to design, build and enhance a successful career. We are also dedicated to motivating the success of our employees through competitive base salary, incentives, and health and retirement benefits.

Join Exelon and share your passion at a forward-thinking Fortune 100 company. Establish yourself in a place where you can truly shine and create a brighter, more sustainable tomorrow. Energize your career at Exelon!

PRIMARY PURPOSE OF POSITION:

Exelon Utilities Team Digital is looking for a highly motivated, self-driven, open minded IT Project Manager to deliver fast paced projects to our customers through web, mobile apps, wearables and voice assistance. Our Project or Product delivery models utilize a design driven approach to measure customer expectations and solution usability to tailor optimal solutions to our end-users.
Exelon, a forward-thinking Fortune 100 company will provide you the stability, tools and resources you need to design, build and enhance a successful career as part of a diverse, inclusive and energetic workforce. We are also dedicated to motivating the success of our employees through competitive base salary, incentives, health and retirement benefits.

We value our people and the diverse skills and backgrounds they bring to collectively work towards Exelon’s goal of providing clean, affordable and innovative energy to create a more sustainable future for everyone.
If you feel that this role matches your passion and skills, apply now to Energize your career at Exelon!
PRIMARY DUTIES AND ACCOUNTABILITIES:


Exelon’s Team Digital aims to rapidly deliver reliable and innovative products and services that enable the business and enhance our customer’s experience.
Our team paves the digital path forward for Exelon Utilities and beyond. We value our people and the diverse skills and backgrounds they bring to collectively work towards Exelon’s goal of providing clean, affordable and innovative energy to create a more sustainable future for everyone.
Manage IT projects consisting of cross-functional teams involving multiple IT disciplines, directing engaging with our business partners and managing contract resources. Portfolio is mostly Agile methodology-based projects and a very few Hybrid/Waterfall projects.

Responsible for managing the scope, schedule and budget of projects, products and programs. Leads project teams through business case / funding approval process, initiation / discovery, execution and project closeout in accordance with IT Management Model and PMI standards. These projects have budgets that will typically range from $250K to $15 million.

Responsible and accountable for overall project performance delivering new IT services, technologies and various organizational initiatives from initiation to closeout. Must follow organizations established PM standards and governance.
Ensures project costs, schedule and scope are managed, including the development of recovery plans, to stay within approved limits. Regularly report out on project status including Risks and Issues, Variances and mitigation plans.
Interface with external and internal stakeholders to coordinate project requirements.
Primary communicator with the sponsor and key stakeholders on project issues, including executive level and interdepartmental presentations.
Ensures a good working relationship between the project team, internal resources, vendors and interfacing organizations.
Coaches and leads team members to ensure completion of assigned tasks. Be familiar and experienced with Waterfall and Agile Project methodologies.
Identify and obtain project team resources.
Ensures project team members understand their respective responsibilities.



POSITION SCOPE:


The Project Manager is an individual contributor accountable for project budgets, team performance and developing strategic plans to implement projects for various organizations.
Responsibilities also include managing scope, budget and schedule within approved parameters and providing structured and detailed reports to the appropriate Management team.

Tasks include but are not limited to, ensuring the completion of business cases, budgetary approvals, project scheduling, design and engineering tasks, management reviews, project reporting, managing issues/risks, project financial analysis, equipment procurement and relationship management with key internal and external stakeholders including senior management, the business partners and customers.

Lead IT staff and resources in accordance with IT Business Plan. Plan and manage scope, schedule, and budget for defined deliverables in accordance with IT project management standards.
