job_title: Project Manager/Business Analyst - Strategy Consultant - PMO
job_description:
About Fresh Gravity:
Founded in 2015 and rapidly expanding, Fresh Gravity (www.freshgravity.com) is a business and technology consulting company at the cutting-edge of digital transformation. We drive digital success for our clients by helping them adopt transformative technologies that make them nimble, adaptive and responsive to their rapidly-changing business needs. Our unparalleled digital transformation expertise combines business strategy prowess with digital technologies know-how. Our expertise includes Data Management, Artificial Intelligence, Data Science & Analytics, and API Management & Integration.
In a short time, we have crafted an exceptional team who have delivered impactful projects for some of the largest corporations in the world. We are on a mission to solve the most complex business problems for our clients using the most exciting new technologies. And we are looking for top talent to join us in our quest.
Fresh Gravity’s team members are authorities in their field, but know how to have fun, too. We’re building an inspiring, open organization you’ll take pride in. We challenge ourselves to grow – every day. We create value for our clients and partners – every day. We promise rich opportunities for you to succeed, to shine, to exceed even your own expectations.
We are thoughtful. We are engaged. We are relentless. We are Fresh Gravity.
Fresh Gravity is an equal opportunity employer.

About this position:
Our Client Success capability is seeking a strong techno-functional project manager cum business analyst who will be responsible for driving successful project outcomes for Fresh Gravity’s clients. The candidate should have demonstrated experience or a strong desire to learn and engage in managing projects that cross the boundaries of data management, API management and integration, data science and artificial intelligence. Exceptional communication skills, the ability to manage client and project team relationships, and strong analytical skills are keys to success in this position.

Requirements
Key Responsibilities Include:
Project Management:
Lead and participate in the full delivery lifecycle of strategy and implementation projects for our clients using agile and hybrid project management approaches (e.g., experience as a Scrum Master)
Plan workstreams, assign and track work activities, identify, report and manage/mitigate risks, manage resolution of outstanding issues and actions,
Manage the development lifecycle using a combination of agile and waterfall delivery models including activities such as backlog grooming, sprint planning, retrospectives, test cycle definition and planning, migration and cutover planning.
Define models to track status of activities and deliverables to facilitate quantitative reporting of the project progress
Provide weekly status on project activities, deliverables, scope, schedule, budget, and risks/issues
Business and Technical/Functional Analysis:
Participate in strategy/roadmap initiatives while aligning the strategy to the business objectives, including helping establish organization constructs, development methodologies and selection of technology components (e.g., API gateways, code repository tools, data quality tools, data management/governance strategy, etc.)
Plan, lead and manage requirements definition and solution design working sessions in addition to documenting functional use cases and architectures, business requirements, and high level business solution approaches
Research market trends and technology articles, propose strategic direction ideas, best practices, gathering current state information through stakeholder interaction using interviews / workshops
Communicate business requirements to architects and developers and assist in conducting feasibility assessments and identify optimal approaches to technically achieve the business requirements (e.g., Assist Sr. Technical Architects and leads in Apigee/API Migration Strategy on an API Strategy project)
Define and influence direction of organization constructs and technology management methodology change with organizations (e.g., define data governance frameworks on a data governance strategy assessment project)
Own the delivery of demos to our clients of working software built to specification and soliciting feedback to ensure satisfaction of business requirements (e.g., demonstrate data stewardship functionality on an MDM project)
Verify the development artifacts/software are built to specification through various levels of testing
Other:
Assist in responding to RFPs by participating in planning, scoping, solution definition and estimation
Manage client and vendor partner relationships and activities to ensure alignment of schedule, scope, and responsibilities
Support and contribute to an evolving project delivery methodology by designing and creating templates, accelerators and reusable artifacts
Skills and Qualification Requirements
Bachelors or Masters (preferred) degree in a technology or project management discipline
4 to 6 years of project management and functional architecture experience
2+ years of experience working in a business context (technology consulting, systems integration, management consulting, working as an analyst “in industry,” etc.) – Big 5 Consulting or similar (e.g., Deloitte, Accenture, E&Y, KPMG, PwC, Slalom, etc.) background highly desirable
Exceptional proficiency with fundamental day-to-day processes of project delivery and running a team, for example:
Estimating personnel requirements
Leading scoping exercise and work effort estimation and planning to develop comprehensive effort estimates (duration, FTE requirements, cost, execution plan of activities)
Assigning tasks to team members and monitoring/tracking completion of deliverables
Running effective client meetings (setting context, establishing goals, capturing key decisions, managing scope changes, etc.)
Managing scope and negotiating change requests
Status reporting, appropriate escalation of risks/issues
Strong experience and familiarity with tools, templates and accelerators of different types pertaining to different stages of a project (e.g., project retrospective tools, Jira backlog boards, Quality Strategy templates, Functional design documents, etc.)
Expert experience with tools like Jira and Confluence
Exceptional proficiency with project- and stakeholder-management theory and practices – demonstrated ability to proactively drive workstreams with minimal supervision, independently escalate and resolve issues, handle changes in technical direction, etc.
Experience in one of more of our capabilities (API Management & Integration, AI, Data Science & Analytics or Data Management) is not required but will be good to have
Someone who is looking for a niche consulting firm with an excellent culture and has the desire to grow as the company grows.
Geographic Location:
Ideally, based in the Dallas area [Optional - DC/Virginia/Maryland, or Raleigh (NC)]. Might require occasional travel if client projects are outside of the area
Benefits
In addition to a competitive package, we promise rich opportunities for you to succeed, to shine, to exceed even your own expectations. In keeping with Fresh Gravity’s challenger ethos, we have developed the 5Dimensions (5D) benefits program. This program recognizes the multiple dimensions within each of us and seek to provide opportunities for deep development across these dimensions. Enrich Myself; Enhance My Client; Build My Company, Nurture My Family; and Better Humanity.

job_title: Sr Director of Data and Analytics
정리된 job_title: Sr Director of Data and Analytics
job_description:
At Equiscript, we improve access to healthcare in the communities we serve. We are able to do this through the motivation, ingenuity, and dedication of our talented team.

Are you looking for a career where you can be part of a successful, growing business that is doing meaningful work in communities across the country?

Located in historic North Charleston and Salt Lake City, Equiscript has been on the Inc. 5000 list of Fastest Growing Companies in the United States for the past four years and was chosen as one of the Best Places to Work in South Carolina three years in a row. We were also named one of Modern Healthcare's 2019 Best Places to Work in Healthcare. We are a dynamic, growing company that values its employees and the patients and health centers we serve. As passionate people who enjoy coming to work and being part of a team, we are looking for candidates who will support and embrace our company’s Cause and Core Values. If this is you, apply today!

Sr Director of Data & Analytics::

General Description:
Equiscript is seeking an experienced candidate to serve in the role of Senior Director of Data and Analytics (SDDA). The SDDA will serve as a department and business leader, reporting to the CFO.
High-Level Vision - :the SDDR is responsible for the big picture of the data priorities and strategy for the company. A high level of understanding of both data and strategy and the company’s business is required.
Implementation -: The SDDR is responsible for the implementation of data-driven solutions within the company’s strategy at every level in the company. This requires the ability to manage teams on technical projects and build a business case around technical projects with many variables and uncertainty.
Data Accuracy, Security, and Privacy - :the SDDR is responsible for collecting and maintaining accurate data, ensuring data security, and devising and implementing data privacy policies. The SDDR is to work with leadership to develop, define, and implement legal and ethical guidelines for the collection and use of data.
Identifying Business Opportunities - :The SDDR is the person most responsible for identifying business opportunities discovered through data. In broad terms, the SDDR should increase revenue or decrease costs based upon information learned through data initiatives.
Data-Driven Culture Leader - :The SDDR must serve as the leader for a data-driven culture within the company. This includes communicating to everyone at the company the importance of data, security, and privacy as well as the business value of data.
Key Responsibilities:
The SDDA will develop new ways to interpret and use data to advance Equiscript’s business. Working closely with the Sr. Director of Information Services, this position will build the structure and processes necessary to serve internal business users. In this role, the SDDA will define how Equiscript looks at reporting, tracking, and decision-making. The SDDA will:
Have expertise in creating and driving business value and growth through the effective use of data.
Collaborate with IT on the architecture, design, integration, and staging of data and the development, implementation, and maintenance of the associated data storage systems.
Be responsible for developing and administering Equiscript’s data and information strategy in order to facilitate and enhance organizational decision-making and data utilization across the company.
Lead a centralized Data and Analytics service and develop data-related policies and procedures; design, improve, and streamline organizational data systems; and drive innovation in the area of enterprise-wide data science, analysis, and visualization.
Be responsible for recruiting staff or engaging contractors that can use emerging technologies to improve the performance of the company.
Be responsible for developing and administering Equiscript’s data and information strategy in order to facilitate and enhance organizational decision-making and data utilization across the company.
Be responsible for overseeing the development and management of new machine learning and predictive modeling algorithms.
Be responsible for communicating effectively with all company departments and helping those departments perform to a higher standard with tools developed under the oversight of the SDDA.
Serve as a system-wide leader for data and analytics. Working closely with our client, patient, and pharmacy facing teams, develop a comprehensive understanding of the company’s overall business goals and data analytics needs
Analyze data, identify trends, and recommend how to improve and grow the business
Build and establish the automation of reports & dashboards – identify and select analytics partners to improve reporting
Own and expand patient identification and patient lifecycle and lifetime value reporting
Present data in a clear and concise way to the executive team
Research the latest technologies and assess their impact on business trends
Professional Qualities:
Evidence of strong leadership and communication skills at a C- or board level
Experience in information management projects and programs
Familiarity with big data solutions
Familiarity with data governance and quality control
Background in statistics or mathematics
Experience with creating best practices and methodologies for technical projects
Experience managing technical teams
Understanding of and experience building business cases for large technical projects
Familiarity with data modelling and visualization techniques
Strong business experience in the field
Preferred Experience:
Bachelor’s or graduate degree in a quantitative field such as Mathematics, Statistics, Computer Science, Finance, Economics, or a related field.
5-8 years of experience working with data analytics teams to provide reporting, analysis, modeling, and strategic insight
Experience with a variety of analytics platforms and database programming languages (i.e. CRM, Web Analytics, BI tools, etc)
Experience in integrating complex, inter-departmental processes and information strategies, and/or designing strategic metrics and scorecards required.
Experience running data analytics teams using the latest data mining, machine learning and/or artificial intelligence techniques required. Clinical background, or technical background in the healthcare domain is highly desirable.
Hands-on experience with implementing data management programs preferred.
Ability to provide written and oral interpretation of highly specialized terms and data, and the ability to present this data to others with different levels of expertise

Computer Skills:
Statistical analysis software/packages such as ProgR, Minitab, SAS/STAT, etc.
Visualization/BI tools such as Tableau, PowerBI, etc.
Ability to write and tune SQL queries
Advanced Database/warehouse/lake knowledge; Master Data Management (MDM) applications; and Extract-Transform-Load (ETL/ELT) tool
Physical Requirements:
Requires the ability to sit or stand for long periods of time, occasional stooping, and reaching; May require lifting up to 25 pounds; requires a normal range of vision and hearing with or without accommodations.
Additional Information:
Cleared Background Check Required
Employment Information:
Position located in North Charleston, SC but remote candidates will be considered. Remote candidates will be expected to travel approximately 20% to the main office.
Benefits include health plan, dental, vision, paid time off
Flex time
401k with up to 4% match
Benefits of Full Time Employment with Equiscript:
Competitive salaries
Interesting, challenging, meaningful work
Bright, high quality teammates
Strong company culture based on teamwork and healthy competition
Group health, dental, vision, life and disability insurance
401K with up to a 4% match
Wellness programs
Company-provided training for personal and professional development
Generous PTO Policy
10 paid holidays annually
Flexible schedule
Casual dress code
Parking

Software Development Director-20000F7V


Applicants are required to read, write, and speak the following languages: English

Preferred Qualifications

Every day, enterprises around the world focus on how to help their employees work simpler and smarter. And while enterprises are as diverse as the people in them, they all share many similar core needs.

Helping everyone work simpler and smarter means letting enterprises focus on what makes each of them special. They focus on what they’re best at, and in turn, they let Oracle do the rest.

At Oracle, we’re committed to making a state-of-the-art consumer-grade enterprise experience that connects, empowers and delights our users, and is the factor that distinguishes our software from the competition.

Customers need to review and approve critical business transactions, to ensure policy compliance. Such approval requests need to be easy to understand and disposition, and straightforward to implement and maintain. This is the key responsibility for the Approvals team.

We're creating a modern Approvals experience, smoothing human decisions for critical business transactions. We're putting the "Ahh" into Approvals, and helping users love Oracle one interaction at a time.

To deliver the benefits to users, applications product teams will adopt the new Approvals system. In addition to delivering an amazing customer experience, we'll ensure the new system is a pleasure to implement and operate. As we succeed, we'll expand to further help our customers and the application product teams.

We need a technical leader who loves hiring, guiding and coaching team members to deliver fantastic user experience, applying their deep experience with modern agile practices, and driving continuous improvement.

These developers love solving customers' business problems with thoughtfully-conceived technology. Software that resonates with end users and developers, because it was designed with a deep and nuanced understanding of the challenges they face every day.

Together we'll deliver an Approvals service customers love. One that makes us proud, using modern architecture, technology, and techniques. We'll continually learn by working with customers and our application development partners, and we'll relentlessly drive to delight.

What you'll do
You will build, grow and develop an agile team and its members.
You'll bring your deep experience with modern agile practices, and will drive continuous improvement both within and beyond the team.
You'll develop your leadership, enriching your knowledge and experience with continuous delivery and continuous improvement.

You'll work with Oracle Cloud Applications Development teams and their customers, to understand and implement their requirements and to help them implement effectively.
We'll improve using short iterations, and by responding quickly to customer feedback.

Modern agile practices and culture

Dev+Ops, to deliver operability at scale

Microservice architecture, because this approach fits our problem space
Helidon MicroProfile for microservices
Java, SQL and Oracle RDBMS, our rock-solid foundation
Oracle's latest Cloud Infrastructure services, including Kubernetes / Docker and Streaming.
Observation-driven design, to support data-driven investment, potentially with Artificial Intelligence / Machine Learning (AI, ML)
Who you are
You are passionate about delivering excellent software, and driven to help others develop their software craft, eventually into experts and leaders.
You make the world better by delivering and improving software and software development.
You thrive on working well with others. You make the people around you better. You love to collaborate with customers and users, team members and other developers, and inspire them to do their best. You are a font of positivity and people get energy from their encounters with you.
You don’t already know everything and you love to learn. You’re inspired by helping users solve their problems. You love finding out you’re wrong. You use quantitative and qualitative data to constantly refine your views. You improve your craft every day.
You recognize and welcome appropriate risks, and accept that learning will inspire changing direction.
And finally, you want to be part of creating dramatic and impactful change at a company that is committed to delighting our users.

Dev+Ops
Oracle ADF Business Components
RESTful services

Manage a team that designs, develops, troubleshoots and debugs software programs for databases, applications, tools, networks etc.

Build enhancements within an existing software architecture and envision future improvements to the architecture.

Assists in the development of short, medium, and long term plans to achieve strategic objectives. Bliss Point Media is a rapidly growing performance media advertising agency startup based in Santa Monica that combines world-class media capabilities with cutting-edge statistics and computer science. Using technology as a differentiator, Bliss Point Media brings modern statistical and computational techniques to bear on our clients' biggest marketing opportunities across linear TV and streaming/OTT video platforms. Our approach provides our clients with unique and powerful tools to maximize the effectiveness of their advertising campaigns while providing an experience of strategic depth and flawless execution. We work with some of the world's most recognizable new brands as well as established companies that want to rewrite their media playbook.

The Role
Bliss Point's clients are performance advertisers, which is to say they make investments with the expectation of a quantifiable return. Our job is to quantify those returns with maximal precision, and steward our clients' investments so as to make the return/investment ratio as attractive as possible.

Bliss Point's approach to this challenge involves deploying a suite of algorithms that are both purpose-built and general purpose; that is, specifically designed for a given context, but broadly applicable to different advertisers operating within that context.

Surrounding this core set of consistent, repeated questions, there are innumerable auxiliary questions: Should we test incrementality using an A/B audience holdout or a geographic holdout? How many impressions do we need to achieve statistical significance for our incrementality test, and how should those impressions be allocated between the control and exposed groups? What is the optimal frequency when we're running a promotion versus not? Are we better off ramping up media some time in advance of a promotion, or in a just-in-time fashion? When we ramp spend on TV, how much extra branded search spend should we budget for? Ad infinitum.

This role will be auxiliary to the Client Strategy team, providing econometric support across the client base to bolster strategy and execution of campaign investments. In addition to analytical work, the role will have a significant interpersonal aspect: communicating methods and findings to clients, and contributing to the learning & development track for the client strategy team. The Econometrics Manager will report to the Director of Econometrics.

Background & Competencies

Degree in statistics, data science, applied math, economics, or related field

Strong foundations in probability theory and econometrics

0 - 3 years of experience in applied data science

Significant practical experience with R/Python and SQL

Lots of hands-on experience with real-world, imperfect data, and a zeal for turning disorder into sensible order

Greater emphasis on: experimental design, hypothesis testing, observational and quasi-experimental measurement techniques

Lesser emphasis on: big data, deep learning, artificial intelligence, etc.

A love of solving puzzles with data!

Compensation
Bliss Point is a startup, and we're looking for someone who finds that exciting rather than intimidating. We're profitable and will offer a very competitive total compensation package to the right candidate, with a salary range from $80,000-$100,000 to start depending on skills and experience, plus stock options and variable compensation.

Benefits

Bliss Point offers full medical benefits (Blue Shield of California PPO plans), including dental and vision coverage. After 60 days of employment, you will be eligible for our uncapped vacation policy. After 6 months you would become eligible for the BPM 401K. The company also offers parking, a gym membership from Burn Fitness in Santa Monica, cell phone reimbursement and bonus opportunities, paid out based on individual and company performance on a quarterly basis.

All applicants must be authorized to work in the United States. The company does not offer visa sponsorship at this time.

Emotional and mental health problems on a spectrum and not everyone needs the same care. wayForward untangles access to emotional wellness and mental health care for employees and members. We identify member needs and deliver personalized care, both digital and traditional. Our solution is delivered via a mobile and web app-based platform. We are a rapidly growing startup in the mental health and wellness space. Since 2017, we’ve covered 500K lives and projecting to grow to over 1 million within a year. Our solutions are used primarily by employers.

You have preferably worked in healthcare/wellness settings. AI and Machine Learning experience is a strong plus.

You have a STEM undergraduate and/or master’s degree (preferred)
Benefits

401(k) plan, FSA & commuter benefits
The opportunity to grow alongside a company filling a huge need in the world
Fun, diverse, open-minded co-workers
Our HQ is in NYC. The position is fully remote at the moment and will remain highly flexible after COVID-19 reopening.

Core Services Engineering builds and manages the critical products and services that Microsoft runs on. We boldly pursue big ideas that power transformational advances at Microsoft and for our customers, while helping Microsoft teams work smarter, faster and more securely every day. Core Services Engineering employees have deep technical and business expertise, customer insights, and a clear point of view that comes from first-hand, large-scale experience with Microsoft and industry solutions. We are engineers, technology leaders and experts, digital transformation change agents, and customer advocates.
We have exciting opportunities for you to innovate, influence, transform, inspire and grow within our organization and we encourage you to apply to learn more!

Our customers are HW engineers, Planners, Sourcing Managers, Factory Operations, Logistics and Warehouse Operations, Customer Support, Datacenter Ops, Microsoft Retail Stores - all of these are involved in the whole lifecycle from designing products to ensuring we can build them at scale and deliver them to our customers. We partner with suppliers, manufacturers, logistics providers and retailers to make and sell Microsoft products and services. We do what we say, when we say. We work hard and we have fun!

We are in the process of extending our data infrastructure and provide a highly scalable data service across the world. This Business Intelligence and analytics platform will be responsible for consolidating multiple geo-distributed data sources, replicating data updates within tight SLAs and delivering large data snapshots to any machine in any data center at any time. We are developing Data Lake and Data warehousing capabilities that aid in business decision making for the supply chain using the latest Azure technology stack - specifically ADL, ADF, ADW, ADB etc. Our Data Lake and Warehousing solution will provide end-to-end supply chain visibility of business and system events and correlate them using complex event processing technology. We are an agile team, with a great track record, shipping every two weeks. We are looking for a Program manager with strong technical skills, excellent communication, leadership skills, coupled with passion for quality, agility and efficiency. As a Sr. Program Manager, you will be responsible for the delivery of Business intelligence platforms and infrastructure to enable manufacturing, testing, and repair of Microsoft products throughout the world. You will identify and drive optimization initiatives to improve factory uptime, decreasing IT costs, and decrease onboarding time. The person best suited to this role understands how to get things done through influence and collaboration and is adept at working within agile solution delivery models. This position requires an individual who is excited to be part of a team implementing rapid changes related to emerging business strategies and employing information technology to meet business goals. Candidates must be prepared to succeed against aggressive goals with minimum supervision, be comfortable working with internal and external partners and virtual / offshore teams, and must have a process-focused aptitude to manage a variety of responsibilities and deliverables.

Responsibilities
Plan and communicate infrastructure and platform solutions by identifying resource requirements, collaborating with feature teams and service providers to architect and design the optimal solution, and proactively managing program risks and issues
Execute lifecycle management services to ensure compliance with hardware, OS, and platform roadmaps
Project management for Business Intelligence and Analytics strategy and direction:
End to End project management including all critical milestones: planning, procurement, and build-out activities
Identify and delivery on opportunities to reduce costs on Business Intelligence platform and Infrastructure
Collaborate with external partners and partner Microsoft IT groups on Business Intelligence platform and infrastructure projects
Build solutions in Azure, big data, Hadoop technologies and able to generate actionable insights and aid in live site reviews is a requirement
Manipulate and analyze complex, high-volume, high-dimensionality data from varying sources using a variety of tools and data analysis techniques
Work with data engineers to operationalize dashboards and ingest new data sources (provide data modeling requirements)
Contribute to Data Exploration Analysis and help build scenarios for modeling
Define, track and report key metrics to assess overall business health
Deliver in depth analysis on business performance (trends, funnels) and drivers, as well as forecasts and targets
Build/design dashboards to enable ongoing monitoring of business health
Provide actionable insights on how to improve our services
Assist in scoping and planning new programs - identifying degree of fit of with MS technologies and estimating overall timeline/cost for an implementation and sustainment
Work in a dynamic environment, managing multiple priorities, commitments, and projects with minimal supervision
Develop standards, processes, and operation procedures to reduce risk, ensure costs are aggressively managed, and enable effective delivery of network services
Designing, developing high quality solutions with an emphasis on quality, simplicity and maintainability while ensuring sound instrumentation and telemetry into the solutions and measure Availability and Operational Intelligence metrics
Qualifications

7+ years of experience leading agile projects or service management activities
Proficient in Hadoop, ADL, Azure Data bricks, ADF, ADW etc
Extensive knowledge and experience in data warehousing, data modeling, data processing (ETL), e-metrics/measurement, business intelligence, information retrieval, parallel and distributed computation
Experience in implementation of Cloud Computing concepts and platforms
Experience in analyzing very large real-world datasets and hands-on approach in data analytics
Proven problem resolution, judgment, negotiating and decision-making skills
Drives through ambiguity, self-motivated and thrives on minimal supervision. Sound judgment, decision-making skills, and ability to work under continual deadline pressure in an extremely volatile and high paced environment
Confident, takes ownership, willingness to “do what it takes” to get the job done with proven experience leading complex programs/initiatives to successful completion
Be a self-starter and a leader that can maintain focus and deliver results consistently that drive business capability value
Good written and oral communication skills with experience providing project status to line and senior management
BS in Computer Science or related field

Preferred, not required:
Project Management Professional (PMP)
Certified Scrum Master (CSM)
Experience with Machine Learning, Artificial Intelligence

Describe the ideal candidate
The ideal candidate will have experience leading complex portfolios that include designing enterprise scale network infrastructure, agile development practices, and experience in designing & tuning telemetry. In addition, this position requires an individual who can demonstrate the ability to ensure highly resilient and scalable service designs through partnership with other members of the service team.

job_title: Assoc Strategic Planning Dir - Integrated Global Compliance
job_description:
IQVIA™ is the leading human data science company focused on helping healthcare clients find unparalleled insights and better solutions for patients. Formed through the merger of IMS Health and Quintiles, IQVIA offers a broad range of solutions that harness the power of healthcare data, domain expertise, transformative technology, and advanced analytics to drive healthcare forward.
JOB OVERVIEW
 IQVIA has a vision that goes beyond simply optimizing individual safety, regulatory, quality, and compliance functions – IQVIA Integrated Global Compliance solutions. Using cloud-based technology combined with advanced analytics, including artificial intelligence and machine learning, IQVIA is bringing together global regulatory intelligence, safety data, product quality information and legal/ethical guidance on an integrated platform. For customers, this means improved compliance performance at lower cost across all functions, visibility across their complete compliance landscape, faster response times and more predictive planning, throughout the product lifecycle.
Job Profile Summary
The IQVIA Integrated Global Compliance commercial strategy and operations team is tasked with driving the growth of IQVIA’s services and technology solutions across safety, regulatory, quality and commercial compliance. This is a high-profile role with visibility at the CEO and senior executive level. In this role you will lead, support and oversee workstreams related to commercial strategy, sales operations, sales enablement, product development and marketing.
Job Duties:
Work with business leaders to define positioning and overall strategy for IQVIA Integrated Global Compliance and provide range of support in process from organization to data and evidence development.
Monitor industry trends, competitor actions, economic developments, regulatory and market environment to identify and plan for impact on business strategy and operations.
Assess existing and potential markets and customer segments including trends; engage with internal stakeholders to understand business needs; conduct research and analysis; and translate data into executable and effective outputs and strategies to enable growth.
Work with business leads and respective teams to identify whitespace, and work with business leaders to identify and analyze possible mergers, acquisitions, divestitures, and strategic partnerships to support strategy and financial goals. Plan, direct and implement certain aspects of the acquisition process as needed and work with corporate development to facilitate overall process.
Lead, support and contribute to product development efforts as needed; support roll out and training for new products as needed; and develop forecast models to support decision making – investment requirements, Rol, sales targets, etc.
Support sales excellence activities which include Account/customer segmentation and targeting as well as development and tracking of sales targets. Provide knowledge sharing of best practice and lessons learned from customer experiences.
Act as a link between the business and the general IQVIA sales organization, etc. Support sales enablement activities which includes the development of content training programs, delivery of training as needed, working with marketing to develop sales aids and case studies, development and implementation of programs and systems to improve both the quality and quantity of sales activities and sales of company products during each stage of the customer buying process.
Ensure CRM, financial and other business processes are “fit for purpose” and used correctly.
Respond to inquiries for solutions and services, and research prospects’ needs and spending patterns.
Support marketing by providing guidance around strategic priorities, ensuring content is provided and is accurate and supports larger marketing initiatives.
Engage customers in both sales and non-sales cycles to better understand customer needs and challenges; refine all strategic decisions; build industry visibility, positioning and representing IQVIA Integrated Global Compliance as the premier compliance partner; and drive sales where applicable.
Travel Requirements: Yes, requires 10-20% domestic and international travel to meet with clients, internal stakeholders, and to attend conferences.
Job Requirements: Requires a Bachelor’s, Master’s, or PhD degree in life sciences or business administration or foreign equivalent and 8 years with a Bachelor’s, or 6 years with a Masters, or 4 years with a PhD of healthcare or technology industry progressively responsible experience demonstrating knowledge of industry issues and current developments by using and generating primary and secondary data including interview information, market research reports, annual reports, unstructured web based and opinion information; conducting quantitative and qualitative research and analysis techniques including forecasting, financial analysis, thematic analysis; managing and delivering projects, reports, presentations and analysis to senior level stakeholders and customers to agreed time and quality targets; and experience: developing commercial strategies for life science companies including positioning, go-to market and portfolio optimization; and development of account plans, labor forecasts and management of sales pipeline for commercial operations.
Join Us
Making a positive impact on human health takes insight, curiosity, and intellectual courage. It takes brave minds, pushing the boundaries to transform healthcare. Regardless of your role, you will have the opportunity to play an important part in helping our clients drive healthcare forward and ultimately improve outcomes for patients.
Forge a career with greater purpose, make an impact, and never stop learning.
IQVIA is an EEO Employer - Minorities/Females/Protected Veterans/Disabled
IQVIA, Inc. provides reasonable accommodations for applicants with disabilities. Applicants who require reasonable accommodation to submit an application for employment or otherwise participate in the application process should contact IQVIA’s Talent Acquisition team at workday_recruiting@iqvia.com to arrange for such an accommodation.

BCG’s Knowledge Services group is a growing, global team that drives knowledge management strategy, program implementation and operations for BCG. The group develops the business cases, defines the scope and provides overall management of major knowledge management platforms and programs, including efforts in areas such as machine learning/artificial intelligence, expertise/reputation management, search, content management, social collaboration/communities, taxonomy, analytics, business request management and other related areas. Team members include Product Managers, Project Managers, User Experience specialists and Business/Functional Analysts.

We are adding the role of Product Manager, Search to our team in order to build and drive a new product team dedicated to developing a completely new and innovative, machine learning based knowledge search platform at BCG. In this role, you will be on the leading edge of key knowledge, collaboration and data driven technologies.

We are seeking experienced, innovative candidates with a strong passion for knowledge, data/analytics and/or machine learning to fill a Product Manager position leading a new team with a focus search driven knowledge delivery. The new product team will drive the design, development, evolution and rollout of a key new platform that will serve as a core element of our future knowledge capabilities at BCG. Candidates should possess an entrepreneurial drive, meaningful SaaS-type product management expertise, ideally in the data analytics and machine learning domain, as well as experience with knowledge based software products or similar technologies.
YOU'RE GOOD AT
Product Strategy, Development & Engagement
Drive the product innovation, vision, design and future roadmap for a new knowledge platform, in alignment with BCG’s overall knowledge strategy, as well as other firm initiatives
Serve as a collaborative thought leader, leveraging internal BCG as well as external expertise in relevant areas in order to bring the best possible solutions to the table
Effectively manage stakeholders' expectations while building credibility with senior stakeholders through a strong business sense and balancing of priorities
Collaborate with BCG data scientists and analytics experts to bring “best of breed” solutions to bear in the product solution
In collaboration with data scientists, establish training processes and procedures for the platform in order to effectively tune it to BCGs needs
Instil a strong prioritization of user-centered design and a focus on user experience as a key focus for the agile team
Business Requirements Gathering & Prioritization for Agile Execution
Deeply engage with users and stakeholders to evaluate and recommend innovative solutions and capabilities that address critical business needs
Maintain a robust backlog of future product requirements, incorporating strategic product planning and tactical sprint-to-sprint value delivery
Collaborate with the technology team to create and establish the agile development team that will deliver on both functional/non-functional objectives
Ensure an ongoing customer/user feedback capture via multiple channels and methods
Lead team members in both product development and requirements gathering efforts
Product Development Planning
Lead and organize the prioritization of product capability enhancements, functional improvements, operations and user support
Manage overall team productivity, quality and effectiveness
Identify potential solutions outside current technology stack that may solve business requirements
Product Training & Support
Collaborate service owner to support creation of necessary support documentation
Analyze support queries for possible opportunities to improve product
YOU BRING (EXPERIENCE & QUALIFICATIONS)
Undergraduate degree required, advanced degree preferred
8+ years of product management experience or equivalent experience in a product oriented role (e.g., product owner, sr. business analyst) is required
SaaS platform and digital product experience preferred
Experience collaborating with designers, developers, QA, and other stakeholders to deliver product is required
Experience working within software product development and a user-centered design product team environment required
Experience with agile development processes and best practices is preferred
Knowledge and experience with data analytics, machine learning, mathematical or algorithmic oriented product experience strongly preferred
Some travel (including international) may be required, expected to be less than 25%
YOU'LL WORK WITH
Our product managers and business builders work with our clients and colleagues in developing new digital ventures and products from planning to launch. We are a mix of business leaders, corporate strategists, and product specialists.
CITY
Boston
COUNTRY
United States
YOU'LL BE TRAVELLING
Yes (30%)

Regular

WHO WE ARE
BCG pioneered strategy consulting more than 50 years ago, and we continue to innovate and redefine the industry. We offer multiple career paths for the world’s best talent to have a real impact on business and society. As part of our team, you will benefit from the breadth and diversity of what we are doing today and where we are headed next. We count on your authenticity, exceptional work, and strong integrity. In return we are committed to supporting you in discovering the most fulfilling career journey possible—and unlocking your potential to advance the world.

The Knowledge Team (KT) is a group of experts within respective fields or areas providing industry, functional and geographic expertise to consulting teams. KT members are aligned to Practice Areas, sometimes serving as members of case or project teams. KT offers insight into a topic or function derived from BCG’s knowledge base and case/project experience.
EQUAL OPPORTUNITY

Introduction
Axtria is a global provider of cloud software and data analytics to the Life Sciences industry. We help Life Sciences companies transform the product commercialization journey to drive sales growth and improve healthcare outcomes for patients. We are acutely aware that our work impacts millions of patients and lead passionately to improve their lives.
Since our founding in 2010, technology innovation has been our winning differentiation, and we continue to leapfrog competition with platforms that deploy Artificial Intelligence and Machine Learning. Our cloud-based platforms - Axtria DataMax™, Axtria InsightsIQ™, Axtria SalesIQ™, and Axtria MarketingIQ™ - enable customers to efficiently manage data, leverage data science to deliver insights for sales and marketing planning, and manage end-to-end commercial operations. With customers in over 30 countries, Axtria is one of the biggest global commercial solutions providers in the Life Sciences industry. We continue to win industry recognition for growth and are featured in some of the most aspirational lists - INC 5000, Deloitte FAST 500, NJBiz FAST 50, SmartCEO Future 50, Red Herring 100, and several other growth and technology awards.
Axtria is looking for exceptional talent to join our rapidly growing global team. People are our biggest perk! Our transparent and collaborative culture offers a chance to work with some of the brightest minds in the industry. Axtria Institute, our in-house university, offers the best training in the industry and an opportunity to learn in a structured environment. A customized career progression plan ensures every associate is setup for success and able to do meaningful work in a fun environment. We want our legacy to be the leaders we produce for the industry. Will you be next?
Candidates will be expected to have familiarity with application of analytics to sales and marketing problems such as :
Commercial Model Design, Sales Force Sizing and Structure
Patient analytics using Real-World Data sources such as anonymized longitudinal patient claims data, lab/diagnostic testing data, etc.
Segmentation, Targeting, , Promotion Response Modeling, Marketing Mix Optimization, Digital Analytics
Market Access Analytics incl. pull-through analysis, Payer-plan segmentation, Rebate optimization, etc
Territory Alignment, Sales Call Planning, Incentive Compensation
Responsibilities
Lead cross-functional teams to pilot and implement client solutions with a focus on client satisfaction across a solution area and industry verticals.
Leverage and customize Axtria's proprietary analytics to client needs, resulting in exceptional client value from every project.
Manage multiple concurrent projects ensuring exceptional client satisfaction and on-time delivery.
Work closely with the Technology and Product Management groups to ensure ongoing refinement of our analytical tools and development of new client solutions.
Make presentations and recommendations to clients on optimal customer, sales and marketing strategies and tactics.
Develop and maintain skills to the highest standards consistent with best practices and emerging trends in analytics.
Contribute to Axtria's development of new solutions and analytical models.
Recruit, manage and mentor a team of analysts
Required Skills/Experience
A degree in Engineering, Computer Science or a related field with 6-10 years of prior relevant work experience. Graduate degree is preferred.
Relevant expertise in using analytic tools such as Excel, ProgR, SAS, SPSS, SQL, Python, Tableau, Alteryx, and able to quickly master new packages when needed
Strong analytical skills, excellent communication skills and the ability to communicate actionable analytical findings to a non-technical audience in clear and concise language.
Proven ability to frame a business issue, design the right solution, and deliver results.
Ability to lead projects and teams
Experience with the application of statistical estimation techniques and / or optimization techniques
Exposure to / experience working with large data sets.
Familiarity / expertise in using Pharmaceutical data sets such a prescriber-plan data, patient level data, transactional claims, EMR/EHR data, SPP Hub data, diagnostic data etc. is a plus.
Logistics and Location
We are hiring for Chicago, IL
U.S. Citizens and those authorized to work in the U.S. are encouraged to apply.
Flexibility to travel and/or relocate within the US as per project requirements.

We're looking for a Coaching & Development Manager to join our team at Insight.

Insight offers professional training Fellowships to facilitate career transitions for high-achieving scientists and engineers in data careers. Over the last 7 years, we've welcomed nearly 3500 Fellows into our Fellowship programs in Data Science, Data Engineering, Health Data Science, Artificial Intelligence, DevOps, Decentralized Consensus, and Security to gain experience with the industry-specific tools needed to work in their growing fields.

At Insight, our mission is to foster a collaborative learning space where Insight Fellows do impactful work leading to a thriving career. Our Coaching and Development team advances our mission by providing mentorship and strategic career guidance to our Fellows in group and one-on-one settings.
Skills and Experience

Education/Background: You have 3-5 years of career development experience, including: conducting mock interviews, providing training on career development techniques, and helping job-seekers navigate hiring processes. Education, public speaking, and/or group facilitation experience is also highly valued.

Communication : The Coaching and Development Manager will be the face of Insight in many forums, so our ideal candidate is highly skilled in writing (internal and external emails, website content), public speaking (facilitating workshops and engaging discussions), and in 1:1 conversation (advising Fellows, interviewing).

This job might be for you if:
You enjoy coaching motivated, ambitious individuals to help them find opportunities for personal growth and career advancement
You understand the role of a coach and how to effectively help people consistently move towards achieving their goals, and excel at giving helpful, actionable feedback
You have extensive knowledge of job hiring processes and have constructfully helped people successfully maneuver through them to land their desired positions
You enjoy facilitating workshops (in person and virtually) and have the ability to keep both large and small groups of people engaged
You enjoy working with diverse populations, including international students
You have strong communication skills and the ability to teach those skills to others
You are highly skilled in collaborating across multiple locations and teams and take initiative to ask for or offer help when needed
You're self-motivated, and can both practice and teach great time management and prioritization skills

We're especially excited to talk to you if you have prior experience working in a fast-paced environment, like a startup and/or education.

On a given day, you might:
Develop content and facilitate group workshops on job search strategy and career development topics
Work with different sizes of Fellow groups, from one-on-one coaching all the way to giving an interactive workshop to 200+ Fellows
Partner with subject matter experts and industry mentors to execute specialized trainings and collaborative exercises on cutting-edge data and professional development tools and best practices
Research, create, and update career development resources for Fellows and alumni
Review and provide feedback on Fellow and alumni career development materials, such as resumes
Provide coaching to Fellows to identify their unique value, improve communication skills, and prepare for interviews

The Alexa Artificial Intelligence team is a group of scientists and developers working on spoken language solutions that revolutionize how customers interact with Amazon’s products and services. The team’s mission is to push the envelope in natural language understanding (NLU) in order to provide a natural, conversational, experience for our customers. Products such as Amazon Echo, Amazon Dash, and Fire TV are illustrative of the user-delighting spoken language solutions Amazon is building.
As a member of the team you will be responsible for leading the development and launch of core product features. You will have significant influence on our overall strategy by helping define these product features, drive the system architecture, and spearhead the best practices that enable a quality product.
The ideal candidate is clearly passionate about new opportunities and has a demonstrable track record of success in delivering new features and products. A commitment to team work, hustle, and strong communication skills (to both business and technical partners) are absolute requirements. Creating reliable, scalable, and high performance products requires exceptional technical expertise, a sound understanding of the fundamentals of Computer Science, and practical experience building large-scale distributed systems. This person has thrived and succeeded in delivering high quality technology products/services in a hyper-growth environment where priorities shift fast.
Internal job description
We are building new Alexa capabilities in the area of paralinguistics (looking beyond the words in spoken interactions) and finding ways to quickly experiment, ship, and iterate with these new features. This is a challenging set of problems that will allow you to learn more about spoken language understanding as well as scaling systems to new devices, interaction types, locales, regions, etc.

COMPANY: Stilman Advanced Strategies
POSITION: Senior Program Manager. Small company style so you'll wear Product Owner, Project Manager and Software System Engineer hats
LOCATION: Work Remote- work from anywhere USA. Ideal cities; Washington, DC area, Orlando FL, Denver, CO. US Citizenship is required. This position requires the ability to obtain and maintain a security clearance during early employment which we sponsor.

Company Overview
STILMAN Advanced Strategies develops software based on Linguistic Geometry (LG), a unique Artificial Intelligence (AI) approach. Our core technology generates predictive, tactically correct Courses of Action (COAs) that dynamically adapt in response to changes in missions and actions taken by the intelligent opposition. These tools support mission planning, rehearsal, training and execution use cases for military commanders across echelons and services. Our applications have been shown to deliver unique value to the warfighter due to the quality of generated COAs, UX/UI design that makes it easy to fully comprehend complex COA results and to define mission inputs, as well as ease of deployment and integration with other system with well-defined modern APIs.

Our small, distributed team has been developing and continually improving these software applications since 1999. We pride ourselves on the quality of our software and we are excited as we continue this development with US Navy, US Army, Missile Defense Agency (MDA) and other agencies to further enhance, integrate, and deploy these products.

The Role: Senior Program Manager
We are looking to bring on a dedicated Senior Program Manager (aka Product Owner / Software System Engineer) to work closely with our software developers on our primary software applications that include web app that leverages modern UI technologies, UX concepts, GIS/mapping, communications protocols, data formats, and military concepts, as well as backend components with custom Artificial Intelligence (AI) engine, military modeling and simulation framework (M&S), and integration capabilities for our own front end and for 3rd party systems. This web-based system encompasses a large feature set for map-centric scenario construction and editing, 2D and 3D animated visualization, real time collaboration, COA analytics, wargaming, and integration with other military and simulation systems. As the feature set grows, we need to ensure that user experience for both basic and advanced users is as smooth as possible, little training is needed, and the military users can intuitively use the tool to help them think about tactics rather than spending their time thinking about how to use the tool.

In this role, you will become the Subject Matter Expert (SME) of military Courses of Action analysis, wargaming and simulation software systems. Prior military tactical experience and/or understanding of the military operations and capabilities would be a strong asset, although not required.

You will communicate with the clients to assist with gathering feedback and new requirements and decomposing them into actionable, well-defined user stories and tasks. You will work with the development team to design solutions to customer needs, help document the system and feature design, and communicate it with key stakeholders outside of the company. You will take part in design of UI/UX and military modeling for new features or redesigning existing ones based on customer needs, feedback, and your own recommendations for usability improvements. You will work directly with the development team to manage and prioritize backlog, track developer progress and guide them in making decisions to ensure end software closely matches user needs. As a superuser of our software you will use the software, communicate insights for the development team, and demonstrate the functionality to the current or prospective customers. You will support our integration efforts through close communication with the product owners and software engineers of the other companies to make sure that the end product fits customer needs, and to represent and advocate for the technical approach designed by our development team.

Key Skills to Have
Military experience. Officer level and tactical strongly preferred
Technically savvy
Excellent communicator
Dependable, creative, and detail oriented
Great Experience to Have, Some Combination needed
Modeling and Simulation
Representing technical team in meetings
Capturing user needs
Managing the development backlog
Planning the work of software developers
Software development experience
Technical writing
UI/UX design
Benefits & Other
We offer an attractive compensation package including competitive salaries, bonuses, medical and dental coverage, flexible schedule & PTO, and tuition assistance. US Citizenship is required. This position requires the ability to obtain and maintain a security clearance. This is a full time employee hire to Stilman, working in partnership with Talent Architect Rick Powell, Fractional Recruiter. We fly under the radar on social media but will be glad to share more information with you once we are in discussions. Thanks for considering Stilman Advanced Strategies for your next career move!

Adaptability to needs and strategies of individual business units; tolerance for ambiguity; ability to take ownership and drive projects in a rapidly changing environment.

We are currently seeking a Data / Analytics Manager to join our team of outstanding employees!

POSITION OVERVIEW

The Data / Analytics Manager will be responsible for managing and coordinating data management and business intelligence activities. This role will be responsible for driving business value with data. Data responsibilities will include the management and coordination of data cleansing, migration, and validation activities. Business Intelligence responsibilities will include the management and coordination of analysis, design, development, and testing activities for business intelligence reporting and dashboarding.

QUALIFICATIONS

Proven experience as a Sr. Data or Business Intelligence Analyst, leading large data initiatives.
In-depth understanding of ETL (Extract/Transform/Load) tools and techniques.
Experience with Enterprise Resource Planning (ERP), Product Lifecycle Management (PLM), and the associated data / reporting.
Experience with data modeling, data warehousing, and/or a data lake.
Expert level experience with business intelligence reporting (Microsoft Power BI).
Strong familiarity with Microsoft Dynamics 365 Business Central.
Knowledge and familiarity with SQL database concepts and SQL queries.
Analytical mind with a problem-solving aptitude.
Ability to discuss technical matters with non-technical business users.
Ability to coordinate and manage data activities performed by vendors.
Proficiency with Microsoft Office, particularly Microsoft Excel.
Ability to work towards and meet project deadlines and milestones.
Ability to manage both internal and external data / BI team members.
Excellent verbal and written communication skills.
Experience with Azure BYOD or data warehousing.
Experience with Centric PLM is a plus.

ESSENTIAL DUTIES INCLUDING BUT NOT LIMITED TO

Manage the data team, including data migration and business intelligence team members.
Manage and coordinate data cleansing, migration, and validation activities.
Provide and implement recommendations to improve data quality.
Coordinate with vendors on data migration and business intelligence activities.
Coordinate with business analysts and data owners on data testing and validation.
Coordinate analysis, design, and testing activities for business intelligence reporting.
Translate business requirements into technical specifications.
Coordinate with BI developers on data modeling and report/dashboard development.
Utilize data visualization techniques in the design of BI reporting and dashboards.
Work with subject matter experts on BI requirements and user testing.
Oversee the design and deployment of the data warehouse/data lake.
Make recommendations on the best value propositions for artificial intelligence.
Advise and assist on best practices for data security and Segregation of Duties.
Make recommendations on database management, i.e. indexing, etc.
Assist with back-up documentation and audit requirements.
Assist with IT data change management procedures and audit for ERP and PLM.
Assist with annual restore and recovery tests.
Assist with data-related compliance requirements, such as PCI and GDPR.
Assist with data-related IT policy development, including data privacy policy.
Develop and update project documentation.

EDUCATION REQUIREMENT

Bachelor s Degree in Data Science, Data Management, Computer Science, Information Systems, or related field. 5+ years of related work experience.

BUSINESS HOURS

Corporate Office Hours: Mon-Fri, 8:30am-5:30pm Central

ABOUT US

Lark is the world's largest A.I. healthcare provider, servicing more than a million patients suffering from, or at risk of, chronic disease with A.I. Nurses. We're on a mission to improve people's health and happiness through our digital health coach. We are the only A.I. nurse ever to become fully medically reimbursed to 100% replace a live nurse because we achieved equivalent health outcomes to live healthcare professionals - which allows for infinitely scalable healthcare. Since launch, Lark has continued to receive awards and accolades for both our product, and our leadership, including:

Apple's Top 10 Apps in the World
Business Insider's most innovative companies in the world along with Uber and Snapchat
A CEO who was recognized as the #1 in Top 10 Women in Tech to Watch by Inc.
CDC recognition of our Diabetes Prevention Program.

Duties and Responsibilities

What You'll Do:

Manage a team of developers to evolve our core service, the conversation engine to help the Lark product scale
Lead breaking down our monolith on the conversation engine side to the right highly scalable architecture
Coordinate the team's efforts in core development using the agile methodology
Own the full stack around the conversation engine, the editor, testing, debugging tools
Work closely with leadership to plan and manage a sustainable release cycle
Coordinate with Data and Business teams as needed
Recruit, mentor and grow team members
Build a culture of engineering best practices

Knowledge and Skills

What You'll Need:

Javascript / TypeScript / Node.js for backend services required
Java, Kotlin & Spring Boot/Hibernate nice-to-have
Go Lang a huge plus to have
Experience with micro-services and events-driven architectures highly preferable
Experience with AWS
Experience with Kubernetes a very big plus
Experience with both SQL and NoSQL technologies such as DynamoDB, when to use what.
Experience with React & Next.js are a plus as those are used in for our support tools
Familiarity with Test Driven Development, testing and mocking practices a big plus
Comfortable moving quickly and learning new technologies to use daily
Religious about writing maintainable and performant code
Passionate about Lark's mission in the health/wellness space

Credentials and Experience

Experience leading a team of Engineers through various stages of product development, with a prior focus on scaling consumer-facing applications.
Minimum of 10+ years of experience in software development
5+ years of experience leading a team
Experience scaling backend services to millions of users.


JOIN US Our team works with cutting edge tools and technology related to Artificial Intelligence and Machine Learning. We are using NLP to process millions of meals, and accelerometer data to compute activity and sleep amounts from users' phones. Our chat AI is the most sophisticated digital health engagement tool in the world. Join us and make it even better!

Lark is an Equal Opportunity Employer. Lark does not discriminate on the basis of race, religion, color, sex, gender identity, sexual orientation, age, non-disqualifying physical or mental disability, national origin, veteran status or any other basis covered by appropriate law. All employment is decided on the basis of qualifications, merit, and business need.

With operations in 35+ nations and ~ 20,000 employees worldwide, CSL is driven to develop and deliver a broad range of lifesaving therapies to treat disorders such as hemophilia and primary immune deficiencies, and vaccines to prevent influenza. Our therapies are also used in cardiac surgery, organ transplantation and burn treatment.

CSL is the parent company of CSL Behring and Seqirus. CSL Behring is a global leader in the protein biotherapeutics industry, focused on bringing to market biotherapies used to treat serious and often rare conditions. CSL Behring operates CSL Plasma , one of the world's largest collectors of human plasma, which is used to create CSL's therapies. Seqirus is the second largest influenza vaccine company in the world and is a transcontinental partner in pandemic preparedness and a major contributor to the prevention and control of influenza globally.

We invite you to take a look at the many career possibilities available around the globe and consider building your promising future at CSL by becoming a member of our team!
Responsibilities

Reporting into the Global Head of Engineering Standards, the Director, Industry 4.0 will be responsible for introducing innovation and technology solutions and processes into the engineering, manufacturing and enterprise data environments, with the objective of advancing the CSL network toward Factory of the Future. The individual will be responsible for identifying Industry 4.0 trends that hold potential to achieve superior efficiency by driving solutions throughout the CSL manufacturing ecosystem.

The incumbent must demonstrate comprehensive knowledge of E2E processes for delivering Biotherapies across a global supply chain network.

As part of a global organization, the position requires approximately 50% travel. Peers will be located across CSL Behring US/EU/APAC sites.

The position requires the ability to build and maintain strong relationships and collaborate effectively with all levels and cross functionally within the organization.
Qualifications

Provide Global Engineering Leadership for Industry 4.0 US/EU/APAC network

Strategize with senior leadership to establish vision for Industry 4.0 across the CSL network

Partner with internal peers and stakeholders to identify efficiencies that may be gained across the E2E environment by applying innovative enterprise data management and manufacturing technology and processing solutions

Lead team of internal stakeholders and subject matter experts to evaluate opportunities for applying Industry 4.0 concepts - adopting intelligent solutions (up to artificial intelligence) for facilities, utilities, manufacturing equipment and enterprise systems across the E2E environment

Develop business cases for proposed investments

Represent innovation and technology topics within Engineering Council and facilitate collaboration to achieve consensus on disposition

Partner with internal peers and stakeholders to develop deployment plans

Resource design and realization to successfully deliver solutions which meet business case objectives

Establish metrics to demonstrate and socialize business value

Represent Global Engineering throughout the matrix environment in the communication of Industry 4.0 strategies, evolving trends, practices and delivery plans

Responsible for compliance of capital investments with design standards and standard design platform governance process

Provide Global Engineering Leadership for Engineering Standards

Responsible for Engineering Standards related to Industry 4.0 which will be developed to guide design and implementation of core platforms and processes

Develop standardized approach to Innovation/Technology, Robotics & Automation, Digital Twinning, Connected Services, Data Management, Product Robustness, amongst other evolving Factory of the Future concepts

Collaborate with internal peers to establish requirements and harmonize with supporting/dependent business processes

Translate innovation and technology vision into process requirements and supporting design attributes which form the basis for Engineering Standards

Responsible for ensuring harmonization of Industry 4.0 related Engineering Standards across the global network

Responsible for ensuring alignment of standards with Operations Value Streams

Maintain Engineering Standards throughout Life Cycle

Provide training and ensure institutionalization across engineering community

Provide Global Engineering Leadership in external Industry 4.0 community

Engage with industry peers to identify and collaborate around established and emerging innovation and technology which has potential to achieve superior business value by embedding Industry 4.0 within the CSL E2E environment

Benchmark with external peers to identify opportunities which realize the highest business value

Collaborate with industry peers to evaluate investments against comparable industry benchmarks to ensure target business value is achieved or exceeded

Responsible for socializing achieved value to engineering community and business leaders

Education

Bachelor's degree in engineering or related field required, advanced education preferred and/or an MBA with at least 15 years of engineering in a Life Sciences or related E2E Regulated manufacturing environment

Experience

Minimum of 15 years' experience in a manufacturing environment in roles with increasing responsibility within the engineering space.

Minimum 8 years of managerial experience

Direct experience with planning, design and implementation on innovative manufacturing technology related to highly complex engineering capital investments

Significant experience with automation and related system architecture utilizing Siemens and Rockwell Automation platforms

Substantial experience with Process Controls Systems GAMP Categories Level 0 through Level 3, ISA S88/S95 philosophies and related data acquisition and management

Direct experience with E2E fully integrated manufacturing processes utilizing various OEM unit operations and control platforms, harmonized across common process control and execution systems

Knowledge and application of Overall Equipment Effectiveness modules to maximize E2E manufacturing process efficiency

Experience with utilization of Connected Services technologies and IoT to collect and exchange data for predictive environment value realization

OEE

Knowledge of Digital Twinning and its application to E2E environments

Experience with Product Robustness and related data analytics

Excellent management skills and an ability to prioritize effectively to deliver results within aggressive timelines with the ability to work independently and as part of a team

Substantial prior experience in the development and implementation of engineering standards and life cycle management of tools, processes and methodologies

Demonstrated ability to deliver solutions in a dynamic environment

Direct experience with organizational transformation and related supporting engineering processes

Excellent collaboration skills and ability to align people and resources towards organizational success

Must demonstrate strategic thinking and innovative approach to responsibilities

Nimble and comfortable in a fast-paced environment with minimal direction and able to adjust workload based upon changing priorities

Must demonstrate maturity and seasoned judgment in reaching critical decisions

Strong interpersonal skills including verbal and written communication are essential in this collaborative work environment

Competencies

Managerial Courage: Does not hold back anything that needs to be said; provides current, direct, complete, and 'actionable' positive and corrective feedback to others; lets people know where they stand; faces up to people problems on any person or situation quickly and directly; is not afraid to take negative action when necessary.

Business Acumen: Knows how businesses work; knowledgeable in current and possible future policies, practice, trends and information affecting his/her business and organization; knows the competition; is aware of how strategies and tactics work in the marketplace.

Drive for Results/Execution: Can be counted on to exceed goals successfully; is constantly and consistently one of the top performers; very bottom-line oriented; steadfastly pushes self and others for results.

Strategic Agility: Sees ahead clearly; can anticipate future consequences and trends accurately; has broad knowledge and perspective; is future oriented; can articulately paint credible pictures and visions of possibilities and likelihoods; can create competitive and breakthrough strategies and plans.

Decision Quality: Makes good decision based upon a mixture analysis, wisdom experience, and judgment; most his /her solution and suggestions turn out to be correct and accurate when judged over time; sought out by others for advice and solutions.

Innovation Management: Is good at bringing the creative ideas of others to market; has good judgment about which creative ideas and suggestions will work; has a sense about managing the creative process of others; can facilitate effective brainstorming; can project how potential ideas may play out in the marketplace.

Developing Talent: Provides challenging and stretching tasks and assignments; holds frequent development discussions; is aware of each person's career goals; constructs compelling development plans and executes them; pushes people to accept developmental moves; will take on those who need help and further development; cooperates with the developmental system in the organization; is a people builder.

Interpersonal Savvy: Relates well to all kinds of people, up, down and sideways, inside and outside the organization; builds appropriate rapport; builds constructive and effective relationships; uses diplomacy and tact; can diffuse even high-tension situations comfortably.

Managing Vision and Purpose: Communicates a compelling and inspired vision or sense of core purpose; talks beyond today; talks about possibilities; is optimistic; creates mileposts and symbols to rally support behind the vision; makes the vision sharable by everyone; can inspire and motivate entire units or organizations.

Customer Focus: Is dedicated to meeting the expectations and requirements of internal and external customers; gets first-hand customer information and uses it for improvement in products and services; acts with customers in mind; establishes and maintains effective relationships with customers and gains their trust and respect.

Organizing: Can marshal resources (people, funding, material, support) to get things done; can orchestrate multiple activities at once to accomplish a goal; uses resources effectively and efficiently.

Priority Setting: Spends his/her time and the time of others on what's important; quickly zeros in on the critical few and puts the trivial aside; can quickly sense what will help or hinder accomplishing a goal; eliminates roadblocks; creates focus.

Negotiation Skills : ability to work into a matrix organization and able to influence and persuade, without having a direct authority

Communication: ability to dialogue and convey effective message through the organization at different levels and across cultural differences; unbiased.

Financial Acumen: understand business needs and translates into plans and actions with a clear and measurable value proposition.

Basic understanding of c-GMP's and EHS&S requirements globally.

Mature Understanding of Contracting models and its applicability worldwide.

Ethical conduct: understanding of owning anticorruption practices.

Here at the Alexa Artificial Intelligence Distributed Product Platform team, you will help Alexa better-understand humans with each passing day.
We are looking for a Senior Technical Program Manager to head-up development initiatives related to , security and policy enforcement for the spoken language understanding technology that powers the Alexa voice experience. In this role:
