job_title: Director, Real World Evidence, Analytics & Innovation
job_description:
Overview:
Jazz Pharmaceuticals is an international biopharmaceutical company focused on improving patients’ lives by identifying, developing and commercializing meaningful products that address unmet medical needs. We are continuing to expand our commercial product portfolio and our research and development pipeline in therapeutic areas that can leverage our unique expertise.

Our therapeutic areas of focus include sleep and hematology/oncology – areas in which we have a deep understanding of the patient journey and a suite of products and product candidates to address critical needs.

We are looking for the best and brightest talent to join our team. If you’re looking to be a part of a company with an unwavering commitment to improving patients’ lives and being a great place to work, we hope you’ll explore our career openings and get to know Jazz Pharmaceuticals.
Position Profile:
The Director will collaborate with a diverse set of scientists inside and outside the Global Value – HEOR (GV-HEOR) group to conduct research of Real World Data (RWD) using advanced analytics, including Machine Learning, to facilitate the execution of value demonstration activities. The Director will provide input on selection of fit-for-purpose RWD and analytical platforms for various initiatives, efficiently execute analytics and predictive modeling that meet CARSE standards, and facilitate external research that leverage innovative analytics such as interactive visualization. The Director will help develop internal collaborations on RWD assets, analytics, and technology across the organization. Responsibilities extend to methodological expertise to improve the design, conduct, analysis, interpretation of studies, and may involve external publications and presentations. The Director will report to a Global Value Lead.
Essential Functions
Facilitate initiatives with external partners that leverage innovative technology such as machine learning, artificial intelligence, and interactive visualization.
Provide expert analytical support to GV-HEOR personnel in the design, analysis, reporting, and interpretation of HEOR projects involving RWD to meet CARSE standards and contribute to publications and external presentations.
Partner with GV-HEOR personnel, biostatisticians, clinicians, programmers, market research, and other Jazz personnel to optimize utilization of RWD.
Participate in GV-HEOR regular meetings and engage in proactive communications with project leads to better understand scientific and business needs.
Provide computational and statistical advice on complex analytic issues supporting HEOR projects conducted by external vendors.
Develop, implement, and promote methodologies based on state-of-the-science computing and statistical research and dissemination of the results both internally and externally.
Develop effective collaborations with GV-HEOR personnel.
Stay current with research on HEOR methodology and its applications pertinent to the GV-HEOR needs.
Be up-to-date on training and compliance with all SOPs as required based on the assigned curriculum.
Required Knowledge, Skills, and Abilities
At least 5 years of post-graduation experience with health economics, health technology assessment, and outcomes research methodology used in RWE. Candidates with less work experience, or experience in other fields, will also be considered if they have exceptional relevant methodology research credentials.
Deep understanding of Machine Learning technology, hands-on experience preferred (e.g., Lupi, Random Forest, Reinforcement Learning, NLP)
Hands on experience performing complex RWD analysis in a cloud environment.
Hands on experience analyzing EMR and Claims Big Data (e.g., MarketScan, Explorys)
Intimate familiarity with Oncology/Hematology commercial and governmental claims and EMR big and small data.
Experience with analytical platforms (e.g. Aetion)
Required/Preferred Education and Licenses
Ph.D. in HEOR related discipline, required.
Description of Physical Demands
Occasional mobility within office environment.
Routinely sitting for extended periods of time.
Constantly operating a computer, printer, telephone and other similar office machinery.
Description of Work Environment
Work indoors in normal office environment with little exposure to excessive noise, dust, fumes, vibrations and temperature changes.
Frequent computer use at workstation.
May move from one work location to another occasionally.
Responsibilities may require a work schedule that may include working outside of “normal” work hours, in order to meet business demands.
Occasional public contact requiring appropriate business apparel.
Jazz Pharmaceuticals is an equal opportunity/affirmative action employer and all qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to race, color, religion, sex, national origin, disability status, protected veteran status, or any characteristic protected by law.

Compass is building the first modern end-to-end real estate platform by integrating agents, buyers and sellers through technology. Before Compass, no one has achieved the blend of the Natural Intelligence that hundreds of thousands of enterprising real estate agents bring to this market, with the Artificial Intelligence that cloud, mobile and AI technologies enable.

As one of the fastest growing technology companies of our generation, in an industry larger than any other, we have an opportunity and obligation to build a world-class engineering team and the operating platform that will transform the real estate industry. In 2019 we tripled the size of our Product & Engineering team, and are searching for creative and inspiring colleagues at all levels of the engineering organization to join us as we continue to expand in 2020.

About This Role:

In this role, you will work with a group of engineers and analysts to build the Compass data platform. Our team's mission is to envision, build and deploy the next generation end-to-end platform for data ingestion, processing, storage, scheduling and analysis at massive scale to provide leverage for Compass. Every team at Compass—product, engineering, finance, operations, people and culture and leadership rely on our platform to make data-informed decisions as well as power the business with data.

Responsibilities:

Develop the vision and product roadmap for data platform solutions and features, including self-service visualization products, dashboarding tools, analytics products and data warehouse
Work closely with key internal business stakeholders to understand user needs with data, identify gaps in our offerings and form product requirements
Craft data platform including but not limited to data pipelines, alerts and analytics, data infrastructure, API (250+ fields), ETL, data quality and coverage projects.
Develop and implement data standards to ensure the accuracy and quality of data through all upstream and downstream data channels
Set ambitious goals, and measure and quantify impact on a regular basis
Champion and build a culture of data informed decision making

Requirements:

Bachelor's degree in an analytical field (Computer Science, Statistics, Mathematics, Economics or related field)
5+ years of product management or related experience for data products
Proven ability to lead teams and work cross-functionally with technical and non-technical team members
Familiarity with big data technologies (such as Kafka, Hadoop, Spark and Redshift), relational databases and data products generally
Experience with developer tools and platforms (Github, AWS, Airflow) a plus
Experience with business intelligence tools such as Looker or Tableau is a plus
Ability to thrive and adapt in a fast-paced, high-growth and rapidly changing environment

At Compass, our mission is to help everyone find their place in the world. This means we continually celebrate the diverse community different individuals cultivate. As an equal opportunity employer, we stay true to our mission by ensuring that our place can be anyone's place.

Mastercard’s Commercial Product team develops and delivers world-class solutions for small, middle and large sized enterprises around the world. As a part of this business, the Global Business to Business (B2B) Product team develops solutions and services to increase the efficiency, safety, security and electronification of business payments. Mastercard has developed the Track Business Payment Service. It is the first global open loop commercial solution built to simplify and automate the exchange of payments-related data between the world’s buyers and suppliers. It leverages common standards, richer data exchanges and multiple payment types to optimize the value, efficiency and control of B2B payments. The B2B payment opportunity is estimated at $125T annually.

The Manager of Commercial Data Strategy & Analytics will lead the group’s efforts to create scalable processes to maximize customer uptake of the Track BPS solution with buyers, supplier and their agents.

Role:

Works in collaboration with the Director of B2B Product Management to advance Commercial Data Strategy and Analytics goals
Partners across all B2B data products to ensure data assets and strategy are coordinated
Supports the Regional Market Managers and Agent Solutions team by equipping them with the tools to target priority agents and corporates pre- and post-implementation
Partners with Data & Services, Operations & Technology and Artificial Intelligence teams as necessary to create algorithms to identify trends with buyer, supplier and their agents

You will:

Create decision-making tools and analytics to drive Track BPS virality and network effects
Create the strategy and execute on a unified vision for Commercial data
Act as the gatekeeper and custodian of internal and client-provided Commercial data
Design, deliver and manage the data ingestion, matching and analytics processes for Track BPS agents across the pre-sales, enrollment and onboarding lifecycle
Optimize corporate match algorithms, interaction rates and success rates across the Track BPS portfolio

All About You:


3-5 years of experience in performing data analysis and developing business centric data strategies
A self-starter with the intellectual curiosity to develop an optimized data strategy and management approach of information assets to maximize business outcomes
The ability to leverage data analytics to maximize data match algorithms across disparate data sets
Experience in leveraging SQL, Hadoop and data analytics Business Intelligence (BI) tools such Tableau, Power BI
Ability to decompose business and technical process flows; develop optimized solutions and articulate business requirements to technical teams for implementation
Strong analytical skills and attention to detail, with an ability to create and present objective analysis
Undergraduate degree required in Computer Science, Management Information Systems, Data Science, Applied Mathematics or related field
MBA or relevant post graduate degree recommended
Mastercard is an inclusive Equal Employment Opportunity employer that considers applicants without regard to gender, gender identity, sexual orientation, race, ethnicity, disabled or veteran status, or any other characteristic protected by law.

Description:

Our client is THE global leader of entertainment and technology. Among their key initiatives are interactive entertainment such as gaming, artificial intelligence, cloud services, film entertainment, and other internet services. Some of their best of breed International partners and investment companies include Epic Games, Riot, Activision, Take-Two and EA.

Our client is dedicated to creating a reliable, fun, and professional interactive entertainment experience for users through the creation of world-class online games. If you are eager to do groundbreaking work in a friendly, cross-cultural environment, they can provide unparalleled stability, resources, access to more than a billion users, and an international perspective.

Job Description:

Our Award-winning client seeks an Animation Director with outstanding animation skills who can really help us build a new world-class IP from concept to market!

Are you ready to create something groundbreaking, genre-defining and fun for years to come? Do you have an insatiable passion for video games and creating new ways for players to be engaged? We are looking for a phenomenal animation director who shares our love for our medium. Come channel your energy into making an exceptionally fun experience and defining the great studio culture necessary to inspire minds to develop great video games.

Responsibilities:

Start with a player-first mentality, embedding an obsessive drive to know, understand, and serve the players who are engaged with the game.
Work with the team to develop and manage an animation vision and production plan capable of delivering upon the promise of the game.
Keep up to date with the bleeding edge of animation trends within video game development and evangelize ideas that will innovate both the player experience and the creative development of the product.
Participate in the hiring of the animation discipline.
Responsible for the career growth and mentorship of the animation discipline on the project.
Act as the key animation contact for the studio, representing the project and team to all external partners and stakeholders.
Define and uphold animation principles to ensure the animation direction of the game is cohesive, inspiring, and represents the right balance between good looking motion and fluid player input.
Work side-by-side with all directors and leads to take a multi-discipline approach to creativity and problem-solving.
Proactively identify opportunities and risks to improve the work of the team, the quality of the project, and studio knowledge as a whole.
Have a cross-platform mindset up-front and ensure that the animation of the game can support an experience that can work seamlessly on different systems and form factors.
Ensure that the animation direction of the game starts with a Live product foundation, capable of regular updates and malleable to key changes if necessary.

Requirements:

A portfolio of visionary, inspiring, industry-leading animation that demonstrates your direction and capacity to execute on it within a game.
At least 8 years of professional AAA game development experience.
At least two projects shipped in a leadership position.
At least one AAA action title shipped.
At least one product shipped during the current generation of games (PS4/XBOX ONE).
Demonstrable, outstanding management and communication capabilities.
Proven ability to define and manage the animation direction and roadmap for large-scale projects.
A team player who knows how to get the best out of everyone on the project and not just within art.
Experience creating animation in and shipping a game using Unreal Engine 4 a plus.

What is in it for you?

Create high-quality games backed by unlimited resources: You will be working to bring incredible game ideas to market, and you will never run out of resources at your disposal. You will be supported completely to bring next-gen experience live to players around the world!
Make a major impact at a global studio: You will be working on a key initiative at this global Studio, building games that are hits not just in the east or west, but globally. The impact of your efforts will ripple not just through the whole studio group (2,500+ employees) but will serve as a blueprint for the entire gaming industry.

To obtain more details or explore this job; please submit a copy of your resume by e-mailing: resumes@gamegrouprecruit.com.

job_title: Watson Health - Director of Business Development – Clinical Trials
job_description:
Introduction
At IBM, work is more than a job - it's a calling: To build. To design. To code. To consult. To think along with clients and sell. To make markets. To invent. To collaborate. Not just to do something better, but to attempt things you've never thought possible. Are you ready to lead in this new era of technology and solve some of the world's most challenging problems? If so, lets talk.

Your Role and Responsibilities
IBM Watson Health was created in 2015 to help solve some of the world's most pressing health challenges through data, analytics, health expertise, and Artificial Intelligence. By enabling human experts with augmented intelligence, IBM Watson Health helps the Life Sciences enterprise around the world translate data and knowledge into insights to accelerate clinical research. International Data Corporation (IDC) ranked IBM number one in AI market share. IBM has tens of thousands of clients, of which over 330 are on the Fortune 500 list and include many worldwide enterprises, from small and medium businesses, to the world's largest organizations and governments. IBM has 20,000+ client engagements across 20 industries including healthcare, financial services, communications and media, energy and utility, government, industrial, and education, among others. It is the diversity and breadth of our portfolio – spanning hardware, software, services, research, financing and technology – that uniquely separates us from other companies in the industry.

At IBM Watson Health we are supported by the proven innovation of IBM, the dynamic intelligence of Watson, and our collective expertise in — and dedication to — improving health. Smarter Health means simpler processes, better care, faster breakthroughs, and improved experiences for people around the world.

We are looking for talented individuals who share our focus on corporate responsibility, diversity and inclusion, and our passion for the patient experience. When we incorporate diversity into our business, we create better innovations and outcomes. Together we are destined to usher in the next era of healthcare.

Job Summary:
This position is a hunting role responsible for selling our clinical trial software to industry segments that include Pharmaceutical, Biotechnology, Medical Device and Contract Research Organizations (CROs).


You will be selling IBM Clinical Development, which is an intuitive, flexible, and scalable cloud-based clinical data management platform. With IBM Clinical Development we bring premier data integration capabilities, patient engagement, and seamless reporting and analytics all in one highly configurable platform that gives valuable insights and high quality and compliance features that are required to complete high stake trials.


You will be responsible for achieving signings objectives in the assigned territory. This includes making strategic cold calls, identifying and qualifying opportunities, penetrating new accounts and expanding existing client relationships. It will be imperative to leverage our many company-wide resources in order to successfully and efficiently close opportunities.


***Candidates must have: Five or more years of selling clinical trial software to Sponsors and CROs, with a deep rolodex and proven track record of success.


Essential Job Duties:
Work independently and collaborate with other Watson Health portfolio sales professionals to meet and exceed quarterly and annual sales targets.
Leverage and coordinate sales, senior and executive leadership team, and other cross functional resources to bring opportunities to successful conclusion and meet or exceed sales objectives.
Generate new business leads and manage the end-to-end sales process.
Develop and execute strategic sales plans for specific opportunities within assigned territory.
Develop and manage assigned accounts/territories by contacting targeted market segments and managing the pipeline daily.
Maintain and update all required account and opportunity data within company CRM, as directed.
Successfully complete technology platform training, including certification.
Pursue a program of self-development using selected reading, seminars, and participation in continuing education.
Achieve full proficiency at demonstrating technology solution(s) to prospects in client meetings and tradeshow settings.
Work with Senior and Executive Leadership Team, Sales Leader, and Marketing to support trade shows.
Identify and communicate possible platform improvements based on direct customer interactions and input.
Maintain high customer satisfaction level by developing strong relationships and ensuring execution excellence.

Required Technical and Professional Expertise

Five or more years of selling clinical trial software to Sponsors and CROs, with a deep rolodex and proven track record of sales success.
Knowledge and comprehensive understanding of the field of clinical research and the life sciences industry.
Results oriented individual with experience working with business leaders and technology innovators, with a demonstrated ability to forge successful sales and market strategies.
Strong presentation and public speaking skills are essential.
Strong verbal and written communication skills are a must.
Experience working directly with senior executives (VP, SVP and above).
Experience selling advanced technology products/solutions that require a 6-18-month decision cycle, involve multiple stakeholders, and are comparatively large in individual order value.
Understanding of competitive landscape.
Four-year degree or equivalent combination of education and experience.

Preferred Technical and Professional Expertise

Five or more years of selling clinical trial software to Sponsors and CROs, with a deep rolodex and proven track record of sales success.
Knowledge and comprehensive understanding of the field of clinical research and the life sciences industry.
Results oriented individual with experience working with business leaders and technology innovators, with a demonstrated ability to forge successful sales and market strategies.
Strong presentation and public speaking skills are essential.
Strong verbal and written communication skills are a must.
Experience working directly with senior executives (VP, SVP and above).
Experience selling advanced technology products/solutions that require a 6-18-month decision cycle, involve multiple stakeholders, and are comparatively large in individual order value.
Understanding of competitive landscape.
Four-year degree or equivalent combination of education and experience.

About Business Unit
IBM Watson Health is pioneering a new partnership between humanity and technology with the goal of transforming global health and revolutionizing many aspects of the medical and pharmaceutical industries, as well as government sectors. We aspire to improve lives and give hope by delivering innovation to address the world’s most pressing health challenges through data and artificial intelligence insights.

Your Life @ IBM
What matters to you when you’re looking for your next career challenge?

Maybe you want to get involved in work that really changes the world? What about somewhere with incredible and diverse career and development opportunities – where you can truly discover your passion? Are you looking for a culture of openness, collaboration and trust – where everyone has a voice? What about all of these? If so, then IBM could be your next career challenge. Join us, not to do something better, but to attempt things you never thought possible.

Impact. Inclusion. Infinite Experiences. Do your best work ever.

About IBM
IBM’s greatest invention is the IBMer. We believe that progress is made through progressive thinking, progressive leadership, progressive policy and progressive action. IBMers believe that the application of intelligence, reason and science can improve business, society and the human condition. Restlessly reinventing since 1911, we are the largest technology and consulting employer in the world, with more than 380,000 IBMers serving clients in 170 countries.

Location Statement
For additional information about location requirements, please discuss with the recruiter following submission of your application.

Being You @ IBM
IBM is committed to creating a diverse environment and is proud to be an equal opportunity employer. All qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to race, color, religion, gender, gender identity or expression, sexual orientation, national origin, genetics, disability, age, or veteran status. IBM is also committed to compliance with all fair employment practices regarding citizenship and immigration status.

Peraton is looking for a part-time academic researcher with innovative thinking on Human Machine Interfaces (HMI) for the modeling of human behavior and reward functions for the purpose of infusing Artificial Intelligence (AI) in human centric design of assistive robots in order to endow them with learning and online behavioral adaptation capabilities. Expertise in creating rational strategies for irrational human behavior to anticipate and respond to irrational human actions. Additional research may include the use of emerging theories of the mind as they apply to the design of AI systems that account for the management of data which overwhelm the humans and to provide guidance to the AI’s learning mechanisms. Research on planning for non-positive eventualities of cyber physical AI systems, such as weapons, which will become a part of the human ecosystem.
What you’ll do…

Conduct research on HMI for socially adept robotic systems.

Model human behavior and reward functions for human centric design of AI systems.

Create rational strategies for modeling and anticipation of irrational human behaviors.

Apply emerging theories of the mind to the design of AI systems to account for overwhelming data.

Document and disseminate these research ideas in academic publications and journal articles.

Evangelize research ideas in public fora such as Ted Talks and other discussions.
You’d be a great fit if…

You have a Master’s degree or higher (with a minimum of 8 years experience) in the fields of education, human machine interfaces or social robotics.

You are an innovative thinking in modeling of human behavior is expected.

Have excellent written and oral communication skills with demonstrated competence on dissemination of ideas to a wide audience.
You’d be an even better fit if…
You have high academic achievement.
SECURITY CLEARANCE
This position requires the candidate be able to obtain and maintain a secret level security clearance. In order to obtain a clearance you must be a US Citizen.

We are an Equal Opportunity/Affirmative Action Employer. We consider applicants without regard to race, color, religion, age, national origin, ancestry, ethnicity, gender, gender identity, gender expression, sexual orientation, marital status, veteran status, disability, genetic information, citizenship status, or membership in any other group protected by federal, state, or local law.

Job Title: Principal Storage Solutions Architect
About our group:
Seagate has one simple mission: to help the world save more of its precious data. Multiple studies have shown that machine learning, artificial intelligence, and data analytics are all improved with larger data sets. These methods are what is needed for the world to solve its important challenges from developing vaccines to combating climate change to improving autonomy in driving that saves lives. Unfortunately, however, the IDC projects that 158 of the 175 predicted zettabytes of data produced in 2025 will not be saved. By lowering the cost of storage, Seagate aims to rescue as much of this at-risk 158 zettabytes as possible to provide larger data sets and correspondingly improved learning, autonomy, and analytics. To achieve this goal, Seagate is developing reference architectures of low cost, scale out object storage to reduce data center costs and enable the Edge/IT 4.0. Our group is dedicated to this goal.
About the role – you will:
As Principal storage solutions architect, your role will be central to important corporate strategy as you will also be the Design Engineering Lead who will be responsible for defining and executing the product design and technical strategy, and resolving technical and process issues. With a cross functional team representing Engineering, Materials, Software, Quality Assurance and Manufacturing, this impactful role ensures that goals are met for time-to-market, time-to-volume, quality, reliability, development expense and product cost. Your responsibility will include the following:
Define rack scale out storage solution architecture in collaboration with other architects.
Architect best in class networking solution for scale out storage products across the distributed enterprise environment.
Drive the Engineering team's decision-making process around critical priorities. Communicates decisions to site management and the functional organizations.
Make tradeoff recommendations and decisions for the program between technical, customer and business needs based on functional team and core team inputs.
Coordinate delivery of product against customer requirements including risk assessments and go/no go delivery recommendations.
Align product technical targets with customer needs and internal technology development plans.
Provide key factory integration support.
Customer interactions required for new product design reviews, quality issues and yields.
Scrum and/or SAFe certified product owner is a plus.
Sets and achieves performance goals. Sets schedules and ensures adherence. Creates a sense of purpose with clear direction and motivates his team and others to overcome obstacles.
Establishes technical strategies across broad areas and functions.
Facilitates discussion with other functional groups. Presents to senior site management. Fosters cross-functional relationships and initiates efforts to overcome significant barriers.
Understands functional deliverables and dependencies. Identifies barriers and works to resolve them with multiple team participation. Builds consensus on difficult technological issues.
Works with abstract ideas or situations across functional areas of the business. Identifies and evaluates fundamental issues, providing the strategy and direction for major functional areas.
Provides direction, goals, schedules, and coaching to an experienced team of Functional Engineering Leads assigned to the Core Team.
Follow Seagate product development process to deliver product milestones on schedule.
About you
Good written and oral communication skills for coordination with the extended team, including engineering groups, and communicating product issues and status to the executive
Ability to lead cross functionally with a wide variety of disciplines and geographies
Your experience includes:
Design best in class networking for scale out storage solutions.
Systems engineering and the integration of subsystems.
Technical project management
Excellent track record of technical leadership on a fast paced Product Development Core Teams.
Data analysis and statistical methods.
Architecting scale out storage solutions using open source object storage technologies (ceph, openstack, swiftstack etc)
Bachelor's Degree (BSCS) and 15+ years experience, Master’s Degree (BSCS) and 12+ years experience, or PhD and 10+ years of experience or equivalent combined education and experience.
Location: Fremont, CA or Longmont, CO
Fremont:

Our Gold LEED-certified Fremont product-design campus drives innovation, bringing together a diverse set of engineering, design, operations, support and administrative teams. The site is equipped with state-of-the-art clean room and lab space. On-site social activities are popular, including our annual BBQ, ice cream social, and holiday events. Wellness programs, gaming rooms and the on-site fitness center help round out and balance your Seagate work-life experience, along with opportunities to give back to our local community.

Longmont:

Our Longmont product-design campus is nestled against the foothills with exceptional views of the Rocky Mountains. Here at work, you can grab breakfast and lunch in the on-site cafeteria or get an afternoon espresso, prepared by a professional barista. Our 1,500+ employees enjoy an active on-site experience from sporting activities (get in a few laps at lunch on our 1-mile walking path around campus, play ping-pong or volleyball, or stop in our 24- hour fitness center for a group or individual workout) to community service and many employee resource groups including Pride!, Women’s Leadership Network and a Young Professionals Network.
Travel: 0-20%
Job Family: Engineering Professional
Job Family: Engineering Professional

Our Solution
Botkeeper is a virtual robotic bookkeeping platform transforming the accounting industry. By the end of 2018 Botkeeper was named a Cool Vendor in AI by Gartner, one of BostInno's Coolest Companies, and one of Business Insider's Enterprise Startups to Bet Your Career On in 2019. Botkeeper is truly the future of bookkeeping!
Botkeeper, a progressive software company with over 1000 clients in its early stages of growth automating financial bookkeeping, brings the next wave in machine learning and artificial intelligence technology to an important and critical aspect of any business. All companies struggle with bookkeeping, prone to error and human inference along with agonizing data entry, reconciliation, and general upkeep in financial bookkeeping. Botkeeper performs all associated tasks not limited to entries, tracking and schedules of revenue, deferred expenses accounts for payroll, reconciliation of bank accounts, and sending invoices to clients. Now scaling, we are bringing in the world's best talent to achieve the true future of bookkeeping.

The Challenge
As a Customer Success Lead at Botkeeper you guide a new client from the late stages of purchase through to their bookkeeping migration to Botkeeper. Successful candidates will have a strong working knowledge of accounting principles and QuickBooks Online. It is the Customer Success Lead's responsibility to understand the services the client has selected from Botkeeper, interpret all the information gathered during the sales process, and capture all the remaining information required from the client to make their deployment successful. This includes assisting and training clients as they provide credentials to Botkeeper to enable our services. A person with complete knowledge and mastery of the lifecycle of a client from presales to healthy client is necessary.
In this position it is also necessary to conduct multiple presentations and calls to help credential setup, facilitate an initial orientation of the deployment process in a product presentation, set appropriate client expectations, request documentation, write the initial form of a Client Playbook as a list of services Botkeeper performs, and conduct a briefing and handoff to accounting services. It is incredibly important to Botkeeper that continuity and health measurement in the first few weeks, overlapping with both Botkeeper expectations and services rendered, are successful. Ideal candidates will have a focus on being highly organized in managing a matrix of clients including both direct and indirect business.

Job Responsibilities:
Client Onboarding & Assessment of Services
Confirming Botkeeper services and additional accounting services offerings and how it applies to clients
Ability to assess QBO clients' books and confirm list of services (included and additional)
Credential all financial, payroll, sales and any other system tied to the GL accounting software with Botkeeper services
Obtain or create Botkeeper Playbook (document client services and procedures that clients do today and how they do it)

Client Deployment Presentation and Orientation:
Deliver and present multiple deployment presentation calls that provide:
Orientation of credentialing and demo of Botkeeper software and services
Describe the deployment process, including expectations of the client and timeliness
Set agenda and reinforce the services being performed
Set cadence for calls and calendar of events with client
Initial Client Training and Orientation of Botkeeper Portal
Demo and train clients on Financial Hub for direct clients
Demo and train client partners on Practice Management Suite

Client + Botkeeper Follow-up and Management
Confirm and persist in getting clients credentialed on the Botkeeper platform for services to commence
Act as the intermediary during the initial phases of deployment for all confirmations of integration and financial institution access
Liaison between accounting services and client along with prescribed additional services if necessary
Project manage each client or partner services and software onboarding

Client Health Checks:
Monitor and maintain a list of accounts and the status of each phase of the deployment workflow process
Maintain existing status reports weekly on the calendar of new deployments, on-boarded clients, and large clients

Large Partner Support
Potential routine on-site visits to Botkeeper's largest clients to continue to support deployment and enhancement of services in Botkeeper replacement of bookkeeping services

KPI's for Success:
Successfully Deployed Clients
Time to Deploy
Relative Health Weeks 1, 2, & 3 and Months 1 & 2
Client Survey Feedback

Requirements for Role:
BA in Accounting and/or 7-10 years experience in client success, accounting technical support, staff accounting, project management or consultative roles (technical or finance)
Strong understanding of QuickBooks Online
Great project management, time management, and documentation skills
Proven delivery of outcomes in client or project-based environments in either a consultative or project management capacity
Understanding of customer success principles and metrics
Comfortable demonstrating to and interacting with clients to resolve and understand services they will be consuming
Organized and meticulous calendar practices with an ability to bring together matrixed client environments and people

job_title: Engineering Manager, Business Intelligence, Discover Navigation/Mobile
job_description:
Note: By applying to this position your application is automatically submitted to the following locations: San Francisco, CA, USA; Santa Cruz, CA, USA
Minimum qualifications:

BA/BS degree in Computer Science or closely related field or equivalent practical experience.
2 years of technical leadership and people management experience.
Experience in software engineering, including experience with web development or mobile client software.

Preferred qualifications:

Experience working with open source tools and frameworks around web application development such as Angular and React.
Experience collaborating with engineering leaders, product managers, and designers.
Comfortable and effective in cross-functional and cross-organizational communication and collaboration
People management skills, proven track record of mentoring and coaching team members.
About the job
Like Google's own ambitions, the work of a Software Engineer (SWE) goes way beyond just Search. SWE Managers have not only the technical expertise to take on and provide technical leadership to major projects, but also manage a team of engineers. You not only optimize your own code but make sure engineers are able to optimize theirs. As a SWE Manager you manage your project goals, contribute to product strategy and help develop your team. SWE teams work all across the company, in areas such as information retrieval, artificial intelligence, natural language processing, distributed computing, large-scale system design, networking, security, data compression, user interface design; the list goes on and is growing every day. Operating with scale and speed, our exceptional software engineers are just getting started - and as a manager, you guide the way.
The Discovery And Navigation team and Mobile team are part of the Business Intelligence ++ domain. Discovery and Navigation’s mission is to enable people to efficiently find insight in Looker, whether they know what they're looking for or not. This team owns the “chrome” to Looker’s web experience. This includes the ability to navigate and discover content that users create on the platform. The mobile team’s mission is to enable navigation and consumption experiences on popular mobile platforms.
Looker is a unified platform that powers data experiences and delivers actionable business insights to employees at the point of decision. Looker integrates data into the daily workflows of users to allow organizations to extract value from data at web-scale.
Responsibilities
Provide consistent clarity, focus and leadership on a daily basis to your team
Collaborate closely with other engineering leaders, product managers, and designers
Participate and collaborate in planning exercises (Bi-Weekly and Quarterly). Mentor and coach team members to develop their skills
Work closely with other engineering leaders to consistently up-level our process as we scale at a rapid pace
Help your team to deliver frequent, valuable, software iterations and deliver high-quality software, on-time. Enable your team to build (mostly brand new!) powerful web applications/components using React and Redux
Google is proud to be an equal opportunity workplace and is an affirmative action employer. About CCC
At CCC, it’s all about connectivity we are a provider of innovative cloud, mobile, telematics, hyperscale technologies and services for the automotive, insurance, and collision repair industries. Our solutions and big data insights are delivered through our CCC ONE™ platform, which connects 350+ insurance companies, 24,000+ repair facilities, original equipment manufacturers, hundreds of parts suppliers, and dozens of third-party data and service providers. Our platform, carwise.com , provides access to car-related services for millions of consumers. Auto Injury Solutions Inc., also a CCC company, provides casualty solutions to auto insurers for the handling of first and third-party claims. In short, our collective set of solutions make connected car, vehicle, and accident data actionable, informing decision-making, enhancing productivity, and helping customers deliver faster and better experiences for end consumers.

NICE inContact’s digital marketing team is looking for an experienced Digital Marketing Manager to craft and execute best-of-breed, paid digital marketing campaigns designed to acquire net new qualified leads through top of funnel channels, including Google Paid Search, Display Network [GDN], retargeting, and paid social. This critical role sits at the intersection of demand and awareness, manages the largest percentage of the Marketing budget, and has the ultimate goal of driving impactful marketing-sourced pipeline growth. Therefore, we are seeking a highly driven, self-motivated individual – equal parts strategic, creative, analytical and operational – to help take our paid digital demand generation activities to the next level.
In this role, you will be the key decision-maker for the paid digital acquisition channels, managing and executing the company’s s paid digital strategy – including experimentation, budgets, and exploration into new channels. Your high growth obsession, strong analytical capabilities, and solid communication skills will push you to effectively measure and report on strategy, tactics, and performance across all paid campaigns and to test, improve, and optimize wherever possible. You will partner with Demand Gen as well as various cross-functional teams (i.e. Creative, Web Production, Product Marketing, Marketing Operations, and Corporate) to manage paid digital experiences from inception through execution to launch innovative campaigns on time and on budget.

As a Digital Marketing Manager, a Typical Day Might Include the Following:

Develop the strategy for paid search, social advertising, display, and re-targeting and manager the day-to-day execution, optimization and reporting of campaigns across these channels.
Drive and coordinate cross-functional teams of stakeholders, writers, designers, web developers to create and maintain digital experiences
Responsible for ad copy writing and editing for search ads and promoted social posts
Partner with other internal teams to support integrated campaigns and advise on the best use of digital tactics to support their objectives
Own the entire metrics stack for digital efforts including lead generation, conversion rates, pipeline generation, effectiveness of spend, and influence on bookings
Oversee a large digital media budget; identify trends and insights, and optimize spend and performance based on the insights
Collaborate with agencies and manage all digital marketing vendor partners.
Proactively identify opportunities for innovation and incremental business growth potential; evaluate, recommend, and test new marketing channels including assessing potential traffic sources, negotiating pricing/terms, and launching campaigns

To Land This Gig You'll Need:
Bachelor's degree in Marketing, Communications, Advertising, Public Relations, or related field (or equivalent work experience) is required.
4-6 years experience in developing and managing paid digital campaigns, ideally for a B2B technology company.
Hands-on user of search platforms (AdWords/Bing), social media advertising (LinkedIn, Facebook, Twitter) and retargeting (AdWords/Adroll)
Hands-on experience with Google Suites (AdWords, Analytics, Search Console, Tag Manager) and testing tools
Familiarity with Marketo and Salesforce a plus
Strong background in SEO, analytics and conversion rate optimization required
Up-to-date with the latest trends and best practices in digital marketing and measurement for a B2B enterprise audience
Must be a self-starter, highly motivated, able to “turn on a dime”, think through problems and come up with innovative solutions, and deliver against very tight deadlines
Expert program and project management skills, and attention to detail
Excellent written and oral communication skills with an ability to problem solve, lead, influence, create visibility, and motivate others
Strong interpersonal and team player skills with an ability to communicate at all levels of an organization both internally and externally
In-depth experience with Google Analytics or similar web analytics platform
Experience with business intelligence reporting tools (DOMO) and/or A/B testing tools is preferred
Experience using various MS Office products
ABOUT NICE inContact: NICE inContact makes it easy and affordable for organizations around the globe to provide exceptional customer experiences while meeting key business metrics. NICE inContact provides the world’s #1 cloud customer experience platform, NICE inContact CXone™, combining best-in-class Omnichannel Routing, Workforce Optimization, Analytics, Automation and Artificial Intelligence on an Open Cloud Foundation. NICE inContact is a part of NICE (Nasdaq: NICE), the worldwide leading provider of both cloud and on-premises enterprise software solutions.

Responsibilities:
NCI: The Database Administrator II, under general supervision, designs, implements and maintains moderately complex databases with respect to JCL, access methods, access time, device allocation, validation checks, reorganization, and statistical methods.

Responsibilities:
Includes maintenance of database dictionaries and integration of systems through database design
Supports data modeling activities by way of prototype database implementations
Implements data models, database designs, data access and table maintenance codes
Resolves database performance and capacity issues, and replication and other distributed data issues
Installs and/or upgrades the mainframe product in the related environment
Competent to work in most phases of database management
Responsible for implementing and maintaining one or more complex Oracle databases
Implements procedures to control access and allocation of data, and maintains security controls
Develops database definitions and documentation
Reviews, develops, and designs data models using standard diagramming techniques, in conjunction with application development teams
Creates logical data models and translates into physical database structures that integrate with existing or proposed database structures
Monitors relational databases to optimize database performance, resource use, and physical implementations of databases
Addresses a variety of database integration issues including migration between disparate databases, integration, maintenance/conversion, capacity planning issues, and new applications
Maintains development, test and production RDBMS environments
Monitors and maintains database security and database software, in cooperation with ISSMs
Provides advice to applications programmers in the effective use of database languages; advises on troubleshooting, exception processing needs and other data management issues
Maintains availability and integrity of databases through multiple access schemes; facilitates sharing of common data by overseeing proper key and index management and data dictionary maintenance
May evaluate and recommend testing and evaluation of new procedures, software, and hardware
Monitors and manages database backups; installs, maintains, and upgrades database software; restores and/or recovers data as required
Experience interpreting data models and developing database structures; using standard diagramming techniques to design and develop computer data models; and implementing and troubleshooting programming changes and modifications
Knowledge of security requirements for databases, developing, documenting, and implementing backup and recovery procedures
Experience configuring, managing and maintaining the operation of complex relational databases
Familiarity with UNIX and Windows operating systems
Qualifications:
Requirements:
Bachelor’s Degree or equivalent related experience
Experience in Design & Implementation; Statistical methods; Access time, device, allocation; Monitor standard procedures; System integration
4 -9 years of experience

Preferred Education and Experience:

Expereince with Oracle
Modeling, documenting, creating and scripting specified logical schemas into physical schemas for all databases on NIPR and SIPR.
Administration, configuration, monitoring and tuning of all databases.
Design, and implement SSIS scripts for internal and external data sources.
Sustainment of existing SSIS scripts.
Configuration management of all changes between development, test and production databases.
Employ best practices for design, implementation and data security.
Design and manage databases.
Model and normalize data.
Solid understanding of T-SQL,Stored Procedures and SQL design principles (MS-SQL 2012/2016) is a plus
Physical Requirements:

This position requires the ability to perform the below essential functions:
Sitting for long periods
Standing for long periods
Ambulate throughout an office
Ambulate between several buildings

Responsibilities:
NCI Information Systems is in search of an Information Systems Security Manager (ISSM) to support the Air National Guard Reserve Order Writing System (AROWS) as part of the Application Development and Support Contract with the Air National Guard.

Responsibilities:

Assist the ANG Information Technology Portfolio Management (IT PfM) Action Officer with reporting on the cost and effectiveness of AROWS to ensure strategic alignment with the DoD Enterprise Architecture. Using the Information Technology Investment Portfolio System (ITIPS) to submit AROWS IT Budget data required to support OMB Circular A-11 requirements, e-Government reviews, OMB Circular A-130, “Management of Federal Information Resources”, budget analysis, special data calls, and Congressional displays.
Assist in the development of Technical, Financial, and Certification Documentation to ensure AROWS remains compliant with the Federal Information Security Management Act (FISMA), the Chief Financial Officer’s (CFO) Act, and Privacy and Records Management Requirements. This includes development of Fiscal Year Budget Estimate Submissions, Organization Execution Plan (OEP) Funding Verification Memos, and OEP Out of Cycle (OOC) Funding Requests. Draft response to data validation inquiries submitted by the Headquarters Air Force Human Resource Management Portfolio Managers.
Conduct annual review of the Risk Management Framework (RMF) Information Assurance Package to ensure AROWS maintains an Authority to Operate (ATO). Update artifacts and information within the Enterprise Mission Assurance Support Service (eMASS) to validate Security Controls and Assessments. Develop Plan of Actions and Milestones (POAMs) for non-compliant items.
Support NGB/A1 in response to taskers and data calls regarding the health and Return on Investment (ROI) of AROWS.
Support efforts in response to DoD and Air Force Audits regarding AROWS and AROWS related data. Participate in Audit Planning, Audit Walk-throughs, assembly of Prepared By Client (PBC) Artifacts, discussions on Notice of Findings and Recommendations (NFRs), and development of Corrective Action Plans (CAPs).
Qualifications:
Requirements:
Bachelor’s Degree in Information Systems, Information Assurance Management, Computer Science, or related field. (May be substituted for relevant work experience).
IAM Level II Certification, or higher (CAP, CASP, CISM, CISSP (or Associate), GSLC)).
Working knowledge of the Risk Management Framework (RMF) process and the National Institute of Standards and Technology (NIST) publications (specifically NIST 800-53 and NIST 800-37).
10 - 15 years experience

Preferred Education and Experience:
Working knowledge of DoD and USAF Audit processes and information systems.
Working knowledge of DoD and USAF Portfolio Management processes and information systems.
Ability to manage the Plan of Actions & Milestones (POA&M) documents associated with Information Systems.
Excellent writing, verbal communication, and time-management skills.
Must possess or be able to obtain a Secret Security Clearance.

Basic Qualifications
Passion for helping startups growEntrepreneurial “builder” mentality3-10 years of technology related sales or business development experienceExcellent verbal and written communication skillsBA/BS degree requiredComfortable delivering results amid ambiguity and change

Account Manager, Startups - Job Description

Amazon Web Services (AWS) offers a complete set of cloud services that enable all companies, from startups to enterprises, to run virtually everything in the cloud, including mobile applications, big data analytics, AI/ML platforms, and microservices/serverless infrastructures. Startups, which are now primarily born-in-the-cloud, represent a critically important and growing subset of customers to AWS. Startups have unique needs, priorities, and growth trajectories that distinguish them from traditional businesses and require different engagement strategies and sales motions from sellers to effectively acquire, grow, and retain them long-term on the AWS platform.

As AWS continues to rapidly grow, we seek an Americas Startup Account Manager to help drive the growth of high-potential early, mid, and late stage startups. Your responsibilities will include driving revenue and user adoption, migrations, and ensuring new startups select AWS as their primary cloud provider. You will align closely with counterparts in business development, marketing, solution architecture and partner teams to lead execution of coordinated go-to-market strategies and sales plays. You will also work closely with business development teams who are driving strategic support, global co-programming, and portfolio engagement to help drive top-of-funnel customer acquisition and accelerate seller cycles in the field.

You will be at the heart of latest trends like artificial intelligence (AI), machine learning (ML), serverless and IoT. Your customers leverage state-of-the-art technologies on AWS to innovate and become the next disrupters, like today’s AirBnB, Slack, DoorDash, and Lyft. You are passionate about startups, a self-starter with a strong entrepreneurial spirit who is prepared to work in a fast-paced, often ambiguous environment, execute against ambitious goals, and consistently embrace the Amazon Culture.

Roles & Responsibilities:
Ensure customer success with early, mid and late stage startupsDrive revenue and market share in a defined territory or industry verticalAccelerate customer adoption through well-developed sales engagements and successful GTM StrategyMeet or exceed quarterly revenue and goal targets.Develop and execute against a comprehensive account/territory plan.Create & articulate compelling value propositions around AWS services.Accelerate customer adoption by engaging Founders, CxO, Board of Directors and VC influencersWork with partners to extend reach & drive adoption.Develop long-term strategic relationships with key accounts.Ensure customer satisfaction.Expect moderate travel.

Preferred Qualifications
MBA/MA/MS degreePrevious cloud expertise at a technology companyA technical background in engineering or computer scienceHistory of working for, or selling to tech startups

Engineering

Senior Technical Program Manager

New York City

Compass is building the first modern end-to-end real estate platform by integrating agents, buyers and sellers through technology. Until Compass, no one has achieved the blend of the Natural Intelligence that hundreds of thousands of enterprising real estate agents bring to this market, with the "Artificial Intelligence" that cloud, mobile and AI technologies enable. We are building AI to empower AI - Artificial Intelligence to empower Agent Intelligence.

As one of the fastest growing technology companies of our generation, in an industry larger than any other, we have an opportunity and obligation to build a world-class engineering team and the operating platform that will transform real estate. In 2019 we will triple the size of our engineering team and are searching for creative and inspiring colleagues at all levels of the engineering organization.

At Compass, our mission is to help everyone find their place in the world. This means we continually celebrate the diverse community different individuals cultivate. As an equal opportunity employer, we stay true to our mission by ensuring that our place can be anyone's place. Our entrepreneurship principles bind us together and inform how we tackle the tremendous challenges ahead.

About the Role

A Technical Program Manager at Compass is empowered to drive cross-cutting initiatives across our product and engineering organization. The initiatives you drive will span deep technical improvements such as performance and reliability, development and deployment of scalable engineering systems (e.g. shift to microservices architecture), and product and data initiatives (e.g. instrumentation of customer usage and sentiment). You will look for ways to standardize, ensure execution is efficient and consistent, and set accountability by tracking progress, resolving dependencies, evaluating risks and communicating status to upper management and project stakeholders.

At Compass You Will:

Provide programmatic leadership for technical initiatives that support our platform to power real estate agents, buyers and sellers
Identify opportunities for efficiency and scale and define vision for your team and the company
Be a domain expert on real estate technology and products and an empathetic partner to our customers
Be respected by a team of highly technical and top talent engineers
Help build a scalable engineering culture for hundreds of top talent engineers by leveraging modern principles of decoupled systems and automated CI/CD/testing/monitoring to drive efficiencies

What We Look For:

BA/BS in Computer Science and 5+ years experience
Proven track record of technical program management in top talent and high performance teams, directing initiatives across multiple teams and managers
Experience managing initiatives within large scale systems in rapid growth environments
Familiarity with containerization, microservices architecture, continuous integration and delivery
Proven success in working with product, marketing, business, and operations divisions

At Compass, our mission is to help everyone find their place in the world. This means we continually celebrate the diverse community different individuals cultivate. As an equal opportunity employer, we stay true to our mission by ensuring that our place can be anyone's place.

Location: Princeton, NJ
Overview
The Manager, Data Science & Machine Learning will be a subject matter expert who will help shape the firm’s perspectives and capabilities in the Data Science and Artificial Intelligence (AI) Machine Learning space. The right individual in this role will structure and execute cutting-edge analytical and machine learning techniques on large, complex, structured and unstructured biopharma data sets (including big/patient-claims data) to address clients’ commercial questions and help them make fact-based strategic decisions. This individual will provide thought leadership, develop new AI machine learning offerings and technology solutions, drive business impact by delivering offerings and solutions to clients, and coach and develop data scientists. Candidates will be experienced in the application of sophisticated analytics and AI machine learning techniques to address sales, marketing, payer, and provider questions using real-world data sources such as anonymized longitudinal patient claims data, EHR, lab and diagnosis data, etc. Success in this position requires demonstrated thought leadership, and demonstrated success in business development, client engagement, organizational and people development, managing multiple projects simultaneously, structuring innovative machine learning solutions, and driving business impact for clients.
Responsibilities
Solutions Leader
Serve as a subject matter expert, adept at addressing pressing commercial questions through the application of AI machine learning techniques to biopharma data, including big/patient claims data and unstructured data in order to generate actionable business insights
Play a key role in defining and developing data science and AI machine learning capabilities and offerings that create scale and advance firm’s capabilities
Work closely with Partners and client teams to uncover and understand client’s pressing commercial questions and issues, recommend appropriate AI machine learning analytics and technology solutions to innovatively address the challenges, and provide expertise in architecting and implementing solutions for clients
Lead and own successful delivery of AI machine learning engagements that deliver high-impact results for clients
Direct multiple AI machine learning projects simultaneously,
Motivate, coach, and serve as a role model for analysts in project team
Business Development
Build case studies and white papers that demonstrate the use cases for our AI machine learning capabilities and the value-proposition of our solutions to clients and prospects
Support Partners with pre-sales activities and help convert prospects to new clients
Support Partners in developing custom AI machine learning solutions to grow existing clients
Support Partners in drafting proposals with solutions, staffing plans, and pricing
Support Partners in responding to specific RFP questions; help create competitive differentiation through the innovative application of AI ML techniques to address business problems across Practice Areas like Multi-Channel Marketing, Digital, Patient Services, Brand Planning, Incentive Compensation, Sales Force Sizing, Data Management and Forecasting
Qualifications
Master’s degree in Statistics, Math, Advanced Analytics, Computer Science, Engineering or related discipline; PhD degree preferred
10+ years of relevant post-collegiate work; 8+ years of work experience with PhD degree
5+ years of experience implementing big data/advanced analytics concepts and algorithms (e.g. text mining, social listening, recommender systems, feature engineering, predictive modeling, etc.) to address biopharma commercial questions
Expertise in AI Machine Learning techniques, and a strong understanding of biopharma and healthcare data sets, including big- (patient claims) data
Hand-on experience coding in Python/R/SAS
Deep knowledge of analytic tools such as ProgR, Python, SAS, SPSS, SQL, and Tableau
Hands-on experience building AI Machine Learning models to address a range of commercial questions using H2O, SageMaker, MLFlow or comparable DS framework in the AWS/Azure Cloud
Previous experience or familiarity with Hadoop and database systems
Track record of business development (pre-sell, upsell) success
Agile project planning and project management experience
Team management and skill development experience
Excellent oral and written communication skills; comfort presenting complex ideas in simple terms to clients and prospects
Strong attention to detail, with a business-focused mindset
Excellent critical thinking and problem solving skills
Prior authorship of industry or academic publications
Analytics software solution development experience, preferred

Req. ID: 196903

Our vision is to transform how the world uses information to enrich life. Join an inclusive team passionate about one thing: using their expertise in the relentless pursuit of innovation for customers and partners. The solutions we build help make everything from virtual reality experiences to breakthroughs in neural networks possible. We do it all while committing to integrity, sustainability, and giving back to our communities. Because doing so can fuel the very innovation we are pursuing.
In this highly visible and challenging role at Micron’s advanced NAND development group, you will participate in early architecture development and product definition, projection of critical design specs, defining critical architecture design features, test plans, system integration considerations, and verification planning. Successful candidates will have in-depth knowledge of NAND memory physics, strong design skills, team member mentor, self-motivated, and a standout colleague.

Responsibilities:
Active participant working with system, process and test engineering to develop new architectures for advanced memory products
Detailed knowledge in design of analog/digital circuits includes some of these areas: OpAmps, voltage reference, oscillator, high voltage charge pump, regulators, switched capacitor circuit, NAND page buffers, efficient NAND array control, design simulation, layout supervision and silicon evaluation.
As part of a multi-disciplinary team, the engineer will participate in system-level modeling and simulation
Supervise layout and optimize layout throughout post-layout simulations
Silicon evaluation and characterization.
Prepares test methods and design specifications.
Qualifications:

Typically requires 5 - 10 years of experience in memory design ( NAND, NOR, SRAM, DRAM, CAM etc) preferably non-volatile memory design (NAND FLASH, NOR FLASH).
Familiarity with Cadence design environment.
Requires experience with transistor level simulators such as Spice and gate level simulators such as Verilog.
Requires experience with some of these circuits: charge pumps, regulators, hv-switches, voltage & current references, col/row decoders, sense amps, op-amps, comparators, oscillators, switched capacitor circuits, A/D & D/A converters, transceivers & IO’s.
Education:
MS in EE and/ or 5-10 years of design experience
About Micron Technology, Inc.

We are an industry leader in innovative memory and storage solutions. Through our global brands – Micron® and Crucial® – our broad portfolio of high-performance memory and storage technologies, including DRAM, NAND, 3D XPoint™ memory and NOR, is transforming how the world uses information to enrich life. Backed by more than 40 years of technology leadership, our memory and storage solutions enable disruptive trends, including artificial intelligence, 5G, machine learning and autonomous vehicles, in key market segments like mobile, data center, client, consumer, industrial, graphics, automotive, and networking. HR Transformation Consultant Job Description
A global leader in consulting, technology services and digital transformation, Capgemini is at the forefront of innovation to address the entire breadth of clients' opportunities in the evolving world of cloud, digital and platforms. Building on its strong 50+ year heritage and deep industry-specific expertise, Capgemini enables organizations to realize their business ambitions through an array of services from strategy to operations. The Group reported 2017 global revenues of EUR 12.8 billion. Visit us at www.capgemini.com. People matter, results count.
Industry: Information Technology and Services
Company size: 200,000+ employees
Headquarters: Paris, France
Type: Public Company
Founded: 1967
Specialties: Consulting, Technology, Outsourcing, Business Technology, Process Consulting, Package Based Solutions, Custom Solution Development, Application Management, Business Information Management, and Artificial Intelligence

Join Capgemini and drive automation and innovation for leading global organizations and corporations. Business is not usual. Today we see multiple shifts occurring simultaneously. Shifts that are broad, complex, and at high velocity and are driving new levels of disruption and value creation. The risks of not acting or acting in yesterday’s innovation paradigms are far too great. The current situation demands doing something beyond the ordinary. Organizations must confront the new realities and develop an intrinsic ability to apply innovation.
Capgemini’s HR Transformation approach helps frame and implement the solution to modern problems in volatile, uncertain, complex, and ambiguous situations.
Principle Duties and Responsibilities
As a HR Transformation Consultant within Capgemini’s Business Services Global Business Line the following set of responsibilities and duties exists. Deliver agile strategies, recommendations and solutions that will overall improve our client’s HR employee experience and HR outcomes. Constantly promoting Capgemini’s Digital Employee Operations (DEO) and Digital Learning Operations (DLO) practice, its principles while leveraging our assets. Specifically, within our DEO offering, our HR Transformation Consultants, along with improving the employee experience, will drive to adjust and manage our client’s efforts to move transactional back-office to the front office. Additionally, engage our clients in rethinking their process and HR administration operations to drive the best experience at an optimal cost. With Capgemini’s intelligent automation, our consultants help our clients to make the best use of their HCM investment through a range of intelligent automation solutions with front office live chats, chatbot, and knowledge portals to back office Robotic Process Automation (RPA) offerings.
You will partner with clients to develop and deliver HR Operating Models that will improve HR administrative operations efficiencies. Support detail assessments, design sessions, design and build requirements, support development and implementation of the to-be HR organization processes and strategies to leverage Digital HCM platforms Workday, Success Factors, Oracle, and SAP.
Minimum 4 years of external consulting experience or other relevant experience related to successful delivery of HR Transformation.
Minimum 3 years of experience in one or more of the following HCM platforms: ServiceNow, Workday, Success Factors, Oracle, PeopleSoft, and SAP
Bachelor’s Degree required. Ability to independently understand and transition into Capgemini’s methodologies and approaches. Support sales cycle with RFP/RFI/RFQ development. Demonstrated ability to influence at all levels of management. Strategic thinker who understands the ever-changing Human Resource market. Demonstrated ability to transition HR Services to BPO delivery centers. Ability to build, develop and implement and engage in new service delivery approaches; possibly different from the status quo. Comfort in identifying and communicating complex problems; takes an analytical and creative approach with problem solving. Energetic, passionate, highly self-motivated, collaborative, organized individual driven to execute flawlessly in a fast-paced, ever changing, dynamic environment. Experienced with creating thoughtful presentations in clear action driven and outcome-oriented ways. Ability to meet travel requirements where needed.

At Northrop Grumman we develop cutting-edge technology that preserves freedom and advances human discovery. Our pioneering and inventive spirit has enabled us to be at the forefront of many technological advancements in our nation's history - from the first flight across the Atlantic Ocean, to stealth bombers, to landing on the moon. We continue to innovate with developments from launching the first commercial flight to space, to discovering the early beginnings of the universe. Our employees are not only part of history, they're making history.

Northrop Grumman Mission Systems seeks an innovative, high-energy, and passionate candidate to join the team as a BD Operations Analyst focused on supporting business development and capture teams across the enterprise. The qualified applicant will lead BD operations activities as part of the Artificial Intelligence (AI) Campaign. Critical to the success of this role is demonstrated relationship building and ability to influence at all levels of the organization. Supports Proposals and RFI responses across the enterprise with AI related content e.g. past performance, proof points, capabilities.
In coordination with AI architects, domain, and customer SMEs, develops marketing materials to be used in customer engagement activities.

Support market and competitor assessment efforts pertaining to AI technologies.
Manages the enterprise-wide AI business pipeline.
Aligns AI technology areas to key programs and captures
Performs analysis and assessment of the pipeline and develops reports for leadership
Collects data from internal tools (i.e. Workbench) and coordinates inputs from strategic programs across the enterprise.

5+ years' experience in a business development or operational role.
Dynamic self-starter with strong attention to detail and the ability to function independently.

Strong problem solving and analytical skills
