The Role
Shell Power and the Energy Transition

Shell is a leader in the energy transition towards a low-carbon future. We aim to cut the net carbon footprint of our business and energy products by 65% by 2050. Shell is investing $1-2 billion a year as we look for commercial investments in new and fast-growing segments of the energy transition.

Central to Shell’s energy transition strategy is developing a leading global clean power business. Our Power strategy focuses on meeting commercial, industrial and residential customer needs, bolstered by our activities in generation, power trading and marketing, retail energy, distributed energy resources and grid services, as well as our ability to optimize supply and demand across our large asset and customer portfolio. We’re also deploying low-carbon energy projects, including wind, solar, storage and natural gas.

Shell has demonstrated for more than a century its ability to transform and grow its energy sources, products and services to support societal development and evolution. Our Shell Power business is now combining our experience, partnerships and technical know-how to enable new ways to continue powering progress towards a more sustainable energy future.

Shell Energy Platform


The Shell Energy Platform organization is leading Shell’s efforts to design, develop, deliver and maintain a global energy management platform that unlocks value across Shell’s Power business. Shell Energy Platform aims to enable Shell’s efforts to harness the potential in its vast fleet of customers, energy assets, and power trading capabilities to deliver value across the energy industry value chain
.
The Shell Energy Platform organization is a nimble, cross-functional, deeply technical and passionate group that embodies the speed and agility of a startup while embracing the scale of one of the largest companies in the world. Achieving a balance between agility and global scale provides unique opportunities, and Shell Energy Platform borrows from best-in-class product development, continuous delivery, and commercialization approaches while adapting them to Shell’s unique global scale.

Shell Energy Platform is empowered to coordinate and align Shell’s energy management platform objectives, strategies, and execution approaches across the company, as well as to design, deliver and maintain a mission critical component of Shell’s ability to deliver differentiated products, offerings and capabilities across its expanding global footprint.

Responsibilities

The Principal Engineer, ML Engineering will lead ML engineering activities for the Shell Energy Platform and significantly contribute to data science, data engineering, optimization engineering, orchestration engineering and ML Ops efforts. This experienced engineer will grow and optimize this critical technical foundation for Shell Energy Platform, and will work across Shell’s global power business, suite of portfolio companies, and enterprise Centers of Excellence to deliver outsized value. Responsibilities include:
Lead ML engineering efforts for Shell Energy Platform
Serve as the senior ML engineering expert for a global platform and global commercial operations that rely on best-in-class ML techniques, software engineering and MLOps.
Serve as the Shell Energy Platform’s evangelist on best practice ML engineering principles, techniques, tools, and processes. Engage on and inform enterprise-level ML engineering standards, techniques, principles, tools and processes across Shell.
Serve as technical architect for designing capabilities that accelerate development speed, value creation, and asset reusability for data scientists across the globe.
Guide team delivery and increase throughput on development of ML engineering capabilities and features, as well as commercial project delivery.
Guide and develop a high-performing ML engineering team
Team – oversee and develop the emerging Shell Energy Platform ML engineering team.
Culture – develop and nurture an empathetic team culture based on respect, collaboration, equal opportunity, diversity, and recognition of strong contributions.
Collaboration – Work closely and align principles, tools and techniques with strategy, product management, software engineering, architecture, solution delivery, and commercial teams across Shell Energy Platform and Shell.
Process – Embrace best practices in ML engineering, product management, product development, engineering, and user support to deliver outstanding team results.
Professional development – support motivating, developing and retaining talent, maintaining a deep talent bench and developing team capabilities needed to succeed.
Recruiting – support proactive recruitment of exceptional talent, maintaining a rich pipeline of talent to quickly bring onto the team.
Contribute significantly to Data Science, Data Science Infrastructure, Optimization and MLOps
Data Science – support development of Energy Platform’s data science capabilities, including design of frameworks, techniques and tools leveraged across our user base.
Data Science infrastructure – support design and delivery of cloud, data and compute infrastructure for data science, ML engineering, optimization, orchestration and ML Ops.
Optimization – support design and delivery of optimization capabilities, including design of frameworks, techniques and tools leveraged across our user base.
MLOps – support MLOps activities that underpin our delivery and support efforts.
Contribute as senior technical leader of Shell Energy Platform
Serve as a technical senior leader of the Shell Energy Platform team, providing expertise, support, and leadership across the team.
Support team strategy, culture, planning, productivity and advocacy activities.

Requirements
At least 10 years of experience that informs machine learning engineering capabilities in complex energy software solutions with a globally distributed user base.
Advanced technical degree strongly preferred (e.g. PhD in computer science, engineering, data science, etc.) or equivalent experience in relevant field.
Demonstrated technical expertise and leadership across data science, data engineering, software engineering, orchestration, optimization and infrastructure domains.
Demonstrated technical expertise in theory and application of machine learning and artificial intelligence techniques and orchestrations, with preference to application in the energy domain.
Development competency in distributed systems, streaming data and functional programming.
Development competency across a breadth of languages, frameworks and tooling, such as Python, ProgR, Kubernetes, Kubeflow, JavaScript/JVM, Scala, Akka, Reactive Streams, Kafka, etc.
Development competency in data engineering and storage, including across breadth of tools such as S3, RDS, EFS, No-SQL, graph db, Spark, etc.
Experience in energy management domain is a plus, with comfort in energy asset optimization, asset control and data flow loops, and wholesale electricity market applications
Company Description
Shell is a global group of energy and petrochemical companies with about 84,000 employees across more than 70 countries. We aim to meet the world’s growing need for more and cleaner energy solutions in ways that are economically, environmentally and socially responsible. We have expertise in exploration, production, refining and marketing of oil and natural gas, and the manufacturing and marketing of chemicals. As a global energy company operating in a challenging world, we set high standards of performance and ethical behaviors. We are judged by how we act and how we live up to our core values of honesty, integrity and respect for people. Our Business Principles are based on these. They promote trust, openness, teamwork and professionalism, as well as pride in what we do and how we conduct business. Building on our core values, we aspire to sustain a diverse and inclusive culture where everyone feels respected and valued, from our employees to our customers and partners. A diverse workforce and an inclusive work environment are vital to our success, leading to greater innovation and better energy solutions.

Technical Program Manager
Location: Salt Lake City, UT
The Technical Program Manager serves an instrumental role in delivering NICE inContact software features to the marketplace. The Technical Program Manager will help drive, plan and coordinate software development activities from concept to completion. This person is responsible for participating in and leading multiple engineering teams, sometimes in multiple countries, to implement and deliver the product vision while removing roadblocks and ensuring success. This is a leadership role that owns the development program.

Major Functions/Responsibilities
The Technical Program Manager acts as the program leader on a leadership team and collaborates with Product and R&D leaders to structure a program into actionable work items for Architects, Engineers, and Quality Assurance Engineers.
The Technical Program Manager executes the product vision through the software development lifecycle to ensure program goals are met.
Interface with teams throughout the company to drive, plan, and implement software objectives.
Work closely with Product and R&D stakeholders to ensure each Software Development Life Cycle plans and delivers content at sprint and release planning levels.
Provide timely project and program status updates, risks and issues to all stakeholders.
Coordinate with Release Management to schedule, communicate and drive releases onto each environment.
Coordinate with Go-To-Market teams for product launches and technical documentation.
Create and communicate visual layouts and proof-of-concepts integrating Jira/Confluence for real-time communication.
Occasional travel, as needed.
Coach Agile principles to Development Scrum Masters
Communicate in an effective and professional way with customers in and outside of NICE inContact.
This job description is not intended to be all-inclusive, and employee will also perform other reasonable related business duties as assigned by immediate supervisor and other management as required.
This organization reserves the right to revise or change job duties as the need arises. This job description does not constitute a written or implied contract of employment.
Experience Requirement
4-5+ years working in a key software development lifecycle role4+ years Technical Program or Product Management experience using formal techniques and principles
Experience communicating and negotiating with Director and above personnel
Proactive, responsive and committed to removing roadblocks to fulfill timelines
Strategic thinker, consensus builder
Capable of building Jira and Confluence dashboard integrations
Excellent written and verbal communications skills
Preference for those with SaaS technical program management experience
Preference for those with international experience
Preference for those with AWS tech stack knowledge
Preference for those with partner/VAR/OEM/reseller experience

Experience Preferred:

Experience working with Enterprise software requirements and Cloud/SaaS architecture
Understanding the difference between passive vs active program management
Experience with multiple Agile methodologies
Experience leading globally dispersed teams
Experience with hardware and software reliability programs
Experience with engineering, software development, and operational methodologies
PMP certification

ABOUT NICE inContact: NICE inContact makes it easy and affordable for organizations around the globe to provide exceptional customer experiences while meeting key business metrics. NICE inContact provides the world’s No. 1 cloud customer experience platform, NICE inContact CXone™, combining best-in-class Omnichannel Routing, Workforce Optimization, Analytics, Automation and Artificial Intelligence on an Open Cloud Foundation. NICE inContact is a part of NICE (Nasdaq: NICE), the worldwide leading provider of both cloud and on-premises enterprise software solutions.

job_title: Applications Service Desk Manager (ServiceNow) with TS/SCI
job_description:
Job Description
Are you an Innovative Service Desk Leader with Big Data Analytics experience, looking to join a passionate team of industry leading individuals focused on creating a new Big Data Analytics Platform?
CACI is currently looking for an Applications Service Desk Manager (SDM) with Big Data Analytics experience to join our TALOS (Transforming All-Source Analysis with Location-Based Object Services) Program supporting the Defense Intelligence Agency (DIA) client located in Northern Virginia and Aurora, Colorado!
Join this dynamic team of individuals supporting the best practices in Big Data, Data Analysis, Artificial Intelligence (AI), Machine Learning (ML), and advanced analytics to enhance the DoD’s and the IC’s information processes and technical architectures.
The Service Desk Manager will have the opportunity to lead, plan, direct, and coordinate the End User Service Desk team’s activities for the TALOS Program.
The TALOS program thrives in a culture of innovation and is constantly seeking individuals who can bring creative ideas to solve complex problems, both technical and procedural at the team and portfolio level. The ability to be adaptable and to work constructively with a technically diverse and geographically separated team is crucial.
What You’ll Get to Do:
Provide leadership, guidance, and demonstrate a mature task management approach in support of a suite of operational applications for the Intelligence Community and DoD.
Identify and assemble the appropriate blend of resources to meet program needs and requirements, including subcontractor selection
Plan, schedule, monitor, and report on service desk activities related to the program
Facilitate status review meetings among project team members and clients
Coach and counsel members of the end-user support services team to accomplish program goals, meet established schedules, and resolve technical/operational issues
Establish appropriate metrics for measuring key program criteria
Identify and recommend contingency measures
Facilitate the creation of communication plan, ensuring that appropriate information is exchanged among key stakeholders
Advise senior management on project management capability and risk
Work closely with clients and customers to assess their needs, provide information or assistance, resolve their problems, and/or satisfy their expectations.
Recommend controls by identifying problems; writing improved procedures
Perform daily, weekly, and monthly reviews and analyses of current processes using operational metrics and reports
Suggest changes to senior management using analytics to support your recommendations. Actively participate in the implementation of approved changes
Create informative, actionable, and repeatable reporting that highlights relevant business trends and opportunities for improvement
Conduct insightful, ad hoc analyses to investigate ongoing or one-time operational issues
You’ll Bring These Qualifications:
This role REQUIRES a TS/SCI security clearance
(B.S.) in Information Management Systems, Computer Science, or a related discipline. Equivalent professional experience will be considered in lieu of degree
7 plus years of experience overseeing the day-to-day activities of service-desk operations in support of an IT Service Management Operation
Twelve years of Federal Customer Support Experience
Experience providing management, implementing policies and procedures regarding how incidents and request are identified, received, documented, distributed, and completed
Ability to design, test and deploy Remedy Self Service and remote support tools
Experience providing data and reports of KPI's and trends to End User Service Director in daily reporting formats
Exposure to increasing first call resolution, implementing self service capabilities and meeting service desk service level agreements.
Expertise in the Agile Software Development Life cycle
Familiarity with service desk technologies including IT Service Management (prefer ServiceNow)
Demonstrated experience and proven success implementing changes, processes, and standards to improve an enterprise-wide service desk
These Qualifications Would be Nice to Have:
Experience fulfilling the DIA mission in support of the COCOMs
Demonstrated successes with SAFe methodologies
Experience with Jira
Help Desk Institute or Service Desk Institute Service Operations Manager Certification
Experience providing performance-based customer service support against multiple performance metrics in the Federal Government
What We can Offer You:
BIT Systems Inc. a CACI company, provides all of the benefits of a small company but with the stability of a multi-billion dollar company. As part of this, we offer a fairly unique benefits package. Basically, BITS benefits equate to 50% of your salary on TOP of your base salary. The first part is a tax-qualified profit sharing retirement plan to which BITS annually contributes up to 25% of your base salary (not in excess of applicable IRS limits) to your retirement account under the plan. The second part consists of BITS' Individual Benefit Account Plan (the IBA), which is used for premiums, medical reimbursements, dependent care, education and BITS' Paid Time Off (PTO) Policy. Both components of the benefits package are paid for by the company and do not come out of your take home pay. For more information please check out: http://www.caci.com/bit-systems/benefits.shtml
Our work environment is mission-focused but relaxed, is professional but casual, and requires individual responsibility within team constructs. We offer an environment where business casual and shorts/flip flops work side by side successfully; we let you be you. DACOHP
We’ve been named a Best Place to Work by the Washington Post and the Denver Post.
Our employees value the flexibility at CACI that allows them to balance quality work and their personal lives.
We offer competitive benefits and learning and development opportunities.
We are mission-oriented and ever vigilant in aligning our solutions with the nation’s highest priorities.
For over 55 years, the principles of CACI’s unique, character-based culture have been the driving force behind our success
TALOS
Job Location
US-Reston-VA-DENVER


CACI employs a diverse range of talent to create an environment that fuels innovation and fosters continuous improvement and success. At CACI, you will have the opportunity to make an immediate impact by providing information solutions and services in support of national security missions and government transformation for Intelligence, Defense, and Federal Civilian customers. CACI is proud to provide dynamic careers for employees worldwide. CACI is an Equal Opportunity Employer - Females/Minorities/Protected Veterans/Individuals with Disabilities.

Varo is on a mission to redefine banking so it's easy for everyone to make smart choices with their money. Our app offers bank accounts and high-yield savings accounts that don’t cost a thing, tools to help you manage your money and save automatically, and invitation-only personal loans at competitive rates. On the contrary, traditional banks charge fees, offer next-to-nothing savings rates, and don’t work with their customer’s best interests in mind.

Varo is distinct from other fintechs: With preliminary approval for a bank charter from the Office of the Comptroller of the Currency (OCC), we're on our way to becoming the first mobile-centric national bank in the country. Our unique team combines the best people in tech and banking, and we’re wildly passionate about keeping our customers happy by helping them manage and grow their money. Based in San Francisco and privately held, Varo has raised $189M to date, led by Warburg Pincus and The Rise Fund / TPG Growth.

ABOUT THE AI and ML TEAM

The Artificial Intelligence and Machine Learning (AIML) team at Varo is a small, passionate team driven to help people improve their financial lives with modern state of the art AI and ML technology. A lot of our services are implemented in Python and Java/Kotlin. Over the next year we will be building some key pieces of our ML infrastructure such as a centralized feature store and model service so if you are looking for a growth opportunity come join us! We are driven by building products which will help improve the financial well being of our customers lives. We value collaboration, ownership, growth, initiative and the importance of thinking like an engineer with the curiosity of a data scientist.

ABOUT THE PRINCIPAL MACHINE LEARNING ROLE

As a Principal Machine Learning Engineer you will play a key role in driving and executing the vision of Varo as a leader in AI and Machine Learning. You will help build scalable, reliable and performant machine learning systems with all the required monitoring and alerting. You will be responsible for owning project(s) from design to deployment. This is initially an individual contributor role but could evolve into a leadership role within the team.

WHAT YOU'LL DO
Build and deploy production-ready code that is high quality, robust, efficient, and maintainable

Alvarez & Marsal is a leading independent global professional services firm, specializing in providing turnaround management, performance improvement and corporate advisory services, is seeking to expand its Private Equity Performance Improvement (PEPI) – M&A Services team. With more than 3,500 professionals based in 40 locations across North America, Europe, Asia, and Latin America, our firm excels in problem solving and value creation. Drawing on a strong operational heritage and hands-on-approach, our professionals work closely with organizations and stakeholders to help tackle complex business issues and maximize value.
 A&M’s Private Equity Performance Improvement Services (PEPI) practice, with offices throughout the US, focuses on serving upper middle market and large cap private equity firms who have engaged A&M to help improve operating results at their portfolio companies. The companies we serve are upper middle market in the $50 million to $1 billion plus range.
Our PEPI services include:
Robotic Process Automation (RPA)
Merger Integration & Carve-outs
IT- pre-acquisition diligence
IT- post-acquisition implementations and integration
Interim Management
Rapid Results
Supply Chain
CFO Services
Private Equity Focused Professionals
We bring a structured and disciplined approach to create and capture value. We provide private equity buyers with a broad continuum of knowledge and tools for mergers, acquisitions, carve-outs, joint ventures and alliances.
The PEPI M&A Services team works across the full spectrum of the deal lifecycle from pre-deal technology, operational and synergy reviews, through 'Day-1' planning, to post-deal implementations. Our services include due diligence (IT and operational), merger integration / carve-out planning and execution, transition service agreement negotiation & governance, ERP implementations, IT operations & cost reduction, SDLC, enterprise architecture and robotic process automation.
The PEPI M&A Services group is a growing business targeting high growth in the next two to four years. We offer excellent opportunities for career advancement and build leadership skills. The leadership team is focused on providing development opportunities, training and exposure to international business assignments.
Director:

Develop requirements for the design, development, testing and implementation of RPA bots that will interact with multiple third-party applications

Provide on-going operational support including upgrades, defect fixes and any Process change activities
Lead development teams utilizing Agile/Scrum methodologies

Software development / programming experience, including agile software development experience

Excellent client relationship skills and business development

Job Details
Are you a Telcom and/or Media industry expert who has deep knowledge and a point of view in transforming the customer experience in the Telcom and/or Media industries? Do you have experience in enterprise software in the industry? Are you a compelling communicator and passionate about driving growth in the Telcom and Media industries? Are you a experienced business professional with the ability to think and act strategically?


If so, we are looking for a leader to join our Communications & Media Industry Solutions organization to grow our global Telcom and Media business industry vertical. This senior role requires a thoughtful point of view about the Telcom and Media industries, as well as the ability to develop and drive industry specific solutions into the market, drive the business at scale, foster relationships with Telcom and Media senior executives, and work closely with our Comms and Media account teams on strategic opportunities.


We are looking for a proven track record in the following three key attributes:


1. Industry Experience: We are seeking an industry expert on 360 degree customer engagement and employee experience with direct experience in or selling to the Telcom and/or Media industries. The role requires 10+ years of working in/selling into Telcom and/or Media organizations, as either a subject matter expert or as a senior executive from the industry. Experience in Telcom/Media, B2B sales, B2C sales, retail, call center service, field service and artificial intelligence (AI) driven customer and employee experience design preferred. Deep knowledge in both comms and media a big plus.

Understand industry challenges, systems landscapes, positioning, use cases, areas of opportunity, and sales tactics. Deep understanding of customer systems of engagement, technical architectures, key process flows and design is preferred.

Segment Leader: Proven ability growing a global Telcom and Media industry segment with successful experience leading a team to develop, own and drive a Telcom and Media solution set that differentiates Salesforce to continue to be a leader in the industry category. Proven ability to develop short and long term plans to achieve solution revenue targets, engaging with large direct and matrixed Sales, Pre-Sales, Corporate Marketing, Architects, and other cross-functional teams as needed. Iodine Software equips healthcare teams with the most innovative tools to solve some of their toughest problems in clinical documentation. By leveraging new technologies like Natural Language Processing, Machine Learning, and Artificial Intelligence, our platform drives significant improvements in how hospitals document patient health conditions, in turn positively influencing team performance and patient outcomes.


Our client base is growing rapidly, and we need talented, dedicated individuals to help drive our continued success. Our Implementation Managers are responsible for the success of our customer deployments. They are tech-savvy, resourceful individuals with the ability to make quick connections and foster client relationships at all levels of an organization, from executives to end-users. If you are passionate about problem solving, focused on driving results, are a respected collaborator, and consider yourself a technologist at heart, this position may be right for you.


What You’ll Do


Serve as both project manager and technical expert on implementations of Iodine Software solutions
Synthesize and understand complex data sets from new clients and ensure client information is mapped to the Iodine system
Configure, test, and deploy hosted customer implementations of our software
Assist in the deployment of upgrades of our software for entire client base
Collaborate with product and engineering teams to continuously improve the offering
Partner with client success team to ensure solutions are aligned with long-term strategy
Lead customer calls and meetings
Identify dependencies and communicate consistently with project team to ensure smooth & timely deployments
Provide ongoing business and technical support to existing customers
Work with marketing, development, and sales as needed to continuously improve customer satisfaction


What You’ll Need


Bachelor’s degree from a relevant program, with strong record of academic achievement
Minimum 3.0 GPA
Strong attention to detail, highly organized with an absolute focus on quality
1+ years’ experience with software implementations
Proven track record of managing multiple, competing priorities while consistently exceeding goals

Outstanding oral and written communication skills
Proven ability to adapt to different environments, build strong relationships, and influence others positively

Team player DNA with a desire to solve for the interests of our clients and of our business
Positive, self-starter attitude with desire to exceed expectations and ability to work extended hours when necessary
Attention to detail, highly organized, with an absolute focus on quality of work

What You’ll Get:


This is a unique opportunity to join a close-knit, rapidly growing team and help us build and scale our services organization. You will be learning the latest technologies that are pushing the boundaries of our industry and impacting the way medical teams document patient health conditions. You will be a first point of client contact, directly influencing the way clients experience our product and our team. You will interface with all aspects of the business and have exposure to many learning opportunities – from implementation management to machine learning analysis to software development.


See Something, Do Something


At Iodine, we are incredibly privileged to be entrusted with an enormous amount of Protected Health Information (PHI) amounting more than 90 million lives. Inherent to our culture is the need to live up to that trust in everything we do. Security is a primary responsibility shared by every Iodine employee and we expect everyone to honor that responsibility. That includes abiding by our security policies, being constantly vigilant to possible risks to the privacy and safety of the information given to our care and bringing forward any concerns about security.


You must be currently authorized to work full-time in the United States on a permanent basis.

The School of Electrical Engineering and Computer Science (EECS), within the College of Engineering at Oregon State University, invites applications for Instructors in the Computer Science (CS) undergraduate program. Available Instructor positions are fixed-term, non-tenure track, 12 month full-time (1.0 FTE) positions, with the possibility of renewal at the discretion of the School Head. The closing date for this posting may be adjusted without prior notification to applicants.

The School of Electrical Engineering and Computer Science is a leader in undergraduate educational innovation. With programs including TekBots, the online Post-Baccalaureate degree in CS, and the Center for Applied Software Solutions (CASS), EECS engages students at all levels for real-world experiences and opportunities. With a strong research strength, teaching coursework is continually improved to respond to the most current needs of industry and academia.

The OSU College of Engineering is committed to being recognized as a national model of inclusivity and collaboration. We strive to develop a community of faculty, students, and staff that is inclusive, collaborative, diverse and centered on student success. As such, we seek applicants who will broaden our capacity to advance student success across individual identities, racial/ethnic categories and socioeconomic backgrounds.
Position Duties
90% Instruction
Computer Science instructors prepare and teach course materials in one or more areas of CS including, but not limited to, the following: Introductory Programming, Data Structures, Algorithms, Databases, Artificial Intelligence, Operating Systems, Networking, Security, Web and Cloud Development, and Mobile Development.
Responsibilities include equipping students with the required skill set, assessing student performance, and/or preparing students to be successful leaders in their chosen profession.
Instructors may assist in driving curriculum design and development.
Responsibilities also include creating an inclusive classroom (e.g., mentoring and supporting students from diverse backgrounds, and fostering affirming classroom interactions across different and challenging structural/cultural barriers that limit movement towards social equity in engineering education and practice).
5% Supervision
Instructors provide leadership, supervision, and direction for graduate and undergraduate teaching assistants, as well as student workers.
5% Professional Development
Instructors engage in training, continuing education, and other professional development activities contributing to effectiveness as an instructor.
Minimum/Required Qualifications
Master’s Degree in Computer Science, Electrical Engineering or related field
Experience teaching, mentoring and facilitating learners, inside or outside a classroom setting.Deep understanding in one or more areas of need in the CS program (specifically: Introductory Programming, Data Structures, Algorithms, Databases, Artificial Intelligence, Operating Systems, Networking, Security, Web and Cloud Development, and Mobile Development)
Demonstrable commitment to promoting and enhancing diversity.Excellent written and verbal English skills.
Preferred (Special) Qualifications
Doctorate in Computer Science, Electrical Engineering or related field.Strong interpersonal communication skills.

Introduction
Axtria is a global provider of cloud software and data analytics to the Life Sciences industry. We help Life Sciences companies transform the product commercialization journey to drive sales growth and improve healthcare outcomes for patients. We are acutely aware that our work impacts millions of patients and lead passionately to improve their lives.
About us……..
Since our founding in 2010, technology innovation has been our winning differentiation, and we continue to leapfrog competition with platforms that deploy Artificial Intelligence and Machine Learning. Our cloud-based platforms - Axtria DataMax™, Axtria InsightsIQ™, Axtria SalesIQ™, and Axtria MarketingIQ™ - enable customers to efficiently manage data, leverage data science to deliver insights for sales and marketing planning, and manage end-to-end commercial operations. With customers in over 30 countries, Axtria is one of the biggest global commercial solutions providers in the Life Sciences industry. We continue to win industry recognition for growth and are featured in some of the most aspirational lists - INC 5000, Deloitte FAST 500, NJBiz FAST 50, SmartCEO Future 50, Red Herring 100, and several other growth and technology awards.
Axtria is looking for exceptional talent to join our rapidly growing global team. People are our biggest perk! Our transparent and collaborative culture offers a chance to work with some of the brightest minds in the industry. Axtria Institute, our in-house university, offers the best training in the industry and an opportunity to learn in a structured environment. A customized career progression plan ensures every associate is setup for success and able to do meaningful work in a fun environment. We want our legacy to be the leaders we produce for the industry. Will you be next?
Candidates will be expected to have familiarity with application of analytics to sales and marketing problems such as:-
Commercial Model Design, Sales Force Sizing and Structure
Patient analytics using Real-World Data sources such as anonymized longitudinal patient claims data, lab/diagnostic testing data, etc.
Segmentation, Targeting, , Promotion Response Modeling, Marketing Mix Optimization, Digital Analytics
Market Access Analytics incl. pull-through analysis, Payer-plan segmentation, Rebate optimization, etc
Territory Alignment, Sales Call Planning, Incentive Compensation
Responsibilities: -
Lead cross-functional teams to pilot and implement client solutions with a focus on client satisfaction across a solution area and industry verticals.
Leverage and customize Axtria's proprietary analytics to client needs, resulting in exceptional client value from every project.
Manage multiple concurrent projects ensuring exceptional client satisfaction and on-time delivery.
Work closely with the Technology and Product Management groups to ensure ongoing refinement of our analytical tools and development of new client solutions.
Make presentations and recommendations to clients on optimal customer, sales and marketing strategies and tactics.
Develop and maintain skills to the highest standards consistent with best practices and emerging trends in analytics.
Contribute to Axtria's development of new solutions and analytical models.
Recruit, manage and mentor a team of analysts
Required Skills/Experience: -
A degree in Engineering, Computer Science or a related field with 6-10 years of prior relevant work experience. Graduate degree is preferred.
Relevant expertise in using analytic tools such as Excel, ProgR, SAS, SPSS, SQL, Python, Tableau, Alteryx, and able to quickly master new packages when needed
Strong analytical skills, excellent communication skills and the ability to communicate actionable analytical findings to a non-technical audience in clear and concise language.
Proven ability to frame a business issue, design the right solution, and deliver results.
Ability to lead projects and teams
Experience with the application of statistical estimation techniques and / or optimization techniques
Exposure to / experience working with large data sets.
Familiarity / expertise in using Pharmaceutical data sets such a prescriber-plan data, patient level data, transactional claims, EMR/EHR data, SPP Hub data, diagnostic data etc. is a plus.
Logistics and Location: Thousand Oaks, CA

Snap Inc. is a camera company. We believe that reinventing the camera represents our greatest opportunity to improve the way people live and communicate. Our products empower people to express themselves, live in the moment, learn about the world, and have fun together.
We're looking for a Product Manager to join Snap Inc! We're looking for someone who has a ML-focused background that can leverage and apply machine learning technology to shape the future of our paid products. Working from our Santa Monica headquarters, you’ll partner closely with Engineering in building out scalable ranking systems and models to improve ads personalization and advertiser performance. You’ll become the internal voice of our revenue-generating products by focusing on synthesizing external research, internal analytics, and cross-functional team feedback into a long-term product vision and near-term execution plan .
What you'll do:
Develop and launch machine learning centric products and services that help our broader business, while being conscientious and cautious of impacts on core user experience
Define the business goals and own the results for your product area
Manage a long-term roadmap for internal tools, data and analytics, and revenue-related products and improvements
Solicit ideas and feedback, gather requirements, write specs, create wireframes and workflows, and coordinate cross-functionally
Drive strategic product decisions via evaluation of market trends and meticulous retrospective and prospective analysis of product and revenue performance
Become the internal voice and representative for revenue-related products
Knowledge, Skills & Abilities:
Ability to initiate and drive projects to completion with minimal guidance
Ability to communicate the results of analyses in a clear and effective manner
Exceptional analytical skills
Minimum Qualifications:
BA/BS from a leading undergraduate institution in CS/EE/General Engineering or Economics/Physics/Psychology/Math
3+ years of product management or product marketing experience at a consumer or enterprise technology company
Deep knowledge of machine learning/artificial intelligence/computer vision
Preferred Qualifications:
Experience building and applying ML technologies to large scale problems
Experience with product design, software development, or interaction design
Experience with brands and agencies in the digital advertising space
Familiarity with SQL, Python, ProgR, Minitab, or SPSS

Bristol-Myers Squibb is a global Biopharma company committed to a single mission: to discover, develop, and deliver innovative medicines focused on helping millions of patients around the world in disease areas such as oncology, cardiovascular, immunoscience and fibrosis.
Join us and make a difference. We hire the best people and provide them with a work environment that places a premium on diversity, integrity, collaboration and personal development. Through a culture of inclusion, we create a better, more productive work environment. We believe that the diverse experiences and perspectives of all our employees help to drive innovation and transformative business results.
The GPS (Global Product and Supply) Analytics and Data Science team within Business Insights and Analytics partners with the BMS GPS organization to support data analytics for all key functions within GPS including Manufacturing Operations. GPS Analytics focuses on answering key business questions that will drive prioritized business decisions using advanced analytics and data science. The Manufacturing Operations organization at BMS supports drug product manufacturing from commercialization through end of lifecycle. Manufacturing Operations scope includes Plant Operations, Science & Technology (MS&T), Internal Manufacturing, External Manufacturing and Network Strategy and Business Operations. The Manager, Manufacturing Operations Analytics will partner with the Associate Director of Manufacturing Operations Analytics to answer key business questions within the Internal Manufacturing Operations space with an emphasis on the Biologics Operations. The successful candidate has a background in Manufacturing Operations and has expertise in one or more of the following areas: data analytics, data visualization, statistics, machine learning, predictive modeling, artificial intelligence, Python and ProgR, coding, ProgR, Shiny app development, and Tableau/Spotfire dashboard development.
The Manager, Manufacturing Operations Analytics and Data Science will partner with the Associate Director of Manufacturing Operations Analytics to establish core capabilities within the team, namely:
Supporting Business Decisions – Work closely with business stakeholders to proactively identify and address priority business questions within Manufacturing Operations.
Driving Analytics and Capabilities – Answer key business questions using innovative analytic and data science techniques, assist with establishing core analytical and data science capabilities, standards, processes and methodologies for the team.
Driving Team Productivity and Operational Excellence – Play a critical role in managing team productivity, timeliness and quality of deliverables. Ensure consistent adoption of standards, processes and methodologies by contracted or other team staff. Continuously seek opportunities and approaches for enhancing the team’s overall productivity.
Supporting Business Decisions
Identifies and contextualizes critical business issues, working to embed an objective and unbiased point of view into the business conversation.
Drives the application of fact based decision making for key questions within the Manufacturing portfolio enabling priority business choices.
Develops and maintains a deep understanding of Manufacturing, and plant operations business priorities, meeting agreed upon analytics deliverables / timing.
Driving Analytics and Capabilities
Designs, develops and implements a broad array of business analytics that solve complex problems in a computationally efficient and statistically effective manner.
Identifies new opportunities to further leverage analytics, data and analytical tools.
Ensures best practice adoption within stated areas of responsibility, applying appropriate levels of technical capability, standardization and subject matter expertise.
Proactively manages planned and ad hoc analytics requests, ensuring consistent quality and timeliness in delivery to business stakeholders.
Leverages standards for the provision of analytics to support planning and decision making processes, and utilizes appropriate escalation processes.
Provides input/feedback and works actively to improve and enhance capabilities related to the GPS BIA team
Supports culture of analytics and fact-based decision making through the utilization of standard methodologies and approaches.
Driving Team Productivity and Operational Excellence
Supervises and collaborates closely with external analytics contractors and vendors when applicable or assigned.
Conducts detailed team walkthroughs and peer review of team’s work to ensure quality, cross training and knowledge management within the team.
Ensures consistent adoption of standards, processes and methodologies by contracted or other team staff.
Authors detailed documentation that describes analytics tool development, assumptions and input data and any specialized data treatments. Authors user manual for dissemination within Manufacturing Operations user base.
List of minimum requirements
BA/BS required (quantitative area of study or engineering)
MSci, MEng or other Masters in quantitative area of study, analytics or data science preferred
Experience – Responsibility and minimum number of years
5+ years hands-on working in the area of data science, data analytics, data integration, reporting.
5+ years of hands-on experience with analytics, modeling platforms, data manipulation software and visualization tools (e.g. Advanced SQL, PL/SQL, ProgR, Python, SAP HANA, Spotfire, Tableau, Microsoft Suite, Hadoop, Redshift).
Experience working in the manufacturing space. Experience working in a GMP arena is a plus.
Experience interpreting analytical results and ascertaining implications to the business.
Experience interacting with business stakeholders understanding, anticipating, and fulfilling their insight/analytical information requirements.
Experience managing a team of contracted resources.
Competencies – knowledge, skills, abilities, other
Strong creative problem solving skills to answer key business questions.
Ability to work with diverse teams across organizational lines and structures.
Strong project management skills with demonstrated ability to lead multiple projects and priorities.
Strong analytical skills with substantial knowledge of data analysis & data engineering.
Strong written and verbal communication skills.
Ability to quickly gain and apply quality specific knowledge.
Ability to learn new tools quickly.
Proven ability to lead small teams/groups and manage a heavy workload.
Bristol-Myers Squibb recognizes the importance of balance and flexibility in our work environment. We offer a wide variety of competitive benefits, services and programs that provide our employees the resources to pursue their goals, both at work and in their personal lives.

Overview
Are you passionate about bringing AI (artificial intelligence) services into our daily lives? We are looking for product managers to bring their ideas to life and to build AI services for Samsung’s suite of devices including mobile, speakers, wearables, etc. In this position, you will be part of a collaborative team of world-class researchers and engineers in the field of AI technologies, encompassing voice assistant, computer vision, AR/VR, and robotics.
Come join the Samsung Bixby team and be part of the future of AI services. The position will be initially focused on voice services as well as new use cases that delight our consumers in the areas of voice and vision.
Position Summary:
The Product Manager will join the Global Product Management team. The Bixby global team works closely with global teams in Korea and local teams in Mountain View and San Jose across various internal organizations – including business, engineering, architecture, and linguists – to define requirements and roadmaps for Samsung Bixby. This product manager will champion the product design and realization from inception to launch and post-launch.
Responsibilities:
Contributing to the vision and strategy of our overall products and services.

Acting as Product Owner to drive clarity of the product to meet commercial and strategic goals.

Defining and articulating use cases/features/requirements for features that have been proposed.

Ensuring that features/requirements meet certain entry criteria before assignment to a release.

Soliciting and formalizing feedback from business teams and technology partners.

Ensuring adherence to Product Management processes related to change control, documentation, etc.

Company:

Samsung

Qualifications:

College degree in Computer Science or similar. MBA preferred.

5+ years of product management experience.

Strong market analysis skills.

Empathize deeply with our customers and advcatate for their needs

Excellent verbal and written communication skills.

Team player with exceptional time management skills.

Proven previous experience in end-to-end product lifecycle (concept through deployment and maintenance) is required.

Technical and business confidence to assert and/or defend positions regarding definition and priority of features.

Proactive, self-starter with the ability to multi-task and work independently at all levels in the organization.

Able to travel internationally (<25%).

Diploma

Level of experience (years):

Senior (5+ years of experience)

The Office of the CTO for Microsoft is chartered with understanding, shaping and accelerating technologies and their impact on Microsoft, industry and society in order to empower every person and every organization to achieve more. Whether it is providing insights company-wide, giving meaning to an “AI First” company, or helping to drive impact of “Intelligent Cloud/ Intelligent Edge Computing”, the Office of the CTO is down in the trenches, working with our engineering, field and strategy teams across the company. We gather information, synthesize best practices, drive cross-company workstreams, support cross-industry partnerships and engage in activities that inform the CTO and the SLT and move the needle on Microsoft’s strategic and technical direction.

The deputy office is focused on Scale H2 Technologies and includes highly technical, but cross-functional and highly independent leaders who accelerate leading edge technology to scalable, rapidly growing solutions. This team works across the company through connecting people, resources and ideas across organizations and disciplinary boundaries. We are the glue between the customer need + strategy + technical execution. We are the 1+1 >2.
Responsibilities
Responsibilities
Advanced Technology Advisor is an experienced technologist across hardware, software, networking, possessing scientific acumen, operations, and a passion for product.
Hands-on with cutting-edge technologies, jump-in directly into code, prototype, connect and improve on architectural components of solutions
Can understand and map technical architecture, hold their own with product teams
Has strong product acumen, usability research and user experience background
Can wade through and understand deep technical concepts, rationalize and align them across organizations
Is a strategic thinker, with through understanding of market trends, a passion for deep technical and market analysis and capable writer ready to present to C-Suite leaders
Work with Technical Teams, Business Development, Corporate Development leaders and M12, to align organization and accelerate scalability of growth businesses
Technically proficient in AI/ML, Intelligent Edge, Computer Vision Technology and 5G
Has a proven track record working on innovative technologies, contributing to important strategic technical projects
Strong operational program manager that leaves no stone unturned, but can communicate at the appropriate level of abstraction, a self-starter who can work in ambiguous environments, keeping the shared goals in mind
Qualifications
Qualifications
Required:
10+ years of experience in Technical/Engineering/ Technical Program Manager role with hands-on experience
Experience leading technical projects, shipping software, troubleshooting technical issues

Preferred:
Be respected by product and technical teams
Excellent communicator and EQ
Be able to lead through influence, work across teams at scale and feel confident engaging with executives
Artificial Intelligence, 5G, Intelligent Edge and IoT expertise
Cloud development at scale: Azure or similar
PhD or MS degree in Computer Science

At Marvin, we make windows and doors inspired by how you live so you're inspired to live well. We are driven by the momentum of four generations of innovation and excellence to imagine and create better ways of living. Our business reaches across the nation and our products are represented around the world. With our commitment to our local communities and to providing innovative solutions using new technology, we are always looking for ways to move our people, as well as our business, forward.

Marvin is in the midst of a digital transformation journey and actively pursuing highly optimized digital manufacturing and automation while simultaneously leveraging Human Centered Design to create innovative, disruptive, personalized and delightful new products and experiences for our employees, channel partners and customers. Our executive leadership has recognized the critical need to enhance our data capabilities and the role our overall data and analytics performance will play as a foundational cornerstone for this transformational journey. As a result we are searching for a highly talented executive to lead this critical technology function.

The primary objective for this position is to drive positive and impactful business outcomes through effective data architecture and optimization of the company’s data assets. This role will be responsible for partnering with business leaders to develop a strategic roadmap, inclusive of a data products and services approach, that delivers efficient, agile data operations and key business performance/decision analytics… powering the achievement of the company’s most important strategic priorities short and long term. The role will also ensure that key measures and protocols around data governance, compliance, security, quality, availability and consumability will be consistently and successfully implemented across the enterprise data ecosystem.

The successful candidate will lead Marvin’s data performance function but is also expected to be a strong contributor to the performance of the overall IT Leadership Team – a team anchored around the high-performance tenants of Trust, Healthy Debate, Commitment to Decisions, Performance Accountability and Results. Additionally, the successful candidate will be a purpose and values driven people leader, strategic and positive thinker and capable of concisely articulating a case for change while effectively rallying the organization to that end. They will also lead and develop the organization’s operational data, analytics data and data sciences teams to enable the organization to effectively mold and utilize data assets for the achievement of the desired manufacturing, automation, employee, channel-partner, customer and financial results.

Essential Job Functions

Leadership

Vision & Strategy
Develop and refine the enterprise strategic roadmap for data performance
Connect vision to actionable tactical objectives and project initiatives
Drive a connected and collaborative strategy across all Marvin leadership and business functions
Consolidate disparate business entity strategies to ensure optimal financial performance for the enterprise
Team Leadership & Development
Nurture an environment of vulnerability and trust, foster healthy debate, gain commitment, facilitate accountability and deliver desired results as a team
Support and promote implementation of EOS (Traction) management process within the data performance teams
Evaluate, develop and build the team in support of the strategic vision and roadmap
Coach and mentor team leaders to execute the playbook and drive overall team development and performance

Culture

Values and Culture Flag Bearer
Highly engaged in the business functions to identify and define data solution targets that empower the Marvin strategic business plan
Company purpose and values in action (Purpose: Imagine and Create Better Ways of Living; Values: Do the right thing, Be stronger together, Think differently, Raise the bar, Believe it’s possible)
Take an immersed position in the business and leverage observations to bring thought leadership around data and business performance
Be curious, insightful, good listener, humble, adaptable and results oriented (give away the credit, take the responsibility)
Innovation
Nurture an environment that encourages exploration and embraces fast intelligent failure
Promote the principles and adoption of Human Centered Design
Identify and implement leap-frog opportunities to rapidly enhance data performance capabilities
Identify high impact continuous improvement initiatives

Partnership

Strategic Mindset
Build partner alignment around high impact outcomes (ROI – place the right bets)
Thought leadership and influence (strategic point of view, socialize to gain alignment and buy-in)
Proactive partner (driving vs. reacting)
Decisions in context (present, near future, long term)
Relationships
Take an immersed position in the operational and channel landscapes
Earn respect of key business and technology stakeholders
Develop win-win strategic partnerships
Effectively communicate strategic plans and innovative ideas to IT and Marvin Leadership

Governance

Governance and Alignment
Deliver a highly collaborative and efficient data project work intake and prioritization governance process
Collaborate and ensure alignment on business and technical solution architecture to ensure the achievement of Marvin enterprise data strategies
Implement best practices for data performance, compliance, governance and data security

You are a good fit if you have:

EOE

The Company
Founded in 2010, Axtria is a global provider of cloud software and data analytics to the Life Sciences industry. We help Life Sciences companies transform the product commercialization journey to drive sales growth and improve healthcare outcomes for patients. We are acutely aware that our work impacts millions of patients and lead passionately to improve their lives.
Technology innovation has been our winning differentiation, and we continue to leapfrog the competition with platforms that deploy Artificial Intelligence and Machine Learning. With customers in over 30 countries, Axtria is one of the biggest global commercial solutions providers in the Life Sciences industry. We continue to win industry recognition for growth and are featured in some of the most aspirational lists – INC 5000, Deloitte FAST 500TM, NJBiz FAST 50, SmartCEO Future 50, Red Herring 100, and several other growth and technology awards.

The Role
The role of Director, Product Management is responsible for driving and delivering a world-class strategy for a suite of Axtria products. This person employs a unique blend of business & technical savvy, the drive to make vision a reality, and the desire to invest in the commercial success of their product. The Director of Product Management partners cross-functionally to define the vision of the product, product release requirements and execution strategies. Works closely with Engineering and UX teams to develop and drive delivery. This role works with marketing to define go-to-market strategy, helping them understand the product positioning, key benefits, and target customer. The Director Product Management also supports product marketing as an internal and external evangelist for the product, while also partnering with the direct sales & customer success teams, and key customers.
This is an individual contributor role with the potential to have people management responsibilities in the future as the company grows and the product portfolio expands.
This role reports to the Head of Product Management. Preferred location is Berkeley Heights, NJ. Travel expectation up to 25% as needed.

Key Responsibilities
Define, lead, and communicate product strategy in line with the business goals.
Ensure rapid pace of moving from strategy to execution of product initiatives.
Synthesize ideas on strategy, planning and execution to identify new market opportunities & create the next generation of products, building consensus and driving execution along the way.
Work within a team of Product Managers, Engineers and UX Designers to drive agile execution of new product launches. Develop a strong understanding of stakeholders to drive decisions.
Actively participate in Scrum ceremonies working with team members in the US as well as in India.
Ensure ongoing product growth and expansion by gaining and exploiting market feedback from customers and prospects.
Evaluate market share and drive competitive analysis across a suite of products.

Required Experience/Skills
Bachelor's Degree required / technical undergraduate degree preferred, MBA or equivalent preferred.
Minimum 7+ years experience in product management, with a combined 12+ years industry experience including product development/technical role/product marketing in a software solutions oriented business.
Experience in a B2B SaaS or software company specifically related to Data Ingestion, Data Model and Data Quality.
Ability to conceptualize, negotiate and sell ideas internally and externally.
Strong understanding of user-centered design principles.
Proven track record for developing, managing and launching large-scale cloud-based software products.
Strong technical and data-analysis skills.
Exceptionally strong writing and presentation skills.
Excellent organizational, project and resource management skills.

The Preferred Qualifications
Experience in leading Agile/Scrum adoption in prior roles as a Product Owner.
Experience working in a fast-paced environment.
Experience working on large scale data integration products is beneficial in providing product strategy guidance to R&D teams and architects.
Familiarity or work experience in the Pharmaceutical space is highly desired but not required.
Background in the SaaS, software or technology industry is highly preferred.
Prior experience managing people is beneficial.

The exact nature of duties, level of role as well as the salary and compensation package will be commensurate with experience and salary history.
Axtria is an EEO/AA employer M/F/D/V. We offer attractive performance-based compensation packages including salary and bonus. Comprehensive benefits are available including health insurance, flexible spending accounts, and 401K with company match. Immigration sponsorship will be considered.

AWS Applications bring the power of AWS to intuitive applications that use technology like machine learning and robust analytics to help our customers stay ahead of their changing business needs. Our growing portfolio of business applications leverage the power and scale of AWS services to remove the undifferentiated heavy lifting that business users go through daily. As part of our team, you will play a key role in defining and developing the next generation of applications that will be used by millions of people every day.

We are building a new category of AWS Applications that will make customer-centric technology developed to support Amazon.com available to AWS customers. We will leverage the power of Artificial Intelligence and the large ecosystem of AWS services such as SageMaker, AWS Lambda, Amazon S3, and Amazon QuickSight to provide a truly frustration-free, easy-to-use, extensible, and natural customer experience. With this new category of services, we will transform business operations across industries. In our team you will have the unique opportunity to build an AWS service from the ground up. Our team is growing quickly and we’re looking for a Software Development Manager to help us continue to hire and grow the team and set technical direction. You’ll drive a culture that values operational excellence, security, customer focus, and continuous improvement.

With a strong leadership and a culture of challenge, support, and feedback, you will grow your skills and talents so you can scale with the new opportunities that arise as the organization expands.

You will guide a diverse, smart, and hardworking team. We are parents, artists, adventurers, and athletes who enjoy time outside of the office. We’ve worked hard to create a trusting, collaborative, diverse, and supportive atmosphere. We’re looking for a positive, enthusiastic, driven, and personable manager to continue this work environment and lead this team.

job_title: Artificial Intelligence Application Business Development Manager
job_description:
Artificial Intelligence Application Business Development Manager
We are seeking to fill the position of Artificial Intelligence Application Business Development Manager. This is a full-time position, based in Jacksonville, FL and reports to the Chief Operating Officer. The role is responsible for positioning truevue360 to facilitate revenue growth by leveraging our brand products and services, while maintaining the business unit’s sales targets to meet company objectives. The successful candidate will be a creative technologist who excels at relationship building and/or can leverage existing contacts to facilitate direct sales and develop partner channels in diverse markets. The role requires a detail-oriented individual with exceptional written and verbal communication skills. The candidates’ goals will be accomplished through multiple activities including developing strategies and tactics with the partner for quotes, bids and project or program capture. The candidate will be instrumental in developing creative application concepts to present customers with disruptive AI solutions and help partners with their differentiation of truevue360 applications and services, market penetration, and revenue and margin growth to achieve quota.
We specialize in developing, implementing and supporting integrated advanced technology systems to address complex business challenges. Our core proprietary technologies focus on passenger and freight rail, correctional facilities, security, and distribution centers gatehouse automation/logistics. Our proprietary applications include artificial intelligence, deep learning/machine vision video analytics-based security applications, intelligent process controls, and information technologies for a wide range of global customers. For more information, please visit our parent company website at http://www.duostech.com/.
Responsibilities:
Recruit, acquire, develop and manage key strategic clients and channel partners
Develop and maintain relationships with clients and partners through identification of key decision makers and managing and building relationships in diversified markets
Identify and assess potential business opportunities in diverse markets and provide feedback to our engineering and R&D teams
Support partners with project proposals, bidding, and presentations to successfully capture projects
Support partners by answering complex questions pertaining to product features, functions, licensing, integration, and program or project requirements
Utilize a solutions-based sales process. Be prepared to uncover business pains, articulate ROI, and deliver customized product demonstrations to help prospects understand the importance of embracing the digital evolution and artificial intelligence.
Participate in sales forecasting and planning in an effective manner by assisting with researching, developing, and maintaining long- and short-range sales and marketing plans
Monitor, analyze, and communicate monthly sales data and targets
Drive continual training activities which articulate truevue360 strategic direction, product and technology, sales strategies, go-to-market efforts, demand creation, and marketing programs and communications
Develop an in-depth understanding of truevue360 products, programs, projects, and sales methodology
Work closely with Marketing to provide project and content coordination in support of partner-driven marketing events with support from marketing and channel strategy resources
Support key marketing activities necessary for sales growth, road shows, conferences, tradeshows, sales training, and various sales engagement activities
This position requires extensive travel throughout North America
Qualifications:
5+ years of experience in sales role (SaaS preferred)
Exposure to selling Artificial Intelligence applications/systems
Experience developing and managing channel partners and programs to meet and exceed sales quotas
Excellent negotiation skills/techniques with channel partners and clients as well as internal delivery teams for successful execution of sales targets
Exceptional English language written and verbal communication skills
Familiarity with data analysis, reporting, and CRM systems
Understanding of national and regional technology marketplace requirements and trends
Ability to analyze and understand channel partner organizations
Ability to leverage internal and external resources to achieve sales objectives
Proven ability to drive the sales process from plan to close
Successful track record of relationship management and sales

Generous compensation package with incentives based on performance. Benefit package includes paid group health, dental, life, and disability insurance plus voluntary vision, critical illness, off the job accident insurance, non-matching 401(k) plan, Employee Assistance Program, and paid vacation and sick days.
To apply please submit a detailed resume, and if qualified, our Human Resources will administer a mandatory questionnaire.

(Nasdaq: DUOT) and is an equal opportunity employer and employees or applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to age, color, disability, gender, national origin, race, religion, sexual orientation, gender identity, protected veteran status, or any other classification protected by federal, state, or local law.
