Bring Fresh food to more people!

The fresh, perishable food industry is massive and growing faster than the packaged consumer goods industry. But, to date, most supply chain technologies have been built for non-perishable goods. This technology gap results in suboptimal decision making-causing billions of dollars of excess food purchasing and waste every year.

So we built Afresh (http://afreshtechnologies.com/) with a simple argument: a supply chain company, built specifically for fresh food and using the cutting edge of technology could massively reduce food waste, make nutritious food more accessible, and multiply the profitability of food companies at the same time.

We’ve grown fast. In our deployments with large grocery chains we have reduced food waste by 25-40% and massively boosted customer profits! Our system is now live with several large regional grocers representing hundreds of stores and billions of revenue. Our backers include Innovation Endeavors (former Google CEO Eric Schmidt’s firm) and Baseline Ventures (first money in Stitchfix, SoFi, Heroku, Instagram).

We are a passionate team united by our mission to make an impact in the food system. We hope you'll join us!

What will you be doing?
As Afresh’s first Product Marketing Manager you will be responsible for go-to-market strategy, market analysis, event marketing and positioning of Afresh’s core solution as well as our expanded product portfolio. You will establish a product marketing function and team that focuses on revenue growth and scale by creating timely, authoritative, defensible product knowledge and collaborate with key functions across the organization to build and iterate on a winning go-to-market strategy. We are looking for someone who enjoys tackling new challenges and working in a fast-paced environment that is changing every day.
Build the Product Marketing function from the ground up.Become an expert on Afresh’s solution and a key spokesperson on its valueDevelop and iterate on GTM strategy by partnering with cross-functional teams like product, sales, and business operations.Create and continuously iterate on compelling messages that resonate with target personas and segments.Enable demand generation with marketing materials like case studies, website and blog content to help establish Afresh as the market leader in fresh food supply chain solutions.Partner with product management to develop product positioning and messaging, points of differentiation, market opportunity analysis, and customer proof points.
-Build user guides and other -training materials for Afresh's end customers that clearly communicates our product's value and differentiated functionality.Oversee the launches of new products and features, including content creation, and campaign strategy.

What skills do you need?3-5 years of industry experience in product marketing.
-A demonstrably successful -background in B2B SaaS product marketingHighly collaborative, self-starter, with a tremendous desire and excitement to learn and improve.A passion for precision and details, with the ability to manage multiple priorities and tasks simultaneously.Strong interpersonal and relationship building skills and a proven track record partnering with product teams to develop roadmap and take products to launch.Experience developing messaging and use cases.Outstanding written and verbal skills and presentation abilitiesStrong alignment with our core values: Kindness, Candor, Proactivity and Humility.

Background
About 30-40% of food produced worldwide is thrown away, causing nearly a trillion dollars of economic losses, trillions of gallons of wasted water, and billions of tons of greenhouse gas emissions. In the US, about 40% of all food waste occurs at the retail level and downstream, largely driven by insufficient technology and manual processes.

Afresh seeks to tackle some of these big problems around food waste. Born out of Stanford's Computer Science PhD program, Afresh is the first Fresh food supply chain company. We bring the cutting edge of artificial intelligence to Fresh food to minimize food waste.

Our machine learning-powered supply chain solutions are tailored for the many nuances and complexities of perishables. Our first product is a store-level replenishment tool that optimizes the ordering of items in fresh categories - produce, meat, deli, dairy, bakery, and prepared foods. The goal is to minimize waste and maximize in-stock rate, and consequently, profit.
So far, our results are in line with that goal! Our technology is deployed across the country and used every day—our customers have reduced their food waste by 33-50%+ and significantly improved their profits.

We're growing fast: we're in partnership with several large regional grocers representing 500+ stores and >$10B in revenue. Our backers include Innovation Endeavors (former Google CEO Eric Schmidt’s firm) and Baseline Ventures (first money in Stitchfix, SoFi, Heroku, Instagram).
We earnestly believe that Afresh represents a one-of-a-kind opportunity to have massive social impact, at profitable scale, by employing novel technology—and to have a ton of fun along the way.

job_title: Manager, Manufacturing Operations Analytics and Data Science
job_description:
Bristol-Myers Squibb is a global Biopharma company committed to a single mission: to discover, develop, and deliver innovative medicines focused on helping millions of patients around the world in disease areas such as oncology, cardiovascular, immunoscience and fibrosis.


Join us and make a difference. We hire the best people and provide them with a work environment that places a premium on diversity, integrity, collaboration and personal development. Through a culture of inclusion, we create a better, more productive work environment. We believe that the diverse experiences and perspectives of all our employees help to drive innovation and transformative business results.


Bristol-Myers Squibb is a global biopharmaceutical company whose mission is to discover, develop and deliver innovative medicines that help patients prevail over serious diseases.


One shared journey is moving us forward at Bristol-Myers Squibb. Around the world, we are passionate about making an impact on the lives of patients with serious disease. Empowered to apply our individual talents and ideas so that we can learn and grow together. Driven to make a difference, from innovative research to hands-on community support. Bristol-Myers Squibb recognizes the importance of balance and flexibility in our work environment. We offer a wide variety of competitive benefits, services and programs that provide our employees the resources to pursue their goals, both at work and in their personal lives.


The GPS (Global Product and Supply) Analytics and Data Science team within Business Insights and Analytics partners with the BMS GPS organization to support data analytics for all key functions within GPS including Manufacturing Operations. GPS Analytics focuses on answering key business questions that will drive prioritized business decisions using advanced analytics and data science. The Manufacturing Operations organization at BMS supports drug product manufacturing from commercialization through end of lifecycle. Manufacturing Operations scope includes Manufacturing, Science & Technology (MS&T), Internal Manufacturing, External Manufacturing and Network Strategy and Business Operations. The Manager, Manufacturing Operations Analytics and Data Science will partner with the Director of Manufacturing Operations Analytics to answer key business questions within the Manufacturing Operations space. The successful candidate has a background in Manufacturing Operations and has expertise in one or more of the following areas: data analytics, data visualization, statistics, machine learning, predictive modeling, artificial intelligence, Python and ProgR, coding, ProgR, Shiny app development, and Tableau/Spotfire dashboard development.

The Manager, Manufacturing Operations Analytics and Data Science will partner with the Director of Manufacturing Operations Analytics to establish core capabilities within the team, namely:

Supporting Business Decisions - Work closely with business stakeholders to proactively identify and address priority business questions within Manufacturing Operations.
Driving Analytics and Capabilities - Answer key business questions using innovative analytic and data science techniques, assist with establishing core analytical and data science capabilities, standards, processes and methodologies for the team.
Driving Team Productivity and Operational Excellence - Play a critical role in managing team productivity, timeliness and quality of deliverables. Ensure consistent adoption of standards, processes and methodologies by contracted or other team staff. Continuously seek opportunities and approaches for enhancing the team's overall productivity.

Supporting Business Decisions

Identifies and contextualizes critical business issues, working to embed an objective and unbiased point of view into the business conversation.
Drives the application of fact based decision making for key questions within the Manufacturing, Finance and Procurement portfolio's enabling priority business choices.
Develops and maintains a deep understanding of Manufacturing, Finance and Procurement business priorities, meeting agreed upon analytics deliverables / timing.

Driving Analytics and Capabilities

Designs, develops and implements a broad array of business analytics that solve complex problems in a computationally efficient and statistically effective manner.
Identifies new opportunities to further leverage analytics, data and analytical tools.
Ensures best practice adoption within stated areas of responsibility, applying appropriate levels of technical capability, standardization and subject matter expertise.
Proactively manages planned and ad hoc analytics requests, ensuring consistent quality and timeliness in delivery to business stakeholders.
Leverages standards for the provision of analytics to support planning and decision making processes, and utilizes appropriate escalation processes.
Provides input/feedback and works actively to improve and enhance capabilities related to the GPS BIA team
Supports culture of analytics and fact-based decision making through the utilization of standard methodologies and approaches.

Driving Team Productivity and Operational Excellence

Supervises and collaborates closely with external analytics contractors and vendors when applicable or assigned.
Conducts detailed team walkthroughs and peer review of team's work to ensure quality, cross training and knowledge management within the team.
Ensures consistent adoption of standards, processes and methodologies by contracted or other team staff.
Authors detailed documentation that describes analytics tool development, assumptions and input data and any specialized data treatments. Authors user manual for dissemination within Manufacturing Operations user base.

List of minimum requirements

BA/BS required (quantitative area of study or engineering)
MSci, MEng or other Masters in quantitative area of study, analytics or data science preferred

Experience - Responsibility and minimum number of years

5+ years hands-on working in the area of data science, data analytics, data integration, reporting.
5+ years of hands-on experience with analytics, modeling platforms, data manipulation software and visualization tools (e.g. Advanced SQL, PL/SQL, ProgR, Python, SAP HANA, Spotfire, Tableau, Microsoft Suite, Hadoop, Redshift).
Experience working in the manufacturing space.
Experience interpreting analytical results and ascertaining implications to the business.
Experience interacting with business stakeholders understanding, anticipating, and fulfilling their insight/analytical information requirements.
Experience managing a team of contracted resources.
Competencies - knowledge, skills, abilities, other
Strong creative problem solving skills to answer key business questions.
Ability to work with diverse teams across organizational lines and structures.
Strong project management skills with demonstrated ability to lead multiple projects and priorities.
Strong analytical skills with substantial knowledge of data analysis & data engineering.
Strong written and verbal communication skills.
Ability to quickly gain and apply quality specific knowledge.
Ability to learn new tools quickly.
Proven ability to lead small teams/groups and manage a heavy workload.
Bristol-Myers Squibb recognizes the importance of balance and flexibility in our work environment. We offer a wide variety of competitive benefits, services and programs that provide our employees the resources to pursue their goals, both at work and in their personal lives.

job_title: Director of Data Architecture - Information Resources
job_description:
Summary
This position is responsible for the planning and development of the data warehouse and business intelligence systems for Enterprise Data Services.

Experience and Education
Bachelor’s degree in Information Systems, technology, engineering, or related field required. Advanced degree in science, technology, engineering, math, or related field preferred.
Ten (10) years of progressively responsible Data Warehouse management, Business Intelligence, or related IT experience required. Prior experience in the healthcare industry and agile development methodologies is highly preferred.

Job Description
Serve as a technology thought leader for the EDW. Provide leadership on data architecture, data modeling, data governance, and business intelligence tools.

Oversee the expansion of the EDW to support the enterprise data initiatives integrating data from disparate source systems.

Review and approve data model design of facts and conformed dimensions. Define and enforce data modeling standards using appropriate methodology (e.g., Kimball).

Lead the development of automation for data transformation and quality control using Microsoft technology including SQL Server, SSIS, and SSAS

Discover new and improved ways to deliver data to end users ensuring the appropriate business intelligence tools, such as Power BI, Tableau, SSRS, ProgR, etc., are employed to meet customer needs

Oversee the design of the EDW server farm working with on premise data centers as well as cloud hosting such as Azure.

Explore and introduce new analytics technology especially in the areas of Artificial Intelligence (AI) and Big Data.

Participate in relevant data governance workgroups and steering committees.

Prioritize and facilitate data requests from operational groups. Manage utilization of various resources to maintain maximum efficiency and meet performance objectives.

Implement changes that lead to continuous improvement in customer service. Maintain breadth and depth of knowledge in cutting edge technology and leverage enterprise and industry best practices.

Ensure compliance with applicable laws, regulations, privacy & security policies, and procedures.

Oversee budget expenditures and scheduling. Manage supervisors and/or subordinate managers, establishing priorities.

Perform other duties as assigned

Work requires ability to monitor and maintain budget.
Work requires ability to work with confidential information on a da ily basis.
Work requires ability to effectively interpret and apply organizational policies, procedures, and systems.
Work requires excellent interpersonal, organizational, supervisory/managerial, and analytical skills.
Work requires demonstrated ability to manage multiple projects and exercise decision-making and problem solving skills.
Work requires ability to read, write, develop plans, procedures, and coordinate persons and other resources to accomplish goals.
Work requires knowledge of personal computers.
Work may require ability to lead committees as appropriate.
Work may require telephone and personal contact with all levels of internal and external personnel and organizations.

Working Conditions Work is performed primarily in general office environment.

Salary Negotiable

In addition, it is UT Southwestern policy to prohibit discrimination on the basis of sexual orientation, gender identity, or gender expression.

At Synopsys, we’re at the heart of the innovations that change the way we work and play. Self-driving cars. Artificial Intelligence. The cloud. 5G. The Internet of Things. These breakthroughs are ushering in the Era of Smart Everything. And we’re powering it all with the world’s most advanced technologies for chip design and software security. If you share our passion for innovation, we want to meet you.

Our Software Security and Quality business is all about building secure software—faster. That starts with our static analysis, software composition analysis, and dynamic analysis so our customers can build security and quality into the DNA of their code at any stage of the software development lifecycle and across the supply chain. All while minimizing risks and maximizing speed of application development. To find out more about SIG, Synopsys check out https://www.synopsys.com/software-integrity.html.

Technical Lead – SaaS Platform

As the Technical Lead for SaaS Platform engineering, you will be joining the team that is building our state of art SaaS Platform that enables security and development teams to build secure, high-quality software faster.

You would collaborate with different teams in research & development group taking abstract concepts to elegant technical solutions in production with leadership and hands-on contribution thru design, development, testing and deployment. You would work across teams and organizations to ensure that the architecture and design are of high quality, stable, scalable and reliable. You would drive the technical design and the best engineering practices through design reviews, architecture reviews, hackathon activities and customer interactions.

Specific responsibilities include
Help define and drive technology vision, strategy and roadmap to build enterprise capabilities (scalability, fault tolerance, extensibility, maintainability etc.)
Hands-on implementation of the critical interfaces and complex modules of the systems and features
Collaborate with the engineering team to drive key design decisions, document / communicate architectural expectations and ensuring alignment
Hold engineers to the highest expectations and provide feedback on code and architectural approaches implemented by the team
Help teams disassemble and address complex technical issues
Stay abreast of industry trends, evaluate technologies to progress platform architecture
Partner with product managers to shape product definition and requirements so that it can be built in a flexible, extensible, and robust way
Collaborate with User Experience design team to increase product’s usability
Drive a culture of quality, technical curiosity, continuous improvement, and data-driven decision-making

Key Qualifications
14+ years of software development experience building and scaling enterprise customer facing products and services
Must have a track record of building, deploying and scaling distributed, highly available, large scale, high performing multi-tenant SaaS applications
Must have sound understanding of failure modes, resiliency patterns, and techniques to enable robust, self healing architecture
Must have experience building micro-services and customer facing APIs
Full-stack expertise and experience in Java technologies eco-system (spring, JPA, JMS…) and one of JavaScript technologies (React, Angular, Ember…)
Mastery in database technologies including RDBMS and NoSQL databases (PostGres / MySQL / Cassandra) and experience writing high performing queries
Experience and skills in global deployment patterns using cloud technologies and container technologies
Proven expertise and passion for continuous development - CI/CD
Customer-first and results-first mindset and the ability to make practical decisions when making engineering choices
Experience with at least one public cloud platforms such as AWS, Azure or GCP
BS/MS in Computer Science/Engineering, or equivalent experience

Inclusion and Diversity are important to us. Synopsys considers all applicants for employment without regard to race, color, religion, national origin, gender, sexual orientation, gender identity, age, military veteran status, or disability.

GPS Analytics focuses on answering key business questions that will drive prioritized business decisions using advanced analytics and data science. The Manufacturing Operations organization at BMS supports drug product manufacturing from commercialization through end of lifecycle. Manufacturing Operations scope includes Plant Operations, Science & Technology (MS&T), Internal Manufacturing, External Manufacturing and Network Strategy and Business Operations. The Manager, Manufacturing Operations Analytics will partner with the Associate Director of Manufacturing Operations Analytics to answer key business questions within the Internal Manufacturing Operations space with an emphasis on the Biologics Operations. The successful candidate has a background in Manufacturing Operations and has expertise in one or more of the following areas: data analytics, data visualization, statistics, machine learning, predictive modeling, artificial intelligence, Python and ProgR, coding, ProgR, Shiny app development, and Tableau/Spotfire dashboard development.

The Manager, Manufacturing Operations Analytics and Data Science will partner with the Associate Director of Manufacturing Operations Analytics to establish core capabilities within the team, namely:

Supporting Business Decisions - Work closely with business stakeholders to proactively identify and address priority business questions within Manufacturing Operations.
Driving Analytics and Capabilities - Answer key business questions using innovative analytic and data science techniques, assist with establishing core analytical and data science capabilities, standards, processes and methodologies for the team.
Driving Team Productivity and Operational Excellence - Play a critical role in managing team productivity, timeliness and quality of deliverables. Ensure consistent adoption of standards, processes and methodologies by contracted or other team staff. Continuously seek opportunities and approaches for enhancing the team's overall productivity.

Supporting Business Decisions

Identifies and contextualizes critical business issues, working to embed an objective and unbiased point of view into the business conversation.
Drives the application of fact based decision making for key questions within the Manufacturing portfolio enabling priority business choices.
Develops and maintains a deep understanding of Manufacturing, and plant operations business priorities, meeting agreed upon analytics deliverables / timing.

Driving Analytics and Capabilities

Designs, develops and implements a broad array of business analytics that solve complex problems in a computationally efficient and statistically effective manner.
Identifies new opportunities to further leverage analytics, data and analytical tools.
Ensures best practice adoption within stated areas of responsibility, applying appropriate levels of technical capability, standardization and subject matter expertise.
Proactively manages planned and ad hoc analytics requests, ensuring consistent quality and timeliness in delivery to business stakeholders.
Leverages standards for the provision of analytics to support planning and decision making processes, and utilizes appropriate escalation processes.
Provides input/feedback and works actively to improve and enhance capabilities related to the GPS BIA team
Supports culture of analytics and fact-based decision making through the utilization of standard methodologies and approaches.

Driving Team Productivity and Operational Excellence

Supervises and collaborates closely with external analytics contractors and vendors when applicable or assigned.
Conducts detailed team walkthroughs and peer review of team's work to ensure quality, cross training and knowledge management within the team.
Ensures consistent adoption of standards, processes and methodologies by contracted or other team staff.
Authors detailed documentation that describes analytics tool development, assumptions and input data and any specialized data treatments. Authors user manual for dissemination within Manufacturing Operations user base.

List of minimum requirements

BA/BS required (quantitative area of study or engineering)
MSci, MEng or other Masters in quantitative area of study, analytics or data science preferred

5+ years hands-on working in the area of data science, data analytics, data integration, reporting.
5+ years of hands-on experience with analytics, modeling platforms, data manipulation software and visualization tools (e.g. Advanced SQL, PL/SQL, ProgR, Python, SAP HANA, Spotfire, Tableau, Microsoft Suite, Hadoop, Redshift).
Experience working in the manufacturing space. Experience working in a GMP arena is a plus.
Experience interpreting analytical results and ascertaining implications to the business.
Experience interacting with business stakeholders understanding, anticipating, and fulfilling their insight/analytical information requirements.
Experience managing a team of contracted resources.

Strong creative problem solving skills to answer key business questions.

Strong project management skills with demonstrated ability to lead multiple projects and priorities.

Strong written and verbal communication skills.
Ability to quickly gain and apply quality specific knowledge.

Cortana is a key ingredient of Microsoft's vision to democratize Artificial Intelligence and empower every person and every organization on the planet to achieve more. Cortana's natural user experience fundamentally changes the way we use devices, applications, services, and technology in the next wave of computing. We are looking for the right people to envision and help deliver the AI platform and experiences that people can’t do without, that gives them more time for the important things, alleviates the stress of daily lives and bring smiles to faces.

If you are passionate, creative, and want to thrive on the cutting edge of AI, then the Cortana team is where you want to be. It is an exciting time to be a part of the Cortana team, pushing the industry with one of Microsoft’s most unique products. We take our responsibility to build an inclusive user experience seriously and building inclusive teams is fundamental to that.

In this role, you will be at the forefront of this growing industry of intelligent assistants. You will have significant customer/product impact leading and driving innovations to the Cortana platform and architecture. Your efforts will result in a highly capable platform that powers a range of intelligent and assistive experiences across a variety of Microsoft 365 end points targeted at productivity improvements for the users. Specifically, in this role you will be responsible for understanding, defining and delivering the most important facets of a human’s life (e.g., people, information, etc.) and improving the ability to recognize them in the most natural ways that human’s interact (i.e., text, voice, etc.).

To be successful in this role, you must thrive on the challenge of advancing the state-of-the-art. You must also be experienced in collaborating across teams at Microsoft, cutting through ambiguity and getting products shipped with highest quality. If you have the vision and passion to make Cortana the industry leader in this space, then this is the job for you.
Responsibilities
Technology and Product related:
Own the roadmap for infrastructure that power rich entity recognition capabilities
Deliver the end to end quality of various product lines for natural language multi-modal interactions
Represent the above to various stakeholders ranging from exec leadership to partner teams
Lead feature improvements through iterative design and experimentation by leveraging data to build strong understanding of customer
Collaborate closely across multiple disciplines (design, data science, user research, engineering) to execute on our vision for the future
Qualifications
The ideal candidate for this role is a talented and experienced Program Manager with:
Strong technical leadership abilities with demonstrated strategic thinking and vision
5+ years of relevant program management experience in the tech industry
Proven track record of delivering large complex projects (ideally online services and AI/ML related)
Familiarity and/or experience in AI/ML, speech recognition and natural language technologies
Ability to effectively communicate and write functional specifications
Excellent analytical, communication, presentation, and negotiation skills
Ability and experience in managing cross-functional organizations, customers, and executive leadership teams
Motivated to work with and leverage internationally distributed development teams
Entrepreneurial mindset with a bias for action and drive for results

Responsibilities for this Position:
Help make the technologies, products and services that make a difference. That’s the opportunity that’s waiting for you at General Dynamics Mission Systems. We help our nation’s heroes keep our nation safe by creating solutions so advanced, they redefine innovation for the world. It’s an amazing challenge. And it’s waiting for you now.


We apply advanced technologies such as Artificial Intelligence, Blockchain, AR/VR, Cloud Native and Quantum Physics to solve our customers’ missions in cyber, RF, undersea, interstellar and everything in between.


Utilizing your strict adherence to confidentiality, dedication to a job well done and strong organizational skills, you’ll provide general administrative support to managers and their staff. You’ll manage the calendars, meeting and travel schedules and associated arrangements, expense and time reporting, and other responsibilities to relieve them of administrative details and allow them to concentrate on other business activities. Your poise, initiative, and precision will shape the environment in which we all work. It’s your chance to put your talent to the ultimate test. Are you ready?

Technologies that aren’t just top-notch, they’re often top-secret
A team of bold thinkers committed to exploring what’s next
Opportunities to gain new knowledge - as it’s discovered

Self-starter who can apply discretion when dealing with sensitive information/situations

Exceptional organization and time management skills, attention to detail, and ability to multi-task high priorities
Outstanding interpersonal skills and a professional demeanor in interacting with a wide variety of people
Commitment to ongoing professional development

General Dynamics Mission Systems (GDMS) engineers a diverse portfolio of high technology solutions, products and services that enable customers to successfully execute missions across all domains of operation. With a global team of 13,000+ top professionals, we partner with the best in industry to expand the bounds of innovation in the defense and scientific arenas. Given the nature of our work and who we are, we value trust, honesty, alignment and transparency. We offer highly competitive benefits and pride ourselves in being a great place to work with a shared sense of purpose. You will also enjoy a flexible work environment where contributions are recognized and rewarded. If who we are and what we do resonates with you, we invite you to join our high performance team!

LivePerson is a transformational force in how brands and consumers communicate. With over 18,000 brands, including Citi, HSBC, Disney, Verizon, and Home Depot, we are on a mission to make life easier for people and brands everywhere through trusted Conversational AI. We believe in a future where conversations are the norm for getting your intentions fulfilled - whatever they are.

We are an innovative, intent-driven company that believes in building the future and we are looking for growth minded, unconventional thinkers, developers and builders to join the team.

You will thrive here if:
You can operate in a fast paced, dynamic environment

You can advance the SOTA in dialogue systems with experiments and code that are well-designed and well-implemented.

You can build partnerships that move our business forward

You see feedback or failure as motivation to learn and to grow

You believe data-driven decision making is the norm

You relate to our core principles (link) and want to work with Conversational AI experts


In this role, you will work with one of the world's largest goal-oriented conversational data sets to push the boundaries of computational linguistics and drive innovative new products at scale. In addition to a world-class data set, you'll also have an at-scale population of expert data annotators (contact center agents) to help drive investigation and learning.

In this role you will:
Propose and execute research efforts that drive product strategy
Publish and present cutting-edge research derived from our conversational data
Apply cutting-edge methods of NLP/NLU to learn and derive value from one of the world's largest goal-oriented conversational data sets.
Develop state of the art approaches to unsupervised/semi-supervised problems in intent and dialog management.
Some areas of research of particular interest:
Learning NLP systems using self-supervision from unannotated dialogue - Leveraging latent structure within task-oriented dialogue data to solve classification and dialogue problems more accurately and label-efficiently.
Faceted unsupervised learning - how can we inject knowledge into unsupervised tasks? How can we inject knowledge into clustering/similarity tasks to reflect facets we care about (intent) and orthogonalize irrelevant facets?
Lightly/distantly supervised dialog management ML systems - How can we utilize self-supervision and reinforcement learning to learn representations of conversational goals and policies from unlabelled historical conversations in a goal-oriented setting?
Controllable natural language generation - How can we build adaptable natural language generation systems that can be easily controlled/configured?
Requirements:
D. in Computational Linguistics, Computer Science, Statistics, or Mathematics
3-5 years post-graduate experience in ML, specifically in NLU/NLP
Expertise in NLP techniques to solve problems in dialogue management: either direct experience in dialogue systems OR experience in reinforcement learning
Track record of applied research on NLP or related fields, e.g. NLU, NLG, ASR/TTS and/or experience with dialogue systems
Writing Python code that is efficient and clean in a Linux environment
Experience with Python packages for Machine Learning (Scikit-Learn), NLP (SpaCy), and Deep Learning (Pytorch)
Proven track record of problem-solving, communication, and critical-thinking skills
Demonstrated capacity to work closely with teammates in a highly collaborative environment, as well as providing strong individual contributions
Preferred qualifications:
Record of publications in competitive journals/conferences in the field, such as EMNLP, ACL, ICLR, NIPS, NAACL.


Why you'll love working here:

LivePerson was named to Fast Company's World's most innovative companies of 2020 list for the Artificial Intelligence category. We offer top tier tech & data science colleagues, along with opportunities to push your own limits. We embrace invention and experimentation. You'll have great benefits, flexible time off, plus snacks and drinks to keep your mind fresh and stomach full. Most importantly, you'll have an ability to make an impact at work and at brands across the globe as we build the future with trusted Conversational AI together.

At LivePerson, people from diverse backgrounds come together to do their best work and be their authentic selves. We are proud to be an equal opportunity employer.

We also consider qualified applicants regardless of criminal histories, consistent with legal requirements.

We are leading HDR technologies for TV and researching AI (Artificial Intelligence) based picture quality enhancement also. DMS lab keep focusing on researching new algorithm for TV and display's picture quality improvement and optimization and supporting production.

This position requires managing picture quality team's projects and people and planning new project for the next year. The position requires frequent collaboration with colleagues and other teams also. For example, Samsung has a lot of organizations such as Korea team, China, India, EU R&D center and this position requires good collaboration with other country's teams and people. This position also will be required to plan to new project with new technologies. For instance, Samsung 8K TV is supporting 8K AI scaler function for customer value and differentiation and this is one of the new projects suggested as a PQ algorithm project. We are trying to develop AI related technologies for display's PQ and Deep Learning background is essential for this position.

PQ project and people managing
Collaboration with Korea, Mexico or other country's team
Find and research new project for TV's PQ excellence
HDR 10+, Deep Learning based Super Resolution, FRC technologies understanding and leading the industry
Experience Requirements:
More than 10 year's PQ research and development experience
More than 5 years project manager experience
Ph.D. is preferred in AI related major (EE, CS, CE preferred)

Associate Director, Global Contract Lead



Description
Developing innovative therapies is one of the most challenging, most essential and personally rewarding fields in science. This is the most exciting time to be a part of Astellas, a company with a uniquely collaborative and patient-focused culture.

There's something special about working at Astellas. It's reflected in our focus on the people we serve, the way we treat each other and the results we achieve together as a company.

Astellas is announcing an Associate Director, Global Contract Lead opportunity in Northbrook, IL.


Purpose & Scope:

The role will support the entire Procurement category and sourcing teams in efficient commercial contract management. The role will have the following key goals:

Enhance value of sourcing activities by create a standardized contract management process that is tailored to each geography
Create a process and technology backbone to ensure a seamless and smooth process of creating, negotiating, storing and retrieving contracts
Provide sound contracting practices and ensure compliance with Astellas policies and procedures
Working with other key functions (in particular, Legal and Global Business Services) to develop a global contracting operating model which effectively manages risk whilst delivering optimum agility and efficiency


Essential Job Responsibilities:

The role will enable the Global Category Management and Technology Lead as well as the entire Sourcing and Category teams by establishing a centralized and standardized (yet customized by region) contracting process as well as creating a easy to use repository of contracts. The role will have following key responsibilities:

Create an end to end global operating model and process of contract management that is standardized as much as possible taking into account regional nuances. This will include :
Implement and co-develop procedures for contract management and administration in compliance with company policy
Develop, own and deliver a globally standardized support model which delivers end-to-end ownership of the contracting process including all administration and negotiation
Developing and maintaining standard contracting templates and playbooks (along with legal) which both mitigate risk and drive agility
Develop a technology strategy which builds on and enhances the current myContract platform including the use of Robotic Process Automation and Artificial Intelligence
Coaching the category and sourcing managers on the process
Ensure appropriate contract close-out, extension, or renewal protocols
Ensure that the contract management process is being followed. Monitor compliance by company employees with established procedures
Work with Procurement Technology Lead to develop a technology strategy which builds on and enhances the current myContract platform including the use of advanced capabilities such as Robotic Process Automation and Artificial Intelligence
Establish an audit process to not only ensure compliance to contracting process but also to ensure compliance to contracts and as such, offer improved risk mitigation and incremental commercial value
Provide all categories and business stakeholders with a 'Contract as a Service' approach in order to both reduce touch points and provide increased speed/cycle time reduction
Own end-to-end Contract Life Cycle Management activities including proactive renewals and effective management of data to support wider business change activities
Primary point of contact with Legal and responsible for incorporating and communicating all legal advice and input
Work closely with Supplier Risk Lead in order to provide required inputs to a seamless Supplier Risk program
Consult key stakeholders and own the contracting continuous improvement plan along with all necessary change management and training requirements


Quantitative Dimensions:

Develop an operating model to negotiate, manage and store in excess of 10,000 commercial contracts per annum, covering a spend of $3.7bn
Ownership of all resources dedicated to the Contract Management process (Administration and Negotiation) - currently consists of 21 resources (BPO, Interim and Permanent). Exact number will be reviewed as part of Operating Model delivery
Ad-Hoc Management: With the support of key stakeholders, will interact and lead multi-functional teams
Travel: Key area of the role will be to support with, align and influence Global/Regional stakeholders and therefore, global/regional travel will be required (~20% of role)


Organizational Context:

Key Relationships:

Legal Department
Global Business Services - in particular, Global and Regional P2P Leads
Category Leads
Category Managers
All Business Stakeholders who may be involved in commercial contracts
Reports to: Global Category Management & Technology Lead


Requirements
Qualifications:

Required

Minimum Qualification

Degree required
3+ years of Experience in procurement contracting activities
Fluency in English conversational and business English (equivalent to TOEFL iBT 105+, or 7.5 IELTS, CAE- Cambridge English advanced exam)


Minimum Experience

Strong organization skills
Experience with information systems
Comfortable working with contracts
General working knowledge and competency in Microsoft packages and Source to Pay systems
Exceptional problem-solving and analytical skills (multiple complex analyses simultaneously)
Good planning/project management skills
Evidence of developing innovative commercial solutions using a wide range of value levers


Job specific skills (behavioral)

High energy, enthusiastic
Strong interpersonal and influencing skills - important to build relationships, trust and to become respected by the business teams
Strong oral and written communication and presentation skills
Strong problem solving skills
Strong implementation skills. Able to interpret business requirements and effectively align inputs, outputs and results
Makes good and timely decisions that move the organization forward, based upon a mixture of facts, analysis, experience and judgement
Builds strong customer relationships and delivers customer centric solutions
Ability to handle multiple projects at the same time and close advanced projects on time with minimal supervision
Operates well under ambiguity and able to effectively maneuver through complex policy, process and people related issues
Must be a good team player - willing and able to assist peers in Global Procurement and able to work in multi-functional, cross-regional teams


Preferred

Legal experience

Preferred Qualifications

The race is on! Emerging technologies like artificial intelligence, autonomous, mobility, and IoT have changed the way business structured with all things digital and their expectation of immediacy and value.


To meet the customers’ needs today and exceed their expectations for tomorrow, Oracle is laser-focused to empower and accelerate companies around the world to respond to customer’s cloud transformation with solutions “Powered By” or “Integrated With” Oracle Cloud Platform, or with services to plan, implement, and manage their “last upgrade” transformation or modernization efforts.


The Oracle PartnerNetwork (OPN), a programmatic effort to enable our partner ecosystem, provides the tools, education, and assistance critical in accelerating the delivery of Cloud solutions or services to assist our mutual customers.

Oracle is looking for a Director, OPN Program Lead to join our dynamic team. We are seeking a passionate, results-oriented, proven individual with experience in the innovation and management of global partner programs. This is a highly visible role across the organization and is an opportunity to make a lasting impact on the growth and success of our customers, our partner ecosystem, and Oracle.

The successful candidate must have proven experience and success in working collaboratively across executive management, field sales organization, product development, marketing, etc. They will be passionate about their work, self-motivated, detail oriented and have excellent problem-solving abilities. Additionally, they will have superb communication and project management skills, communicate progress and results both written and verbally, in a clear and easy-to-understand way.

The ideal candidate will possess an extensive background working with technology partnerships and partner programs, particularly as related to Managed Service Providers (MSPs) and Strategic Implementers (SIs), along with strong business development, strategic alliances, and entrepreneurial skills. He/she should have a demonstrated ability to think strategically about new business models, solution selling, and technical challenges to help build and convey compelling value propositions for Oracle customers with our partners. Facebook AI’s mission is to advance the state-of-the-art in artificial intelligence through fundamental and applied research in open collaboration with the community. Our work covers the full spectrum of topics related to AI, including deriving knowledge from data: theory, algorithms, applications, software infrastructure and hardware infrastructure. We actively engage with the community through publications, open source software, participation in technical conferences and workshops, and collaborations with academia. Facebook AI researchers and engineers work from our offices around the globe: Menlo Park, CA, New York City, Seattle, WA, Montreal, Canada and Paris, France. Facebook is seeking an experienced Program Manager to develop content, manage rollout of projects, and help drive effective communications and collateral for the Facebook AI organization. This role will partner closely with a large cross-functional team including engineering leadership, product marketing, program management, researchers, and engineers, as well as external partners across organizations in industry and academia. The ideal candidate has experience creating content and build awareness and engagement for a technical product or audience. To be successful, you will be eliminating barriers to your team's success, clearly communicating your work to all stakeholders and ensuring the big picture stays in focus while delving into the details on specific issues. Ideal team members are adaptable and resilient, eager to attack unfamiliar problems with curiosity and tenacity, self-motivated and demonstrate creative and critical thinking capabilities to help the team be more efficient. The right candidate will be a strong communicator, passionate about fundamental research, comfortable with ambiguous environments, can move fast, bring people together, and focus squarely in advancing the science forward.
Program Manager, Facebook AI Responsibilities
Establish and scale collaboration programs, including being the lead on internal organizational content and information
Collaborate cross-functionally and with researchers on the Facebook AI narrative and on strategic thinking with VP and Leadership team
Drive the development of simple tools and processes to provide ongoing tracking of progress & key milestones
Provide coordination support and improve collaboration among scientists working on similar areas
Increase awareness of research progress internally across FAIR leaders, AI org and the company at large
Help scientists and engineers with planning, prioritization and risk management
Partner on building on-boarding programs and messaging that help new scientists & engineers ramp up quickly on Facebook AI & Facebook tools, systems & processes
Partner with research and engineering leaders to organize key workshops & events
Proactively identify technical, legal, procedural, logistical, and communication issues and drive creative solutions to fix them and manage risk
Drive internal process improvements, remove gaps, coordinate multiple parties and alleviate bottlenecks
Ability to map dependencies and relationships between research and teams
Establish strong working relations with all partners with an emphasis on unblocking team members when they are stuck and managing cross-functional engagements
Minimum Qualifications
Proven track record of building and scaling programs
Experience in communication and messaging to a large organization
Experience working directly with technical scientists, engineers, and management
Communication, coordination, organizational and multitasking experience
Interpersonal experience, including relationship building, and collaboration with a cross-functional, global team
Experience operating autonomously across multiple teams, demonstrated critical thinking, and thought leadership
Preferred Qualifications
Experience working in AI/ML programs or teams
Experience working with students and interns, and general understanding of key AI research conferences and forums
Experience delivering tech programs or products from inception to delivery

Responsibilities for this Position:
Developing mission-critical systems that help keep people safe is what we do. At General Dynamics Mission Systems, you’ll be part of the team that helps heroes make a true impact. As a X-Lab Systems Engineer/Analyst Lead, you’ll lead model and simulation activities as you participate in requirements analysis and management, functional analysis, performance analysis, system design, trade studies, systems integration and test (verification). It’s your chance to step up to the challenge and prove you’re ready to lead the world.
The Command and Control, Battle Management, and Communications Experimentation Laboratory (C2BMC X-Lab) is a very fast paced and dynamic environment. The X-Lab is responsible for developing and integrating future-capability prototypes for the Ballistic Missile Defense System (BMDS) including Sensor/Weapon Integration, Algorithm Development, User Interface Development and other critical leading-edge missile defense technologies. The X-Lab has a need to augment the team with a senior systems engineer and analysis lead that holds at least a Secret clearance with a TS/SCI being preferable and possesses demonstrable skills in the following areas:

Analysis tool development using MATLAB, Excel, S-Code, Satellite Toolkit (STK), etc.
Perform verification and validation of systems (functional and performance)
Full cycle systems engineering of new capabilities
System and subsystem decomposition
Use case, system requirements, performance specification development, and UML modeling
System interface design & Interface Control Document development
Conducting and participating in peer reviews
Good communication skills (written and oral)
Leadership of a team composed of multiple disciplines
This position will focus on and lead the analysis of R&D systems in C2BMC and will contribute to other ongoing X-Lab projects as needed. Including the assessment on how the C2BMC prototype system performs by identifying high level objectives and refining into an integrated set of metrics, analysis tool development, assessment of experimental data, generating and presenting customer-quality products containing analytical observations. The Lead Analyst will apply these results to identify and work to enhance C2BMC for future operations. The Lead Analyst must possess expertise in a technical discipline related to systems engineering, analysis, or missile defense. The Lead Analyst should be comfortable with rapidly changing requirements, design challenges that require novel solutions, fast-paced activities, and tight deadlines.

The Lead Analyst must have [12+] years of experience leading or contributing to an integrated team environment with other systems, software, and specialty engineers to develop solutions that includes a background in all aspects of the analysis life cycle. The Lead Analyst should have experience with identification of analysis objectives, metric generation, data assessment, and presentation of the results. The Lead Analyst should have demonstrated the ability to analyze high level customer needs and defined a structured and logical approach to refine the objectives and analysis requirements. The Lead Analyst should have demonstrated the ability to communicate effectively, developed and scripted analysis tools, clearly present technical approaches and findings, and have experience in writing and implementing analysis plans within a project. Ideally, the Lead Analyst will have experience in working on IRAD-type projects.

Position Responsibilities:
Perform as individual contributor and Analyst Lead for advanced concepts development projects. This includes directing the activities of junior level engineers. Contribute in full lifecycle development of advanced concepts. Position is responsible for performing the evaluation of advanced missile defense command and control capabilities to provide highly innovative and ingenious solutions to complex technical problems. Including defining and
coordinating analysis objectives and metrics for various experimental prototypes, performing the associated analysis, and serve as the X-Lab spokesperson on advanced projects when briefing results to the customer. Actions are critical to achieving X-Lab organizational objectives and directly affect the impact of X-Lab technological capability. Assignments are often self-initiated with consultation and agreement of X-Lab leadership. The Lead Analyst will provide oversight of maintenance and improvements to the analysis tool suite. Support advanced concept demonstrations during live and simulated MDA test events. Non-standard work hours are highly likely during event execution and a small amount of travel may be required.

Preferred Qualifications:

It is an exciting time to be building experiences and devices at Microsoft. There is no organization in the world that is better positioned to fundamentally change the way that people live and work. The future of productivity is collaborative, intelligent, and embedded in the world around us. Help shape the rapidly evolving productivity landscape by conducting the research needed to create next-generation intelligent systems and drive the company’s collective bold ambitions for productivity forward.

As a member of the Experiences and Devices Office of Applied Research, your core mission will be to deliver research that fundamentally impacts Microsoft’s products and services. You will also contribute to the scientific community and beyond through presentations, publications, and other outlets (e.g., blogs, press interviews). We are looking for candidates who are smart and creative, as well as self-driven, curious, and comfortable with ambiguity. The successful applicant will collaborate closely with people across Microsoft’s product teams and Microsoft Research, and have the opportunities see their ideas realized in products and services that are used worldwide.

Responsibilities

Leading teams of researchers and developers on cross-org projects that help our products push the boundaries of what is technologically possible.
Working with people in a range of roles, including researchers, engineers, designers, and other key product stakeholders. Serving as a bridge between research and product.
Sharing your research with others via a range of means, including publication, to enable others to build on your work and to contribute to the reputation of our products as cutting-edge and science driven. Communicating complex ideas clearly.
Qualifications
We seek applicants from researchers across all areas of machine learning, artificial intelligence, and related fields and a passion for product impact. Examples of current research directions include:

Machine learning and optimization
Deep learning
Reinforcement learning
Natural language processing
Neuro-symbolic systems and reasoning
AI fairness, transparency and ethics
Program synthesis
Machine teaching

Successful candidates will have a PhD and an established research track record as demonstrated by publications at top international research venues and open source software. Scientific leadership as demonstrated by participation on program committees is desirable. Candidates should also have a deep understanding of software system principles and the ability to lead and partner with others to ship developed technology.

Requirements:
Education: PhD in Computer Science or related engineering or science fields required
At least two years of experience in a research leadership position.
Expertise in developing or applying predictive analytics, statistical modeling, data mining, or machine learning, especially at scale
Excellent problem solving and data analysis skills
Effective communication skills, both verbal and written
Strong software design and development skills/experience
Strong collaboration skills, both within-team and cross-team

You should submit a CV and the names of at least three references as required by the online application. You should also upload the two conference or journal articles, book chapters, or equivalent writing samples which best demonstrate your expertise.

Microsoft is an equal opportunity employer. All qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to age, ancestry, color, family or medical care leave, gender identity or expression, genetic information, marital status, medical condition, national origin, physical or mental disability, political affiliation, protected veteran status, race, religion, sex (including pregnancy), sexual orientation, or any other characteristic protected by applicable laws, regulations and ordinances. We also consider qualified applicants regardless of criminal histories, consistent with legal requirements. If you need assistance and/or a reasonable accommodation due to a disability during the application or the recruiting process, please send a request via the Accommodation request form.

Benefits/perks listed below may vary depending on the nature of your employment with Microsoft and the country where you work.

job_title: Senior Manager Applied Scientist - Machine Learning
job_description:
A MS in CS focused on Machine Learning, Statistics, Operational research or in a highly quantitative field5+ years of hands-on experience in big data, machine learning and predictive modeling5+ year people management and cross department functional experienceKnowledge of a statistical analysis package such as ProgR, Tableau, and high-level programming language (E.g. Python) used in the context of data analysis and statistical model buildingStrongly motivated by entrepreneurial projects and experienced in collaboratively working with a diverse team of engineers, analysts, and business management in achieving superior bottom line resultsStrong communication and data presentation skillsStrong ability in problem solving and driving for results

Interested in applying deep learning techniques to Terabytes of Data with sub 1 second latency on billions of requests a year? We are looking for a dynamic, innovative and accomplished Senior Applied Science Manager to lead deep learning for the Multi-Channel advertising conversion prediction team. Our conversion prediction team works to ensure consumers see ads that interest them and advertisers see great return on their marketing. We need a leader to grow our team of engineers and scientists to improve our models through new innovations and expanded features.

Are you excited by the prospect of analyzing terabytes of data and leveraging state-of-the-art data science and machine learning techniques to solve real world problems? Do you like to own end-to-end business problems/metrics and directly impact users? As a Senior Applied Sciences Manager, you will lead a team of managers, applied scientists, data scientists and engineers to conceptualize and build algorithms that predict how advertising and consumers interact. You will be the single-threaded owner of the deep learning models that feed our bidding algorithms and will be responsible for both near-term improvements to existing algorithms as well as long-term direction. Your team will include experts in deep learning, statistics and analytics that are working on state-of-the-art modeling techniques, as well as generating insights that fuel critical investments. You will also lead an engineering team that works on handling terabyte scale data and implementing features and algorithms that process billions of events per day. Your strong leadership skills will be utilized to help deliver critical projects that cut across organization structures and meet key business goals

Key responsibilities:
Deliver key goals to enhance advertiser experience and deliver 2-3x improvements to campaign performanceUse deep learning and statistical techniques to create new, scalable solutions for conversion predictionDrive core business analytics and data science explorations to inform key business decisions and algorithm roadmapEstablish scalable, efficient, automated processes for large scale data ingestion, transformation, experimentation, and productionHire and develop top talent in machine learning, data science, and software engineering and accelerate the pace of innovation in the groupBuild a culture of innovation and long-term thinking, and showcase this via peer-reviewed publications and whitepapers

Technical leader with 12+ years of exceptional, hands-on experience in machine learning in e-commerce, fraud/risk assessment, or an enterprise software company building and providing analytics or risk management services and software.Ph.D. degree in in Statistics, CS, Machine Learning, Operations Research or in a highly quantitative field.Knowledge of distributed computing and experience with advanced machine learning libraries like Spark MLLib, Tensorflow, MxNet, etc.Strong publication record in international conferences on machine learning and artificial intelligenceExperience working with advertising, retail, or e-commerce data

job_title: Business Operations Manager, Data and Systems
job_description:
Feedzai is at the confluence of three thrilling areas: artificial intelligence, financial technology, and financial crime. And our world-class team of marketers is tasked with creating messages that are greater than the sum of these three areas. We're selling one of the world's most advanced platforms to some of the world's most discerning buyers, and we're protecting commerce for hundreds of millions of people. Every day, our platform processes billions of dollars' worth of transactions from around the world, stopping fraud in its tracks without good customers feeling any friction.

As the Manager of the Data and Systems team, you will be responsible for planning and executing on accomplishing Feedzai's business objectives through the application of enterprise tools and technology, and automation. This role reports to the SVP of Operations and will work closely with IT, Security, and the rest of the organization, to ensure that business outcomes are data driven.


Responsibilities
Manage and lead the Data and Systems team to increase transparency, accessibility, and accuracy of enterprise data, systems, and tools (e.g. Tableau, Salesforce, Netsuite, Gainsight, Hubspot, Jira, Google Data Studio, etc.)
Partner with the Sales, Marketing, Finance, and Operations teams to drive forecasting, analytics, metrics, and reporting
Ensure data quality and optimize our enterprise data
Gather, translate, and implement business and stakeholder requirements into solutions that will drive operational efficiency
Identify operational weaknesses and help improve processes to keep teams as efficient as possible
Develop, build, and maintain reports that contain actionable metrics to monitor the health and performance of various departments
Troubleshoot and resolve bugs identified by end users
Keep up to date with Salesforce releases, features, and best practices

Qualifications
Bachelor's degree in Computer Science, Software Engineering, Data Science, MIS, or other similar fields
3+ years experience as a manager of a data/systems focused team
Experience with business analysis, business process improvement, and project managing complex enterprise projects
Ability to communicate complex details to both business and technical audiences
Experience with Apex/Visualforce, JavaScript, HTML, CSS, etc
Advanced Excel knowledge
Experience in B2B SaaS environment, preferably enterprise software, is a plus


Feedzai is an Equal Opportunity Employer. We are interested in every qualified candidate who is eligible to work in the United States. However, we are not able to sponsor a visa for this role.

Feedzai does not accept unsolicited resumes from recruiters or employment agencies.

Bachelor's Degree5+ years of experience in product or program management, product marketing, business development or technologyExperience with end to end product deliveryExperience with feature delivery and tradeoffs of a productExperience overseeing roadmap strategy and definitionBachelor’s Degree in Engineering, Computer Science or related technical field

Software has revolutionized every industry it has touched. While online learning has taken a strong root over the last two decades, we are at the cusp of the next wave of innovation in the learning space with Machine Learning and Artificial Intelligence. And where better to influence that than in the company known for innovation at a global scale.

Amazon Learning Products and Services team is looking for a Senior Product Manager to join an exciting opportunity to reinvigorate our learning platform. As a senior product manager, you will be responsible for designing, implementing and driving a new customer outreach program for our learning platform. Through this program, you will be contributing to our business growth by bringing in new business partners across the company and its subsidiaries. You will also be responsible for nurturing and measuring the success of these customers and business through a programmatic approach.

On this team, you’ll get to wear many hats, work fast and smart, and iterate quickly. We are looking for someone who is ready to take ownership of a growing business opportunity and join a tightly-knit team tackling interesting challenges. You are innovative, courageous, positive, and are itching to explore your own full potential in creativity, technology, and experiences.

Proven track record of taking ownership and successfully delivering results in a fast-paced, dynamic environment7+ years of customer-facing product development and product management experience, including defining, launching, and optimizing product and servicesExperience designing and driving customer outreach programs in a systematic mannerExperience leading cross-functional teams to deliver products and online services on tight deadlinesExperience coordinating complex product development cycles and software/hardware development schedulesMarketing experience is a plusStrong analytical and quantitative skills with the ability to use data and metrics to back up assumptions, recommendations and drive actionsAbility to think strategically and execute methodicallyProficient writer and communicatorExperience with developing business partnershipExperience with learning management systems (LMS) or other similar learning environment a huge plusKnowledge of agile product development and life-cycle management process.MBA or Master’s degree

job_title: Director of Artificial Intelligence – AI Digital Transformation and Technical Solutions Lead, Manufacturing and Energy, U.S. AI Country Plan
job_description:
Director of Artificial Intelligence – AI Digital Transformation and Technical Solutions Lead, Manufacturing and Energy, U.S. AI Country Plan
Organizations around the world are going through rapid digital transformation. This is especially true in the US, where we see this phenomenon being accelerated by the scale and agility of the Cloud and fueled by the latest innovation in machine learning and artificial intelligence. As they progress through their transformations and examine impacts on employees, partners, customers, and society, new strategies are emerging with socio-environmental factors and sustainability at the center.

Desired Leadership, Aspirations and Values:
Customer Obsession: The AI Country Plan team, the Office of the Chief Digital Officer and Microsoft are committed to have a customer first approach. We expect our leader to have a demonstratable history of making a difference for customers and showing a customer first approach.
Growth Mindset: Experience and passion for learning (technical and soft skills); implementing practices from others; trying, failing and learning from that; sharing practices and knowledge for others’ benefit

Responsibilities:
Key Responsibilities:

The two leaders will collaborate with key industry sales teams, associations, customers, influencers and regulators to ensure to remove blockers and drive innovation.

Experience in influencing Senior Leadership teams to drive strategy and investments. required

Excellent Communicator: Able to distill widely variant feedback into root cause issues and provide actionable feedback to other stakeholders, deep technical product demo, presenting, writing, and verbal communication skills required.

Data Platform modernization and migration, and Analytics is preferred.
AI Solutions: High-level expertise in sophisticated cloud solutions that include knowledge mining, Machine Learning, Cognitive services and understanding of identity, authentication, security, privacy, and compliance requirements, and experience integrating them into cloud and hybrid solutions
Technical breadth: Enterprise customer level experience with Cloud technologies, Artificial Intelligence, Data Landscape, Architecture Designs, Open Source Technologies, Industry Standards and demonstrated ability to integrate new technologies on prem as well as on the cloud.
Market insights: Understanding of Artificial Intelligence solutions from competitors (AWS, GCP, others) as well as Architect Artificial Intelligence based applications, startups and partner ecosystem.
Industry Builder: Understand capabilities of, strategically be able to work with, influence cohesively, build and grow, Microsoft (or similar) customers, members of the Microsoft (or similar) sales, services, and marketing organizations, internal and external communities and Microsoft (or similar) partners, thinktanks and associations.
Strategy: Experience developing strategies, execution plans and reporting to achieve business goals through multiple channels and competing to take market share.

Bachelor’s Degree, MBA and Masters in Technical fields or relevant job experience all accepted
Certifications: Azure Fundamentals, Data Engineer or Azure AI Engineer preferred
Additional trainings, technical or sales certifications and education in Enterprise Architecture valued
Travel: 25 to 50% in U.S. Based Territories
