The NC State College of Education leads the way in North Carolina in preparing professionals, conducting research, and engaging communities to improve educational outcomes for all learners across the state and beyond. With two-thirds of its faculty grant active and over 120 funded research projects totaling over $90-plus million, the college ranks No. 1 in education research productivity in North Carolina and among the Top 6 percent of colleges of education in the nation. During the 2018-2019 fiscal year, the faculty had half of their proposals funded and brought in over $30 million in new funded research. They address society’s most pressing educational challenges and convert their research to action and innovative solutions that transform teaching and learning environments across the lifespan, with particular strengths in improving technology-enhanced learning and teaching in STEM education and literacy; increasing diversity, equity and access in education; and innovating leadership development.

The college is composed of three academic departments: Educational Leadership, Policy, and Human Development; Science, Technology, Engineering, and Mathematics Education; and Teacher Education and Learning Sciences, with approximately 124 faculty members and 92 support and professional staff. The college’s 1,700 undergraduate and graduate students study across 60-plus degree programs that deliver highly-engaged and personalized academic experiences that prepare them to lead in the field of education. The college is also home to the Friday Institute for Educational Innovation and the proposed Belk Center for Community College Leadership and Research.

The Department of Science, Technology, Engineering, and Mathematics Education emphasizes exemplary teaching, scholarship, and service in the context of a university education. With a primary emphasis on improving schools and society, the Department prepares quality educators for middle, secondary, and post-secondary school science, technology, engineering, mathematics, graphic communications, and informal settings. In addition, the Department offers a Graphic Communication Concentration (non-teaching) and several minors, including Technology, Engineering, and Education licensure track and a Technical Graphic Communications track for industry. The Department also has programs preparing professionals for leadership at the master’s and doctoral levels.

The Artificial Intelligence Academy (AIA) program will prepare participants for AI careers that are in high demand nationwide. It will include two levels of training and associated certifications: Basic AI (artificial intelligence and data mining focus) and Advanced AI (machine learning and analytics focus). Apprentices can complete the entire program in forty weeks. Industry partners will pay apprentices for at least part-time work during the program and will also cover apprentice tuition and fees for the AI credential program. Companies will benefit from additional workers in their organizations and will have the option to hire the apprentice upon completion of the program.

The project will include partners from a variety of sectors. Industry partners include IBM, CISCO, Citrix, Pentair, Hazardous Software, Diveplane, Randstad Technologies, Battelle Memorial Institute and MCNC. Educational partners include N.C. Community Colleges/Apprenticeship NC, Purdue Global, MACUL and Metriks Amerique. Veterans and other recruitment-related affiliated agencies involved in the project include FASTPORT, VetsinTech, Warrior Maven, Paradigm Shift, Monster Jobs, Dice, Industrial Internet Consortium, Crosby Communications and Clearance Jobs. The NC Chamber will serve as a workforce development partner on the project.

Essential Job Duties
This position is grant funded and therefore contingent upon the availability of funding with a proposed start date of July 1, 2020.

The Director will serve as the operational leader for the A.I. Academy (AIA) apprenticeship program. The Director will assist the Executive Director in providing overall oversight for the entire operation of the AIA, including supervising the Program Coordinator and other central AIA full-time staff (e.g. Instructional Designer, Videographer, Technical Staff/Programmer, Data Coordinator, Assistant Instructors, Teaching Assistants, and others TBD).

The Director will lead project management which will include supporting thousands of fully online adult learners through providing training for Instructors, Assistant Instructors, and Teaching Assistants, and continuously monitoring student success and making adjustments to programming as necessary.

The Director will develop procedures and processes to attain high levels of retention, program operation, and student support, including ensuring alignment of the program with industry partner needs. The Director will lead required quarterly reporting to the DOL on the AIA program in consultation with the Executive Director. The Director will work with the Executive Director on strategic direction for the AIA program and development of a sustainability plan for continuing the program after DOL funding has ended.

This work will include, but is not limited to:
Oversight for AIA Basic and Advanced program operation including project management.Supervision of five-fifteen central AIA full-time staff.Strategic planning work with the Executive Director for the AIA.Development of AIA program operational procedures and processes.
Development of apprentice retention plans and other student support mechanisms.Tracking of and decision-making regarding AIA program financials with the Executive Director.
Oversight for AIA program data tracking.Leadership of required quarterly reporting to the DOL on the AIA program.Communicating with AIA partners and leading periodic small group calls and large group meetings as necessary.
Other duties as assigned.

Other Work/Responsibilities

Minimum Education/Experience
PhD or EdD in Curriculum & Instruction or similar education field.

At least 5 years of experience managing academic programs (academic affairs).

At least 2 years of experience managing or administering online/distance learning programs.

Departmental Required Skills
Experience with managing enrollment and financial aspects of academic programs.

Excellent organizational and communication skills, willingness to take initiative, and ability to work with a team toward a common goal.

Excellent time-management skills and ability to meet deadlines.

Ability to present at state and/or national conferences about industry partners, community colleges, etc.

Must be meticulous, self-directed, conscientious, a good listener, and a quick learner.

Preferred Experience, Skills, Training/Education
Demonstrated organizational, supervisory, data management, and budget management ability, including demonstrated success in planning and managing budgets

Evidence of sound financial management and responsibility for operating budgets

Understanding of research, assessment, and evaluation strategies

Strong organizational, presentation, and writing skills

Proven ability to effectively communicate with varied audiences, specifically including industry partners, community colleges, etc.

Ability to develop and sustain a work environment that fosters continuous growth and great working relationships

Required License or Certification
N/A

In addition to your application please submit a curriculum vitae/resume, a cover letter, and contact information for three professional references.

Business Group Highlights

Intelligence

The Intelligence group provides high-end systems engineering and integration products and services, data analytics and software development to national and military intelligence customers. Serving federal agencies and the Intelligence Community for more than 50 years, the Intelligence group helps our clients meet their mission needs by providing trusted advisors, leading-edge technologies, and innovative solutions.

Responsibilities

The Challenge: Are you looking for an opportunity to make a difference in the government space? Do you enjoy being both a project manager and a technical enthusiast at heart? What if you could find a position that is tailor-made for your mix of development, engineering, and communication skills? That's why we need you, a proven leader, to help us shorten the time it takes to get critical tools developed and into the hands of warfighters who need them and to quickly provide assistance and aid to the people who need it. As a senior manager, you will lead a contractor team which provides strategic architecture planning and analysis for a ground systems enterprise. You will be a part of the Govt Program Management Office as a SETA and will be asked to support the customer’s desire to provide mission with solutions. You will function as an organizational Lead with frequent and direct interface with senior customers.

Let us help you in building your career while you provide mission critical support to the warfighter. When you join Perspecta, you can expect a culture that focuses on supporting our employees , opportunities that provide stability while offering variety. You'll also be exposed to a wealth of training resources to further continuous learning. We will also take care of you financially, by providing a benefits package that is unmatched and puts money back into your paycheck. Let us pay a significant portion of your medical, dental, vision premiums, give you extra PTO days and a monetary bonus once a year (on top of regular salary increases)!

What we need from you:

To be who you are, an energetic, forward leaning, self-starter visionary!
Holds a positive outlook
Strong customer intimacy skills
Knowledge of current IT solutions such as AWS, Google, Containerization, Machine Learning, Artificial Intelligence, etc
Knowledge of infrastructure configuration practices and software engineering best practices
Knowledge or experience in implementing DevOps
SAFe or Agile experience/certification
Demonstrated ability to work and quickly transition across multiple tasks
Expert representational, oral, and written communication skills, including the ability to produce clear, logical, and concise products;
Superior organizational and interpersonal skills, and demonstrated ability to interface effectively via written and oral forums with personnel at all levels of government
Demonstrated capability and success working in team environments with multiple subcontractors
Qualifications
Prefer 12+ years with BS/BA or equivalent with at least 4 years of management-level responsibility
Hold an active TS/SCI clearance with Poly
Understand Systems Engineering: requirements, architecture, and verification/validation (V&V) process
Systems Engineering experience on large complex systems
Acquisition experience on small to large systems
Project management and acquisition management
Understanding of programmatic processes, including configuration management, risk and readiness
Understanding and experience implementing a CI/CD pipeline
About Perspecta

What matters to our nation, is what matters to us. At Perspecta, everything we do, from conducting innovative research to cultivating strong relationships, supports one imperative: ensuring that your work succeeds. Our company was formed to bring a broad array of capabilities to all parts of the public sector—from investigative services and IT strategy to systems work and next-generation engineering.

Our promise is simple: never stop solving our nation’s most complex challenges. And with a workforce of approximately 14,000, more than 48 percent of which is cleared, we have been trusted to just that, as a partner of choice across the entire sector.

Argo AI was founded to tackle one of the most challenging applications in computer science, robotics and artificial intelligence with self-driving vehicles. Argo AI is developing and deploying the latest advancements in artificial intelligence, machine learning and computer vision to help build safe and efficient self-driving vehicles that enable these transformations and more. The challenges are significant, but we are a team that believes in tackling hard, meaningful problems to improve the world.

We are building a high-performance team that is excited by complex engineering challenges and is passionate about making transportation safer, more affordable and accessible for all.

The Sensors Hardware team is responsible for defining, developing, and delivering the sensing suite that enables Argo's self-driving system to accurately perceive the world.

The Engineering Manager, Camera Hardware will manage a team of engineers responsible for all aspects of camera hardware development, including research, design, test, qualification, and deployment of Argo AI's camera systems. Core responsibilities of this role include direct personnel management, resource and budget allocation, cross-functional alignment with partner teams, and engagement with outside suppliers.

What you'll do:

Manage a team of engineers responsible for delivering Argo AI's custom camera hardware
Ensure the personnel and program success of Argo's camera engineering team
Drive personnel management tasks including hiring, goal planning, progress tracking, mentoring, reviewing employee performance, team status reporting, prioritizing resources, etc.
Work closely with external vendors to ensure engineering teams are aligned, escalating issues with appropriate partners to keep programs on track
Establish best practices for the camera engineering team and the engineering organization as a whole
Work with executives and engineering leadership to drive key decisions
Help define the future roadmap for cameras at Argo

What we're looking for:

Degree in Computer Engineering, Electrical Engineering, Mechanical Engineering, Physics or a related field
Strong leadership skills suitable for recruiting, leading and managing highly diverse teams of engineers to develop high-performance camera systems
Strong understanding of core camera design principles, including optics, image sensors, image signal processing, and embedded software
Experience working with contract engineering and contract manufacturing partners, including those overseas
A record of leading projects and teams successfully and working in a fast paced environment
Ability to collaborate with other teams and leaders to help entire organization row in the same direction
Experience developing highly complex embedded hardware systems in robotics, transportation, aerospace, consumer electronics, defense, medical, energy, or similar industries
Desired experience in Python and/or Matlab
Desired experience with automotive development processes and considerations (APQP, DFMEA, Functional Safety, etc)
Excellent presentation and communication skills, with demonstrated ability to work with cross-functional teams to drive decisions
Ability to write concise, clear, and detailed engineering documentation

Basic Qualifications :
Bachelor’s degree in systems engineering, a related specialized area or field is required (or equivalent experience) plus a minimum of 8 years of relevant experience; or Master's degree plus a minimum of 6 years of relevant experience. Agile experience preferred.

CLEARANCE REQUIREMENTS:
Department of Defense Secret security clearance is required at time of hire. Applicants selected will be subject to a U.S. Government security investigation and must meet eligibility requirements for access to classified information. Due to the nature of work performed within our facilities, U.S. citizenship is required.
Responsibilities for this Position:
Developing mission-critical systems that help keep people safe is what we do. At General Dynamics Mission Systems, you’ll be part of the team that helps heroes make a true impact. The work we do is important. The challenges we face are career-defining. The opportunity we can offer is one-of-a-kind.


We apply advanced technologies such as Artificial Intelligence, Blockchain, AR/VR, Cloud Native and Quantum Physics to solve our customers’ missions in cyber, RF, undersea, interstellar space and everything in between.

As a X-Lab Systems Engineer/Analyst Lead, you’ll lead model and simulation activities as you participate in requirements analysis and management, functional analysis, performance analysis, system design, trade studies, systems integration and test (verification). It’s your chance to step up to the challenge and prove you’re ready to lead the world.
The Command and Control, Battle Management, and Communications Experimentation Laboratory (C2BMC X-Lab) is a very fast paced and dynamic environment. The X-Lab is responsible for developing and integrating future-capability prototypes for the Ballistic Missile Defense System (BMDS) including Sensor/Weapon Integration, Algorithm Development, User Interface Development and other critical leading-edge missile defense technologies. The X-Lab has a need to augment the team with a senior systems engineer and analysis lead that holds at least a Secret clearance with a TS/SCI being preferable and possesses demonstrable skills in the following areas:

Analysis tool development using MATLAB, Excel, S-Code, Satellite Toolkit (STK), etc.
Perform verification and validation of systems (functional and performance)
Full cycle systems engineering of new capabilities
System and subsystem decomposition
Use case, system requirements, performance specification development, and UML modeling
System interface design & Interface Control Document development
Conducting and participating in peer reviews
Good communication skills (written and oral)
Leadership of a team composed of multiple disciplines
This position will focus on and lead the analysis of R&D systems in C2BMC and will contribute to other ongoing X-Lab projects as needed. Including the assessment on how the C2BMC prototype system performs by identifying high level objectives and refining into an integrated set of metrics, analysis tool development, assessment of experimental data, generating and presenting customer-quality products containing analytical observations. The Lead Analyst will apply these results to identify and work to enhance C2BMC for future operations. The Lead Analyst must possess expertise in a technical discipline related to systems engineering, analysis, or missile defense. The Lead Analyst should be comfortable with rapidly changing requirements, design challenges that require novel solutions, fast-paced activities, and tight deadlines.

The Lead Analyst must have [12+] years of experience leading or contributing to an integrated team environment with other systems, software, and specialty engineers to develop solutions that includes a background in all aspects of the analysis life cycle. The Lead Analyst should have experience with identification of analysis objectives, metric generation, data assessment, and presentation of the results. The Lead Analyst should have demonstrated the ability to analyze high level customer needs and defined a structured and logical approach to refine the objectives and analysis requirements. The Lead Analyst should have demonstrated the ability to communicate effectively, developed and scripted analysis tools, clearly present technical approaches and findings, and have experience in writing and implementing analysis plans within a project. Ideally, the Lead Analyst will have experience in working on IRAD-type projects.

Position Responsibilities:
Perform as individual contributor and Analyst Lead for advanced concepts development projects. This includes directing the activities of junior level engineers. Contribute in full lifecycle development of advanced concepts. Position is responsible for performing the evaluation of advanced missile defense command and control capabilities to provide highly innovative and ingenious solutions to complex technical problems. Including defining and
coordinating analysis objectives and metrics for various experimental prototypes, performing the associated analysis, and serve as the X-Lab spokesperson on advanced projects when briefing results to the customer. Actions are critical to achieving X-Lab organizational objectives and directly affect the impact of X-Lab technological capability. Assignments are often self-initiated with consultation and agreement of X-Lab leadership. The Lead Analyst will provide oversight of maintenance and improvements to the analysis tool suite. Support advanced concept demonstrations during live and simulated MDA test events. Non-standard work hours are highly likely during event execution and a small amount of travel may be required.

Preferred Qualifications:
The primary work location is the Missile Defense Integration and Operations Center (MDIOC) located on Schriever AFB, CO. The following knowledge base and/or skills are desired for the Senior Systems Engineer:
Integration practices and methodsTest driven development and continuous integration
Ability to extract data to support analysis
Operating systems experience with Windows & Unix/Linux
Algorithm design and implementation
DoD Architecture Framework (DoDAF)
Physics & mechanics of powered and ballistic missile flightTheory and application of the BMDS
Theory and application of command and control systems
Theory and application of track correlation algorithms
Probability theory and optimal state estimation
Familiarity with Link-16, including content, transmission rules, etcCoding skills a plus (Java, C++, and shell scripts)
Excellent communication skills (written and oral)
Company Overview:
General Dynamics Mission Systems (GDMS) engineers a diverse portfolio of high technology solutions, products and services that enable customers to successfully execute missions across all domains of operation. With a global team of 12,000+ top professionals, we partner with the best in industry to expand the bounds of innovation in the defense and scientific arenas. Given the nature of our work and who we are, we value trust, honesty, alignment and transparency. We offer highly competitive benefits and pride ourselves in being a great place to work with a shared sense of purpose. You will also enjoy a flexible work environment where contributions are recognized and rewarded. If who we are and what we do resonates with you, we invite you to join our high performance team!

The NVIDIA Deep Learning Institute (DLI) trains developers, data scientists and researchers how to tackle meaningful problems using artificial intelligence and accelerated computing. We are looking for a specialist DLI Instructor for NVIDIA North America and Europe, based on the East Coast (e.g. Washington, D.C., New York, Boston). This position requires experience as a professional online and in-person instructor, excellent artificial intelligence (AI) knowledge and a shown understanding of the latest AI and accelerated computing trends and technologies. You will be responsible for developer education on NVIDIA deep learning products and tools. You will also be an excellent teammate and a good communicator with proven presentation abilities, able to work and thrive in a dynamic environment. This role presents an opportunity for an accomplished instructor with a capacity to learn quickly and exercise good judgment to gain in-depth experience driving growth in GPU-accelerated neural networks and machine learning training within the developer community.
What you´ll be doing:
Deliver new and existing DLI training workshops as an NVIDIA Certified Instructor (CI).
Schedule and conduct Train-the-Trainer workshops and promote CI achievements to develop our community of Certified Instructors.
Promote business development activities in North America and Latin America (NALA) & Europe, Middle East and Africa (EMEA) by guiding customers through the deep learning tools for GPU Computing products.
Align Master Instructor (MI) and CI expertise with the Content Development team to help generate new content that is relevant, represents the direction of NVIDIA and keeps DLI at the forefront of AI.
Assist team in building education infrastructure based on NVIDIA technology.
Champion AI and accelerated computing among the NVIDIA technical community.
Partner with DLI Content Developers and our Certified Instructor Program Manager to define and implement technical requirements for Instructor Certification (criteria, application, assessment, interview, delivery) for each workshop.
Help guide strategic DLI customers by providing recommendations for DLI content aligned with their goals, team needs, background, criteria, etc.
Conduct instructor evaluations / interviews to assess and certify DLI instructor candidates.
Travel (up to 30%) for client deliveries and conferences.
What we need to see:
6+ years of AI experience.
BS CSE, CS or EE degree , Master's degree preferred.
Professional experience delivering technical training both online and in-person.
Sophisticated knowledge of modern neural network architectures, machine learning algorithms and AI applications.
Customer facing skill set and background.
Python or C / C++ programming experience.
Parallel programming expertise is preferred.
Familiarity with GPU technology and CUDA programming.
Knowledge of OpenMP, MPI and other parallel programming languages is desirable.
Experience using PyTorch, TensorFlow, Caffe2 or other Deep Learning Frameworks.
Work history with technical computing customers - preferably supercomputing.
Ability to communicate effectively with customers.
Positive relationship and interpersonal skills.
Ability to multitask optimally in an energizing environment.
Good oral / written English communication skills.
Wow us with your effective presentation skills training developers! We want to know about your programming background. Impress us with AI projects you have worked on! Highlight how you prioritized multiple high-priority projects at a time.

Udacity is looking for an experienced marketing leader to oversee its brand strategy and marketing efforts. This person will lead the brand marketing, content marketing, product marketing, and PR teams - in order to clearly articulate the company's mission and unique standing in the online learning industry. As the company ramps aggressive growth and expands into new markets, the Director of Brand and Product Marketing will focus on defining our overall brand identity and messaging across all of its business units. This position will report to the Chief Marketing Officer.

Responsibilities:

Develop, lead and manage The company's brand marketing strategy across all of the core lines of business.

Demonstrate thought leadership crucial to accelerating growth of our brands and products, delivering clear insights and action plans to improve program performance.
Drive market, product and customer segmentation and industry analysis; define the customer journey and build contact strategies;
Develop, test and refine benefits, product positioning and messaging.
Conduct research and leverage findings to build actionable recommendations with regards to messaging and customer segmentation.
Be the expert on use cases, expectations and the competition across the portfolio. Develop strategies and manage programs that drive demand for all of The company.
Analyze customer data and feedback and external research to help better inform campaigns that meet the company's awareness and revenue goals.
Create the go-to-market plan for product launches.

Develop and lead marketing campaigns

Oversee all earned marketing efforts, including but not limited to PR, content marketing, and events, to establish the company as the thought leader in online education.
Partner with creative and growth marketing teams to drive creative campaigns that work across social, digital, and traditional channels.
Define and regularly measure KPIs that track progress against key brand initiatives.
Manage the campaign calendar - across all of The company's course launches, expansions, promotions, campaigns, events and product launches. As such, the position will serve as a key nerve center and traffic manager for the company - managing execution and message continuity across multiple teams.
Develop a content marketing strategy and program that produces unique case studies, customer success stories, and thought leadership whitepapers across both the B2C and B2B landscape.

Implement collaborative brand strategy initiatives across the company.

Partner with analytics team on research and reporting initiatives to inform and optimize marketing plans, program execution, executive decisions and priorities.
Help the Product and Business Development teams to manage the operational components of strategic partner campaigns, identifying and driving business growth opportunities.
Work closely with consumer growth, enterprise marketing, and enterprise sales team to develop compelling messaging for each customer segment.
What we value:
A brand marketing leader who has a strong understanding of analytics, brand strategy, and research trends, but who can also think outside of the traditional advertising box and shepherd groundbreaking creative campaigns to market.
7+ years' experience in a senior brand marketing role with fast-paced brand. At least five years of that experience should be working in-house (i.e. not in an agency).
Demonstrated ability in ideating, creating and implementing large-scale and unique creative brand campaigns. Experience with collecting market data and other external information to deliver a structured and actionable marketing strategy.
The role requires sound judgment, the ability to multi-task and to work collaboratively with a number of diverse departmental requests and needs – while protecting and leveraging the equity of The company's brand.
The right candidate is a self-starter who is comfortable with a high-level of responsibility across the organization, and who can own a wide-range of issues and projects within a dynamic, rapidly growing company.
The ideal candidate is a collaborative and curious individual, who enjoys working across departments to develop interesting narratives and campaigns for external/internal audiences.

Experience doing so within limited budgets and tight timelines.
Previous strategy or brand strategy experience in management consulting or CPG firms.

We are looking for a Software Development Manager to play a leadership role on the Amazon FSx for Lustre team. Launched in a Re:Invent keynote in November 2018, Amazon FSx for Lustre is a brand new AWS service that makes it easy for customers to launch and run high-performance file systems in the cloud. With Amazon FSx, in just minutes you can provision a Lustre parallel file system that can process massive data sets at up to hundreds of gigabytes per second of throughput, millions of IOPS, and sub-millisecond latencies. Customers already love the service, but we're just getting started. Come join the Amazon Web Services engineering team in our Boston Seaport location overlooking the Fort Point channel as we revolutionize the world of high performance computing (HPC) and cloud storage!

AWS is a dynamic and rapidly growing business within Amazon, with over a million active customers in 190 countries around the world. AWS has been continually expanding its services to support virtually any cloud workload, and it now has more than 90 services that range from compute, storage, networking, database, analytics, application services, deployment, management, developer, mobile, Internet of Things (IoT), Artificial Intelligence (AI), security, hybrid and enterprise applications. We maintain this rapid pace of innovation by treating each team like its own independent business inside AWS, directly accountable for their customers’ satisfaction, service innovations, growth, and meeting revenue goals.

As a Software Development Manager, you will lead a team designing and building transformative new customers experiences on Amazon FSx for Lustre. Delivering reliable and high-performance services and features at AWS scale requires technical leaders with extraordinary expertise and boundless creativity. At Amazon, managers will interact with customers, understand our business goals, and innovate rapidly, delivering high-quality and ground-breaking functionality.

Embark on a journey with us to build a new service for AWS. We need your passion, innovative ideas, and creativity to shape the future of a nascent service at Amazon scale with a team that is super smart, driven to serve customers, and fun to work with!

Scalable computing systems, software architecture, data structures and algorithmsWindows file system administrationWindows file system developmentAgile/SCRUM enterprise-scale software developmentStorage software, storage protocols and high-performance mapping constructsNetwork protocols like TCP/IP, UDP, HTTPS, DHCP and DNSBuilding secure software and security algorithmsBuilding and operating scalable infrastructure software or distributed systemsPassion for technical leadership and mentoringEffective verbal and written communication skillsEffective analytical skills, with problem solving abilities in the face of ambiguityAbility to collaborate with a talented, diverse team

About:
Would you like to be part of the new space movement? Are you a rock star engineer? Do you have the leadership gene? Raytheon Intelligence and Space is the place for you. In the last few years you might have seen in your social media feed amazingly beautiful images of the Earth from space in exquisite detail. Or perhaps images in the news forecasting the weather and reporting on natural disasters. Maybe you’ve even gazed at images from deep space wondering when humans will journey to the farthest reaches of the universe. Job Description:
The RF Algorithm Engineer provides the full range of systems design and analysis-related activities in support of SAS RF programs. These activities include:
Development of mathematical algorithms for RF signal processing and calibration
Modeling and simulation of sensor physics and phenomenology to predict performance
Development of system and/or subsystem requirements
Data analysis of hardware under test or in operations
Design and development of RF waveforms
Creating technical presentations to both internal and external customers
Participating in customer and/or program technical reviews
Technical team leadership participating in technical peer reviews throughout the product lifecycle of design, development, integration and test, and requirements verification

Required Skills:
Minimum 8 years of relevant experience in systems engineering and/or algorithm development
Knowledge and experience of basic RF operations: Filtering, Pulse Compression, Calibration, and/or Antenna Array processing
Knowledge of RF signal processing techniques, experience developing advanced mathematical algorithms, analytic techniques and computer simulations
Able to effectively multi-task and prioritize actions
Proficient in Matlab, C++, Python, or related programming languages
Strong written and oral communication skills
U.S. Citizenship and ability to access to US only data systems
U.S. Citizenship status is required as this position requires an active U.S. Security Clearance as of Day 1 of Employment
Active DoD Secret Clearance

Desired Skills:
Experience in RF design, development, integration and test (system verification)
Experience in hardware and/or software development of embedded, real-time systems
Experience in digital pre-distortion, advanced coding and modulation, and channel equalization schemes/techniques
Experience in space-time adaptive processing
Experience in system requirements development
Experience in machine learning, artificial intelligence, deep learning, convolutional neural networks
Technical publications and/or patents

Battelle is guided by a founding mission. We invest our knowledge, talents and resources, helping our customers achieve their most important goals. We apply scientific rigor and creativity, succeeding where others may fail, and we invest in our communities, making the world better for generations to come. All of us share a common purpose: to solve the greatest challenges of today and tomorrow.

Our 22,000 employees work at the forefront of scientific innovation to tackle critical challenges in security, human health, manufacturing, energy and environmental management. Battelle’s work is grounded in the belief that science, technology and a passion for excellence can make industries more competitive and the world a better place.


JOB SUMMARY
Battelle is seeking a Software Architect & Development Lead to provide senior leadership across the software communities of our Contract Research Organization in National Security, Environment & Infrastructure, and Health business units to translate scientific discovery and technology advances into societal benefits. As our Software Architect & Development Lead, you’ll live our core values – Unity, Creativity, Collaboration, Excellence and Appreciation.

The position is located in Columbus, OH with travel to regional sites as required.

At Battelle, we solve the toughest problems in the world. We invent new technologies that span tactical systems, strategic analytics, novel machine learning and artificial intelligence algorithms, modeling, embedded human medical implants, chem-bio sensors, cyber platforms, and neural networks for government and commercial clients.

MAJOR RESPONSIBILITIES
Lead Software Delivery Life Cycle (SDLC) practices across our Contract Research Organization
Serve as a champion/SME for development & devops practices across the organization, providing coaching, mentoring, and technical support
Design, develop and execute software and data solutions to address business issues
Provide architectural blueprints and technical leadership
Evaluate and recommend tools, technologies and processes to ensure the highest quality product platform
Collaborate with peer organizations, quality assurance and software developers to produce cutting-edge software, data management and DevOps solutions
Lead and actively engage in the software & data community
Facilitating discussions with clients to develop capabilities to meet current and future objectives
Communicating to diverse audiences including customers and clients, senior management, software developers, scientists and academia
THE FOLLOWING IS REQUIRED
You know how to motivate teammates, are driven and comfortable rolling up your sleeves. You thrive in a fast-paced, cross-discipline, collaborative environment. You are strategic, adaptable, and flexible. You meet the following minimum requirements:
Bachelor’s degree in related field with 15 years of experience or master’s degree in related field with 10 years of experience or PhD with 8 years of experience; or an equivalent combination of education and or experience in a related field.
Experience with automated deployment, continuous integration, and release engineering tools
Knowledge of software development, patterns, vulnerability assessment, and software testing methodologies
Knowledge of cloud environments and how to implement cloud architectures
Knowledge of data system management and data science techniques
Experience adapting legacy systems to modern architectural environments
Deep technical knowledge of modern software development life cycles
Experience advocating and driving adoption of industry best practices
Ability to communicate clearly and concisely to all levels and a flexible mindset to handle a quickly changing culture
Must be a US Citizen with the ability to obtain and maintain a TS clearance
Willingness to travel to regional office sites and partner locations across the United States
THE FOLLOWING IS DESIRED
Graduate degree in EE, CS, CE, Math, Physics, Physical Sciences or equivalent
Active SECRET or TS clearance
Understanding of government and commercial contracting processes
Software development experience in embedded microcontroller based systems

BENEFITS
Battelle’s competitive benefits program includes comprehensive medical and dental care, matching 401K, paid time off, flexible spending accounts, disability coverage, and other benefits that help provide financial protection for you and your family.

Battelle provides employment and opportunities for advancement, compensation, training, and growth according to individual merit, without regard to race, color, religion, sex (including pregnancy), national origin, sexual orientation, gender identity, marital status, age, genetic information, disability, veteran-status, or any other characteristic protected under applicable Federal, state, or local law. job_title: Principal Developer - Monitoring and Automation Platform
job_description:
TECHNOLOGY SERVICES GROUP (TSG) is the central infrastructure services group with a proven track record of innovating to help BNY Mellon and its customers have most reliable, nimble and cost-effective solutions in the financial services market place. BNY Mellon App Engine technology is leading edge with industry first PasS/IaaS fully integrated solution, combined with enterprise standards for developers.

TSG is building next generation scalable, efficient data center as a service using the latest innovation infrastructure. Building on top of the cloud deployments in BNY Mellon, we are aggressively automating and bridging the green field cloud with the existing virtual computing environments.

TSG provides global infrastructure, end user computing and production support services. The organization’s goal is to provide reliable, resilient, next-generation enterprise technology infrastructure and support that enables BNY Mellon employees to deliver client commitments and business solutions around the world. We are continuously improving and bridging the gap between cost, customer needs, and innovative tools to ensure the best possible experience.

The Enterprise Monitoring and Automation team's goal is to provide the tools and strategy to drive holistic end-to-end enterprise technology monitoring across a combination of people, process, and tools. Define and implement a comprehensive standardized set of ‘best-of-breed’ monitoring tools for use across the enterprise. Democratize the monitoring data and federate dashboard configuration and events management. Develop a modern automation platform using artificial intelligence and machine learning to facilitate automated issue resolution and faster triage.
We are engineering a full stack Monitoring and Automation platform utilizing Open Source software (Prometheus, Grafana, ELK, Spring, Cloudprober), commercial software (AppDynamics, Moogsoft, Ipsoft, Anodot) and home-grown software. We are a distributed team with wide range of development and system skills that seek to produce robust, yet simple solutions to problems. We are hiring people that are self-starters who can work independently with minimal direction.

Key responsibilities include:
Design and develop performant, highly scalable applications for mission critical applications in the Monitoring and Automation space.
Work closely with key applications and DevOps stakeholders throughout the firm to help develop the application backlog and pipeline.
Contribute as a Senior-level, subject matter expert that the team can look to for guidance across the Monitoring and Automation space.
Develop high performance Angular-based applications and RESTful API’s using the latest technologies in a container based environment.
Help guide and mentor more Junior-level Developers to support and encourage continuous improvement and career development process.
Principal Developer->> Consults with internal business groups to provide high-level application software development services or technical support. Provides comprehensive senior-level technical consulting to IT management and senior technical staffs. Evaluates compliance with the organization's technology standards. Works with internal business groups on implementation opportunities, challenges, and requirements of various applications. Analyzes information and provides recommendations to address and resolve business issues for a specific business group. Guides and consults with IT management and technical staffs regarding use of emerging technologies and associated services. Participates in defining corporate implementation and integration strategies of new technologies. Advocates for innovative, creative technology solutions. Contributes to the achievement of area objectives.

Qualifications
Bachelor's degree in computer science engineering or a related discipline, or equivalent work experience is required.
Ten to twelve (10-12) years of experience in software development is required.
Experience in the securities or financial services industry is a plus.
Five or more (5+) years of expertise in Java, J2EE, Spring Boot, Javascript is preferred.
Five or more (5+) years of experience with relational databases such as Oracle, MSSQL and/or similar is preferred.
Highly organized, self-motivated, well spoken, and able to work independently with minimal direction is preferred.
Knowledge and experience with GIT repository or similar is preferred.
Golang or C/C++ knowledge is a plus.
Knowledge working with databases such as Postgre and/or MongoDB is a plus.
Experience designing, deploying, and testing of enterprise level monitoring and application automation is a plus.
Experience or exposure to a DevOps role with a passion for stable, resilient and available platforms is a plus.

BNY Mellon is an Equal Employment Opportunity/Affirmative Action Employer.
Minorities/Females/Individuals With Disabilities/Protected Veterans.
Our ambition is to build the best global team – one that is representative and inclusive of the diverse talent, clients and communities we work with and serve – and to empower our team to do their best work. We support wellbeing and a balanced life, and offer a range of family-friendly, inclusive employment policies and employee forums.

job_title: Sr. Product Manager, Technical - Global Telecom
job_description:
7+ years of enterprise IT experience, including database systems, tiered storage architectures, server, and desktop virtualization, data center operations, network security, etc.5+ years of technical knowledge of Telecom industry applications, platforms, and data ecosystem5+ years management of technical customer-facing resourcesTechnical degree required (or equivalent work experience); Computer Science or Math background highly desired

JOB DESCRIPTION
Want to disrupt an industry by delighting customers and have a massive impact? Do you have the business background, technical depth, and communication skills needed to help Amazon Connect build a world-class telephony network? Excited to join one of the newest and most exciting AWS services? Come be a leader on a team that is building a product that will touch millions of people daily.
Amazon Connect is a highly disruptive cloud-based contact center that enables businesses to deliver engaging, dynamic, and personal customer service experiences. Amazon Connect is the result of the ten years of development that went into building the tools Amazon uses to provide its award winning customer service at massive scale and launching it as a publicly available AWS service. With Amazon Connect, you can create your own cloud-based contact center and be taking calls in minutes. Amazon Connect leverages the power of Artificial Intelligence and the large ecosystem of AWS services such as Amazon Lex, Amazon Polly, AWS Lambda, Amazon S3 and Amazon Kinesis to provide a truly frustration free, easy-to-use, extensible, and natural customer experience. With this technology, we are transforming an industry and the way customers interact with businesses and how agents service them.
We have a rapidly growing customer base and an exciting charter in front of us that includes solving highly complex engineering and algorithmic problems. We are looking for a passionate, talented, and experienced Product Manager to join us to innovate on this new service that addresses customer needs to build modern contact centers in the cloud.
The position represents a rare opportunity to be a part of a fast-growing business soon after launch, and help shape the technology and product as we grow. You will be playing a crucial role by developing the next generation user-interface to build the interactions a customer could configure within an Amazon Connect instance. You will have the opportunity to design and deliver scaleable, resilient systems while maintaining a constant customer focus.
Industry analysts have said, “Amazon Connect is quietly positioned to massively disrupt by enabling companies to focus on customer service, not service centers.” and “Amazon is totally disrupting the customer contact center space as they have many other market-spaces with customer-centric solutions with open platform integration with assistance from the partner community.”
As a product manager on our team, you will own driving strategic initiatives through completion. You will work cross-functionally across teams to solve challenging problems using the latest technologies. You will make data-driven decisions and work with leadership across AWS to prioritize your programs.
What is in it for you?
Team culture: You'll be joining a fun team that prides itself on a great work environment with an inclusive group of people that love working together towards a common goal.Impact: Work on a service that will be used, directly and indirectly, by millions of customers and has a meaningful impact to their functions and interactions.Gratification: You will know you are directly responsible for solving real customer problems.Critical and Fast: This is a strategic new business for AWS, and we are moving fast, really fast.Ownership: You will quickly become responsible for key components of the service, and drive what and how to build them.Learn & Grow: If you want to learn and grow with challenges of a designing and building a large-scale fault tolerant systems – this is an opportunity of a life time.Innovate: We learn from our customers and invent every day on their behalf.Make history: AWS is the leader in a current industry wide revolution, and specifically at Amazon Connect, we are changing the way customers think about contact centers.Have fun: Surround yourself with a highly talented team of product managers, engineers, and UX designers that like to solve complex problems, but also work in a fun and autonomous environment.
Additional resources:
Learn more about Amazon Connect here.See the media coverage about Amazon Connect here.Understand the true power of Amazon Connect here.

PREFERRED QUALIFICATIONS
Deep understanding of user behavior and interactions with web products.Sharp analytical abilities, proven design skills, and a track record of delivery.Strong communication skills for both a technical and business audience, with an emphasis on writing down ideas effectively.8+ years of experience working on successful technology products from ideation through launch.Experience in the contact center industry or B2B SaaS.Experience with cloud technologies.Proven ability to influence a large organization effectively.Strong track record of shaping business strategy for technical products or services for large Enterprises or partners.5+ years of technical knowledge of Telecom industry applications, platforms, and data ecosystemHighly technical and analytical and will be capable of understanding the complexities of negotiating complex Telecom contracts.

job_title: Program Manager, Diversity, Equality and Inclusion 1
job_description:
Req. ID: 202244

Our vision is to transform how the world uses information to enrich life. Join an inclusive team passionate about one thing: using their expertise in the relentless pursuit of innovation for customers and partners. The solutions we build help make everything from virtual reality experiences to breakthroughs in neural networks possible. We do it all while committing to integrity, sustainability, and giving back to our communities. Because doing so can fuel the very innovation we are pursuing.
Do you have a passion for diversity, equality, and inclusion? Are you driven to build an environment where every team member can fully contribute? If so, this role will allow you to collaborate with key partners and the DEI team to develop and execute holistic strategies to make a difference for Micron team members.

As a Program Manager, Diversity, Equality and Inclusion at Micron Technology, you will work with the global HR Team, Business Leaders and other key partners to drive our Employee Resource Group (ERG) and Inclusion initiatives globally. Reporting into the Vice President of Diversity, Equality and Inclusion, you will be responsible for the design, development and integration of targeted Inclusion programs and initiatives that align to Micron’s global Diversity, Equality and Inclusion strategy.

This position can be located in San Jose, Boise, Japan, SIngapore, Taiwan, or China.

Responsibilities include, but not limited to:
Lead all aspects of the formation and global expansion of our Employee Resource Groups
Partner with ERGs and Executive Sponsors to establish clear governance and goals that are tied to business impact and evaluated regularly
Collaborate closely with ERGs to craft and develop research, reports and/or models required to evaluate results and efficiency of ERG plans
Identify and implement process improvements and metrics based on industry standard methodologies
Plan events, including preparing budgets, retaining vendors, preparing communications and marketing materials
Assist with implementing social media strategy for the organization and ERGs
Develop and lead the annual global ERG summit
Own the development and implementation of our global Inclusive Leader training initiative, in partnership with Leadership Development
Utilize technology and standard methodologies to develop new innovative learning programs that drive DEI awareness, understanding and action
Lead DEI Council, including meeting facilitation, council goals, training and deliverables
Demonstrate subject matter expertise in organizational change, inclusion and talent to build strategies and tactics that improve inclusion culture
Partner with the DEI data analyst and the People Analytics Team to measure and report progress on the advancement of Inclusion initiatives
Provide a framework and mentorship for ERG membership records, budget, and expense management
Partner with Learning team to build career development programs for ERG Leaders
Maintain close relationships with business partners, HR and team members to identify DEI learning needs
Qualifications and Requirements:

4+ years of Diversity & Inclusion experience or related experience in HR, Talent Management or Program Management
Proven program management experience with the ability to effectively drive cross-functional projects with multiple partners
Expert facilitation skills with experience developing and delivering locally-relevant diversity content
Proven track record to work with all levels of management as a tactical and strategic partner, mentor and advisor
Excellent communication skills; ability to influence and build trusting relationships
Ability to interpret data and transform those insights into measurable strategies
Prior experience working in a large, global organization a must
Ability to follow assignments through to completion with a bias towards action
Ability to travel
About Micron Technology, Inc.

We are an industry leader in innovative memory and storage solutions. Through our global brands – Micron® and Crucial® – our broad portfolio of high-performance memory and storage technologies, including DRAM, NAND, 3D XPoint™ memory and NOR, is transforming how the world uses information to enrich life. Backed by more than 40 years of technology leadership, our memory and storage solutions enable disruptive trends, including artificial intelligence, 5G, machine learning and autonomous vehicles, in key market segments like mobile, data center, client, consumer, industrial, graphics, automotive, and networking. Our common stock is traded on the Nasdaq under the MU symbol. To learn more visit micron.com/careers.
Micron believes that all persons are entitled to equal employment opportunities. Micron recruits, hires, trains, promotes, disciplines and provides other conditions of employment without regard to a person’s race, color, ethnicity, religion, gender, gender identity, or expression, age, national origin, disability, veteran’s status, sexual orientation, marital status or other classifications protected under law or Company policy. This includes providing reasonable accommodation for team members’ disabilities or religious beliefs and practices. All qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to race, color, religion, sex, sexual orientation, gender identity, national origin, veteran or disability status.

To request assistance with the application process and/or for reasonable accommodations, please contact Micron’s Human Resources Department at HR4U@micron.com.

Interested in amazing benefits and receiving 25% in PROFIT SHARING annually?
Are you interested in supporting a team focused on creating a new Big Data Analytics Platform for the Defense Intelligence Agency? If so, then this is the position for you!

We are seeking a passionate and driven individual with solid Government program experience as a Risk Manager to execute all tasks needed to identify and mitigate program risks on TALOS. TALOS is a DIA initiative to advance the state of the art in Big Data, data analysis, Artificial Intelligence (AI), Machine Learning (ML), and advanced analytics to enhance the DoD’s and the IC’s information processes and technical architectures.
Are you self-motivated and enjoy a challenge? We invite you Invent Your Future with CACI International!
What You’ll Get to Do:
Leads efforts with Team Leads to identify and mitigate risk through the risk register
Conduct assessments to define and analyze possible risks.
Evaluate the gravity of each risk by considering its consequences
Audit TALOS risk processes and procedures
Develop, maintain, and update the program Risk Management Plan (RMP)
Design processes to eliminate or mitigate potential risks
Create contingency plans to manage crises
Evaluate existing policies and procedures to find weaknesses
Prepare reports and present recommendations
Help implement solutions and plans
Evaluate employees’ risk awareness and train them when necessary
You’ll Bring These Qualifications:
Active DoD Top Secret with the ability to obtain SCI security clearance
Bachelor’s degree in Engineering, Science, or related technical discipline with
5+ total years of related experience. ( Experience in DIA is a plus)
Project Management Professional (PMP) Certification
Experience tracking tasks using PM tools (e.g. Microsoft Project, Excel)
Leading and scheduling project meetings

CI POLY
Experience fulfilling the DIA mission in support of the COCOMs

Working knowledge of Agile software development practices
What We Can Offer You:
BITS, a CACI Company, offers very rewarding and unique benefits, which equates to 50% of compensation on TOP of your base salary! The first part is a tax-qualified profit-sharing retirement plan, to which BITS annually contributes up to 25% of your base salary (not in excess of applicable IRS limits) to your retirement account. The second component consists of BITS' Individual Benefit Account (IBA), which is used for premiums, medical reimbursements, dependent care, education and Paid Time Off (PTO) policy. Both components of the BITS benefit package are paid for by BITS, in addition to your base salary and potential performance bonuses. We believe in a healthy home/work balance and both of our locations offer a wide variety of activities to balance with your work life. Learn more at BITS
We’ve been named a Best Place to Work by the Washington Post and the Denver Post.
Our employees value the flexibility at CACI that allows them to balance quality work and their personal lives.
We offer competitive benefits and learning and development opportunities.

Introduction
Axtria is a global provider of cloud software and data analytics to the Life Sciences industry. We help Life Sciences companies transform the product commercialization journey to drive sales growth and improve healthcare outcomes for patients. We are acutely aware that our work impacts millions of patients and lead passionately to improve their lives.
Since our founding in 2010, technology innovation has been our winning differentiation, and we continue to leapfrog competition with platforms that deploy Artificial Intelligence and Machine Learning. Our cloud-based platforms - Axtria DataMax™, Axtria InsightsMax™, Axtria SalesIQ™, and Axtria MarketingIQ™ - enable customers to efficiently manage data, leverage data science to deliver insights for sales and marketing planning and manage end-to-end commercial operations. With customers in over 75 countries, Axtria is one of the largest global commercial solutions providers in the Life Sciences industry. We continue to win industry recognition for growth and are featured in some of the most aspirational lists - INC 5000, Deloitte FAST 500, NJBiz FAST 50, SmartCEO Future 50, Red Herring 100, and several other growth and technology awards.
Axtria is looking for exceptional talent to join our rapidly growing global team. People are our biggest perk! Our transparent and collaborative culture offers a chance to work with some of the brightest minds in the industry. Axtria Institute, our in-house university, offers the best training in the industry and an opportunity to learn in a structured environment. A customized career progression plan ensures every associate is setup for success and able to do meaningful work in a fun environment. We want our legacy to be the leaders we produce for the industry. Will you be next?

As an Advanced Systems Administration Specialist, you’ll serve as a front-line interface to users with technical issues by conducting systems analysis and development to keep systems current with changing technologies. job_title: Data Scientist Lead, Capacity Planning & Analytics
job_description:
The Business Planning and Analysis (BP&A) team is a part of Consumer and Community Banking Finance and Operations. The Quantitative Workforce Optimization (QWO) team is tasked with delivering quantitatively driven solutions to support the core BP&A functions (demand forecasting, capacity planning, resource scheduling, and business analysis & support). The BP&A team supports Chase's call centers, back office, and ~5,200 retail branches.
Projects engaged by the QWO team can be complex, data intensive, and of a high level of difficulty, each having significant impact on the business. Typically these problems will be of an unstructured nature, whereby the employee will be expected to quickly assess and comprehend the situation then develop a practical problem solving strategy. You will be expected to analyze the topic in question, develop solution proposals and review their results and next steps with management for prioritization and delivery.
The QWO team has four core functions:

Data Infrastructure & Controls

Run-the-Bank Quant

Change-the-Bank Quant

Operations


The Run-the-Bank Quant team is tasked with ensuring the day-to-day analytics and reporting activities are delivered quickly and to stakeholder satisfaction. Particular focus is paid to ad-hoc and executive questions surrounding:

Scenario analyses in support of CAO, marketing, National Sales, site strategy, call center, etc. troubleshooting

Exploratory data analysis for root-cause explanations to answer the pre/post "why" questions (e.g. why are call times 15% higher than our YoY counts)

Non-operational but informational reporting / visualization and executive presentations


Responsibilities
The RTB Quant Vice President will be charged with delivering on the RTB functional priorities listed prior. Your work will directly support the greater CCB BP&A efforts to ensure they have the best and most predictive data available for use, and will work hand-in-hand with them to ensure Chase maintains the best quantitative workforce optimization.

Being a People Technology Manager at iManage means…
You are a dynamic, data oriented HRIS professional with experience streamlining various human resources systems, reporting, data analytics, and HR business processes. You will manage large global HRIS projects with various stakeholders and help propel the iManage People Operations technology vision forward.
You will be responsible for building the iManage HRIS technology strategy for the People Operations Systems and maximizing the use of Ceridian Dayforce to achieve the People Operations mission. You will use your creative, analytical mindset to own the roadmap and feature definition within our HRIS system including implementing new modules and assessing gaps. You will examine and improve current practices, while investigating future methods to process data and solve issues using HRIS technology on a global scale. As a People Technology Manager, you will have both individual contributor and team management responsibilities.
We value innovation and out of the box thinking to solve business problems and identify opportunities for HR technology to evolve – it is about curiosity, creativity and a commitment to excellence in a fast-paced environment. You will make your mark on a collaborative global team while developing your passions and having fun along the way! You will help us enable all iManage employees to #MakeItMeanSomething.
iM Responsible For…
Developing the vision and product roadmap for our iManage People Technology solutions regarding Ceridian Dayforce and other HRIS tools; defining short-term and long-term technology rollout strategies.
Owning and delivering on HR Operations metrics.
Managing all HRIS policies, workflows, and reporting capabilities.
Defining and owning the new People Operations helpdesk ticketing system and escalation tickets.
Serving as the HRIS subject matter expert and partnering with Global People Operations to ensure system functionality meets organizational needs.
Delivering innovative products and solutions that solve complex business problems in the People Operations systems space.
Anticipating and recommending technology solutions and innovation opportunities by understanding business challenges and strategic and operational priorities.
Being the main point of escalation for any HRIS related issues
Assisting in enhanced reporting while understanding and following standards that ensure the data integrity of HR information globally.
Reviewing, analyzing and creating detailed documentation of business processes and system functionality, including workflows, program functions and steps required to execute transactions.
Performing Ceridian Dayforce business processes and related system configurations
Serving as the first point of contact with various HRIS vendors as needed
iM Qualified Because I have…
A Bachelor's degree in Human Resources, IT, business or related field
5+ years of professional level HRIS, information technology or human resources experience
Experience with a complex HRIS system, with Dayforce experience as an advantage
Worked in ether a regulated environment or with ISO and SOC compliance – audit experience and compliance experience
Expertise in HRIS rollouts and understanding of stakeholders and moving parts.
Project Management experience
Experience providing HR software to a medium to large employee population
Experience working across various countries or jurisdictions for employment law purposes
Strong analytical and problem-solving skills as well as time-management, project/tasks prioritization skills
Expertise in data entry methods & data audits
The ability to handle and protect confidential and sensitive information
Experience collaborating with others worldwide as part of a global team
About iManage
iManage combines artificial intelligence with content and email management to free, secure, and understand information. Over 3000 companies and 1 million users worldwide rely on our market-leading software to share and protect their most valuable data. Our work is not always easy but it is ambitious and rewarding.
So we're looking for people who love a challenge. People who are happiest when they're solving problems and collaborating with the industry's best and brightest. In exchange, we'll make sure the work you do here is worth doing. That's the iManage way. It's how we do things that might appear impossible. How we develop our employees' strengths and unlock their potential. It's how we find meaning in everything we do.
Whoever you are, whatever you do, however you work. Make it mean something at iManage.

job_title: Principal Data Scientist- Industrial Discrete Sector Industry
job_description:
Introduction
As a Data Scientist at IBM, you will help transform our clients’ data into tangible business value by analyzing information, communicating outcomes and collaborating on product development. Work with Best in Class open source and visual tools, along with the most flexible and scalable deployment options. Whether it’s investigating patient trends or weather patterns, you will work to solve real world problems for the industries transforming how we live.

Your Role and Responsibilities
Quantum computers are incredibly powerful machines that take a new approach to processing information. Built on the principles of quantum mechanics, they exploit complex and fascinating laws of nature that are always there, but usually remain hidden from view. By harnessing such natural behavior, quantum computers can run new types of algorithms to process information more holistically. They may one day lead to revolutionary breakthroughs in materials and drug discovery, the optimization of complex manmade systems, and artificial intelligence. We expect them to open doors that we once thought would remain locked indefinitely.

What you’ll be doing:
IBM Services is looking for a Quantum Data Scientist who will interface with research and algorithm experts to implement quantum approaches, which includes data pre-/post-processing, running numerics and visualizing data. Working with quantum industry experts, you will be a key member of a multi-discipline squad focused on building quantum capabilities and researching quantum application development for clients within discrete manufacturing industries, including aerospace & defense, automotive and electronics manufacturing.
Work with IBM Q Start team on active exploratory research engagements to prepare for future use case commercialization within specific industries
Engage and educate client data science teams to define promising areas for quantum exploration
Implement quantum approaches, which includes data pre-/post-processing, running numerics and visualizing data
Collaborate with industry and solutioning experts to design and shape experiments to demonstrate quantum-enabled advantage
Define best practices related to information architecture, including collection, integration, organization, analysis and visualization of data for quantum-enabled impact
Engage in practice development initiatives focused on building employee knowledge and skills in specific areas of expertise through coaching and development of training course material
At IBM our goal is to be essential to the world, which starts with our people.

Career Growth
Skill development: We help our employees develop and grow their foundational skills
Finding the dream job at IBM: Endless career paths and advancement opportunities
Diversity of people: Commitment to creating a diverse and inclusive culture

IBM offers a competitive benefits program, designed to help employees build a solid financial foundation for meeting a diverse array of needs.

Benefits
Parental Bonding/Maternity LeavePaid Care LeaveHealthcare, Dental and VisionFlexible Work HoursAdoption and Surrogacy Assistance ProgramEmployee DiscountsWorldwide Diversity & Inclusion and Business Resource GroupsEmployee Stock Purchase PlanRetirement Plan

Learn more about what working at IBM can mean for you!
http://www-01.ibm.com/employment/us/benefits

IBM has been recognized over the years for our ability to innovate and promote a culture of principles and values, using technology as a key element.

Recognitions
Fortune — Most Admired Companies
DiversityInc. — Top 10 Companies for Global Diversity
National Association of Female Executives — Top 50 Companies for Female Executives
Working Mother — 100 Best Companies
2016 Climate Leadership Award



Required Technical and Professional Expertise

PhD/Masters in STEM related fields with knowledge in quantum computing.
5+ years of data engineering and data science experience
2+ years of consulting experience within specific industries with strong domain expertise and business acumen
Proficiency with classical approaches for optimization, machine learning and linear algebra, including linear and combinatorial optimization, routing heuristics, classification and clustering technics, numerical simulation, statistics analysis, real time processing
Familiar with Qiskit software, including Qiskit Aqua for domain applications and Qiskit Terra for quantum circuit design and optimization
Excellent ideation, facilitation and communications skills
Detail-oriented team player with strong interpersonal skills and ability to take a leadership role when necessary
English: Fluent

Must be willing to travel both domestically and globally up to 40% (Will be required once we return to a travel-safe normal)



Preferred Technical and Professional Expertise

Experience with linear programming and/or general mathematical programming
Proficiency in Python with good knowledge of Jupyter, Tensor, Numpy
Deep knowledge and application expertise in ML/DL
Familiarity with Qiskit and quantum concepts and principles, able to model classical ML/DL algorithms within quantum principles
Experience with some aspect of high-performance computing use within an industry context

About Business Unit
IBM Services is a team of business, strategy and technology consultants that design, build, and run foundational systems and services that is the backbone of the world's economy. IBM Services partners with the world's leading companies in over 170 countries to build smarter businesses by reimagining and reinventing through technology, with its outcome-focused methodologies, industry-leading portfolio and world class research and operations expertise leading to results-driven innovation and enduring excellence.

Your Life @ IBM
What matters to you when you’re looking for your next career challenge?

Maybe you want to get involved in work that really changes the world? What about somewhere with incredible and diverse career and development opportunities – where you can truly discover your passion? Are you looking for a culture of openness, collaboration and trust – where everyone has a voice? What about all of these? If so, then IBM could be your next career challenge. Join us, not to do something better, but to attempt things you never thought possible.

Impact. Inclusion. Infinite Experiences. Do your best work ever.

About IBM
IBM’s greatest invention is the IBMer. We believe that progress is made through progressive thinking, progressive leadership, progressive policy and progressive action. IBMers believe that the application of intelligence, reason and science can improve business, society and the human condition. Restlessly reinventing since 1911, we are the largest technology and consulting employer in the world, with more than 380,000 IBMers serving clients in 170 countries.

Location Statement

Being You @ IBM
IBM is committed to creating a diverse environment and is proud to be an equal opportunity employer. All qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to race, color, religion, gender, gender identity or expression, sexual orientation, national origin, genetics, disability, age, or veteran status. Principal Radar Systems Engineer

One global team creating trusted, innovative solutions to make the world a safer place…..
Raytheon Technologies (RTX) offers an innovative and inclusive culture; welcoming diversity and collaboration and providing numerous opportunities for career growth.

The System Design & Architecture Team is the central focus for Mission Systems Integration activities within Raytheon Missiles & Defense (RMD). The more than 2,100 employees provide requirements definition and design at the system, subsystem and component level every day in a collaborative environment which is characterized by respect for the individual, problem solving in a team setting, consensus oriented solutions, and results based recognition. Supporting this mission are teams providing domain expertise and creative solutions in surveillance, naval and missile defense based radar system design, sonar and undersea sensor system design, integrated air and missile defense systems engineering, command and control/battle management system design, combat system and platform architecture design and integration, software intensive system engineering, cyber solutions and algorithm development for signal processing, tracking and discrimination systems. The team welcomes you to join our tradition of achieving excellence through thought and team work while leveraging individual diversity conducive to a flexible work schedule and environment.

Join this highly visible team and perform technically challenging assignments which will directly contribute to protecting our nation and our war fighters.

Are you interested in joining a dynamic, inclusive, and growing professional organization? Integrated Defense Systems is looking for a Radar Senior Systems Engineer to support the Missile Defense and Sensor Systems (MDSS) department. The MDSS department provides subject matter expertise for concept development, architectural design, requirements generation & flow down, modeling and simulation, systems analysis, integration, test and evaluation of world-class Missile Defense & Sensor Systems to be achieved through our people, processes, technology and performance.

Experience with MS Office Suite

Experience with system level requirements development, documentation and maintenance and/or requirements development and design of system level software architecture.

Experience with the development and coding of system models, algorithms, test vectors and analysis tools in support of analyzing radar requirements and performance
Experience and interest in Information Assurance/Cyber Engineering requirements, determination, development, and implementation
Experience working with Matlab, C/C++, Java, or DOORS
Previous military service
Excellent communication, technical writing, oral presentation, and interpersonal skills
Proven ability to interface with customers and lead technical solutions to complex user needs
Strong analytic, technical and problem solving skills
Active DoD Secret Clearance or greater

Bachelor’s Degree in Engineering, Science, Mathematics or related discipline.
