Job Description – Associate/Director

ALQIMI is seeking an Associate Director to join our team.

The successful candidate is a dynamic, highly-motivated self-starter who will manage client engagements and drive profitable growth of ALQIMI products and services. ALQIMI is considering candidates of various experience levels including Associate (4-8 years of experience) and Director (8+ years of experience). The successful candidate will report to the President of ALQIMI.

ALQIMI is a global information technology solutions company based in Washington, D.C., USA. For more than 20 years, ALQIMI has operated in demanding government agency and commercial environments delivering a wide range of cutting-edge IT solutions enabling these organizations to surpass their missions and goals. ALQIMI's domain expertise includes big data software development, artificial intelligence, healthcare IT and large-scale enterprise computing. ALQIMI offers services and products to clients in the US, Europe and Asia.

ALQIMI has developed a big data platform (RAAVN) consisting of applications, microservices and other back-end technologies. The RAAVN platform is a complete end-to-end, system-of-systems capable of open source data collections, all-source data fusion, analytics, artificial intelligence, visualizations and more. Rather than develop point applications, ALQIMI's RAAVN suite is meant to serve as a platform for the rapid development, tailorization/customization of client applications. Such a platform allows a higher level of “future proofing” given that new technologies, third party tools and existing client applications can all be easily integrated. Successful applications of RAAVN have taken place with IBM, the United States Department of Energy and Defense, Jane's, Bajaj Capital and was used to detect and analyze the now famous Russian Troll farms accused of US presidential election meddling.

OPPORTUNITY DETAILS
ALQIMI is currently seeking a dynamic, self-starter to help us manage and grow our business. The candidate must have a minimum of four years of experience and ALQIMI will consider candidates with more experience.

Responsibilities

Manage existing customer engagements. Acting as the “customer success manager” you will ensure the client's satisfaction through attentive interaction with the client and a watchful eye on the statement of work. In addition, you will generate revenue growth by generating new ideas and selling them through to the client.
Growth revenues through new account acquisition. Independently, and as part of a team, pursue new sales of products and services through direct sales efforts including RFP submissions, cold-contacting, marketing, conferences and networking.
Build marketing and proposal materials. Utilizing existing libraries and working from scratch, create pitchbooks, white papers, RFQ submissions, slicks and any other materials necessary to accomplish the goal.
Accept dynamic tasking. ALQIMI prides itself on being highly responsive to its customers and prospects. The candidate will work on a myriad of tasks and projects which will shift with client and customer needs. The candidate will need to be prepared to do whatever has to be done to make progress.
Meet goals. The candidate will have throughput volume, sales volume, customer success and customer expansion goals which the candidate accepts responsibility for.
Continuously learn. Part of our success is dependent on all team members understanding the latest AI/Analytics/Bid Data methodologies so we can develop own best-in-class solution. The candidate will embrace learning initiatives impacting the organization.
Know how to self-task. Having a clear sense of the goals, the candidate should be able to independently lay out a plan for execution and self manage that plan.
Maintain the right mindset. The candidate will help foster a culture of accountability, professional development, high-performance, and ethical behavior including establishing and maintaining productive peer-to-peer relationships with colleagues, customers and prospects.

Must Have Qualifications/Requirements

Minimum of four years experience in a prospect or customer facing role.
Have intermediate knowledge in at least one of the following subject areas: healthcare, DoD, IC, AI, analytics or computer science.
Hold a passport and be willing to travel locally, domestically and internationally

Bonus Qualifications

Fluency in Russian, Spanish or Mandarin a plus

[1]The title the candidate will be designated with will be determined by the candidate's experience level

Company Overview:
Charter Communications is America’s fastest growing TV, internet and voice company. We’re committed to integrating the highest quality service with superior entertainment and communications products. Charter is at the intersection of technology and entertainment, facilitating essential communications that connect 24 million residential and business customers in 41 states. Our commitment to serving customers and exceeding their expectations is the bedrock of Charter’s business strategy and it’s the philosophy that guides our 90,000 employees.

JOB SUMMARY
The Advanced Analytics group has implemented and is operating a new advanced Big Data analytics platform that enables new self-service analytics, decision engineering support, machine learning, modeling, forecasting, and optimizations in Charter’s Advanced Engineering organization. This position is responsible to create and maintain scalable, reliable, consistent and repeatable platforms, systems, and models that support data, data products, and analytical products for advanced analytics by gathering, processing, exploring, and modeling raw and diverse data at scale. It requires lifecycle management of multiple data sources, data discovery, and models. This position architects and delivers models, analytics, automation, and self-service, which are major tenets of the analytics platform.

The most successful candidate will have lifecycle experience in machine learning, deep learning, and/or artificial intelligence within modern parallel environments, such as GPU-enabled platforms and distributed clusters. This lifecycle includes conceiving, developing, prototyping, analyzing, and implementing models with very large (i.e., the top end of big data) and diverse datasets and in collaboration with stakeholders. Desirable experience includes using big data platforms for sources (e.g., Snowflake, AWS/s3, and Hadoop) to create deep learning and machine learning models with GPU-based Python (e.g., NVIDIA/DGX/RAPIDS).

MAJOR DUTIES AND RESPONSIBILITIES
Frames and models meaningful business and engineering scenarios that impact critical business and engineering processes, architectures, and/or decisions

Researches, develops, and implements machine learning models, deep learning models, artificial intelligence, and algorithms that solve business and engineering problems

Develops innovative and effective approaches to solve model problems while communicating the results and methodologies

Leverages multiple data sources to produce products that solve the needs of business and engineering for descriptive models, predictive models, diagnostic models, and prescriptive models

Applies data mining, data discovery, machine learning, deep learning, and artificial intelligence techniques to large structured and unstructured datasets for model creation

Gathers and processes raw data at scale from any source and in any format

Balances workloads and operational demands with open source technologies, cloud services, and commercial solutions while optimizing cost and time-to-solution demands

Creates highly reusable code modules, templates, and packages that can be leveraged across model lifecycle

Increases speed to delivery by architecting and implementing automated solutions

Mentors, educates, and provides senior leadership to data scientists, data analysts, and data engineers

REQUIRED QUALIFICATIONS
Ability to create proof of concept experiments for analytics, machine learning, or visualization tools that includes hypothesis, test plans, and outcome analysis.

Ability to create unsupervised and supervised models. Time series expertise is a plus.

Solid statistical knowledge and techniques.

Exceptional programming skills in Python

Experience with one of the deep learning frameworks, such as TensorFlow or PyTorch.

Develop highly scalable systems, algorithms, and tools to support machine learning, deep learning, and artificial intelligence solutions.

Lifecycle management using Docker and containerization.

Experience with Snowflake, AWS, Hadoop, and/or Spark.

Excellent pattern recognition and predictive modeling skills.

Extracting data and delivering complete analytics and machine learning products primarily using Python; secondary experience with ProgR, Java, Javascript, C, C++, Scala, or Julia is an asset.

Work closely with other data scientists, data engineers, and systems/infrastructure teams to deploy end-to-end models capable of serving production traffic in real-time.

Develop, integrate and optimize model/AI/ML/DL pipelines.

Leverage modern parallel environments, e.g. distributed clusters, multicore SMP, GPU, TPU and FPGA.

Design and implement feedback loops for continual model updates and improvements

Experience receiving, converting, and cleansing big data.

Visualization or BI tools, such as Tableau, Microstrategy, RapidMiner, or anything Microsoft Power BI.

Program, product, or project management experience delivering model and analytics results.

Strong background in Linux/Unix/CentOS/MacOS and Windows installation and administration.

Keen attention to detail with the ability to effectively prioritize and execute multiple tasks.

Ability to read, write, speak and understand English.


PREFERRED QUALIFICATIONS
Jupyter Notebooks, NVIDIA GPU-based Deep Learning, and NVIDIA RAPIDS.
Familiarity with APIs: Javascript API, Rest API or Data Extract APIs.
Familiarity with data workflow/data prep platforms, such as Alteryx, Pentaho, or KNIME.
Familiarity with DevOps/CI/CD/automation/configuration/orchestration management using Puppet, Chef, Ansible, Jenkins, Kubernetes, Airflow, or equivalents.
Knowledge of best practices and IT operations in an always-up, always-available service.
Knowledge of Agile, Scrum, and SAFe environments. Experience delivering within these environment a plus.

Education
Bachelor's degree in a data science, engineering discipline, computer science, statistics, applied math, or related field required.
Master’s degree in a data science, engineering discipline, computer science, statistics, applied math, or related field preferred.

Related Work Experience
3-5+ years of experience in one or more of the following areas: machine learning, deep learning, recommendation systems, natural language processing, fraud detection or artificial intelligence
3-5+ years of experience of lifecycle management in one or more of the following from idea to deployment: artificial intelligence, deep learning models, machine learning models, recommendation systems, natural language processing, or fraud detection.
3-5+ years of experience in data engineering position and/or software development.
Experience delivering multiple systems where candidate was responsible for designing the architecture, implementing, operating, supporting, and managing the release lifecycle from inception to end of life.
7-10+ years of hands-on working experience with Python, RDBMS, SQL, scripting, and coding.
Proven experience in translating insights into business recommendations.

WORKING CONDITIONS
Charter Technical Engineering Center

Highly collaborative and innovative work space

Occasional Travel

Are you a technology innovator with automation in your DNA? Do you like to find cutting edge technology that can transform business processes? If so, then our Director of IT Innovation is the role for you!!
The Director of IT Innovation will drive innovation, both technology-enabled business model innovation and next generation technology. The Director will partner with Assurant’s Enterprise Transformation office and ensure that enterprise transformation initiatives are in line with IT strategies. The Director will also lead teams that implement newer technologies such as RPA, Artificial Intelligence, IPA, etc. Finally, the Director will evaluate new technologies and their “fit for purpose” within the Assurant technology landscape. The Director is expected to be up to speed on new technologies relevant to the business, attends and occasionally presents at conferences representing Assurant.
Responsibilities:
Encourage Innovation
Creates & maintains environment that encourage development of new ideas
Creates & maintains environment that allows for quickly vetting and testing new ideas
Defines the innovation strategy & model
Coordinate Innovation Efforts
Identifies, tracks and/or leads POCs on nextgen technology investments that will deliver upon the differentiate strategy
Leads all nextgen tech discovery
Provides support for nextgen technologies during their infancy
Closely partners with Assurant’s Enterprise Transformation Office on technology enabled business model innovation
Externally Focused
Communicates technology trends, innovations translated for Assurant context to C-level
Regularly attends conferences, thought leadership forums and brings learnings back to benefit Assurant
Partners with key technology vendors to align roadmaps and influence direction
Basic Qualifications:
Bachelor’s degree
8 years of experience in a technology role
3 years of technology leadership experience
2 years of innovation and research of new technology tools / concepts
Preferred Qualifications:
3 years of experience with Intelligent Process Automation (IPA), RPA, AI and DPR
Proven leadership experience driving large technology projects
Led team of technology personnel
Experience in people management
Strong understanding of corporate strategy (and how technology supports and enables)
Deep understanding of technology trends and a broad knowledge of technology products and vendors
Experience establishing long-term, collaborative relationships at senior levels of an organization
Experience developing cost benefit analysis around technology decisions
Ability to organize and lead diverse groups toward common goals
Intellectual curiosity: ability to learn quickly and with enthusiasm
Enterprise-mindset: ability to identify opportunities that maximize benefit to the enterprise as a whole
Systems and conceptual thinking: ability to capture the key elements of a system into a simple abstraction that empowers good decisions
Critical and analytical thinking: ability to analyze multiple long and short-term competing factors to arrive at high-quality recommendations
Communication: ability to effectively communicate (written, verbal, and presentation skills) to multiple levels within the business and technology organizations

Company Overview:
Charter Communications is America’s fastest growing TV, internet and voice company. We’re committed to integrating the highest quality service with superior entertainment and communications products. Charter is at the intersection of technology and entertainment, facilitating essential communications that connect 24 million residential and business customers in 41 states. Our commitment to serving customers and exceeding their expectations is the bedrock of Charter’s business strategy and it’s the philosophy that guides our 90,000 employees.

JOB SUMMARY
The Advanced Analytics group has implemented and is operating a new advanced Big Data analytics platform that enables new self-service analytics, decision engineering support, machine learning, modeling, forecasting, and optimizations in Charter's Advanced Engineering organization. This position is responsible for the guidance and architecture of the Advanced Analytics Platform. The architect will make high-level design decisions, directing tools, platforms and coding standards, and provide guidance for data strategy and governance to build a next-generation analytics environment, that provides real-time analytics as well as artificial intelligence and machine learning capabilities.

MAJOR DUTIES AND RESPONSIBILITIES
Design and implement a data platform called Network:1 Data Plane, with data acquisition, distribution monitoring capabilities, and governance for data pipelines.

Design and implement big data, production-level data processing architectures such as Lambda architectures.

Work with other teams within the organization to ensure efficient and accurate data transfer to the Network:1 Data Distribution Hub.

Must be an expert on the latest Apache Stack technologies, as well as other analytics offerings and newest technologies.

Works closely with stakeholders on the data demand side (data engineers and data scientists).

Works closely with stakeholders on the data supply side (domain experts on source systems of the data).

Focuses on key business results and can weigh business, technical, and strategic architectural tradeoffs.

Demonstrates care about customers, are metrics-driven, and can communicate the costs and tradeoffs of your ideas to top management.

REQUIRED QUALIFICATIONS
Strong experience with distributed computing architectures, including Apache Hadoop and Apache Spark or other distributed computing environments, like Mesos.
Strong experience with data streaming architectures such as Apache Kafka, with experience with stream processing frameworks such as Apache Spark Streaming or Apache Kafka Streams.
Must have knowledge and experience creating of production-level data processing architectures based on Lambda or Kappa approaches.
Must understand functional programming concepts like Filter Map Reduce and functional programming languages like Scala or Python.
Expertise in data storage that demonstrates knowledge of when to use a file system, relational database, or NoSQL variant.
Strong background in Linux/Unix/CentOS installation and administration.
Expert in large scale data collection, ingestion, and distribution systems. Experience with large scale Kafka implementations is a must.

Ability to identify and resolve end-to-end performance, network, server, and platform issues.
Keen attention to detail with the ability to effectively prioritize and execute multiple tasks.
Ability to read, write, speak and understand English.


PREFERRED QUALIFICATIONS
Familiarity with Machine Learning and Artificial Intelligence frameworks and tools such as Tensorflow, Caffe, and Python.
Familiarity with Graph database technologies, such as Neo4j.
Familiarity with data workflow/data prep platforms, such as Alteryx, Pentaho, or KNIME.
Experience with large scale data collection and distribution systems and architectures.

Knowledge of best practices and IT operations in an always-up, always-available service.

Education
Bachelor's degree in an engineering discipline or computer science.
Master of Science in an engineering discipline, computer engineering or computer science.


Related Work Experience
10- 15+ years of Linux/Unix/CentOS system admin; Windows experience a plus.
10-15+ years of hands-on working experience with embedding analytics applications, model scoring, RDBMS, SQL, scripting, and coding.
Experience delivering one major analytics oriented system where candidate was responsible for designing the architecture, implementing, operating, and supporting.

WORKING CONDITIONS
Charter Technical Engineering Center

Highly collaborative and innovative workspace

Occasional Travel

About Us

At SoarTech, our focus is in the development of artificial intelligence (AI) that reasons like humans do, to automate complex tasks, simplify human-machine interactions, or model human behaviors. Our philosophy is three-fold: to be an augmentation to, not a replacement of, the human; to think top-down, not bottom-up; and to be transparent so that decisions and processing are communicated to the human and in human-like terms.
SoarTech has two primary business areas, Autonomous Platforms, and Intelligent Systems. Both are growing and we are looking for individuals interested in helping us acquire top talent to research, develop, and implement this exciting technology into everyday operations.
Job Description:

Works closely with contracts department to maintain and establish effective and compliant proposal processes. Responsible for developing, planning, and scheduling all proposals efforts and providing administrative support on a variety of projects and tasks.
Duties and Responsibilities:
Develops, plans and schedules proposal efforts
Compiles cost, schedule, and technical elements in the development of proposals in accordance with request for proposal (RFP) specifications
Maintain effective processes for department to support company policies and procedures
Manage proposals (RFP, RFI) and all deliverables as needed, including determining schedules, assigning work packages, coordinating content submission from writers, and submitting responses on-time, as well as final editing and formatting
Coordinate with other departments as needed to provide effective reporting and proposal logging information
Coordinates the collection and accumulation of cost, scheduling, and performance elements from other departments or organizations.
Researches and analyzes historical data, develops cost models to support proposal efforts and market research
Coordinates activities and participates in fact-finding meetings
Participates in reviews with management and customer representatives
Oversight of all quote/proposals, responsible for receipt, set-up, tracking, etc.
Verification that all requirements of quote have been addressed
Prepare and present proposal packages
Required Skills and Experience:
BA/BS in business administration, contracts, technical writing, proposals or a related discipline or equivalent experience.
2–5 years experience in research, technical writing, contracts, proposals or government experience required.
Excellent analytical, verbal and written communication skills
Excellent planning, organization, and coordination skills.
Good leadership and mentoring skills needed to support teams and to accomplish common goals.
Preferred Skills (Not Required):
MA/MS in business administration, contracts, technical writing, proposals or a related discipline or equivalent experience.
Advanced working knowledge of a variety of computer software applications in word processing, spreadsheets, database, presentation software (MS Office, Adobe).
Strong organizational skills and high level of initiative
Effectively demonstrates the ability to set, track and report milestones
Strong ability and experience planning and coordinating to completion multiple concurrent tasks in a multi-deadline environment.
Strong multi task ability and work well with others in a team environment

Soar Technology offers a full package of benefits and competitive salary, flex time, excellent group medical, vision, and dental programs. At SoarTech, we continuously invest in the development of your skills by providing budgeted time for technical skills development for all of our engineers.

Director of Engineering – Software, Amesite Inc.
We seek an amazing technical professional and leader, to manage and grow a dedicated, conscientious and global team focused on one of the world's most important challenges: Improving the way that people learn.

Who you are:
You love solving engineering problems and being constantly challenged by your work. You appreciate being part of a team, and a true owner and leader in your organizations. And you value being able to mentor and coach others to do things they. didn't even believe they could do. You seek growth over comfort, show humility over arrogance, and choose passion over indifference. And you want to be part of the team that turns a huge global challenge into an opportunity–for millions to better themselves and their world.

Desirable Qualifications:
The role requires bringing technical acumen and leadership to advanced algorithm development and execution around learning. Specific experience is less important than a demonstrated ability to master and contribute to mathematics-or science-based computational methods and software delivery.
Versatility
Managed global teams
Done remote / flexible work
Done artisanal technical work
Ability to find resources relevant to new work

About Amesite
At Amesite, we build artificial-intelligence software products designed to improve learning. We formed the company because of the need to make learning more affordable, accessible and engaging. Our team helps educational institutions and businesses improve learning as their technology partner, delivering a disruptive technology driven by AI. And, we offer a constellation of services that help partners implement new programs, and improve existing ones. We only use data to improve learning—our compact with our users. Because it is absolutely vital that learning communities—whether in educational institutions, businesses or nonprofits—get access to cutting edge technology and the most up-to-date and verified content possible.

Amesite is an Equal Opportunity Employer and Prohibits Discrimination and Harassment of Any Kind:
Amesite is committed to the principle of equal employment opportunity for all employees and to providing employees with a work environment free of discrimination and harassment. All employment decisions at Amesite are based on business needs, job requirements and individual qualifications, without regard to race, color, religion or belief, family or parental status, or any other status protected by the laws or regulations in the locations where we operate. Amesite will not tolerate discrimination or harassment based on any of these characteristics. Amesite encourages applicants of all ages.

The Position

The Digital Health Technologies (DHT) group at Roche/Genentech is part of the R&D Personalized Healthcare (PHC) Center of Excellence building the next generation digital health platform, tools, products, and solutions for the future of medicine. We are building an intelligent, regulatory compliant, highly scalable and secure software platform with regulatory, quality, and privacy requirements. We are building clinically validated, regulatory grade digital health products and solutions which include Software as a Medical Device (SaMDs), algorithms, and Digital Therapeutics. Our digital products are built with our intelligent platform and services to provide real-time advanced analysis of multi-modal data which generate actionable insights for our patients and care providers. Our products and solutions are helping bring improvements to the R&D of disease understanding, higher quality of life, and improved health outcomes.

DHT partners across the company with other Digital Health groups to advance digital health solutions which include hardware, software, applications, tools, and platforms to enable development of our therapies as well as more personalized care of patients across a range of therapeutic areas. Our primary focus is on the validation, scaling, and productization of digital health products, solutions, platform and services; inclusive of late-stage development of novel digital biomarkers and endpoints, as well as the design, conduct, and analysis of analytical validation, clinical validation, and clinical utility studies to meet clinical and regulatory requirements, as appropriate.

THE OPPORTUNITY
We are looking for an experienced technology architect who wants to deliver the next generation intelligent digital health platform that will be the foundation of our products, services, and solutions across therapeutic areas such as Neuroscience, Ophthalmology, and Oncology. You will be a senior member on our Architecture & Design team devoted to real-time processing, analytics, machine learning and artificial intelligence. You will design and develop our intelligent digital health platform built from the ground up on our BigData and AI stack using cutting edge technologies. Our platform allows rapid development of clinically validated, regulatory grade applications and solutions leveraging our advanced optimized platform technology stack, AI Engine, Core SDK and Tools. Your work will drive drug discovery, clinical trial ecosystem, and mobile and biomedical wearable sensor analytics that touch millions of patients.

Our goal is to improve access, safety and efficacy of treatment by building evidence-based, clinically-validated digital health products on our advanced intelligent platform.

We are looking for someone who is technology obsessed - with a passion for improving patient care and outcomes.

WHAT YOU’LL DO
You will design, develop, document, test and and deliver our advanced digital health platform and its components, features, and capabilities that improve the well-being of millions of consumers. You will drive the design and implementation of our BigData and AI stack into deployable solutions in production. You will own the technical design and implementation, but align with product management and compliance requirements. This role is inherently cross-functional. You will work closely with the DHT Platform Product Managers, Measurement Scientists, and Compliance & Strategy Leads to develop our platform across our product portfolios.

To be successful, you will leverage cross-functional partnerships with other groups across Roche to define and execute the strategic platform direction of Digital Health, transforming drug development and patient care.

A successful candidate will be passionate about developing technology and data-driven solutions to help improve the lives and health of patients. You are highly technical, analytical, able to work effectively in a matrix organization, and adept at synthesizing a variety of information including research, competitive analysis, user behavior, and new technologies / capabilities, transforming them into features and experiences that consumers love.

RESPONSIBILITIES
Design, document, develop, and test the Big Data and AI stack from design to production, impact all aspects of our system
Perf tune and scale our system
Evaluate latest technologies and make appropriate dependency choices
Mentor junior engineers
Further the culture of product innovation and excellence, characterized as highly collaborative, execution-focused, customer centric and high velocity
Collaborate closely with DHT cross-functional stakeholders including Product Management, Measurement Science, and Compliance & Strategy

Artificial Intelligence Senior Program/Portfolio Manager-200011313

At U.S. Bank, we're passionate about helping customers and the communities where we live and work. The fifth-largest bank in the United States, we’re one of the country's most respected, innovative and successful financial institutions. U.S. Bank is an equal opportunity employer committed to creating a diverse workforce. We consider all qualified applicants without regard to race, religion, color, sex, national origin, age, sexual orientation, gender identity, disability or veteran status, among other factors.

U.S. Bank is looking for an Artificial Intelligence Senior Program/Portfolio Manager to join the fast-paced Innovation team, supporting some of the largest initiatives in our company. The Artificial Intelligence Senior Program/Portfolio Manager is a hands-on role that will provide oversight and management of all aspects of delivering Artificial Intelligence/Machine Learning (AI/ML) solutions to production. The Artificial Intelligence Senior Program/Portfolio Manager will be responsible for managing the full scope of activities within one of Innovation’s AI/ML solution portfolios, to include partner exploration and outreach, user/customer experience design, marketing and branding considerations, solution development and implementation, and demonstration of business value in production environments.


This role will work within the fast-paced Innovation team, which strives for excellence in all phases of execution and lifecycle management. The ideal candidate will have the right attitude and an imaginative mind set, is creative, and has extensive experience with AI/ML solution delivery within industry. The individual will be comfortable working in an innovation-focused environment – in particular, evaluating emerging trends and technologies to assess their feasibility and viability and functioning effectively in a fail-fast environment. The position relies on the individual to be a self-starter and a quick learner, to have a futurist mindset, and to be able to innovate and report on tasks and status proactively.

Job Responsibilities:


Oversees AI/ML solution exploration and delivery through the entire development lifecycle, e.g. rapid prototype, design, build, assemble, test, and pilot.Acts as an advocate for their AI/ML portfolio and conducts outreach to identify partners and define scope for continuing collaborative efforts.Collaborates with other organizations within the company to identify and flesh out new growth opportunities using AI/ML technologies.
Documents and articulates solution architecture and lessons learned for each exploration and accelerated incubation based on feedback from supported components.
Responsible for partnering with the Lines of Business and other stakeholders to determine the impact and facilitate changes related to new and updated Federal law, state law, and agency/investor regulations.
Encourages new transformative thinking and trail blazing and facilitates imagination and ideation sessions.
Maintains current knowledge of technology landscape and emerging developments.
Works with various Product and Enterprise teams to optimize customer and user experiences.
Employs practical approach to data access and management and eventual platform integration of AI/ML solutions.

Qualifications

Basic Qualifications:

Bachelor’s Degree in a STEM field (e.g., Physics, Mathematics, Computer Science, Operations Research, Statistics, or related quantitative/technical field) and at least 5 years of combined experience in program management and/or AI/ML technology development, OR a High School Diploma/GED and at least 10 years of experience.
Significant experience in project/program management and customer relationship management in the AI/ML technology space in an industry setting (banking/financial industry preferred).
Experience working with R&D/innovation-style activities.
Experience with programming and software design fundamentals, e.g. object oriented and functional design principles, best practices, etc.
Knowledge and familiarity with a broad range of AI/ML algorithms, e.g. NLP/Conversational AI, predictive modeling, deep learning, computer vision, etc.
Experience with both relational and non-relational databases and data access methods, e.g. Postgres, MongoDB, SQL, NoSQL, RESTful API’s, GraphQL, etc.Experience with Python programming environment or equivalent (e.g. ProgR, Scala) and related open-source technologies such as NumPy, SciPy, Pandas, BERT, SpaCy, NLTK, Scikit-learn, TensorFlow, Keras, Deeplearning4j, etc.Knowledge and familiarity with AI/ML solution development within cloud-based environments (e.g. Google Cloud, Amazon Web Services, Microsoft Azure), with emphasis on GPU-enabled computing.
Experience delivering communications in a clear, concise, and compelling manner.Willing to travel up to 25% of the time for business purposes.

Preferred Qualifications

The race is on! Emerging technologies like artificial intelligence, autonomous, mobility, and IoT have changed the way business structured with all things digital and their expectation of immediacy and value.


To meet the customers’ needs today and exceed their expectations for tomorrow, Oracle is laser-focused to empower and accelerate companies around the world to respond to customer’s cloud transformation with solutions “Powered By” or “Integrated With” Oracle Cloud Platform, or with services to plan, implement, and manage their “last upgrade” transformation or modernization efforts.


The Oracle PartnerNetwork (OPN), a programmatic effort to enable our partner ecosystem, provides the tools, education, and assistance critical in accelerating the delivery of Cloud solutions or services to assist our mutual customers.

Oracle is looking for a Director, OPN Program Lead to join our dynamic team. We are seeking a passionate, results-oriented, proven individual with experience in the innovation and management of global partner programs. This is a highly visible role across the organization and is an opportunity to make a lasting impact on the growth and success of our customers, our partner ecosystem, and Oracle.

The successful candidate must have proven experience and success in working collaboratively across executive management, field sales organization, product development, marketing, etc. They will be passionate about their work, self-motivated, detail oriented and have excellent problem-solving abilities. Additionally, they will have superb communication and project management skills, communicate progress and results both written and verbally, in a clear and easy-to-understand way.

The ideal candidate will possess an extensive background working with technology partnerships and partner programs, particularly as related to Managed Service Providers (MSPs) and Strategic Implementers (SIs), along with strong business development, strategic alliances, and entrepreneurial skills. He/she should have a demonstrated ability to think strategically about new business models, solution selling, and technical challenges to help build and convey compelling value propositions for Oracle customers with our partners. The candidate should also have a proven track record of influencing innovation through a partner ecosystem with a prior solution and program successes.
Key Responsibilities:
 Own programmatic elements of Partner Tracks of the Oracle PartnerNetwork working horizontally and vertically with various LOBs/development organizations
 Build and analyze valuable benefit packages for members of OPN
 Drive awareness of new or updated program information for internal partner facing teams and OPN Partner ecosystem through established vehicles
 Engage OPN program members directly to gain insight on the user experience of the program
 Evaluate effectiveness and propose adjustments to programs to improve performance and ensure objectives are met
 Promote online Oracle partner communities to drive recruitment and market adoption
 Analyze adoption rates and recommend enhancements on a continual basis
 Maintain a positive, proactive attitude, always exercise great judgment and demonstrate the ability to initiate new programs and obtain senior management buy-in and support.

BASIC QUALIFICATIONS
 Bachelors Degree Required. MBA or another advanced college degree preferred
 7-10+ years in program development for a global technology company, e.g., AWS, Microsoft, Cisco, Salesforce, Oracle. Experience working on MSP and/or SI program development strongly preferred
 In-depth knowledge of the cloud computing industry
 Experience and success in managing large and complex global partner ecosystems with a proven understanding of the various business models
 Strong presentation skills and the ability to articulate complex concepts to cross-functional audiences
 Clear track record of delivering programs that accelerate sales revenue and customer success.
 Proven ability to partner with a wide variety of senior-level individuals including top-level business leaders and customers.
 Strong business acumen, and experience with large, complex organizations during periods of rapid growth and change.
 Resilient and able to thrive in a fast-paced, results-driven environment with a high level of energy.
 Advanced Microsoft PowerPoint and Excel skills (Pivot Tables, Macros).
 Willing to travel domestically and internationally to meet with customers, partners, as needed.

Detailed Description and Job Requirements

Engages in business development strategies and programs in support of Oracle's Sales Organization.

Oversees the development of strategic market/product line business plans and marketing programs to support sales in designated market segments. Engages in many areas of business development to include strategy, programs, demand generation, building pipeline, increasing deal size, and account planning. Analyzes market data to identify trends/opportunities and develops strategic direction from market information. Identifies volume and strategic customers. Primary interaction is with Oracle sales force; however, may interact with external customers as it relates to the development and facilitation of ongoing business and/or business relationship. Supports the business by interfacing with the sales organization and other internal groups (such as Product Development, Operations, GBUs, Marketing, etc.)

Acknowledged authority within the Corporation. Acts as a leader of large-scale company initiatives. Viewed by peers as a leader and top contributor and by line management as a key business partner. 12+ years of Marketing/Business Development experience in the technology industry, preferably software industry. Experience should include relationship management. Conversant in Oracle technology and product strategies. Ability to determine strategy and tactical plans that deliver tangible results. Strong written, verbal, and interpersonal skills. BA/BS degree or equivalent, advanced degree highly desirable.

The mission of the AI Software Architectures & Algorithms Group (Group 104) is to lead the nation in applying Artificial Intelligence and Machine Learning technologies to meet critical national security needs. Our mission areas include counter terrorism, counter human-trafficking, humanitarian assistance and disaster response, protection of the homeland, and protection of the global commons. In collaboration with industry and academia, we develop prototypes at the frontiers of AI for national security for the land, sea, air, and space domains. Our technology portfolio ranges from using AI to augment human capability to enabling autonomous operations.

Job Description
Group 104 seeks a Group Business Manager to handle business management of the Group's financial portfolio and administrative operations. Responsibilities include cost estimating, budget preparation, monitoring financial performance and funding status, internal/external reporting, and program closeouts, while ensuring compliance with laboratory financial policies and procedures. Additional responsibilities include management of procurements, property issues, personnel logistics, time sheet approval and other administrative and operational needs of the group.


Financial Analysis Reporting
Collaborates with group leadership to design, implement and manage WBS structures
Extracts and compiles spending data. Compares actuals to budgets and analyzes variances.
Manages program-level financial reporting provided to sponsors per contract requirement. Contributes to division-level reporting as needed.
Develops best practices. Communicates processes and procedures to extract, compile, analyze, and report financial query results.
Develops complex templates and tools to budget and report actual expenditures for program-level activities. The Business Manager is expected to develop and monitor variance reports for spend plan versus actual cost for programs on a regular basis and track monthly labor, purchase and travel expenses for multiple projects.
Procuerment
Serves as primary manager for all of the group’s procurement activities, whether via purchase order or purchase card.
Actively follows up on all critical and long lead-time procurements.
Collaborates with Division to manage complex or major procurements including, but not limited to, facilitating and documenting market research and serving as primary liaison with the Contracting Services Department.
Reviews and edits all statements of work and memorandums of justification for clarity of purpose. Works with staff to ensure that all SOWs (Statements of work) and MOJs (Memos of justification) are clear and provide appropriate level of detail.
Contributes to the planning and execution of the procurement of capital equipment including all funding, infrastructure, and facilities requirements.
Manages the procurement of consultant services and subcontractor labor. Initiates competitive process and evaluations. Guides technical staff through the steps of the procurement process.
Other Areas
Human Resources & Personnel Management
Supports group office and employees in matters related to recruiting and employment. Provides guidance, information and/or referrals to HR related to application of personnel policies and administrative procedures.

Facilities Planning
May be expected to contribute to the development of long term space plans. May collaborate with facilities to plan and build and/or renovate space for the group.
May be expected to act as custodian to a closed area.

Developmental Knowledge
Will develop and maintain:
Advanced knowledge of internal Lincoln Laboratory standards and procedures in administrative, financial and procurement business processes.
Advanced knowledge of government contracting and acquisition, Federal Acquisition Regulation (FAR), cost estimating, and analysis.
Solid and effective understanding of DoD business and program operations.
Exhibits project management and leadership skills.


Requirements
BS in Finance or related field is required, MS/MBA preferred.
Minimum of 5 years experience beyond degree is required, preferably in a technical environment supporting multiple persons and projects.
Must possess advanced skills in MS Office, especially Excel.
Experience with SAP a plus.
Demonstrated capabilities in presenting ideas written and orally within a cross-functional environment required.
Ability to analyze, discuss and present financial results/reports.
Ability to work independently, seek out answers to problems and drive positive change within the organization.
Minimal travel is involved.
Ability to obtain and maintain a government security clearance is required.

Your role will be to build and lead a new R&D team. Your team will use data science, machine learning, and other disciplines to create new data-based capabilities for Conversant’s real-time digital marketing business.
Conversant analyzes privacy-safe data at internet scale. We handle 200B+ of online interactions a day and have $3.8 trillion in multichannel purchases in our database. The Decision Sciences group is a collaborative R&D team that continually enhances Conversant’s award-winning personalization platform through a combination of data science, machine learning, AI, computer science, and more.
Our colleagues love the fast-paced, dynamic work environment, the speed with which we translate research to business impact, the opportunity to continually learn new knowledge and skills, the internal research seminars and external training opportunities, and the excellent work-life balance our culture promotes.
We prioritize talent and potential over having closely similar prior experience. If data and inference excite you, and you can do the kind of research that starts with a blank sheet of paper and turns it into a new technological reality, we want to talk to you.
RESPONSIBILITIES
Work with Product and Engineering stakeholders to develop an R&D roadmap.
Hire data scientists and other talent to build a highly productive team.
Manage projects end-to-end from early stage research through development.
Use your expertise in data science and/or computer science to research and recommend solutions to our technology and business problems.
Provide technology leadership to yield innovative differentiating solutions.
Develop an understanding of Conversant’s personalization platform and proprietary datasets.
Implement and optimize state of the art algorithms in distributed environments.
Work with our Engineering teams to integrate your solutions into Conversant’s platform.
Participate fully in our collaborative approach to research and applications projects.

REQUIREMENTS
Ph.D in a computational, mathematical, engineering, or scientific field.
Research experience in a computational area such as data science, computer science, machine learning, artificial intelligence, statistics, or graph algorithms.
2+ years leading R&D projects.
Ability to initiate, lead, and conduct R&D projects.
Organizational, motivational and interpersonal skills.
Verbal and written communication skills, including the ability to summarize technically complex information for a non-technical audience.
Additional Information
Great People, Deserve Great Benefits
We know that we have some of the brightest and most talented associates in the world, and we believe in rewarding them accordingly. If you work here, expect competitive pay, comprehensive health coverage, and endless opportunities to advance your career.

Introduction
iRobot Corporation, with a mission of “empowering people to do more” is at the forefront of the development of robotics and artificial intelligence technologies. iRobot has become one of the world’s preeminent specialist designers and builders of consumer robots. iRobot invests in the development and growth of its people, in a culture of empowerment, innovation and fun. Come work with some of the most talented and influential people in the robotics field utilizing cutting edge technologies, in an exciting, fast-growing industry!


Our team's mission is to lead the intelligence revolution for robots, leveraging the power of Machine Learning. Join our Machine Learning team to help us make our robots smarter!


The Principal Machine Learning Engineer will help build development and production systems for storing and processing data, as well as training and deploying machine learning models. If you have a passion for machine learning and working on data at scale, let's talk.
What you will do:
Work closely with machine learning engineers and data platform team to enable faster ML based application development.
Work with state-of-the-art tools and frameworks to build scalable and efficient solutions for data management, machine learning training, and deployment
To be successful you will have:
8+ years experience and a bachelor’s degree, or 6+ years experience and a Masters in CS, data engineering or other related fields
6+ years of software development with Python
4+ years of experience with machine learning, data engineering and deep learning frameworks
Strong communication skills

Experience working with image and video data
Cloud certifications
Experience with Django or similar frameworks
Experience with Kubernetes
Experience working with Serverless cloud computing services

A supportive environment to learn and grow with cutting edge technologies
Opportunity to help design and influence production systems
Do you want to steer the future of one of the largest consumer robot companies in the world? You will have a hand in developing the next generation of products that will live in millions of homes across the world. As a pioneer in the robot industry, our goal is to drive innovation, serve as an industry catalyst and change the world by empowering people to do more.
If the scope and opportunity of this role interests you, then please click to apply!

About us

Blue River Technology serves the agricultural industry with ground-breaking computer-vision and deep learning based equipment. These machines are changing the future of farming by enabling farmers to optimize every plant in their fields. Our technology dramatically reduces the amount of chemicals used, improves farmer profitability, and collects valuable plant-by-plant data.

John Deere & Company, with over 180 years of experience in designing, manufacturing, and distributing innovative products to farmers, acquired Blue River Technology in the fall of 2017 as an independently-run subsidiary. In partnership with John Deere, Blue River has expanded rapidly and together both companies see many opportunities to apply advanced computer vision, machine learning, and robotics technologies to other areas in agriculture beyond spraying

Our office is located in Sunnyvale, CA and is home to 100+ team members with diverse experience including computer vision, machine learning, systems software, autonomous vehicles and precision agriculture. Our working environment is fast paced and highly collaborative, and employees are excited to use their talents to improve food production and protect the environment.

Summary

We are looking for a passionate individual who is excited about developing groundbreaking products for farmers that promote environmental, economic, and social sustainability by using advanced technology to solve real problems.

In this role you will develop and communicate a deep understanding of our customer and their needs through in-depth research, identify and assess opportunities to create products, define and prioritize product initiatives, and collaborate with engineering to deliver these to the market.

Responsibilities

Identify, research, define, execute and prioritize product development initiatives in collaboration with cross-functional engineering teams balancing performance, complexity value, and speed to market
Lead product development initiatives through their full cycle, from ideation to lab and field testing, to customer validation and ultimately commercialization
Drive continuous improvement in the way we build product at Blue River
Define objectives and key metrics, then measure and track progress towards achieving those objectives
Collaborate with leadership on the long term product vision and roadmap
Evaluate new market opportunities from the perspective of customer needs, product fit, and business opportunity
Requirements
Minimum 4 years of experience as a product manager in a technology company
Enthusiasm for creating impactful products that empower users
Proven ability to influence, collaborate, and engage with others from diverse backgrounds ranging from engineers, to computer vision researchers, to agronomists, to field technicians, to growers
Excellent communication skills and ability to communicate technical product information in a clear, concise and creative manner
Delivery focus and a strong understanding of the software development challenges faced by cross-functional engineering teams
Strong organizational, planning and problem solving skills with an ability to resolve ambiguity and traverse between high level strategy and low-level details
Growth mindset with ability to quickly learn and apply experience to new technologies, domains and problems
BA/BS degree in a technical field or equivalent practical experience
Pluses
Experience with or knowledge of agriculture, agricultural technology or equipment
Experience with products that utilize Artificial Intelligence and Machine Learning
Entrepreneurial experience taking a product from ideation to commercialization
MBA or MSE

Blue River offers competitive compensation, including: healthcare and retirement benefits, commuter benefits such as CalTrain passes, mobile Wi-Fi hotspots, and flexible work hours.

About the Department
The Clinical, Medical and Regulatory (CMR) department at Novo Nordisk is one of the most diverse and collaborative groups within the organization. From health-care-provider interactions and developing and implementing regulatory strategies with the FDA to providing medical education and collecting data to support efficacy and new product development, CMR is involved. The one thing that keeps us all marching to the same beat is our patient-centered focus. At Novo Nordisk, you will help patients around the world. As their needs evolve, so does our challenge to find better and more innovative ways to improve their quality of life. We’re changing lives for a living. Are you ready to make a difference?

The Position
The Director, Real World Data Analytics (RWDA) leads the development and execution of RWDA strategic initiatives and specific programs for the assigned therapeutic area or function area through customer engagement, communication, advanced analytics. The incumbent acts as a strategic partner and leads customer engagement in assigned therapeutic area with NNI stakeholders within Clinical, Medical and Regulatory (Health Economics & Outcomes Research (HEOR) Strategy and Evidence Generation, Research Partnerships, Field Medical, North America Clinical Operations), Market Access and Public Affairs, as well as a liaison to therapeutically aligned global counterparts in Epidemiology, Data Science and Real-World Evidence (RWE). The Director communicates the RWDA strategy and project execution to internal and external stakeholders on behalf of RWDA and NNI as well as serves as an advisor on real world data, advanced analytics and real-world evidence methods. S/he leads the development and execution of advanced analytic methods in the development of real-world evidence and insights. S/he manages partner relationships, vendors and strategic collaborations on behalf of RWDA and NNI. The Director serves as the therapeutic area team or function area leader in the execution of specific in-house real-world data studies across the entire Novo Nordisk portfolio utilizing the Novo Nordisk data platform as well as working with external platforms housing real world data (including electronic health records, administrative health claims, as well as uniquely sourced health data). The role acts the real-world data champion within assigned therapeutic area by ensuring the RWDA strategy incorporates key RWD assets.

Relationships
The Director, RWDA reports to the head of RWDA. The Director is responsible for therapeutic team or functional area leadership within RWDA through proactive stakeholder engagement and associated RWE execution, communication of RWDA strategy and RWE to internal and external stakeholders, and leadership in the use of advanced analytics to generate RWE.

Essential Functions
RWDA Team Leadership
Leads and manages the execution of all RWD analyses within the assigned therapeutic or functional area conducted internally, with partners and with vendors
Utilizes the NN Real World Data platform, partnership platforms and analytic tools
Develops and maintains stakeholder relationships to ensure optimal utility of RWD within NNI
Mentors junior staff
RWDA Communication
Communicates the RWDA strategy to key internal stakeholders within assigned therapeutic area responsibilities
Communicates RWE from RWD analytics to internal stakeholders, customers and scientific community
Leadership in Advanced Analytics
Serves as lead reviewer of the Clinical Development & Outcomes Research (CDOR) Research Review Committee
Acts as a key subject matter expert in various methodological and advanced analytic functions and provides consultation to / collaborates with key internal and external stakeholders directly to provide tangible solutions that are aligned to portfolio strategy

Physical Requirements
10-20% overnight travel required.

Qualifications
PhD Preferred or master’s degree in appropriate field required (e.g., epidemiology, biostatistics, health services research, health economics) and at least 8 years of experience in leading RWD analytics, development of RWE and key stakeholder engagement roles
Keen knowledge and at least 8 years of experience in research using real world data and its applications in clinical and business decision making
Experience in advanced analytics including artificial intelligence, machine learning and other advanced methods
Demonstrated prior research accomplishment (e.g., publications in peer-reviewed journals and presentations at scientific conferences)
Excellent leadership, strong communication and critical thinking skills with keen knowledge of real-world databases
Excellent process and project management skills required including the ability to manage a significant volume of projects with exercise of good triage and judgement skills
Strong business acumen and a team player
Strong strategic thinking skills

You should be able to work across various disciplines, structuring solutions that bring together the latest technologies, new sources of data and innovative analytics.Candidates will be expected to have familiarity with digital marketing channel experience both form building solutions as well as project delivery.Key Responsibilities: · Analyze data, trends and performance metrics across channels (paid, owned and earned) to effectively communicate insights and opportunities · Transform business goals into measurable KPIs and support the development of statistical analysis and analytical plan on multichannel/digital marketing activities· Evaluate and optimize channel performance and ROIs of digital channels in an omnichannel environment· Provide guidance and support development of the analytic framework for measurement and optimization of omnichannel marketing programs· Extract, clean and manipulate large, complex data sources to create multichannel marketing datasets, reports, and dashboards.· Summarize and present findings through various communication channelsCandidate Knowledge, Skills and Experience· Bachelor’s degree in one of the following or related fields: Engineering, Operations Research, Management Science, Economics, Statistics, Applied Math, Computer Science or Data Science. An advanced degree is preferred (Master’s, MBA or PhD).· 3+ years of experience in Pharmaceutical / Biotech / Healthcare analytics.· 5+ years’ experience with multichannel marketing/digital analytics, ideally in a pharmaceutical, agency, or other commercial environment· Hands on experience in application of advanced methods and statistical procedures on large and disparate datasets, such as Design of Experiments, Regression and Timeseries.· Hands on experience with web, search, social analytics or media buying platforms - Google Analytics, DoubleClick Campaign Manager, Google Ad Manager, Adobe Analytics/Omniture, Sprinklr or similar tools· Experience in analyzing data, trends and performance metrics across channels (paid, owned and earned) for integrated omnichannel marketing campaigns· Strong hands on experience with SQL is required· Hands on experience with ProgR, / Python is preferred· Experience in MS Office products - Excel and PowerPoint skills required.· Experience with customer journey analytics, including touchpoint/pathway analysis, conversion analysis and customer segmentation is preferredJob Type: Full-timeBenefits:401(k)401(k) MatchingDental InsuranceDisability InsuranceFlexible ScheduleHealth InsuranceLife InsurancePaid Time OffVision InsuranceSchedule:Monday to FridaySupplemental Pay:Bonus PayExperience:Advanced Analytics: 4 years (Preferred)Analytics: 1 year (Preferred)SEO Tools: 4 years (Preferred)Modeling: 4 years (Preferred)Education:Master's (Preferred)Company's website:www.axtria.comBenefit Conditions:Only full-time employees eligibleWork Remotely:Temporarily due to COVID-19

Duties
Summary
About the Position: Serves as a Training Instructor/Writer in Civilian Leader Development designing, developing, delivering, and evaluating graduate and undergraduate level courses in a resident setting or through distributed learning.

Please read the entire announcement before applying and submit the appropriate supporting documentation. Your resume must contain the number of hours worked per week and the dates of employment (i.e., month/year to month/year or month/year to present).
Responsibilities
As a Training Instructor (Artificial Intelligence/Machine Learning), you will perform the following duties which is not an all-inclusive list:
Serves as a specialized advisor/consultant to the College in machine learning and artificial intelligence topic areas.
Develops and delivers subject-matter expertise in leader development competencies, adult education, leader education and management, machine learning and artificial intelligence.
Utilizes computer science theories, statistical modeling, machine learning, and artificial intelligence in order to develop courseware/curriculum for Civilian Education System (CES).
Performs needs assessments and evaluates student learning in terms of adequacy of coverage and accomplishment of approved course and/or course module learning outcomes and learning objectives.
Prepares, publishes, and presents technical papers in government and professional forums.
Prepares and delivers oral briefings to General Officers and members of the Senior Executive Service, to explain technical and operational issues.
Researches and produces course and/or course module materials, to include lesson plans, lecture documents, student handouts, computer generated learning programs, instructor/student books, practical exercises, case studies, and course surveys.
Travel Required
Occasional travel - You may be expected to travel for this position up to 30% of the time.

No

Requirements

Who May Apply: US Citizens

In order to qualify, you must meet the experience requirements described below. Experience refers to paid and unpaid experience, including volunteer work done through National Service programs (e.g., Peace Corps, AmeriCorps) and other organizations (e.g., professional; philanthropic; religious; spiritual; community; student; social). You will receive credit for all qualifying experience, including volunteer experience. Your resume must clearly describe your relevant experience; if qualifying based on education, your transcripts will be required as part of your application. Additional information about transcripts is in this document.

1) designing and teaching undergraduate and/or graduate level courses; and
2) designing course material utilizing artificial intelligence and/or machine learning to provide learning, testing and feedback to students; and
3) delivering briefings to senior civilian executives; and
4) writing for publication.

Communications
