Preferred Qualifications

Oracle Cloud Infrastructure (OCI) – Sr. Director of Product Management/Strategy Development – AI Services and Data Science
Location: Redwood Shores/Santa Clara/Seattle

The Oracle Cloud Infrastructure (OCI) team can provide you the opportunity to build and operate a suite of massive scale, integrated cloud services in a broadly distributed, multi-tenant cloud environment. OCI is committed to providing the best in cloud products that meet the needs of our customers who are tackling some of the world’s biggest challenges.

We offer unique opportunities for smart, hands-on Product Managers with the expertise and passion to solve difficult problems in distributed, highly available services and virtualized infrastructure. At every level, our PM’s have significant technical and business impact designing and building innovative new systems to power our customer’s business critical applications.

This role is available on the OCI Data and AI team as a Senior Director of Product Management for our AI Services and Data Science platform offerings. We are addressing complex and interesting challenges at the intersection of data, artificial intelligence/machine learning and cutting-edge cloud infrastructure. We have several service offerings on the Oracle Cloud Infrastructure. In this role, you would be responsible for the definition and successful delivery of capabilities that accelerate developers applying AI/ML to their solutions and data scientists using our services to build, deploy, and operate machine learning models.

As a Senior Director of Product Management, you will lead a team of Product Management leaders who ensure both inbound and outbound success of Oracle AI and Data Science services. You will own and drive the creation of new services and capabilities and product strategy that addresses our customer’s business challenges to create differentiated value in the market. You will work with a diverse set of stakeholders to define, build, operate, and grow the business of AI/ML services in the cloud at Oracle. As a key leader on the team, you will play a critical role in shaping OCI’s strategy & products and growing the team.

Responsibilities:
Define and understand target markets and build products that leverage Oracle’s unique strengths in data to lead in those markets
Evangelize product strategy and vision with stakeholders.
Work, directly, with key customers to understand their requirements, decipher blockers and translate the feedback into actionable items to improve service offerings and create new products.
Interface, closely, with field sellers and solution architects to address any gaps in the respective services, in a timely fashion.
Evaluate markets trends and know the competitive landscape, in depth.
Drive product launches, including working with: sales and presales field teams, marketing resources and our customers to ensure a successful release/launch.

Minimum Qualifications:
BS in Computer Science, or equivalent experience.
10+ years of combined experience in Product Management and Solutions architecture
Proven track record for shipping/launching entirely new products/services and products/services customer adoption in the cloud.
Ability to define & shape the business strategy for large product areas.
Excellent written and verbal communication skills. Strong and experienced customer focus and engagement.
Able to engage, communicate and manage customer CxO relationships.
Preferred Qualifications:
MS in a technical discipline/MBA
Experience working on a public cloud service, and in-depth knowledge of IaaS/PaaS industry and competitive capabilities
Experience working on AI-centric domains such as machine learning platforms or AI services.
Strong customer focus. Able to engage, communicate, and manage customer CxO relationships
Domain knowledge of: Big Data, Machine Learning end-to-end life cycle and AI centric services like NLP/NLU and Image recognition services
Breadth of different services across different cloud offerings is a plus
Domain knowledge of data driven solution architectures
Domain knowledge around real time data management/streaming or log stream processing
Specific knowledge of certain industries and drivers of potential projects
Hands-on experience conducting demonstrations (demos) using tools and related services that show the potential value of solutions

Oracle is an Equal Employment Opportunity Employer. All qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to race, color, religion, sex, national origin, sexual orientation, gender identity, disability and protected veterans status or any other characteristic protected by law.

As part of Oracle’s employment process candidates will be required to complete a pre-employment screening

Detailed Description and Job Requirements

Manage a team that acts as the central resource and driving force for the design, process, manufacturing, test, quality and marketing of product(s) as they move from conception to distribution. Organize interdepartmental activities ensuring completion of the project/product on schedule and within budget.

As a Senior Director in the product development division, you will lead a team that defines product specifications and or strategy. Gather and analyze information to define product specifications and review design specifications. Envision and communicate product strategy and functionality. Initiate and foster relationships with other groups. Review product documentation and collateral. Ensure successful product releases based on corporate priorities.

Directs and ensures the implementation of operational policies through subordinate managers. Interacts internally and externally with executive management, providing negotiation of difficult matters to influence policy. Functional expertise and broad company knowledge important. Demonstrated leadership and people management skills. Strong communication skills, analytical skills, thorough understanding of product development and product management. BS or MS degree or equivalent experience relevant to functional area. 8 or more years of software engineering or related experience preferred.

Oracle is an Affirmative Action-Equal Employment Opportunity Employer. All qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to race, color, religion, sex, national origin, sexual orientation, gender identity, disability, protected veterans status, age, or any other characteristic protected by law.

job_title: Software Engineering Manager, Citrix Analytics Security
job_description:
We believe work is not a place, but rather a thing you do. Our technology revolves around this core philosophy. We are relentlessly committed to helping people work and play from anywhere, on any device. Innovation, creativity and a passion for ever-improving performance drive our company and our people forward. We empower the original mobile device: YOU!
What we're looking for:
What we are looking for:
You are an innovative product development and data science manager with experience delivering high quality cloud based, data and machine learning products for our Citrix Analytics Security Offering. The opportunity enables you to work with a highly motivated team, innovate on state of the art technical platforms, and deliver innovative and high value customer facing solutions while partnering with teams from multiple different geographies and diverse cultures across Citrix.
Position Overview:
The Citrix Analytics Security Product Development & Data Science Manager is responsible for delivering our cloud based, data and machine learning product to our customers. Citrix Analytics for Security enables customers to take a proactive approach to security by integrating with our entire Citrix portfolio to uniquely protect each user, the workspace, and the network, by innovative use of security policies, data insights, machine learning and artificial intelligence. The position works with senior leadership and product management across multiple different locales (Geos) to define and execute on strategic plans that align with business goals by providing leadership, resources and support for engineering and data science teams to deliver value to external customers of our CAS Security offering. The role is responsible for communicating the strategic direction, driving product and data innovation, and ensuring the team has mature, sustainable, rapid release, and high availability development practices to enable rapid product development and customer value delivery.
Role Responsibilities:
Participates in creating a culture where employees are highly motivated, energetic, excited and enthusiastic working for the company
Implements measurement, reward/recognition and compensation plans that are competitive, motivating, aligned with the Company’s value proposition, vision and strategy, and within approved budget guidelines
Conducts interviews, hires new individual contributors and managers, and provides employee orientation/assimilation training
Develops and manages career path for all job families in the organization; coaches and provides career development advice to staff
Manages the development of direct reports by ensuring, where possible, that project tasks are in line with each employee's career interests
Identifies and fulfills formal and informal training needs to meet the skills and experience requirements of the team and support business goals
Works with employees to create performance and development goals that align with the business goals and conducts employee performance reviews
Addresses performance issues and provides ongoing and corrective feedback in a timely and constructive manner
Manages staff scheduling to meet business goals including work assignments/rotations, employee training, employee vacations, employee breaks, overtime assignment, back‐up for absent employees, and shift rotations
Makes recommendations for policy/process modifications/improvements to streamline and eliminate complex or out of policy operation problems
Mitigates team conflict and communication problems through coaching and conflict resolution practices including cross time zone, Geo and culture scenarios
Coordinates with senior management in planning for appropriate staffing levels
Adheres to Affirmative Action and Equal Employment Opportunity Program principles
Supervises individual contributors and managers in accordance with company policies and procedures
Basic Job Qualifications:
Bachelor’s degree or Master’s in computer science, with 8-10 years of directly related development experience
5+ years of experience managing cloud based and data product development, Software as a Service (SaaS) teams
Experience in leading the development and delivery of multiple software products on time, with high quality and within budge
Significant experience with the software cloud development lifecycle, processes, product development, and project management methodologies and tools
Demonstrated technical expertise and success in managing others in delivering products utilizing advanced programming environments and concepts
Significant knowledge of formal technology architecture and design process, and demonstrated ability to effectively lead these efforts within a software engineering team
Demonstrated capability in recruiting, developing, and managing high performance software development teams
Experience with workforce allocation and change management
Preferred Qualifications:
Experience in Agile methodologies (e.g., Scrum, XP, Lean) highly desired
Experience managing both development & data science teams a bonus
What you’re looking for:
Our technology is built on the idea that everyone should be able to work from anywhere, at any time, and on any device. It’s a simple philosophy that guides everything we do — including how we work. If you’re an engineer, we’ll give you plenty of ways to test your skills on cutting edge technology. We want employees to do what they do best, every day.
Be bold. Take risks. Imagine a better way to work. If this sounds like you then we’d love to talk.
Functional Area:
Software Development
About us:
Citrix is a cloud company that enables mobile workstyles. We create a continuum between work and life by allowing people to work whenever, wherever, and however they choose. Flexibility and collaboration is what we’re all about. The Perks: We offer competitive compensation and a comprehensive benefits package. You’ll enjoy our workstyle within an incredible culture. We’ll give you all the tools you need to succeed so you can grow and develop with us.
Citrix Systems, Inc. is firmly committed to Equal Employment Opportunity (EEO) and to compliance with all federal, state and local laws that prohibit employment discrimination on the basis of age, race, color, gender, sexual orientation, gender identity, ethnicity, national origin, citizenship, religion, genetic carrier status, disability, pregnancy, childbirth or related medical conditions, marital status, protected veteran status and other protected classifications.
Citrix uses applicant information consistent with the Citrix Recruitment Policy Notice at https://www.citrix.com/about/legal/privacy/citrix-recruitment-privacy-notice.html
Citrix welcomes and encourages applications from people with disabilities. Reasonable accommodations are available on request for candidates taking part in all aspects of the selection process. If you are an individual with a disability and require a reasonable accommodation to complete any part of the job application process, please contact us at (877) 924-8749 or email us at ASKHR@citrix.com for assistance.
If this is an evergreen requisition, by applying you are giving Citrix consent to be considered for future openings of other roles of similar qualifications.

job_title: Program Director - Cloud Security and Compliance Management
job_description:
Introduction
At IBM, work is more than a job - it's a calling: To build. To design. To code. To consult. To think along with clients and sell. To make markets. To invent. To collaborate. Not just to do something better, but to attempt things you've never thought possible. Are you ready to lead in this new era of technology and solve some of the world's most challenging problems? If so, lets talk.

Your Role and Responsibilities

***This person may sit in EITHER of the greater Dallas OR Austin metro areas***

As Program Director, you will be responsible for leading high performing security and compliance teams. Employing your collaboration mindset, you will partner with all stakeholders to ensure security programs are delivered on time and meet all the security regulations like SOC2, HIPPA, FedRamp and other related standards.

What You'll Do...
In this role, you'll have the opportunity to contribute directly to the ongoing development, maintenance and validation of the security posture of the IBM Cloud. Your leadership will enable you to develop robust Governance, Risk Management and Compliance security frameworks within the parameters of all required regulatory compliance standards. Achieving efficiency, you will drive efforts to...
Develop security automation and evidence gathering tools
Develop and maintain security target architectures
Build and extend partnerships with the broader cloud architecture teams to ensure security architectures are embedded in to the service framework
Today’s operating environment demands a stack that’s responsive to the innovative enterprise – one that can leverage all data types & access the latest technologies. Be part of a diverse and global team of thinkers and doers - people who want to make an impact, cultivate their expertise and collaborate with some of the world’s top business and technology professionals. We’re hiring ...JOIN US.

Keywords...
#architecture @IBMCloud #management #infra #cisso #SCRUM #il4 #encryption #infosec #xenserver #baremetal #ubuntu @caffeinate_adam #IaaS #agile #ethicalhacking @IBMNAJobs #privacy #swdev #PaaS #itil #cybersecurity

Required Technical and Professional Expertise

In addition to your strong written and verbal communication skills, you'll possess the following...
15+ years of management experience in IT
10+ years of experience in leading security and compliance teams
5+ years in leading cloud security
Experience in IT GRC (Governance, Risk and Compliance)
Experience in dealing with regulators and auditors

Preferred Technical and Professional Expertise

Solid understanding of the challenges that face developers deploying large applications on cloud infrastructure
Excellent interpersonal communications skills to lead productive and collaborative meetings
Excellent written and visual communications skills to produce concise and clear written solution design documents and solution presentations to stakeholders of varying seniority levels.
Experience with Vulnerability scanning, intrusion detection, static code analysis, identity and access management, secrets management, virtualization security, penetration testing, SecDevOps pipeline
MS, or Ph.D. in CS, EE (related technical field) or equivalent preferred.
Machine Learning, Deep-Learning, Artificial Intelligence experience as it relates to static code analysis, vulnerability detection or other security related research.
Containerization experience preferably Docker
Cloud Orchestration experience, preferably Kubernetes
DevOps tools like Travis

About Business Unit
Digitization is accelerating the ongoing evolution of business, and clouds - public, private, and hybrid - enable companies to extend their existing infrastructure and integrate across systems. IBM Cloud provides the security, control, and visibility that our clients have come to expect. We are working to provide the right tools and environment to combine all of our client’s data, no matter where it resides, to respond to changing market dynamics.

Your Life @ IBM
What matters to you when you’re looking for your next career challenge?

Maybe you want to get involved in work that really changes the world? What about somewhere with incredible and diverse career and development opportunities – where you can truly discover your passion? Are you looking for a culture of openness, collaboration and trust – where everyone has a voice? What about all of these? If so, then IBM could be your next career challenge. Join us, not to do something better, but to attempt things you never thought possible.

Impact. Inclusion. Infinite Experiences. Do your best work ever.

About IBM
IBM’s greatest invention is the IBMer. We believe that progress is made through progressive thinking, progressive leadership, progressive policy and progressive action. IBMers believe that the application of intelligence, reason and science can improve business, society and the human condition. Restlessly reinventing since 1911, we are the largest technology and consulting employer in the world, with more than 380,000 IBMers serving clients in 170 countries.

Location Statement
IBM will not be providing visa sponsorship for this position now or in the future. Therefore, in order to be considered for this position, you must have the ability to work without a need for current or future visa sponsorship.

Being You @ IBM
IBM is committed to creating a diverse environment and is proud to be an equal opportunity employer. All qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to race, color, religion, gender, gender identity or expression, sexual orientation, national origin, genetics, disability, age, or veteran status. IBM is also committed to compliance with all fair employment practices regarding citizenship and immigration status.

job_title: Applications Service Desk Manager (ServiceNow) with TS/SCI
job_description:
Job Description
Are you an Innovative Service Desk Leader with Big Data Analytics experience, looking to join a passionate team of industry leading individuals focused on creating a new Big Data Analytics Platform?
CACI is currently looking for an Applications Service Desk Manager (SDM) with Big Data Analytics experience to join our TALOS (Transforming All-Source Analysis with Location-Based Object Services) Program supporting the Defense Intelligence Agency (DIA) client located in Northern Virginia and Aurora, Colorado!
Join this dynamic team of individuals supporting the best practices in Big Data, Data Analysis, Artificial Intelligence (AI), Machine Learning (ML), and advanced analytics to enhance the DoD’s and the IC’s information processes and technical architectures.
The Service Desk Manager will have the opportunity to lead, plan, direct, and coordinate the End User Service Desk team’s activities for the TALOS Program.
The TALOS program thrives in a culture of innovation and is constantly seeking individuals who can bring creative ideas to solve complex problems, both technical and procedural at the team and portfolio level. The ability to be adaptable and to work constructively with a technically diverse and geographically separated team is crucial.
What You’ll Get to Do:
Provide leadership, guidance, and demonstrate a mature task management approach in support of a suite of operational applications for the Intelligence Community and DoD.
Identify and assemble the appropriate blend of resources to meet program needs and requirements, including subcontractor selection
Plan, schedule, monitor, and report on service desk activities related to the program
Facilitate status review meetings among project team members and clients
Coach and counsel members of the end-user support services team to accomplish program goals, meet established schedules, and resolve technical/operational issues
Establish appropriate metrics for measuring key program criteria
Identify and recommend contingency measures
Facilitate the creation of communication plan, ensuring that appropriate information is exchanged among key stakeholders
Advise senior management on project management capability and risk
Work closely with clients and customers to assess their needs, provide information or assistance, resolve their problems, and/or satisfy their expectations.
Recommend controls by identifying problems; writing improved procedures
Perform daily, weekly, and monthly reviews and analyses of current processes using operational metrics and reports
Suggest changes to senior management using analytics to support your recommendations. Actively participate in the implementation of approved changes
Create informative, actionable, and repeatable reporting that highlights relevant business trends and opportunities for improvement
Conduct insightful, ad hoc analyses to investigate ongoing or one-time operational issues
You’ll Bring These Qualifications:
This role REQUIRES a TS/SCI security clearance
(B.S.) in Information Management Systems, Computer Science, or a related discipline. Equivalent professional experience will be considered in lieu of degree
7 plus years of experience overseeing the day-to-day activities of service-desk operations in support of an IT Service Management Operation
Twelve years of Federal Customer Support Experience
Experience providing management, implementing policies and procedures regarding how incidents and request are identified, received, documented, distributed, and completed
Ability to design, test and deploy Remedy Self Service and remote support tools
Experience providing data and reports of KPI's and trends to End User Service Director in daily reporting formats
Exposure to increasing first call resolution, implementing self service capabilities and meeting service desk service level agreements.
Expertise in the Agile Software Development Life cycle
Familiarity with service desk technologies including IT Service Management (prefer ServiceNow)
Demonstrated experience and proven success implementing changes, processes, and standards to improve an enterprise-wide service desk
These Qualifications Would be Nice to Have:
Experience fulfilling the DIA mission in support of the COCOMs
Demonstrated successes with SAFe methodologies
Experience with Jira
Help Desk Institute or Service Desk Institute Service Operations Manager Certification
Experience providing performance-based customer service support against multiple performance metrics in the Federal Government
What We can Offer You:
BIT Systems Inc. a CACI company, provides all of the benefits of a small company but with the stability of a multi-billion dollar company. As part of this, we offer a fairly unique benefits package. Basically, BITS benefits equate to 50% of your salary on TOP of your base salary. The first part is a tax-qualified profit sharing retirement plan to which BITS annually contributes up to 25% of your base salary (not in excess of applicable IRS limits) to your retirement account under the plan. The second part consists of BITS' Individual Benefit Account Plan (the IBA), which is used for premiums, medical reimbursements, dependent care, education and BITS' Paid Time Off (PTO) Policy. Both components of the benefits package are paid for by the company and do not come out of your take home pay. For more information please check out: http://www.caci.com/bit-systems/benefits.shtml
Our work environment is mission-focused but relaxed, is professional but casual, and requires individual responsibility within team constructs. We offer an environment where business casual and shorts/flip flops work side by side successfully; we let you be you. DACOHP
We’ve been named a Best Place to Work by the Washington Post and the Denver Post.
Our employees value the flexibility at CACI that allows them to balance quality work and their personal lives.
We offer competitive benefits and learning and development opportunities.
We are mission-oriented and ever vigilant in aligning our solutions with the nation’s highest priorities.

job_title: Senior Manager, Business Intelligence and Forecasting – Data Mining / BI / Forecasting / SQL
job_description:
OpticsPlanet, Inc has a great opportunity for a Senior Manager of Business Intelligence and Forecasting. This is an excellent chance to feel the heartbeat of one of the world's largest and most data-driven online retailers, and make an impact on the company's success, by overseeing the analysis of the operational and financial performance of the company, and providing actionable suggestions.
In this role, you will see a direct link between your work and company growth. The role is highly cross-functional and will require coordination with several departments such as Supply Chain Management, Marketing, Operations, Finance, and others. This role conducts a wide range of business analysis, defines and communicates the appropriate metrics that are needed to accurately and objectively measure business performance and execute on the company’s goals. The role’s activities include interpreting financial and operational trends, identifying deviations from the expected performance, and conveying results to various departments within the organization. This hands-on management role will challenge the candidate to understand and contribute to many facets of the company including business analytics, risk and revenue forecasting, data management, and executive reporting. You would be managing a team of professionals utilizing advanced SQL skills, statistical analysis, and MS BI stack to achieve these objectives.
Primary Duties and Responsibilities
Directing and overseeing high level strategic and tactical decisions for business intelligence tools and applications
Organizing the work of 5 team members in 3 locations (with the help of an associate manager)
Coaching a team on the pros and cons of different types of analytics, data modeling, and providing mentorship on extrapolating and examining insights from large data sets
Coordinating a big number of one-time custom activities concerned with data collection, analysis, reconciliation, trends investigation
Organizing the metrics and dashboards setup for various areas of the business using MS BI Stack and other custom reporting tools
Managing the creation and maintenance of SSRS reports and subscriptions
Building long-term high-level forecasts for major financial metrics. Maintaining the model, monitoring trends compared to the model, and digging into issues
Keeping track and managing high-level company KPIs
Providing guidance to our Procurement teams during large purchasing campaigns and strategic buys
Driving projects related to the design and development of automated decision-making systems for the business. Answering questions and suggesting improvements on the proprietary systems created earlier, such as Product-level Demand Forecasting, Net Margin calculations system, Lead Times calculation system, Automatic Pricing system, etc.
Acting as a liaison between our Finance and the Business reconciling financial and operational reports and KPIs
Participating as an SME and helping in other company-wide projects. Providing expertise for other departments when it comes to profitability measurement, ROI measurement, understanding impact on cash conversion cycle, etc.
Providing leadership in the development, implementation, and ongoing management of all key performance indicators (KPIs) and reporting capabilities for a number of operational areas. Using insights to challenge the organization to be more efficient and cost-effective.
Researching, analyzing and explaining the current and past activity, expected trends, and the potential effect of the changes made. Presenting and supporting findings and recommendations to various management levels within the organization.
Qualifications, Skills and Requirements
3+ years of managerial experience in the BI field
MA/MS or higher degree in Statistics, Computer Science, Applied Math, Physics, or other technical fields
Understanding of Ecommerce, Supply Chain Management, Finance, and Marketing
Strong MS SQL/MySQL skills
Experience or deep understanding of Microsoft BI tools: SSRS, SSAS, SSIS, PowerBI
Advanced MS Excel skills
Experience solving analytical problems using other technical field approaches
Excellent communication skills
Proficiency in utilizing Google Analytics. Google BigQuery expertise is a plus
Experience in Ecommerce is a major plus
Expertise/background in artificial intelligence/machine learning is a plus
Some programming experience is a plus (PHP, C++, Javascript, VBA, or others).

Description
Job Description:
Leidos Defense Enterprise and Cyber Solutions (E&CS) is searching for a Cyber Chief Architect.
This role entails the overall responsibility of maintaining computer and information security incident, damage and threat assessment programs for the management and operations of an enterprise of network services contracts. These contracts serve the Department of Defense with the objective of building a common approach to administration and cyber security for disparate agency’s common IT services. The Chief Cyber Architect is responsible investigating computer and information security incidents to determine extent of compromise to information and automated information systems, providing computer forensic and intrusion support to high technology investigations in the form of computer evidence seizure, computer forensic analysis, data recovery, and network assessments, researching and maintaining proficiency in tools, techniques, countermeasures, and trends in computer network vulnerabilities, data hiding and network security and encryption. In addition, duties may include designing, developing or recommending integrated system solutions ensuring proprietary/confidential data and systems are protected, participating with the client in the strategic design process to translate security and business requirements into technical designs, and configuring and validating secure systems, testing security products/systems to detect computer and information security weakness.
Primary Responsibilities:
The role will entail participation in the overall formation of the program solution and offer.
This role also involves collaboration within the operational unit on related programs and throughout Leidos to leverage experience and resources for mission-focused critical network programs.
Collaborates with the DoD Program Office and other customer leadership at the most senior levels regarding IT strategy, contractual requirements and service delivery.
Provides technical advice/input that impact strategic client outputs and Leidos business results.
Impacts functional strategy by developing new solutions, processes, standards or operational plans that position Leidos competitively in the marketplace.
Serves as a technical lead on large, complex projects.
Resolves highly complex and multi-dimensional problems requiring consideration of variables that impact multiple aspects of the project/program.
Leads the development of highly innovative products/solutions, achieved through collaboration and dialogue with other experts in the field.
Mentors and coaches other technical staff.
Basic Qualifications:
This position is located in Maryland with potential travel to various locations throughout the U.S. Candidates who are not in the D.C. metropolitan area must have the ability to re-locate.
Appropriate degree from an accredited college or equivalent combined experience/ education, with professional experience and specialized training commensurate with assignment.
20+ years cybersecurity experience securing systems, achieving DoD accreditations, and developing artifacts
10+ years in a cybersecurity leadership role,
Requires highest knowledge and mastery of highly advanced technologies, scientific principles, theories and concepts.
Strong analytical and problem solving skills, with the ability to work independently as well as collaboratively in a team environment
Demonstrated experience with Risk Management Framework (RMF), to include developing approaches, strategy, and implementation. Demonstrated experience of achievement through customer collaboration, education and advice, leading to accreditation and improved cyber postures.
Demonstrated experience building customer relationships to enable achievement of objectives with a positive impact on cybersecurity posture.
Proactive, superior attention to detail and good organizational skills
Business acumen, strong analytical and problem solving skills, reliability and sound judgment
Ability to travel on an as needed basis
Knowledge of U.S. Federal acquisition processes and competitive capture environments
Familiarity with current and emerging network, security, compute, and end user technologies including, but not limited to automation technologies and approaches, software-defined solutions, site reliability engineering, artificial intelligence and machine learning (AI/ML)
Demonstrated experience with DoD cybersecurity programs and systems e.g. ACAS, HBSS, eMASS
Secret level clearance
Preferred Qualifications:
DoD8570.01-M baseline certification or ability to obtain prior to proposal submission
Relevant certifications for Networking and Cybersecurity
Familiarity with DoD Joint Regional Security Stacks (JRSS)
Experience with Comply to Connect (C2C) solutions in DoD
Knowledge of cloud based solutions, RMF control integrations, and enabling protective measures to enhance defensible capabilities
Master’s degree
12+ years in a cybersecurity leadership role, 5 of which are in the DoD
Demonstrated experience leading enterprise-level cybersecurity efforts involving architecture, design, development and deployment
Knowledge of current technologies used for security control reviews, network and security services, including current endpoint security/EDR technologies

Ineligible

Micron Technology’s vision is to transform how the world uses information to enrich life and our commitment to people, innovation, tenacity, collaboration, and customer focus allows us to fulfill our mission to be a global leader in memory and storage solutions. As the Technology and Products Group (TPG) Sr. Director of Data Science, you will define and drive the vision for digital process and product development at Micron. In this role, you will lead a team in all areas of Machine Learning, Artificial Intelligence, and Data Analytics as applied to solving sophisticated problems in semiconductor solutions.

Enabling sophisticated modeling and algorithm development across a broad spectrum of problems to accelerate technology solutions and decision making.
Using vast streams of data (mostly unstructured) and developing intelligence around these data streams to help engineers develop semiconductor solutions faster.
We are looking for a senior-level experienced leader, with a consistent record of attracting, hiring and retaining top talent. You must be comfortable working in a multifaceted, iterative environment that also affords the stability of a global, well-established technology company.

Interact with vendors to drive design and validation automation

At least 5-10 years of related experience in senior management positions with excellent knowledge in modeling and data analytics

About CCC
At CCC, it’s all about connectivity we are a provider of innovative cloud, mobile, telematics, hyperscale technologies and services for the automotive, insurance, and collision repair industries. Our solutions and big data insights are delivered through our CCC ONE™ platform, which connects 350+ insurance companies, 24,000+ repair facilities, original equipment manufacturers, hundreds of parts suppliers, and dozens of third-party data and service providers. Our platform, carwise.com , provides access to car-related services for millions of consumers. Auto Injury Solutions Inc., also a CCC company, provides casualty solutions to auto insurers for the handling of first and third-party claims. In short, our collective set of solutions make connected car, vehicle, and accident data actionable, informing decision-making, enhancing productivity, and helping customers deliver faster and better experiences for end consumers.
Job Description Summary
CCC is the leading provider of software, data, and insights to the automotive claims and parts markets as well as an industry leader in automotive telematics. CCC works with more than 350 insurance carriers – including many of the largest P&C carriers in the country – and more than 24,000 repair facilities, processing the majority of automotive claims in the U.S. Our software solutions connect the claims ecosystem including vehicle owners, property/casualty insurance carriers, automotive collision repairers, parts suppliers, and many others. CCC leads the industry in technology innovation, including the latest in mobile technology and real-world applications in artificial intelligence.
Job Duties
The Position: CCC is creating this new role as a result of the increasingly regulatory environment regarding privacy and the critical importance to CCC’s businesses. As our Director of Data Privacy, you will be responsible for leading our company’s data privacy strategy and advocacy. You will play an instrumental part in owning and driving strategic decisions, and overall data privacy strategy for the company. This role reports our CISO and will work closely with senior managers across the enterprise.
Qualifications
Minimum qualifications:
Bachelor’s degree in Law, Business, Accounting, Computer Science, relevant field, or equivalent practical experience.
15 years of relevant experience working in an advisory capacity with a focus on compliance or regulatory, and challenges related to security and privacy protection issues.
Experience building and managing a data privacy program.
Responsibilities
Create and implement a data privacy capability that will act as interface between legal and business implementation, to include a establishing a program charter, privacy program definitions, policies and standards, and supporting processes.
Advise legal of security best practices and data protection requirements as they relate to the implementation of them within technical environments and data handling processes
Lead enterprise-wide privacy risk assessments to identify key privacy risks and prioritize privacy compliance efforts across IT operations
Integrate privacy assessment findings with the IT risk management function.
Interface with all levels of leadership to communicate privacy program status, privacy protection capabilities, and potential risks to the business.
Establish a culture of privacy accountability and assurance within the organization, with a focus on product development and operational customer support.
Enable privacy responsibilities while creating a privacy awareness within the organization.
Create, communicate, and manage a master privacy controls register within the organization.
Work with key stakeholders to create privacy controls frameworks aligning to the organization’s data operations, operational jurisdictions, and compliance responsibilities.
Develop privacy controls descriptions for communication of privacy program capabilities and efforts with customers.

About the Company
TeraRecon is a leader in advanced visualization and artificial intelligence solutions. Our flagship product, Intuition, is the market share leader for radiology and cardiology advanced visualization. Our AI division was awarded the best new radiology vendor for 2018 and nominated for best new software in 2019 by readers of industry news leader, AuntMinnie. Further, we were recently named the 2020 KLAS Category Leader for Advanced Visualization. We are committed to redefining advanced visualization by leveraging machine learning and improving radiology workflows through personalized automation that increases efficiency. TeraRecon is a privately-held global company with its world headquarters in Durham, NC, and major offices in Tokyo, Japan; Frankfurt, Germany; Fremont, CA and Acton, MA. While our employees are located across the world, we work as one company, functionally-aligned, and goal-driven. TeraRecon’s transparency and collaborative work environment foster an energetic and inviting culture.
About the Position
The Enterprise AI Director of Sales will be working with leaders in medical imaging, including radiologists, neurologists, vascular surgeons, and other specialists to promote the utilization of life-saving, AI-powered clinical applications that accelerate care and significantly improve clinical decision making. Supported by the pristine reputation of a trusted industry leader, this person will position the company as the undisputed innovator of true enterprise-wide imaging AI decision support solutions.
By combining the company’s patented AI platform, best-of-breed AI marketplace technology, and TeraRecon built image processing algorithms, our new AI suites transform what was once a stationary and cumbersome workflow into an intuitive, web-based, near-zero-click experience. The company’s AI platform facilitates the development, visualization, and integration of AI-derived clinical insights as part of the next generation of medical imaging workflows that empower faster and better-informed patient care.
This role will specifically target the C-Suite and work simultaneously with the boots-on-the-ground clinical leadership of the nation’s largest and most impactful health systems. Leveraging our highly capable team of clinical subject matter experts and technical product specialists, the Enterprise AI Director of Sales will own the responsibility for selling the company’s ever-expanding range of AI solutions and Intuiton to its existing and net new customers alike. The role will require selling the whole ecosystem of TeraRecon products.
In this position and with this technology, the Enterprise AI Director of Sales will play a significant role in the medical imaging industry’s adoption and utilization of new AI technologies. This role aligns to our corporate mission of bringing continuous innovation to our customers while also improving the efficiency and efficacy of imaging in healthcare.
Seeking a driven, talented enterprise sales professional with a passion for selling transformative Enterprise software solutions. Reporting directly to the VP of AI Solution Sales, this individual will have a consistent track record of building relationships and closing deals of $500,000 or more with health systems. Experience leveraging existing relationships and building new ones, both internally and externally, will be paramount to success, and this individual should demonstrate a high degree of ownership and accountability. The ideal candidate is a high achiever who has a thirst for perfecting their craft. The ideal candidate will be resourceful, leveraging internal structures, processes and access to a rich portfolio of advanced visualization and AI-enabled solutions to drive rapid growth in the medical imaging AI space. The successful candidate is motivated by and thrives in an autonomous environment, taking ownership of the sales process - from prospecting to process to closing of deals.
The position is a remote field position.

Responsibilities:
Understand the advanced visualization ecosystem so you can effectively communicate the value proposition of TeraRecon EurekaAI and Intuition
Drive the strategic and enterprise accounts to new level
Expand existing accounts and ensure high retention rates on existing accounts
Represent the vision for our company
Execute sales plan for strategic accounts through managing and closing sales opportunities with assigned accounts
Manage and track customer and transactional information in CRM
Provide product demos and support to accounts
Nurture and expand the company’s relationship
Provide regular reporting of pipeline and forecast through CRM

Practice effective, excellent communications with management, customers, and support staff.
Participate in team-building and company growth activities including strategy setting, sales training, marketing efforts, and customer care
Travel to customer locations in support of sales efforts
Identify and build relationships with health systems groups
Take ownership of large accounts to create a national Enterprise AI sales plan, schedule meetings and build sales pipeline
Leverage existing network and develop referring relationships with KOL communities, as well as partnering with the TeraRecon iNtuition sales team
Position yourself as a thought leader to build trust and educate key players and prospects in your target market about TeraRecon EurekaAI solutions and Intuition
Tailor your messaging and sell into C Suites and to leadership of organizations
Partner seamlessly with internal teams to lead a coordinated and effective team selling effort to land large Enterprise deals
Other duties as assigned

Qualifications:
Track record of consistently achieving quota and managing complex sales of $500K+ from start
At least 7 years’ experience successfully selling Enterprise advanced analytics, decision support software solutions
Demonstrated experience selling enterprise subscription / SaaS solutions with annual recurring revenue of more than $250K

Ability and desire to prospect and self-generate robust pipeline to achieve sales quota
Ability to close deals

 As an Enterprise Account Director at [24]7.ai you will be responsible for the following:

SnapLogic is the leader in self-service application and data integration. Our mission is to make it fast and easy for users to access, connect and analyze enterprise data to improve business processes, accelerate decision-making, and drive better business outcomes.

SnapLogic’s Intelligent Integration Platform
[https://www.snaplogic.com/products/intelligent-integration-platform] accelerates data flow across applications, databases, data warehouses, big data streams, and IoT deployments – whether on premises or in the cloud. Unlike traditional integration software that requires painstaking, hand-crafted coding by teams of developers, SnapLogic’s simple but powerful platform enables both IT and business users to create quality, scalable data pipelines that get the right data to the right people at the right time.

The Role:
The Sales Operations Director is a key role within the Sales support group as the primary point of contact for the Sales Team, Marketing, Finance, and other departments. This position will be responsible for inbound and/or outbound lead generation for new product sales to both new and existing customers as well as future sales. The Sales Operations Manager will also be responsible for sales forecasting, analytics, productivity, CRM maintenance, and other sales support functions. This position reports directly to the Chief Revenue Officer.

What You’ll Be Doing:

Develop an in-depth knowledge of SnapLogic’s product and utilize this knowledge to successfully lead Sales operations.
Manage sales support and ensure that daily sales performance metrics are consistently met.
Work with Area VPs to create and maintain a world-class Sales culture, focused on delivering results by providing ongoing coaching and development of sales support staff.
Analyze performance metrics data and leverage it to effectively manage sales operations.
Work with Sales Directors to motivate and drive performance of the Team through a clear and justifiable sales metrics that drive results.
Consistently ensure that business is conducted with integrity at all times and that behavior aligns with SnapLogic values.
Serve as the main point of contact for the Sales Team and address calls for most general business issues; escalate to Area VPs, as appropriate.
Work closely with Area VPs to drive strategy through discussions with the Team.
Responsible for the development and implementation of new processes and procedures for effective and efficient team operations.
Remain knowledgeable of key processes, business initiatives and internal resources in order to assist the sales team and recruitment in accomplishing company goals.
Work closely with Sales Managers and Legal to address contract issues or concerns and to ensure the timeliness of contract review.
Drive quarterly cadence that involves QBR’s weekly forecast calls and sales metrics reporting.
Drive annual budgeting.
Identify opportunities and weaknesses within territories and make proposals to create value and increase operational efficiency.
Assist Area VPs by working effectively with internal support departments to develop effective sales strategies that promote sales to new and existing customers.
Continuously research and remain knowledgeable of industry trends and competition.
Complete sales forecasts and sales activity reports and presentations in a timely manner.

What We’re Looking For:

B.A., Business, Finance or other related fields or equivalent work experience.
Minimum of 10 years in sales operations experience.
Experience managing Sales Ops with demonstrated new sales track record & quota attainment.
Demonstrated leadership, communication and problem solving skills.
Start-up and SaaS experience strongly preferred.
Demonstrated ability to define, refine and implement sales processes, procedures and policies.
Ability to conduct sophisticated and creative analysis of complex data and translate the results into actionable deliverables, messages, and presentations.
Experience managing personnel and contributing toward the development of department strategy.
Strong problem solving and collaboration skills.
Product oriented and strong technical skills.
Experience in developing and making formal presentations to executive management.

Want to work on a team that is disrupting an industry by delighting customers? Looking for a job where your work can have direct and meaningful impact? Amazon Connect is a highly disruptive cloud-based contact center that enables businesses to deliver engaging, dynamic, and personal customer service experiences. Amazon Connect is the result of over ten years of development that went into building the tools Amazon uses to provide its award winning customer service at massive scale and launching it as a publicly available AWS service. With Amazon Connect, you can create your own cloud-based contact center and be taking calls in minutes. Amazon Connect leverages the power of Artificial Intelligence and the large ecosystem of AWS services such as Amazon Lex, Amazon Polly, AWS Lambda, Amazon S3 and Amazon Kinesis to provide a truly frustration free, easy-to-use, extensible, and natural customer experience. With this technology, we are transforming an industry and the way customers interact with businesses and how agents service them.
We have a rapidly growing customer base and an exciting charter in front of us that includes solving highly complex problems. We are looking for a passionate, dynamic and entrepreneurial Technical Program Manager to join us to innovate and drive customer success on the platform that addresses customer needs to build modern contact centers in the cloud. The position represents a rare opportunity to be a part of a fast-growing business and team, and help shape the strategy as we grow. You will also have complete end-to-end technical responsibility for one or more components on the platform - from defining the product roadmap to initiating, defining and executing the projects necessary to deliver on the roadmap. This is a highly visible role - offering the opportunity to interact at all levels of the division and the company - that is ideal for someone who wants to have a big impact on this fast-growing, cutting-edge, business.

Key Responsibilities:
Work with both external and internal customers, across multiple stakeholders and teams to understand business requirements and translate these requirements into technical/functional specifications. Discover the true requirements underlying feature requests; recommend alternative technical approaches; lead engineering efforts to meet aggressive timelines. Balance the business needs versus technical constraints.Work with AWS engineering managers to coordinate the technical development effort, track/drive the project, and manage the operational implementation process. Anticipate bottlenecks, provide escalation management and make tradeoffs; encourage risk-taking behavior to maximize business benefit; identify interdependencies between concurrent projects to prevent downstream problems.Work with product managers to launch these projects and provide ongoing technical support as appropriate. Evangelize within and outside Amazon to encourage a fast and smooth adoption of the services; be the primary conduit for gathering requirements for future enhancements; develop demos, sample and technical collateral as required.Own communication for technical delivery across these projects with senior leadership and across partner organizations.Establish business processes and policies, as well as metrics and indicators for success.
What is in it for you?
Team culture: You'll be joining a fun team that prides itself on a great work environment with an inclusive group of people that loves working together towards a common goal.Impact: Work on a service that will be used, directly and indirectly, by millions of customers and has a meaningful impact to their functions and interactions.Gratification: You will know you are directly responsible for solving real customer problems.Critical and Fast: This is a strategic new business for AWS, and we are moving fast, really fast.Ownership: You will quickly become responsible for key components of the service, and drive what and how to build them.Learn & Grow: If want to learn and grow with challenges of a designing and building a large-scale fault tolerant systems – this is an opportunity of a lifetime.Innovate: We learn from our customers and invent every day on their behalf.Make history: AWS is the leader in a current industry wide revolution, and specifically at Amazon Connect, we are changing the way customers think about contact centers.Have fun: Surround yourself with a highly talented pool of engineers that like to solve complex problems, but also work in a fun and autonomous environment.

job_description:
We’re looking for a highly organized Administrative Assistant to support 4-6 key members of our senior leadership team at OpenAI. You’ll be responsible for the leadership team’s calendars, and provide occasional other operational support as needed. You will act as the administrative engine that keeps this group’s meeting schedule organized and on task. You'll need to apply your diplomacy, discretion, and good judgment as you work across various teams and competing priorities.

Our leadership team reflects OpenAI’s culture and core values, and are a group of mission-driven, kind, and thoughtful individuals. We take pride in evolving a work environment that fosters collaboration, open communication, and authenticity, and offer an annual professional development stipend, an internal mentorship program, and regular leadership development workshops.
Your primary responsibilities:
Coordinate meetings and clear conflicts for members of our senior leadership team, including our Head of Applied AI & Partnerships, VP of Research, VP of Engineering, and CFO with occasional support for additional leaders over time.
Ensure critical meetings aren’t missed or delayed and are prioritized accordingly.
Manage and track expense reports for this group using Expensify.
Occasionally organize and manage travel accommodations and out-of-office meetings for members of this group, and perform other administrative tasks as needed.
Partner with our Executive Assistant to the CEO for broad planning and scheduling needs.
Partner with our internal recruiting team to coordinate interviews for these senior leaders and help to ensure they provide prompt interview feedback.
Work with our Operations team to gather input and calendar availability for various events (happy hours, summer picnic, team offsites, meetups, tech talks, etc.).
Your experience includes:
3-5 years of experience in an administrative or support function.
You've worked with technical teams and supported multiple leaders in the past.
You’ve worked in a startup or similar environment.
You've managed and optimized extremely busy calendars.
You're fluent in Google Calendar, Docs, Sheets, Gmail, etc. and other modern productivity software, and are excited to learn and use new tools.
You may be a good match for this role if:
You are supremely detail-oriented. No comma out of place, misspelling, or absent time zone escapes your eye.
You enjoy supporting and empowering others, especially leaders.
You can balance multiple competing priorities and resolve problems, often under time pressure.
You possess exemplary communication skills, both written and verbal.
Are supremely discrete and exercise excellent judgment in all cases.
You embrace the process of adapting to new and changing situations and are receptive to adjusting course as needed.
You are proactive, self-motivated, and communicative about your needs.
About OpenAI
We’re building safe Artificial General Intelligence (AGI), and ensuring it leads to a good outcome for humans. We believe that unreasonably great results are best delivered by a highly creative group working in concert. We are an equal opportunity employer and value diversity at our company. We do not discriminate on the basis of race, religion, color, national origin, gender, sexual orientation, age, marital status, veteran status, or disability status.

This position is subject to a background check for any convictions directly related to its duties and responsibilities. Only job-related convictions will be considered and will not automatically disqualify the candidate. Pursuant to the San Francisco Fair Chance Ordinance, we will consider for employment qualified applicants with arrest and conviction records.

Benefits
Health, dental, and vision insurance for you and your family
Unlimited time off (we encourage 4+ weeks per year)
Parental leave
Flexible work hours
Lunch and dinner each day
401(k) plan

Snap Inc. is a camera company. We believe that reinventing the camera represents our greatest opportunity to improve the way people live and communicate. Our products empower people to express themselves, live in the moment, learn about the world, and have fun together.
We're looking for a Product Manager to join Snap Inc! We're looking for someone who has a ML-focused background that can leverage and apply machine learning technology to shape the future of our paid products. Working from our Santa Monica headquarters, you’ll partner closely with Engineering in building out scalable ranking systems and models to improve ads personalization and advertiser performance. You’ll become the internal voice of our revenue-generating products by focusing on synthesizing external research, internal analytics, and cross-functional team feedback into a long-term product vision and near-term execution plan .
What you'll do:
Develop and launch machine learning centric products and services that help our broader business, while being conscientious and cautious of impacts on core user experience
Define the business goals and own the results for your product area
Manage a long-term roadmap for internal tools, data and analytics, and revenue-related products and improvements
Solicit ideas and feedback, gather requirements, write specs, create wireframes and workflows, and coordinate cross-functionally
Drive strategic product decisions via evaluation of market trends and meticulous retrospective and prospective analysis of product and revenue performance
Become the internal voice and representative for revenue-related products
Knowledge, Skills & Abilities:
Ability to initiate and drive projects to completion with minimal guidance
Ability to communicate the results of analyses in a clear and effective manner
Exceptional analytical skills
Minimum Qualifications:
BA/BS from a leading undergraduate institution in CS/EE/General Engineering or Economics/Physics/Psychology/Math
3+ years of product management or product marketing experience at a consumer or enterprise technology company
Deep knowledge of machine learning/artificial intelligence/computer vision
Preferred Qualifications:
Experience building and applying ML technologies to large scale problems
Experience with product design, software development, or interaction design
Experience with brands and agencies in the digital advertising space
Familiarity with SQL, Python, ProgR, Minitab, or SPSS

Basic Qualifications :
High School diploma or the equivalent is required. Associate’s degree in Electronics, Computer Science, Mechanical engineering is preferred. In addition, a minimum of 4 years directly related experience is required. J-STD_001, 002, IPC 610, MIL-STD-883, MIL-STD-750 and X-Ray qualification certifications may be required.

CLEARANCE REQUIREMENTS:
Department of Defense Secret security clearance is preferred at time of hire. Candidates must be able to obtain a Secret clearance within a reasonable amount of time from date of hire. Applicants selected will be subject to a U.S. Government security investigation and must meet eligibility requirements for access to classified information. Due to the nature of work performed within our facilities, U.S. citizenship is required.
Responsibilities for this Position:
At General Dynamics Mission Systems, we create the technologies, products and services that help our nation’s heroes keep our nation safe. The work we do is so advanced, we are continuously moving the boundaries of what’s possible. Here you’ll work with the best and your talent will be front and center on projects that impact the world. Are you up to the challenge?

We apply advanced technologies such as Artificial Intelligence, Blockchain, AR/VR, Cloud Native and Quantum Physics to solve our customers’ missions in cyber, RF, undersea, interstellar and everything in between.

Technologies that aren’t just top-notch, they’re often top-secret
A team of bold thinkers committed to exploring what’s next
Opportunities to gain new knowledge - as it’s discovered

Minimum of 4 years directly related experience
J-STD_001, 002, IPC 610, MIL-STD-883, MIL-STD-750 and X-Ray qualification certifications may be required
Solid knowledge of ESD control, workmanship standards, geometric dimensioning and tolerancing, and statistics and process control techniques
Skilled in the set-up of basic electronic test configurations or mechanical test configurations
What sets you apart:
Team player who thrives in collaborative environments and revels in team success
Exceptional problem-solving and communication skills
Open to new ideas and serve as a champion for change when directed from management

Company Overview:
General Dynamics Mission Systems (GDMS) engineers a diverse portfolio of high technology solutions, products and services that enable customers to successfully execute missions across all domains of operation. With a global team of 12,000+ top professionals, we partner with the best in industry to expand the bounds of innovation in the defense and scientific arenas. Given the nature of our work and who we are, we value trust, honesty, alignment and transparency. Company Description

Job Description

Please note that this position can be located in Biogen's Cambridge, MA or RTP, NC locations.
The OSI-AL will support the PO&T organization change management efforts and required workforce development activities to create a continuous improvement & OpEx culture (including the deployment & adoption of relevant methodologies). The OSI-AL is expected to support the sustainable adoption of modern manufacturing capabilities & provide day-to-day supervision to a team of data analytics and metric managers. The OSI-AL Associate Director should be a manufacturing intelligence thought leader and analytics storyteller who can help to energize & influence the organization towards our goal of instituting a top-class highly efficient and data driven continuous improvement culture.

Principle Accountabilities include but are not limited to:
Lead data analytics activities within the Pharmaceutical Operations & Technology CI Ecosystem (20%)
Influence and upskill the organization to institute a top-class highly efficient and data driven continuous improvement culture. (15%)
Support PO&T Senior Leadership to articulate business wants & to develop data analytics and artificial intelligence strategic roadmaps. (15%)
Co-lead the development of business processes designed to respond to performance metrics variance (in conjunction with the OSI BPM team). (20%)
Scout for novel data and artificial intelligence technologies in support of Biogen’s Digital Excellence efforts. (10%)
Oversee day-to-day performance of a mature Data Analytics and KPI BPO team. (20%)

Qualifications

Bachelor's Degree in Operations Research, Economics, Business, Engineering, or Sciences. Advanced degree strongly preferred.
10+ Years of Biotechnology, pharmaceutical or similar highly regulated industry including experience in operations with engagement in Operational and Business support functions.
Lean Six Sigma Green Belt or Black Belt certification
Ability to effectively influence leadership
Excellent oral and written communication skills
Ability to think strategically and to translate strategy into actions
Ability to prioritize and provide clear direction to team members in a highly dynamic environment
Additional Information

The Operational and Systems Improvement-Analytics Lead (OSI-AL) will be responsible for supporting the OSI department’s mission and strategic goals by ensuring that the right information and metrics are used by the organization to monitor performance, identify CI opportunities and to track the effectiveness of implemented improvement programs.

Introduction
Axtria is a global provider of cloud software and data analytics to the Life Sciences industry. We help Life Sciences companies transform the product commercialization journey to drive sales growth and improve healthcare outcomes for patients. We are acutely aware that our work impacts millions of patients and lead passionately to improve their lives.
Since our founding in 2010, technology innovation has been our winning differentiation, and we continue to leapfrog competition with platforms that deploy Artificial Intelligence and Machine Learning. Our cloud-based platforms - Axtria DataMax™, Axtria InsightsMax™, Axtria SalesIQ™, and Axtria MarketingIQ™ - enable customers to efficiently manage data, leverage data science to deliver insights for sales and marketing planning and manage end-to-end commercial operations.
With customers in over 75 countries, Axtria is one of the largest global commercial solutions providers in the Life Sciences industry. We continue to win industry recognition for growth and are featured in some of the most aspirational lists - INC 5000, Deloitte FAST 500, NJBiz FAST 50, SmartCEO Future 50, Red Herring 100, and several other growth and technology awards.
Axtria is looking for exceptional talent to join our rapidly growing global team. People are our biggest perk! Our transparent and collaborative culture offers a chance to work with some of the brightest minds in the industry. Axtria Institute, our in-house university, offers the best training in the industry and an opportunity to learn in a structured environment. A customized career progression plan ensures every associate is setup for success and able to do meaningful work in a fun environment. We want our legacy to be the leaders we produce for the industry. Will you be next?
We are currently hiring for a Business Analyst having pharma experience for our key Life Science clients. Success in this role will require experience working as a current or former report developer. This position requires familiarity with SQL, Data Warehousing, Business Intelligence, and Testing related implementations.
KEY RESPONSIBILITIES:
Leadership – Lead & guide the technical teams independently or with little support to implement & deliver complex project assignments.
Solution Development
Learn and develop on the latest open source and enterprise level big data technologies and platforms
Hands-on development of solution on big data stack (e.g. Hadoop, Spark, Snowflake etc.)
Expertise and significant hands-on (design and development) experience in at least 5 big data technologies
Experience in managing and building solution on AWS cloud environment
Project scoping, analysis, installation, testing and support of various big data platforms
Architect, Design, develop and implement data processing / quality workflow and software products on both streaming and batch data on a big data / cloud-based platform
Integration of diverse pharma data sources on the big data platform
Troubleshoot and Resolve technical issues with hand-on data load optimization techniques and loading
Demonstrate technical leadership
Delivery
Ensure delivery of technical engagements by exceeding customer expectations.
Provide expert consultation and best practices to customers and internal stakeholders.
Prepare Estimation and Pricing for customer and internal projects
Lead small to medium size projects, and manage the execution by planning project activities, assigning tasks to team, tracking and monitoring the tasks, and working with close coordination with the project manager
Project Management –
Provide leadership to help people perform at their best, through motivating and developing them to achieve high performance.
Provide structure, direction and purpose to your team through effective communication/regular meetings
Provide clear guidance, instruction, advice or coaching for the job. Be accessible. Where appropriate, aim for inclusivity - enabling staff to input ideas, and consulting on change and development.
Use the performance management process as a valuable tool for supporting employee development and improvement.
Logical Thinking – Able to think analytically, use a systematic and logical approach to analyze data, problems, and situations. Must be able to guide team members in analysis.
Handle Client Relationship – Manage client relationship and client expectations independently. Should be able to deliver results back to the Client independently. Should have excellent communication skills.
Logistics and Location: -
We are hiring for Berkeley Heights, NJ
U.S. Citizens and those authorized to work in the U.S. are encouraged to apply.
Flexibility to travel and/or relocate within the US as per project requirements.

Company Overview:
Nuance is the pioneer and leader in conversational artificial intelligence (AI) innovations that bring intelligence to everyday work and life. We deliver solutions that understand, analyze, and respond to people, amplifying human intelligence to increase productivity and improve security. With decades of both domain and AI expertise, we work with thousands of organizations across a wide range of industries.

Join our team! At Nuance, we are constantly reinventing how people connect with technology and with each other. Our AI-powered solutions empower organizations to transform “business as usual.” For decades, the world’s leading financial, healthcare, telecommunications, retailers, and government organizations have trusted Nuance to bring them award-winning solutions that deliver more meaningful outcomes and empower a smarter, more connected world. From clinical speech recognition technologies that free physicians to spend more time caring for patients to real-time intelligence that powers billions of customer interactions, we’re deeply committed to helping organizations push the boundaries of what’s possible.
Job Summary:
Summary:
The engineering manager will lead the development of a platform for exchanging data from many sources, primarily EMR's, and in many forms. This data will need to be unified across the clinical continuum for Nuance customers.

Principal Duties and Responsibilities

Lead scrum teams in development of interoperability platform.
Build and manage team(s) that designs and delivers scalable and extensible systems.
Work closely with a variety of different stakeholder groups, including product management, business analysts, marketing, and services to develop new products and features for the platform.
Assist in identifying process improvements and application enhancements.
Perform tasks related to securing the products, tools, and processes that you are responsible for.
Lead/Co-ordinate troubleshooting of customer issues with the team.

Knowledge, Skills, and Qualifications

Education: Bachelor's degree in Computer Science, Software Engineering, Math or a related field
Minimum years of work experience: 8+ years

Required Skills

Ability to lead, organize, and manage projects beginning to end that require coordinated efforts across multiple functions.
5+ years leading development teams. Solid record of delivering product milestones on time and with high quality.
Experience leading and working closely with local and remote development teams.
Proven success in hiring and mentoring highly effective software teams.
Experience leading an Agile/Scrum Team.
3+ years of programming experience using Java, Scala or Python.
1+ years of experience with healthcare software.
Knowledge of one or more cloud platform service like Azure, AWS or GCP.
Experience with security-based best practices for SDLC.
Ability to interact with and accept direction from multiple managers and clients.
Ability to work independently.
Excellent written and oral communication skills.
Ability to multitask with proven tight deadline experience in a fast paced and dynamic environment.

Preferred Skills
Experience developing secure, highly available, cloud applications (Azure).
Experience in developing interfaces with one of more of the major EHR systems.
Familiarity with JIRA, Confluence, Bamboo, or Crucible a plus (Atlassian toolset).
Experience with Git/Bitbucket and Eclipse.
Familiarity with Behavioral Driven Development (BDD).
Experience working in a cross-domain environment involving Java and other Open Source platforms.
Additional Information:
Nuance offers a compelling and rewarding work environment. We offer market competitive salaries, bonus, equity, benefits, meaningful growth and development opportunities and a casual yet technically challenging work environment. Join our dynamic, entrepreneurial team and become part of our continuing success.
Nuance celebrates diversity and is proud to be an equal employment opportunity and affirmative action workplace. We consider all qualified applicants without regard to race, color, religion, sex (including pregnancy), sexual orientation, gender identity or expression, national origin, military and veteran status, disability, genetics, or any other category protected by law or Nuance policy. If you need an accommodation because of a disability for any part of the employment process, please call 781-565-5086 and let us know.
